column1: Business Combination, Step Acquisition, Equity Interest in Acquiree, Fair Value
column2: Fair value at acquisition-date of the equity interest in the acquiree held by the acquirer, immediately before the acquisition date for businesses combined in stages.

column1: Business Combination, Step Acquisition, Equity Interest in Acquiree, Including Subsequent Acquisition, Percentage
column2: Percentage of voting equity interests acquired in a business combination achieved in stages, including equity interests in the acquiree held by the acquirer immediately before the acquisition date and acquired at the acquisition date.

column1: Business Development
column2: Business development involves the development of products and services, their delivery, design and their implementation. Business development includes a number of techniques designed to grow an economic enterprise. Such techniques include, but are not limited to, assessments of marketing opportunities and target markets, intelligence gathering on customers and competitors, generating leads for possible sales, follow-up sales activity, formal proposal writing and business model design. Business development involves evaluating a business and then realizing its full potential, using such tools as marketing, sales, information management and customer service.

column1: Business Exit Costs
column2: Amount of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Includes, but is not limited to, one-time termination benefits, termination of an operating lease or other contract, consolidating or closing facilities, and relocating employees, and termination benefits associated with an ongoing benefit arrangement. Excludes expenses associated with special or contractual termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

column1: Capital
column2: The amount of total capital as defined in the regulations.

column1: Capital Expenditures Incurred but Not yet Paid
column2: Future cash outflow to pay for purchases of fixed assets that have occurred.

column1: Capitalization, Long-term Debt and Equity
column2: This element represents the total consolidated (as applicable) capitalization of the entity which is comprised of its long-term debt and equity instruments. The table may be detailed by subsidiary (legal entity) and include information by type of debt or equity detailed by instrument.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion, Amortization and Valuation Allowance Relating to Oil and Gas Producing Activities
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation, depletion, amortization and valuation allowance relating to oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Asset Retirement Costs
column2: The amount of asset retirement costs previously incurred and capitalized separately from the capitalized amount of the associated long-lived assets.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Mineral Interests in Proved Properties
column2: Capitalized costs of proved properties that include fee ownership or a lease, concession, or other interest representing the right to extract oil or gas subject to such terms as may be imposed by the conveyance of that interest.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Mineral Interests in Unproved Properties
column2: Capitalized costs of unproven properties that include fee ownership or a lease, concession, or other interest representing the right to extract oil or gas subject to such terms as may be imposed by the conveyance of that interest.

column1: Capitalized Costs of Unproved Properties Excluded from Amortization, Period Cost
column2: The sum of the capitalized costs incurred during the period of unproved properties excluded from amortization including acquisition costs, exploration costs, development costs, and production costs.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Oil and Gas Producing Activities, Gross
column2: The sum of capitalized costs relating to oil and gas producing activities before accounting for accumulated depreciation.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Oil and Gas Producing Activities, Net
column2: Net amount of capitalized costs relating to oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Proved Properties
column2: Capitalized costs of proved properties incurred for any combination mineral interests acquisitions; wells and related equipment; support equipment and facilities; and uncompleted wells and equipment and other costs not previously disclosed within this table.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Support Equipment and Facilities
column2: Capitalized costs incurred for support equipment and facilities used in oil and gas producing activities (such as seismic equipment, drilling equipment, construction and grading equipment, vehicles, repair shops, warehouses, supply points, camps, and division, district, or field offices).

column1: Capitalized Costs, Uncompleted Wells, Equipment and Facilities
column2: Capitalized costs of which include those incurred to (1) drill and equip wells that are not yet completed (2) acquire or construct equipment and facilities that are not yet installed.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Unproved Properties
column2: Capitalized costs of unproved properties incurred for any combination mineral interests acquisitions and other costs not previously disclosed within this table.

column1: Capitalized Costs, Wells and Related Equipment and Facilities
column2: Capitalized costs which include those incurred to (1) to drill and equip those exploratory wells and exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells that have found proved reserves and (2) obtain access to proved reserves and provide facilities for extracting, treating, gathering, storing the oil and gas, including the drilling and equipping of development wells and development-type stratigraphic wells and service wells.

column1: Capital Leased Assets, Noncurrent, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of the lessor's net investment in nonoperating or leveraged leases expected to be realized or consumed after one year or normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due in Four and Five Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the fourth and fifth fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due in Two and Three Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the second and third fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Executory Costs
column2: Amounts to be paid by lessee to lessor for maintenance, insurance, and tax expenses related to the leased asset.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Interest Included in Payments
column2: Amount necessary to reduce net minimum lease payments to present value for capital leases.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Net Minimum Payments
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases net of executory costs, which include amounts paid by the lessee to the lessor for insurance, maintenance and taxes.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments to be received by the lessor for capital leases in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Required for Capital Adequacy
column2: The minimum amount of Total Capital required for capital adequacy purposes under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Capital Required for Capital Adequacy to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: The minimum Total risk based capital ratio (total capital divided by risk weighted assets) required for capital adequacy purposes under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Capital Required to be Well Capitalized
column2: The amount of Total Capital required to be categorized as well as capitalized under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Capital Required to be Well Capitalized to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: The Total risk based capital ratio (total capital divided by risk weighted assets) required to be categorized as "well capitalized", in the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Capital to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: Total Capital divided by risk weighted assets as defined in the regulations.

column1: Capital Units, Net Amount
column2: Net amount applicable to investors of capital units or shares.

column1: Cash Acquired in Excess of Payments to Acquire Business
column2: The cash inflow associated with the acquisition of a business when the cash held by the acquired business exceeds the cash payments to acquire the business.

column1: Cash Available for Distributions
column2: Amount of cash eligible for distribution to members or limited partners of limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP), subject to reserves to be maintained as defined in operating or partnership agreement, or in a credit facility agreement.

column1: Cash Flows Between Transferor and Transferee, Repayments of Servicing Fee Advances
column2: Cash flows between transferee and transferor in repayment of service fee advances, in advance of a securitization, asset-backed financing arrangement, or similar transfer in which the transferor has continuing involvement with the transferred financial assets underlying the transaction (including, but not limited to, servicing, recourse, and restrictions on transferor's interests in the transferred financial assets).

column1: Cash Flows Between Transferor and Transferee, Servicing Fee Advances
column2: Cash flows between transferor and transferee in payment of service fees in advance, prior to or in contemplation of a securitization, asset-backed financing arrangement, or similar transfer in which the transferor will have continuing involvement with the transferred financial assets underlying the transaction (including, but not limited to, servicing, recourse, and restrictions on transferor's interests in the transferred financial assets).

column1: Cash Flows Between Transferor and Transferee, Servicing Fees
column2: Cash Flows between a transferee and a transferor attributable to servicing fees related to a securitization, asset-backed financing arrangement, or similar transfer in which the transferor has continuing involvement with the transferred financial assets underlying the transaction (including, but not limited to, servicing, recourse, and restrictions on transferor's interests in the transferred financial assets).

column1: Cash Flows Between Transferor and Transferee, Beneficial Interest
column2: Cash flows between transferee and transferor in payment of the transferor's beneficial interest related to a securitization, asset-backed financing arrangement, or similar transfer in which the transferor has continuing involvement with the transferred financial assets underlying the transaction.

column1: Cash, Including Discontinued Operations
column2: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Includes cash within disposal group or discontinued operation.

column1: Ceded Premiums Earned
column2: Amount of earned premiums ceded to other entities.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Available-for-sale Debt Securities, Other-than-Temporary Impairment Charges, Credit Loss
column2: Amount of expense to write-down the amortized cost basis of loans, after acquisition, to fair value when the decline in the fair value is determined to be other than temporary (OTTI) for loans accounted for as available-for-sale debt securities.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Accretion
column2: Current period recognition due to accretion of the excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in the loan for loans accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that were acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Debt Securities, Other-than-Temporary Impairment Charges, Credit Loss
column2: Amount of expense to write-down the amortized cost basis of loans, after acquisition, to fair value when the decline in the fair value is determined to be other than temporary (OTTI) for loans accounted for as debt securities.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Held-to-maturity Debt Securities, Other-than-Temporary Impairment Charges, Credit Loss
column2: Amount of expense to write-down the amortized cost basis of loans, after acquisition, to fair value when the decline in the fair value is determined to be other than temporary (OTTI) for loans accounted for as held-to-maturity debt securities.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer, Accretable Yield
column2: The aggregate excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in the loan. This relates to loans with deteriorating of credit quality since origination that were acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Accretion
column2: Amount of decrease from accretion of the excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in acquired loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Disposals of Loans
column2: Amount of reduction, resulting from a sale or transfer of a loan, in the excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in acquired loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Acquired During Period, at Acquisition, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value at acquisition of acquired loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Acquired During Period, Commercial, at Acquisition, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value at acquisition of acquired commercial loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Acquired During Period, Consumer, at Acquisition, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value at acquisition of acquired consumer loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Allowance for Loan Losses, Decreases
column2: Amount of reduction in the reserve for loans impairments as a result of current information and events which result in it being probable that estimated cash flows will be significantly higher than previously expected or because actual cash flows are significantly greater than cash flows previously expected for loans not accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that was acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Class of Warrant or Right, Exercise Price of Warrants or Rights
column2: Exercise price per share or per unit of warrants or rights outstanding.

column1: Class of Warrant or Right, Number of Securities Called by Each Warrant or Right
column2: Number of securities into which each warrant or right may be converted. For example, but not limited to, each warrant may be converted into two shares.

column1: Clearance Fees
column2: The amount of expense in the period for clearance fees.

column1: Closed Block Liabilities, Other Policyholder Funds
column2: Amount of closed block policyholder funds held, which are refundable.

column1: Collateral Securities Repledged, Delivered, or Used
column2: The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of securities received as collateral from a counterparty that were re-pledged, sold, delivered or otherwise reused by the entity.

column1: Combined Ratio
column2: Ratio of non-life losses and loss expenses, non-life acquisition expenses and non-life general and administrative expenses, to non-life net premiums earned.

column1: Common Stock, Value, Subscriptions
column2: Monetary value of common stock allocated to investors to buy shares of a new issue of common stock before they are offered to the public. When stock is sold on a subscription basis, the issuer does not initially receive the total proceeds. In general, the issuer does not issue the shares to the investor until it receives the entire proceeds.

column1: Common Stocks, Including Additional Paid in Capital
column2: Amount of par value plus amounts in excess of par value or issuance value for common stock issued.

column1: Common Stocks, Including Additional Paid in Capital, Net of Discount
column2: Amount after discount on shares of par value plus amounts in excess of par value or issuance value for common stock held by shareholders. Includes common stock repurchased and held as treasury stock.

column1: Common Unit, Authorized
column2: Maximum number of common units of ownership permitted to be issued by a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Common Unit, Issuance Value
column2: Stated value of common units of ownership issued by a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Common Unit, Issued
column2: Number of common units issued of limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Common Unit, Outstanding
column2: Number of common units of ownership outstanding of a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Communication
column2: The amount of expense incurred in the period for communication, which is the exchange of information by several methods.

column1: Communications, Information Technology and Occupancy
column2: The aggregate amount of communications, data processing and occupancy expenses.

column1: Concentration Risk, Percentage
column2: For an entity that discloses a concentration risk in relation to quantitative amount, which serves as the "benchmark" (or denominator) in the equation, this concept represents the concentration percentage derived from the division.

column1: Consolidation, Less than Wholly Owned Subsidiary, Parent Ownership Interest, Changes, Additional Interest Issued to Parent
column2: Represents a (noncash) issuance of additional equity interests to the parent by a subsidiary during the period, thereby effecting a change in total (consolidated) equity attributable to the parent. The additional equity interest represented by this element increases the parent's controlling interest in the subsidiary.

column1: Consolidation, Less than Wholly Owned Subsidiary, Parent Ownership Interest, Changes, Issuance of Equity by Subsidiary to Noncontrolling Interests
column2: Represents a sale (new stock issuance) by a subsidiary to noncontrolling interests (third parties, parties directly or indirectly unrelated to parent) during the period. The capital transaction by subsidiary does not result in a loss of control by the parent, but does effect a change in total (consolidated) equity attributable to the parent.

column1: Consolidation, Less than Wholly Owned Subsidiary, Parent Ownership Interest, Changes, Purchase of Interest by Parent
column2: Represents the purchase by the parent of an additional equity interest in a subsidiary during the period, thereby effecting a change in total (consolidated) equity attributable to the parent. The purchase of the additional equity interest represented by this element increases the parent's controlling interest in the subsidiary.

column1: Consolidation, Less than Wholly Owned Subsidiary, Parent Ownership Interest, Changes, Sale of Interest by Parent
column2: Represents a sale by the parent of a portion of its equity interest in a subsidiary during the period, thereby effecting a change in total (consolidated) equity attributable to the parent. The sale of the equity interest represented by this element does not result in a loss of control by the parent.

column1: Contingent Consideration Classified as Equity, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of contingent consideration in a business combination that is classified in shareholders' equity.

column1: Continuing Involvement with Transferred Financial Assets, Principal Amount Outstanding
column2: Principal amount of transferred financial assets in which the transferor has continuing involvement with the assets underlying the transaction. Continuing involvement includes, but is not limited to, servicing, recourse, and restrictions on transferor's interests in transferred financial assets.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due after Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected after the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs to be collected in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Excludes amounts due that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, after Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected after the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contract Receivable Retainage, Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount billed to customers under long-term contracts or programs that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be collected in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contracts Receivable, Claims and Uncertain Amounts, Expected to be Collected after Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of billed or unbilled claims or similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization under long-term contracts that are expected to be collected after the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contracts Receivable, Claims and Uncertain Amounts, Expected to be Collected in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of billed or unbilled claims or similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization under long-term contracts that are expected to be collected in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contracts Receivable, Claims and Uncertain Amounts, Expected to be Collected in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of billed or unbilled claims or similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization under long-term contracts that are expected to be collected in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation
column2: Amount of contractual obligation, including but not limited to, long-term debt, capital lease obligations, operating lease obligations, purchase obligations, and other commitments.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due after Fifth Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due in Fifth Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due in Fourth and Fifth Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due in the fourth and fifth fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due in Fourth Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due in Next Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due in Second and Third Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due in the second and third fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due in Second Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Due in Third Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation due in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Contractual Obligation, Future Minimum Payments Due, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of contractual obligation maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year ended.

column1: Cooperative Advertising Expense
column2: Amount of expense under a cooperative advertising arrangement.

column1: Cost Method Investments, Original Cost
column2: Original amount of cost-method investments at the acquisition date.

column1: Cost of Trust Assets Sold to Pay Expenses
column2: Cost of trust assets sold to pay trust expenses (includes commodities, but is not limited to, gold and silver).

column1: Costs Incurred, Acquisition of Oil and Gas Properties
column2: Cost incurred, including capitalized costs and costs charged to expense, in acquisition of oil and gas properties.

column1: Costs Incurred, Acquisition of Oil and Gas Properties with Proved Reserves
column2: Costs incurred, including capitalized costs and costs charged to expense, associated with the acquisition of oil and gas properties that have proved reserves.

column1: Costs Incurred, Acquisition of Unproved Oil and Gas Properties
column2: Costs incurred, including capitalized costs and costs charged to expense, associated with the acquisition of oil and gas properties that have unproved reserves.

column1: Costs Incurred, Asset Retirement Obligation Incurred
column2: Amount of asset retirement obligations (ARO) costs incurred (whether capitalized or charged to expense) during the period.

column1: Costs Incurred, Oil and Gas Property Acquisition, Exploration, and Development Activities
column2: Amount of costs incurred related to oil and gas property acquisition, exploration and development activities, including capitalized costs and costs charged to expense.

column1: Credit Derivative, Liquidation Proceeds, Monetary Amount
column2: Estimated amount to which the maximum potential amount of future payments under the credit derivative would be covered by the proceeds from liquidation of assets held either as collateral or by third parties.

column1: Credit Derivative, Liquidation Proceeds, Percentage
column2: Estimated percentage to which the maximum potential amount of future payments under the credit derivative would be covered by the proceeds from liquidation of assets held either as collateral or by third parties.

column1: Credit Derivative, Maximum Exposure, Undiscounted
column2: Maximum potential amount of future undiscounted payments that could be required under the credit derivative, before reduction for potential recoveries under recourse or collateralization provisions.

column1: Credit Derivative, Purchased Credit Protection
column2: Amount of purchased credit protection expected to cover future payments under the credit risk derivative.

column1: Cumulative Dividends
column2: Amount of cumulative cash dividends distributed to shareholders.

column1: Customer Loyalty Program Liability, Current
column2: Value of deferred revenue or cost to provide products or services, which is expected to be recognized in income or incurred within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer, resulting from customer loyalty program. Excludes liability associated with frequent flier programs. Includes liability associated with customer loyalty programs for other businesses, for example, but is not limited to, hotels, supermarkets, credit card companies, automobile rental companies, and book sellers.

column1: Customer Loyalty Program Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Value of deferred revenue or cost to provide products or services, which is expected to be recognized in income or incurred after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer, resulting from customer loyalty program. Excludes liability associated with frequent flier programs. Includes liability associated with customer loyalty programs for other businesses, for example, but is not limited to, hotels, supermarkets, credit card companies, automobile rental companies, and book sellers.

column1: Customer Securities for which Entity has Right to Sell or Repledge, Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of customer securities accepted as collateral by the entity that it is permitted by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge to counterparties as collateral.

column1: Customer Securities for which Entity has Right to Sell or Repledge, Fair Value of Securities Sold or Repledged
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of customer securities accepted as collateral by the entity that it has sold or re-pledged to counterparties as collateral.

column1: Debt Instrument, Collateral Amount
column2: Amount of assets pledged to secure a debt instrument.

column1: Debt Instrument, Collateral Fee
column2: Amount of fees associated with providing collateral for the debt instrument.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, Conversion Ratio
column2: Ratio applied to the conversion of debt instrument into equity with equity shares divided by debt principal amount.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, Stock Price Trigger
column2: Price of the entity's common stock which would be required to be attained for the conversion feature embedded in the debt instrument to become effective.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, Threshold Percentage of Stock Price Trigger
column2: Minimum percentage of common stock price to conversion price of convertible debt instruments to determine eligibility of conversion.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, Threshold Trading Days
column2: Threshold number of specified trading days that common stock price to conversion price of convertible debt instruments must exceed threshold percentage within a specified consecutive trading period to trigger conversion feature.

column1: Debt Instrument, Cumulative Sinking Fund Payments
column2: Cumulative amount paid into a fund, which is used to retire the debt instrument.

column1: Debt Instrument, Periodic Payment Terms, Balloon Payment to be Paid
column2: Amount of payment greater than the preceding installment payments to be paid at final maturity date of debt.

column1: Debt Instrument, Redemption Price, Percentage
column2: Percentage price of original principal amount of debt at which debt can be redeemed by the issuer.

column1: Debt Instrument, Redemption Price, Percentage of Principal Amount Redeemed
column2: Percentage of principal amount of debt redeemed.

column1: Debt Instrument, Repurchase Amount
column2: Fair value amount of debt instrument that was repurchased.

column1: Debt Instrument, Repurchased Face Amount
column2: Face (par) amount of the original debt instrument that was repurchased.

column1: Debt Instrument, Sinking Fund Payment
column2: Amount paid into a fund, which is used to retire the debt instrument.

column1: Debtor Reorganization Items, Interest Income on Accumulated Cash
column2: Amount of interest income on accumulated cash, reported as a reorganization item.

column1: Decrease in Restricted Cash
column2: Amount of cash inflow associated with funds that are not available for withdrawal or use (such as funds held in escrow) and are associated with underlying transactions that are classified as investing activities.

column1: Deferred Compensation Arrangement with Individual, Allocated Share-based Compensation Expense
column2: Amount of expense recognized from equity-based compensation arrangements (for example, shares of stock, unit, stock options or other equity instruments), awarded to key employees or individuals. Excludes amount related to plans that cover generally all employees (for example, but not limited to, qualified pension plans).

column1: Deferred Compensation Arrangement with Individual, Cash Award Granted, Amount
column2: Amount of commitment made to pay deferred cash remuneration.

column1: Deferred Compensation Arrangement with Individual, Cash Awards Granted, Percentage
column2: Commitment made to pay deferred cash remuneration expressed as a percentage of the individual's base salary.

column1: Deferred Compensation Arrangement with Individual, Common Stock Reserved for Future Issuance
column2: Number of common shares reserved for future issuance related to deferred compensation arrangements with individuals.

column1: Deferred Costs and Other Assets
column2: Aggregate carrying amount of deferred costs and other assets not separately disclosed.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Gross
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs and Present Value of Future Profits, Amortization
column2: Amount of deferred policy acquisition costs and capitalized present value of the future profits (PVFP) expensed. Acquisition costs are costs that are related directly to the successful acquisition of new or renewal insurance contracts.

column1: Deferred Sales Commission
column2: Carrying amount of advanced commission payments.

column1: Deferred Sales Inducements, Amortization Expense
column2: The amount of deferred sales inducement costs charged against earnings during the period.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Capital Loss Carryforwards
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible capital loss carryforwards.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Investments
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from investments (excludes investments in subsidiaries and equity method investments).

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Net
column2: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, before jurisdictional netting.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Net, Current
column2: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, netted by jurisdiction and classified as current.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Operating Loss Carryforwards
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible operating loss carryforwards.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Property, Plant and Equipment
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from property, plant, and equipment.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, State Taxes
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from state taxes.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense
column2: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowances, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences from reserves and accruals, compensation and benefit costs, and other provisions, reserves, and allowances.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Allowance for Doubtful Accounts
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from the allowance for doubtful accounts.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Legal Settlements
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from the estimated loss from legal settlements.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Unrealized Losses on Trading Securities
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from unrealized losses on trading securities.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Valuation Allowance
column2: Amount of deferred tax assets for which it is more likely than not that a tax benefit will not be realized.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Valuation Allowance, Current
column2: Amount of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and carryforwards expected to be realized or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Deferred Tax Expense from Stock Options Exercised
column2: Amount of deferred tax expense from write-off of the deferred tax asset related to deductible stock options at exercise.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Net
column2: Amount, after deferred tax asset, of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable differences, before jurisdictional netting.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Net, Current
column2: Amount, after deferred tax asset, of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable differences, netted by jurisdiction and classified as current.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense, Capitalized Interest
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from capitalized interest.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from reserves and accruals.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Derivatives
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from derivatives.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Intangible Assets
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from intangible assets other than goodwill.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Gross, Current
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences expected to be realized or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Gross, Noncurrent
column2: Gross amount of noncurrent deferred tax liabilities, which result from applying the applicable tax rate to taxable temporary differences pertaining to each jurisdiction to which the entity is obligated to pay income tax.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Investments
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from investments (excludes investments in subsidiaries and equity method investments).

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Net, Noncurrent
column2: Amount, after deferred tax asset, of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable differences, netted by jurisdiction and classified as noncurrent.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Prepaid Expenses
column2: Amount of deferred tax consequences attributable to taxable temporary differences derived from prepaid expenses.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Property, Plant and Equipment
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from property, plant, and equipment.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Unrealized Currency Transaction Gains
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from unrealized gains on foreign currency transactions.

column1: Deferred Tax Liability Not Recognized, Amount of Unrecognized Deferred Tax Liability, Bad Debt Reserve for Tax Purposes of Qualified Lender
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability not recognized because of the exceptions to comprehensive recognition of deferred taxes related to bad debt reserve for tax purposes of a qualified lender.

column1: Deferred Tax Liability Not Recognized, Amount of Unrecognized Deferred Tax Liability, Policyholders' Surplus
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability not recognized because of the exceptions to comprehensive recognition of deferred taxes related to a policyholders' surplus.

column1: Deferred Tax Liability Not Recognized, Amount of Unrecognized Deferred Tax Liability, Undistributed Earnings of Domestic Subsidiaries
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability not recognized because of the exceptions to comprehensive recognition of deferred taxes related to undistributed earnings of domestic subsidiaries.

column1: Deferred Tax Liability Not Recognized, Amount of Unrecognized Deferred Tax Liability, Undistributed Earnings of Foreign Subsidiaries
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability not recognized because of the exceptions to comprehensive recognition of deferred taxes related to undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries.

column1: Defined Benefit Pension Plan, Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: This represents the noncurrent liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Administration Expenses
column2: Amount of plan administration expenses deducted from total plan assets.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Assumptions Used Calculating Benefit Obligation, Rate of Compensation Increase
column2: Expected rate of compensation increases (for pay-related plans).

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Cost of Providing Special or Contractual Termination Benefits Recognized During Period
column2: If applicable, the cost of providing special or contractual termination benefits recognized during the period on the projected benefit obligation.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Effect of One Percentage Point Decrease on Accumulated Postretirement Benefit Obligation
column2: Amount of effect of a one-percentage-point decrease in the assumed health care cost trend rates on the accumulated postretirement benefit obligation for health care benefits.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Effect of One Percentage Point Decrease on Service and Interest Cost Components
column2: Amount of effect of a one-percentage-point decrease in the assumed health care cost trend rates on the aggregate of the service and interest cost components of net periodic postretirement health care benefit costs.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Effect of One Percentage Point Increase on Accumulated Postretirement Benefit Obligation
column2: The effect of a one-percentage-point increase in the assumed health care cost trend rates on the accumulated postretirement benefit obligation for health care benefits.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Effect of One Percentage Point Increase on Service and Interest Cost Components
column2: The effect of a one-percentage-point increase in the assumed health care cost trend rates on the aggregate of the service and interest cost components of net periodic postretirement health care benefit costs.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Estimated Amount of Plan Participants' Future Benefits Covered by Insurance Contracts Issued by Employer or Related Parties
column2: The amount of estimated future defined benefit annual plan participant benefits covered by insurance contracts issued by the employer or its related parties.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Benefit Payments, Five Fiscal Years Thereafter
column2: Amount of benefits from a defined benefit plan expected to be paid in the five fiscal years after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Benefit Payments, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of benefits from a defined benefit plan expected to be paid in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Benefit Payments, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of benefits from a defined benefit plan expected to be paid in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Benefit Payments, Year Five
column2: Amount of benefits from a defined benefit plan expected to be paid in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Benefit Payments, Year Four
column2: Amount of benefits from a defined benefit plan expected to be paid in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Benefit Payments, Year Three
column2: Amount of benefits from a defined benefit plan expected to be paid in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Benefit Payments, Year Two
column2: Amount of benefits from a defined benefit plan expected to be paid in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Return on Plan Assets
column2: An amount calculated as a basis for determining the extent of delayed recognition of the effects of changes in the fair value of assets. The expected return on plan assets is determined based on the expected long-term rate of return on plan assets and the market-related value of plan assets.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Funded Percentage
column2: Plan assets of a defined benefit plan, as a percentage of projected benefit obligation.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Other Costs
column2: Amount of other defined benefit plan costs.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Settlements, Benefit Obligation
column2: The amount of decrease that relates to an irrevocable action that relieves the employer (or the plan) of primary responsibility for a benefit obligation and eliminates significant risks related to the obligation and the assets used to effect the settlement. Examples of transactions that constitute a settlement include (a) making lump-sum cash payments to plan participants in exchange for their rights to receive specified benefits and (b) purchasing nonparticipating annuity contracts.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Administrative Expenses
column2: Amount of administrative expenses incurred by a defined contribution plan.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Employer Matching Contribution, Percent of Employees' Gross Pay
column2: Percentage of employees' gross pay for which the employer contributes a matching contribution to a defined contribution plan.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Employer Matching Contribution, Percent of Match
column2: Percentage employer matches of the employee's percentage contribution matched.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Employers Matching Contribution, Annual Vesting Percentage
column2: Percentage of employer's matching contributions to a defined contribution plan that vests in a given year.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Maximum Annual Contributions Per Employee, Amount
column2: Maximum amount the employee may contribute to a defined contribution plan.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Maximum Annual Contributions Per Employee, Percent
column2: Maximum percentage of employee gross pay the employee may contribute to a defined contribution plan.

column1: Entity Common Stock, Shares Outstanding
column2: Indicate number of shares or other units outstanding of each of registrant's classes of capital or common stock or other ownership interests, if and as stated on cover of related periodic report. Where multiple classes or units exist define each class/interest by adding class of stock items such as Common Class A [Member], Common Class B [Member] or Partnership Interest [Member] onto the Instrument [Domain] of the Entity Listings, Instrument.

column1: Entity Listing, Depository Receipt Ratio
column2: The number of underlying shares represented by one American Depository Receipt (ADR) or Global Depository Receipt (GDR). A value of "3" means that one ADR represents 3 underlying shares. If one underlying share represents 2 ADR's then the value would be represented as "0.5".

column1: Entity Listing, Par Value Per Share
column2: The par value per share of security quoted in same currency as Trading currency. Example: "0.01".

column1: Entity Number of Employees
column2: Number of persons employed by the Entity

column1: Entity Public Float
column2: State aggregate market value of voting and non-voting common equity held by non-affiliates computed by reference to price at which the common equity was last sold, or average bid and asked price of such common equity, as of the last business day of registrant's most recently completed second fiscal quarter. The public float should be reported on the cover page of the registrants form 10K.

column1: Demutualization Cost and Expense
column2: The costs and expenses incurred pertaining to the reorganization process to convert a mutual entity to a stock company.

column1: Depletion
column2: The noncash expense charged against earnings to recognize the consumption of natural resources.

column1: Deposit Assets
column2: The carrying amount of the asset transferred to a third party to serve as a deposit, which typically serves as security against failure by the transferor to perform under terms of an agreement.

column1: Deposit Assets, Amortizaton Expense from Expirations
column2: Amount of amortization expense from expiration of contracts underlying deposit assets.

column1: Deposit Assets, Effect of Change in Present Value Assumptions Recorded as Expense
column2: Amount of expense due to change in present value assumptions used to value deposit assets.

column1: Deposit Assets, Effect of Change in Present Value Assumptions Resulting in Additions to Expected Recoveries
column2: Amount of decrease in expense due to change in present value assumptions used to value deposit assets.

column1: Deposit Assets, Effect of Change in Present Value Assumptions Resulting in Reductions to Expected Recoveries
column2: Amount of increase in expense due to change in present value assumptions used to value deposit assets.

column1: Deposit Assets, Present Value of Expected Recoveries
column2: Present value of initial expected recoveries that will be reimbursed under the insurance or reinsurance contracts.

column1: Deposit Liabilities, Effect of Change in Present Value Assumptions Recorded as Expense
column2: Amount of expense due to change in the present value assumptions on expected recoveries.

column1: Deposit Liabilities, Effect of Change in Present Value Assumptions Resulting in Additions to Expected Recoveries
column2: Amount of expense from increase in deposit liabilities due to change in present value assumptions used to value expected recoveries.

column1: Deposit Liabilities, Effect of Change in Present Value Assumptions Resulting in Reductions to Expected Recoveries
column2: Amount of decrease in expense from decrease in deposit liabilities due to change in present value assumptions used to value expected recoveries.

column1: Deposit Liabilities Reclassified as Loans Receivable
column2: Amount of deposits held by the entity that have been reclassified as loan balances receivable, for example, but not limited to, overdrafts receivable.

column1: Deposits, Money Market Deposits and Negotiable Order of Withdrawal (NOW)
column2: Amount of deposits in accounts that offer many of the same services as checking accounts although transactions may be somewhat more limited, share some of the characteristics of a money market fund and are insured by the Federal government, also known as money market accounts. Also includes amount of deposits in interest-bearing transaction accounts at banks or savings and loans, that are restricted in regard to ownership and can usually only be held by individuals, nonprofit entities and governments. Negotiable order of withdrawal accounts differ from money market demand accounts as they typically have higher reserve requirements and no limit on the number of checks that can be written.

column1: Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Nonproduction
column2: The current period expense charged against earnings on long-lived, physical assets not used in production, and which are not intended for resale, to allocate or recognize the cost of such assets over their useful lives; or to record the reduction in book value of an intangible asset over the benefit period of such asset; or to reflect consumption during the period of an asset that is not used in production.

column1: Depreciation and Amortization, Discontinued Operations
column2: Amount of deprecation and amortization expense attributable to property, plant and equipment and intangible assets of discontinued operations.

column1: Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization
column2: The aggregate expense recognized in the current period that allocates the cost of tangible assets, intangible assets, or depleting assets to periods that benefit from use of the assets.

column1: Derecognized Assets, Securitized or Asset-backed Financing Arrangement Assets and any Other Financial Assets Managed Together, Delinquent Amount at End of Period
column2: This is the amount of the financial instruments that are considered delinquent (past due) at the end of the period.

column1: Derecognized Assets, Securitized or Asset-backed Financing Arrangement Assets and any Other Financial Assets Managed Together, Net Credit Losses During Period
column2: Net credit losses are charge-offs and are based on total loans outstanding during the period.

column1: Continuing Involvement with Derecognized Transferred Financial Assets, Amount Outstanding
column2: Amount of transferred financial assets in which the transferor has continuing involvement with the assets underlying the transaction that have been derecognized. Continuing involvement includes, but is not limited to, servicing, recourse, and restrictions on transferor's interests in transferred financial assets.

column1: Derivative Asset, Collateral, Obligation to Return Cash, Offset
column2: Amount of obligation to return cash collateral under master netting arrangements offset against derivative assets.

column1: Derivative Asset, Fair Value, Gross Asset Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Fair value, before effects of master netting arrangements, of a financial asset or other contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset. Includes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Derivative Asset, Fair Value of Collateral
column2: Fair value of securities received as collateral against derivative assets.

column1: Derivative Asset, Fair Value, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Fair value, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of financial asset or other contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, offset against an obligation to return collateral.

column1: Derivative Asset, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Fair value of financial asset or other contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, elected not to be offset, deducted from derivative assets.

column1: Derivative Asset, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Fair value of financial asset or other contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Derivative Asset, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Fair value of financial asset or other contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from derivative assets.

column1: Derivative Asset, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Securities Borrowed, Amount Offset Against Collateral
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, of derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed offset against an obligation to return collateral under a master netting arrangement. Includes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.

column1: Derivative Asset, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Securities Borrowed, Collateral, Obligation to Return Cash
column2: Amount of obligation to return cash collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed.

column1: Derivative Asset, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Securities Borrowed, Collateral, Obligation to Return Securities
column2: Amount of obligation to return securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed.

column1: Derivative Asset, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Securities Borrowed, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed. Includes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Derivative Asset, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Securities Borrowed, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Amount of derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed, elected not to be offset, deducted from derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed.

column1: Derivative Asset, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Securities Borrowed, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Amount of derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed.

column1: Derivative Asset, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Securities Borrowed, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of derivative assets, securities purchased under agreements to resell and securities borrowed, offset against an obligation to return collateral under a master netting arrangement.

column1: Derivative, Average Basis Spread on Variable Rate
column2: The average percentage points added to the reference rate to compute the variable rate on the group of interest rate derivatives.

column1: Derivative, Average Cap Interest Rate
column2: Average cap rate on a group of interest rate derivatives, such as interest rate caps or collars. If market rates exceed the cap rate, a payment or receipt is triggered on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Average Cap Price
column2: The average cap rate on a group of price risk derivatives such as caps or collars. A payment or receipt is triggered if the market rate exceeds the cap rate on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Average Exchange Rate Cap
column2: Average cap rate on a group of foreign currency derivatives for example, but not limited to, caps or collars.

column1: Derivative, Average Exchange Rate Floor
column2: Average floor rate on a group of foreign currency derivatives for example, but not limited to, floors or collars.

column1: Derivative, Average Fixed Interest Rate
column2: Average fixed interest rate related to the group of interest rate derivatives.

column1: Derivative, Average Floor Interest Rate
column2: Average floor rate on a group of interest rate derivatives, such as interest rate floor or collars. If market rates fall below the floor rate, a payment or receipt is triggered on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Average Floor Price
column2: The average floor rate on a group of price risk derivatives such as floors or collars. A payment or receipt is triggered if the market rate falls below the floor rate on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Average Foreign Currency Option Strike Price
column2: The average strike price on a group of foreign currency option contracts such as put options or call options.

column1: Derivative, Average Forward Exchange Rate
column2: Average contractual rate at which a foreign currency can be purchased or sold.

column1: Derivative, Average Forward Interest Rate
column2: Average stated rate on a group of interest rate forward or futures contracts.

column1: Derivative, Average Forward Price
column2: The average forward price on the group of price risk forward or futures contracts, such as gas futures contracts.

column1: Derivative, Average Price Risk Option Strike Price
column2: The average strike price on the group of price risk option contracts such as put options or call options.

column1: Derivative, Average Swaption Interest Rate
column2: Average fixed interest rate that will be received or paid upon exercise of a group of interest rate swaption contracts.

column1: Derivative, Average Variable Interest Rate
column2: Average variable interest rate related to the group of interest rate derivatives.

column1: Derivative, Basis Spread on Variable Rate
column2: The percentage points added to the reference rate to compute the variable rate on the interest rate derivative.

column1: Derivative, Cap Interest Rate
column2: Cap rate on an interest rate derivative such as an interest rate cap or collar. If market rates exceed the cap rate, a payment or receipt is triggered on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Cap Price
column2: The cap rate on a price risk derivative such as a cap or collar. A payment or receipt is triggered if the market rate exceeds the cap rate on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Collateral, Obligation to Return Securities
column2: Amount of obligation to return securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against derivative assets.
column4: Issue raised by lisa Cuisino in filing on Aug 8 2018.

column1: Derivative, Collateral, Right to Reclaim Securities
column2: Amount of right to receive securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against derivative liabilities.

column1: Derivative Credit Risk Valuation Adjustment, Derivative Assets
column2: Amount of credit risk valuation adjustment to derivative assets to properly reflect the credit quality of the counterparties.

column1: Derivative Credit Risk Valuation Adjustment, Derivative Liabilities
column2: Amount of credit risk valuation adjustment to derivative liabilities to properly reflect the credit quality of the entity.

column1: Derivative, Exchange Rate Cap
column2: Cap rate on a foreign currency derivative for example, but not limited to, a cap or a collar.

column1: Derivative, Exchange Rate Floor
column2: Floor rate on a foreign currency derivative for example, but not limited to, a floor or a collar.

column1: Derivative, Fixed Interest Rate
column2: Fixed interest rate related to the interest rate derivative.

column1: Derivative, Floor Interest Rate
column2: Floor rate on an interest rate derivative such as an interest rate floor or collar. If market rates falls below the floor rate, a payment or receipt is triggered on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Floor Price
column2: Floor rate on a price risk derivative such as a floor or a collar. A payment or receipt is triggered if the market rate falls below the floor rate on the contract.

column1: Derivative, Foreign Currency Option Strike Price
column2: The strike price on the foreign currency option contract such as a put option or a call option.

column1: Derivative, Forward Exchange Rate
column2: Contractual rate at which a foreign currency can be purchased or sold.

column1: Derivative, Forward Interest Rate
column2: Stated rate on an interest rate forward or futures contract.

column1: Derivative, Forward Price
column2: The forward price on the price risk forward or futures contract, such as a gas futures contract.

column1: Derivative, Gain on Derivative
column2: Amount of increase in the fair value of derivatives recognized in the income statement.

column1: Derivative Instruments and Hedges, Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Fair value of liability arising from contracts that meet the criteria of being accounted for as derivative instruments, financial instrument or contract used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), energy marketing activities (trading activities), expected to be settled after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer. Examples of energy marketing activities include, but are not limited to, trading of electricity, coal, natural gas and oil using financial instruments, including, but not limited to, forward contracts, options and swaps.

column1: Derivative Liability, Fair Value, Gross Asset and Right to Reclaim Cash, Offset
column2: Fair value of asset associated with financial liability or contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, and right to receive cash collateral under master netting arrangements.
