column1: Derivative Liability, Fair Value, Gross Liability Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Fair value, before effects of master netting arrangements, of a financial liability or contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Derivative Liability, Fair Value of Collateral
column2: Fair value of securities pledged as collateral against derivative liabilities.

column1: Derivative Liability, Fair Value, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Fair value, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of financial liability or contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, offset against the right to receive collateral.

column1: Derivative Liability, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Fair value of financial liability or contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, elected not to be offset, deducted from derivative liabilities.

column1: Derivative Liability, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Fair value of financial liability or contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Derivative Liability, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Fair value of financial liability or contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from derivative liabilities.

column1: Derivative Liability, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Securities Loaned, Collateral, Right to Reclaim Cash
column2: Amount of right to receive cash collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned.

column1: Derivative Liability, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Securities Loaned, Collateral, Right to Reclaim Securities
column2: Amount of right to receive securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned.

column1: Derivative Liability, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Securities Loaned, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Derivative Liability, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Securities Loaned, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Amount of derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned, elected not to be offset, deducted from derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned.

column1: Derivative Liability, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Securities Loaned, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Amount of derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned.

column1: Derivative Liability, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Securities Loaned, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of derivative liabilities, securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned, offset against a right to receive collateral.

column1: Derivative, Loss on Derivative
column2: Amount of decrease in the fair value of derivatives recognized in the income statement.

column1: Derivative, Nonmonetary Notional Amount, Energy Measure
column2: Nominal energy measure used to calculate payments on a derivative instrument.

column1: Derivative, Nonmonetary Notional Amount, Flow Rate
column2: Nominal flow rate used to calculate payments on a derivative instrument.

column1: Derivative, Nonmonetary Notional Amount, Mass
column2: Nominal mass used to calculate payments on a derivative instrument.

column1: Derivative, Nonmonetary Notional Amount, Volume
column2: Nominal volume used to calculate payments on a derivative instrument.

column1: Derivative, Number of Instruments Held
column2: The number of derivative instruments of a particular group held by the entity.

column1: Derivative, Price Risk Option Strike Price
column2: The strike price on the price risk option contract such as a put option or a call option.

column1: Derivative, Swaption Interest Rate
column2: Fixed interest rate that will be received or paid upon exercise of the interest rate swaption contract.

column1: Derivative, Swap Type, Average Fixed Price
column2: Average fixed price related to the group of price risk swap derivatives.

column1: Derivative, Swap Type, Average Variable Price
column2: Average variable price rate related to the group of price risk swap derivatives.

column1: Derivative, Swap Type, Fixed Price
column2: Fixed price related to the price risk swap derivative.

column1: Derivative, Swap Type, Variable Price
column2: Variable price rate related to the price risk swap derivative.

column1: Derivative, Variable Interest Rate
column2: Variable interest rate in effect as of the balance sheet date related to the interest rate derivative.

column1: Development Costs, Period Cost
column2: The capitalized costs incurred during the period (excluded from amortization) to obtain access to proved reserves and to provide facilities for extracting, treating, gathering and storing the oil and gas.

column1: Development Wells Drilled, Net Nonproductive
column2: The number of nonproductive development wells (dry wells) drilled in the geographic area. A dry well (hole) is a well found to be incapable of producing either oil or gas in sufficient quantities to justify completion as an oil or gas well. The number of wells drilled refers to the number of wells (holes) completed at any time during the fiscal years, regardless when drilling was initiated.

column1: Development Wells Drilled, Net Productive
column2: The number of productive developmental wells drilled in the geographic area. A productive well is a well that is not a dry well. The number of wells drilled refers to the number of wells (holes) completed at any time during the fiscal years, regardless when drilling was initiated.

column1: Direct Premiums Earned
column2: Amount, before premiums ceded to other entities and premiums assumed by the entity, of premiums earned.

column1: Discontinued Operation, Amounts of Material Contingent Liabilities Remaining
column2: Amounts of material contingent liabilities, for example, but not limited to, product or environmental liabilities or litigation, that remain with the entity despite the disposal of the disposal group that is classified as a component of the entity.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
column2: Amount classified as accounts payable and accrued liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount classified as accounts payable and accrued liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accounts Payable, Current
column2: Amount classified as accounts payable attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accrued Income Tax Payable
column2: Amount classified as income tax obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accrued Income Tax Payable, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as income tax obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accrued Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount classified as accrued liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Cash
column2: Amount of currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits, held by a disposal group.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Cash and Cash Equivalents
column2: Amount classified as cash and cash equivalents attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Consideration
column2: Amount of consideration received or receivable for the disposal of assets and liabilities, including discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Costs of Goods Sold
column2: Amount of costs of goods sold attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Revenue
column2: Amount classified as deferred revenue attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Revenue, Current
column2: Amount classified as deferred revenue attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Revenue, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as deferred revenue attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Tax Asset, Current
column2: Amount classified as deferred tax assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Tax Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as deferred tax assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Tax Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount classified as deferred tax liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Tax Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as deferred tax liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Depreciation and Amortization
column2: Amount of depreciation and amortization expense attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, General and Administrative Expense
column2: Amount of general and administrative expense attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Goodwill
column2: Amount classified as goodwill attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Goodwill, Current
column2: Amount classified as goodwill attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Goodwill, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as goodwill attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Intangible Assets
column2: Amount classified as intangible assets, excluding goodwill, attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Intangible Assets, Current
column2: Amount classified as intangible assets, excluding goodwill, attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Intangible Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as intangible assets, excluding goodwill, attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Interest Expense
column2: Amount of interest expense attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Interest Income
column2: Amount of interest income attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Inventory
column2: Amount classified as inventory attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Inventory, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as inventory attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Operating Expense
column2: Amount of operating expense attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Other Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount classified as other liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Other Expense
column2: Amount of other expense attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Other Income
column2: Amount of other income attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Other Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as other liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Pension Plan Benefit Obligation, Current
column2: Amount classified as defined benefit plan benefit obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Pension Plan Benefit Obligation, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as defined benefit plan benefit obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Postretirement Plan Benefit Obligation, Current
column2: Amount classified as defined benefit non-pension postretirement plan obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Postretirement Plan Benefit Obligation, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as defined benefit non-pension postretirement plan obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Prepaid and Other Assets
column2: Amount classified as prepaid and other assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Prepaid and Other Assets, Current
column2: Amount classified as prepaid and other assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Property, Plant and Equipment
column2: Amount classified as property, plant and equipment attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Property, Plant and Equipment, Current
column2: Amount classified as property, plant and equipment attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Property, Plant and Equipment, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as property, plant and equipment attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Rental Income
column2: Amount of rental income attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

column1: Distributed Earnings
column2: The total amount of dividends declared in the period for each class of stock and the contractual amount of dividends (or interest on participating income bonds) that must be paid for the period (for example, unpaid cumulative dividends). Dividends declared in the current period do not include dividends declared in respect of prior-period unpaid cumulative dividends. Preferred dividends that are cumulative only if earned are deducted only to the extent that they are earned.

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Liability Company (LLC) Member, Cash Distributions Declared
column2: Amount of equity impact of cash distributions declared to unit-holder of limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Liability Company (LLC) Member, Cash Distributions Paid
column2: Amount of cash distribution paid to unit-holder of limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Liability Company (LLC) Member, Distributions Declared, Per Unit
column2: Per unit of ownership amount of cash distributions declared to unit-holder of a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Liability Company (LLC) Member, Distributions Paid, Per Unit
column2: Per unit of ownership amount of cash distributions paid to unit-holder of a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Liability Company (LLC) Member, Unit Distribution
column2: Number of units distributed for payment of a unit distribution to unit-holder of a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Liability Company (LLC) Member, Unit Distribution, Dilution Per Unit
column2: Per unit of ownership amount of dilution resulting from the issuance of additional unit for payment of unit distribution to unit-holder of a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Partner, Cash Distributions Declared
column2: Amount of equity impact of cash distribution declared to unit-holder of limited partnership (LP).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Partner, Cash Distributions Paid
column2: Amount of cash distribution paid to unit-holder of limited partnership (LP).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Partner, Distributions Declared, Per Unit
column2: Per unit of ownership amount of cash distributions declared to unit-holder of a limited partnership (LP).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Partner, Distributions Paid, Per Unit
column2: Per unit of ownership amount of cash distributions paid to unit-holder of a limited partnership (LP).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Partner, Unit Distribution
column2: Number of units distributed for payment of a unit distribution to unit-holder of limited partnership (LP).

column1: Distribution Made to Limited Partner, Unit Distribution, Dilution Per Unit
column2: Per unit of ownership amount of dilution resulting from the issuance of additional unit for payment of unit distribution to unit-holder of a limited partnership (LP).

column1: Dividend Income, Operating
column2: Amount of operating dividend income on securities.

column1: Dividend Income, Securities, Operating, Taxable
column2: Amount of operating dividend income on securities subject to state, federal and other income tax.

column1: Dividend Income, Securities, Operating, Tax Advantaged
column2: Amount of operating dividend income on securities subject to tax benefits. Excludes operating dividend income on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.

column1: Dividend Income, Securities, Operating, Tax Exempt
column2: Amount of operating dividend income on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.

column1: Dividends and Interest Paid
column2: The contractual amount of dividends (or interest on participating income bonds) that must be paid for the current period (for example, unpaid cumulative dividends).

column1: Dividends, Preferred Stock, Cash
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid preferred stock dividends declared with the form of settlement in cash.

column1: Due from Officers or Stockholders, Current
column2: Amounts due from owners or owners with a beneficial interest of more than 10 percent of the voting interests or officers of the company, which are usually due within 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, at Federal Statutory Income Tax Rate, Percent
column2: Percentage of domestic federal statutory tax rate applicable to pretax income (loss).

column1: Employee Service Share-based Compensation, Nonvested Awards, Compensation Not yet Recognized, Share-based Awards Other than Options
column2: Unrecognized cost of unvested share-based awards, other than options, awarded to employees as compensation.

column1: Employee Service Share-based Compensation, Nonvested Awards, Compensation Not yet Recognized, Stock Options
column2: Unrecognized cost of unvested options awarded to employees as compensation.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Weighted Average Purchase Price of Shares Purchased
column2: Weighted average purchase price of capital shares purchased through an employee stock ownership plan.

column1: Energy Marketing Contract Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Fair value of liability arising from energy marketing activities (trading activities), expected to be settled after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer. Examples of energy marketing activities include, but are not limited to, trading of electricity, coal, natural gas and oil using financial instruments, including, but not limited to, forward contracts, options and swaps.

column1: Environmental Costs Recognized, Capitalized
column2: Amount of costs recognized in the balance sheet for known or estimated future costs arising from requirements to perform activities to remediate one or more sites.

column1: Environmental Costs Recognized, Capitalized in Period
column2: Amount of environmental remediation costs capitalized. These expenditures may relate to long-lived improvements in operating facilities.

column1: Environmental Costs Recognized, Recovery Credited to Expense
column2: Amount of any recovery from third parties that is credited to environmental remediation costs.

column1: Environmental Exit Costs, Reasonably Possible Additional Loss
column2: Estimate of reasonably possible loss exposure in excess of amount accrued for remediation, site restoration, postclosure, monitoring commitments, or other exit costs associated with the sale, disposal or abandonment of a particular property resulting from unanticipated contamination of the assets.

column1: Equipment Expense
column2: This element represents equipment expense including depreciation, repairs, rentals, and service contract costs. This item also includes equipment purchases which do not qualify for capitalization in accordance with the entity's accounting policy. This item may also include furniture expenses.

column1: Equity Issued in Business Combination, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of equity issued in a business combination.

column1: Proceeds from Equity Method Investment, Dividends or Distributions
column2: This item represents disclosure of the amount of dividends or other distributions received from unconsolidated subsidiaries, certain corporate joint ventures, and certain noncontrolled corporation; these investments are accounted for under the equity method of accounting. This element excludes distributions that constitute a return of investment, which are classified as investing activities.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Liabilities
column2: The amount of liabilities reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Escrow Deposit Disbursements Related to Property Acquisition
column2: Amount of escrow deposit disbursements related to property acquisition in noncash investing or financing transactions.

column1: Excess Capital
column2: The amount by which the company's Total Capital exceeds the minimum required for capital adequacy purposes.

column1: Excess Capital to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: The amount of excess Total Capital divided by risk weighted assets which are assets that are weighted for credit risk according to a formula used by the Reserve Bank.

column1: Excess Stock, Shares Authorized
column2: Maximum number of excess stock shares permitted to be issued.

column1: Excess Stock, Shares Issued
column2: Number of excess stock shares of an entity that have been sold or granted to shareholders.

column1: Excess Stock, Shares Outstanding
column2: Number of shares of excess stock held by shareholders.

column1: Excess Tangible Capital
column2: Tangible Capital, which, generally includes outstanding stock plus retained earnings, in excess of the minimum amount of tangible capital required.

column1: Excess Tangible Capital Required for Capital Adequacy to Tangible Assets
column2: The amount of excess Tangible Capital, which generally includes outstanding stock plus retained earnings, divided by tangible assets (assets with physical existence) as defined in the regulations.

column1: Excess Tax Benefit from Share-based Compensation, Financing Activities
column2: Amount of cash inflow from realized tax benefit related to deductible compensation cost reported on the entity's tax return for equity instruments in excess of the compensation cost for those instruments recognized for financial reporting purposes.

column1: Excess Tier One Leverage Capital
column2: The amount by which the company's Tier 1 Leverage Capital exceeds the minimum required for capital adequacy purposes.

column1: Excess Tier One Leverage Capital to Average Assets
column2: The amount of excess Tier 1 Leverage Capital divided by average assets as defined in the regulations.

column1: Excess Tier One Risk Based Capital
column2: The amount by which the company's Tier 1 Risk Based Capital exceeds the minimum required for capital adequacy purposes.

column1: Excess Tier One Risk Based Capital to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: The amount of excess Tier 1 Risk Based Capital (which consists of the types of financial capital considered the most reliable and liquid, primarily Shareholders' equity. Examples of Tier 1 capital are common stock or unit, preferred stock or unit that is irredeemable and noncumulative, and retained earnings) divided by risk-weighted assets which are assets that are weighted for credit risk according to a formula used by the Reserve Bank.

column1: Exchange Fees
column2: The amount of expense in the period for fees charged by securities exchanges for the privilege of trading securities listed on that exchange. Some fees vary with the related volume, while others are fixed.

column1: Expense Related to Distribution or Servicing and Underwriting Fees
column2: Expense related to distribution, servicing and underwriting fees.

column1: Exploration Costs, Period Cost
column2: The capitalized costs incurred during the period (excluded from amortization) in identifying areas that may warrant examination and in examining specific areas that are considered to have prospects of containing oil and gas reserves, including costs of drilling exploratory wells and exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells. Exploration costs may be incurred both before acquiring the related property (sometimes referred to in part as prospecting costs) and after acquiring the property. Principal types of exploration costs, which include depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of exploration activities, are: costs of topographical, geographical and geophysical studies, rights of access to properties to conduct those studies, and salaries and other expenses of geologists, geophysical crews, and others conducting those studies. Collectively, these are sometimes referred to as geological and geophysical or "G&G" costs. Exploration costs also include costs of carrying and retaining undeveloped properties, such as delay rentals, ad valorem taxes on properties, legal costs for title defense, the maintenance of land and lease records, dry hole contributions and bottom hole contributions, costs of drilling and equipping exploratory wells and costs of drilling exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells.

column1: Exploratory Wells Drilled, Net Nonproductive
column2: The number of nonproductive exploratory wells (dry wells) drilled in the geographic area. A dry well (hole) is a well found to be incapable of producing either oil or gas in sufficient quantities to justify completion as an oil or gas well. The number of wells drilled refers to the number of wells (holes) completed at any time during the fiscal years, regardless when drilling was initiated.

column1: Exploratory Wells Drilled, Net Productive
column2: The number of productive exploratory wells drilled in the geographic area. A productive well is a well that is not a dry well. The number of wells drilled refers to the number of wells (holes) completed at any time during the fiscal years, regardless when drilling was initiated.

column1: Extinguishment of Debt, Amount
column2: Gross amount of debt extinguished.

column1: Obligations, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of obligations measured on a recurring basis.

column1: Subordinated Debt Obligations, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of subordinated debt obligations including, but not limited to, subordinated loan, subordinated bond, subordinated debenture or junior debt.

column1: Fair Value, Measurement with Unobservable Inputs Reconciliation, Liability, Transfers Into Level 3
column2: Amount of transfers of financial instrument classified as a liability into level 3 of the fair value hierarchy.

column1: Fair Value, Measurement with Unobservable Inputs Reconciliation, Recurring Basis, Liability, Issuances
column2: Amount of issuances of financial instrument classified as a liability measured using unobservable inputs that reflect the entity's own assumption about the assumptions market participants would use in pricing.

column1: Fair Value, Measurement with Unobservable Inputs Reconciliation, Recurring Basis, Liability, Purchases
column2: Amount of purchases of financial instrument classified as a liability measured using unobservable inputs that reflect the entity's own assumption about the assumptions market participants would use in pricing.
column4: Removed because of ambiguity of what a purchase or sale is.

column1: Fair Value, Measurement with Unobservable Inputs Reconciliation, Recurring Basis, Liability, Sales
column2: Amount of sales of financial instrument classified as a liability measured using unobservable inputs that reflect the entity's own assumption about the assumptions market participants would use in pricing.
column4: Removed because of ambiguity of what a purchase or sale is.

column1: Fair Value, Measurement with Unobservable Inputs Reconciliation, Recurring Basis, Liability, Settlements
column2: Amount of settlements of financial instrument classified as a liability measured using unobservable inputs that reflect the entity's own assumption about the assumptions market participants would use in pricing.

column1: Fair Value, Option, Loans Held as Assets, 90 Days or More Past Due
column2: This item represents the aggregate fair value of loans held as assets that are 90 days or more past due for which the fair value option has been elected.

column1: Fair Value, Option, Loans Held as Assets, Aggregate Amount in Nonaccrual Status
column2: This item represents the aggregate fair value of loans held as assets that are in nonaccrual status for which the fair value option has been elected, if the entity's policy is to recognize interest income separately from other changes in fair value.

column1: FDIC Indemnification Asset
column2: Carrying amount of receivable assets originating from the indemnification agreement with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), in which the FDIC is to partially cover losses.

column1: FDIC Indemnification Asset, Accretion of Discount
column2: Increases to the indemnification asset due to accretion of the loan discount relating to loss sharing agreements with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC).

column1: FDIC Indemnification Asset, Acquisitions
column2: Amount of increases to the indemnification asset due to acquisitions of assets relating to loss sharing agreements with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC).

column1: FDIC Indemnification Asset, Additional Estimated Losses
column2: Amount of increases to the indemnification asset due to additional estimated losses assumed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), relating to loss sharing agreements with the FDIC.

column1: FDIC Indemnification Asset, Cash Payments Received
column2: Amount of decreases to the indemnification asset due to cash payments received relating to loss sharing agreements with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC).

column1: FDIC Indemnification Asset, Disposals
column2: Amount of decreases to the indemnification asset due to disposals relating to loss sharing agreements with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC).

column1: FDIC Indemnification Asset, Net Write Offs
column2: Amount of decreases to the indemnification asset due to write offs of loans, net of recoveries, relating to loss sharing agreements with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC).

column1: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Premium Expense
column2: Amount of expense for Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) insurance.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank Advances
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) advances to member financial institutions.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Affordable Housing Program, Principal Outstanding
column2: Principal amount outstanding of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) relating to the Affordable Housing Program (AHP).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Branch of FHLB Bank, Amount of Advances
column2: Amount of advances from the Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Branch of FHLB Bank, Interest Rate
column2: Discloses the single interest rate [if] applicable to the advances from the Federal Home Loan Bank, by branch, as of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Commitment Fees
column2: Amount of unearned commitment fees on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Discount
column2: Amount of unamortized discount on outstanding advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Discount on Affordable Housing Program
column2: Amount of unamortized discount on outstanding Affordable Housing Program (AHP) advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Call Date, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next call date after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Call Date, in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next call date within the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Call Date, in Rolling Year Five
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next call date within the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Call Date, in Rolling Year Four
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next call date within the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Call Date, in Rolling Year Three
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next call date within the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Call Date, in Rolling Year Two
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next call date within the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Put or Convert Date, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next put or convert date after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Put or Convert Date, in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next put or convert date within the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Put or Convert Date, in Rolling Year Five
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next put or convert date within the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Put or Convert Date, in Rolling Year Four
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next put or convert date within the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Put or Convert Date, in Rolling Year Three
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next put or convert date within the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Earlier of Contractual Maturity or Next Put or Convert Date, in Rolling Year Two
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with the earlier of contractual maturity or next put or convert date within the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Fixed Rate
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with fixed interest rate.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Fixed Rate, after One Year
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with fixed interest rate maturing more than one year after the latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Fixed Rate, under One Year
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with fixed interest rate maturing within one year of the latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Floating Rate
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with floating interest rate.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Floating Rate, after One Year
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with floating interest rate maturing more than one year after the latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Floating Rate, under One Year
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) with floating interest rate maturing within one year after the latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, General Debt Obligations, Disclosures, Collateral Pledged
column2: Amount of the collateral pledged in support of federal home loan bank advances outstanding.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, General Debt Obligations, Disclosures, Repayment and Penalties
column2: Amount of repayments and penalties incurred in the satisfaction or roll-over of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advance.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Index Amortizing
column2: Par amount of index amortizing advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Interest Rate
column2: Interest rate of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Interest Rate on Affordable Housing Program Subsidized Loans
column2: Interest rate of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) on Affordable Housing Program (AHP) subsidized loans.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, in Rolling Year Five
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, in Rolling Year Four
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, in Rolling Year Three
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, in Rolling Year Two
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Outstanding, Greater than One Billion Dollars Per Borrower, Amount
column2: Amount of advances outstanding made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) in excess of one billion U.S. dollars per borrower.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Outstanding, Greater than One Billion Dollars Per Borrower, Number of Borrowers
column2: Number of borrowers with Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) advances outstanding greater than one billion U.S. dollars.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Outstanding, Greater than One Billion Dollars Per Borrower, Percent
column2: Percentage of advances outstanding made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) that are in excess of one billion U.S. dollars per borrower to the total advances outstanding.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Par Value
column2: Par amount of advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Premium
column2: Amount of unearned premiums on outstanding advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate
column2: Weighted average interest rate on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Index Amortizing
column2: Weighted average interest rate on index amortizing advances made by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturing after Rolling Year Five
column2: Weighted average interest rate on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturing in Next Twelve Rolling Months
column2: Weighted average interest rate on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturing in Rolling Year Five
column2: Weighted average interest rate on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturing in Rolling Year Four
column2: Weighted average interest rate on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturing in Rolling Year Three
column2: Weighted average interest rate on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank Advances, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturing in Rolling Year Two
column2: Weighted average interest rate on advances made and reported by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Consolidated Obligations
column2: Amount of joint and several obligations consisting of consolidated obligation bonds and discount notes issued by Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Consolidated Obligations, Bonds
column2: Amount of joint and several obligations consisting of bonds issued by Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Consolidated Obligations, Discount Notes
column2: Amount of joint and several obligations consisting of discount notes issued by Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Leverage Capital, Actual
column2: Amount of leveraged capital of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), set by the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Leverage Capital, Required
column2: Minimum amount of leverage capital required for Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), set by the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Regulatory Capital, Actual
column2: Amount of regulatory capital of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), set by the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Regulatory Capital Ratio, Actual
column2: Regulatory capital ratio of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), calculated per regulations of the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Regulatory Capital, Required
column2: Minimum amount of regulatory capital required for Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), set by the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Risk-Based Capital, Actual
column2: Amount of risk-based capital of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), set by the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Risk-Based Capital, Required
column2: Minimum amount of risk-based capital required for Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), set by the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank Stock and Federal Reserve Bank Stock
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) and Federal Reserve Bank stock.

column1: Fees and Commissions, Mortgage Banking and Servicing
column2: Income from mortgage banking activities (fees and commissions) and servicing real estate mortgages, credit cards, and other financial assets held by others net of any related impairment of capitalized service costs. Also includes any premiums received in lieu of regular servicing fees on such loans only as earned over the life of the loans.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Claim Liability, Significant Components of Change, Accretion of Discount
column2: This element represents the amount of the change in the claim liability related to financial guarantee insurance contracts arising from the accretion of the discount of the claim liability.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts Premium Receivable New Business Written
column2: Amount of new business written on financial guarantee insurance contracts.

column1: Financial Instruments Owned and Pledged as Collateral, Amount Eligible to be Repledged by Counterparty
column2: Fair value of financial instrument held by the entity for its own account (proprietary securities) for trading or investment purposes that are carried at fair value and pledged to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions where counterparty has the right to re-pledge such.

column1: Financial Instruments Owned and Pledged as Collateral, Amount Not Eligible to be Repledged by Counterparty
column2: Fair value of financial instrument held by the entity for its own account (proprietary securities) for trading or investment purposes that are carried at fair value and pledged to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions where counterparty does not have the right to re-pledge such.

column1: Financial Instruments Sold, Not yet Purchased, Derivatives and Other Contracts
column2: Fair value of obligations arising from derivatives and other contracts sold short.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Past Contractual Redemption Date, Due to Outstanding Activity
column2: Amount of mandatorily redeemable capital stock past the contractual redemption date due to outstanding activity.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Past Contractual Redemption Date, Due to Regulatory Action
column2: Amount of mandatorily redeemable capital stock past the contractual redemption date due to regulatory action.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Redeemable in Year Five
column2: Amount of mandatorily redeemable capital stock maturing in year five following the date of the latest balance sheet.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Redeemable in Year Four
column2: Amount of mandatorily redeemable capital stock maturing in year four following the date of the latest balance sheet.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Redeemable in Year Three
column2: Amount of mandatorily redeemable capital stock maturing in year three following the date of the latest balance sheet.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Redeemable in Year Two
column2: Amount of mandatorily redeemable capital stock maturing in year two following the date of the latest balance sheet.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Redeemable within One year
column2: Amount of mandatorily redeemable capital stock maturing within one year following the date of the latest balance sheet.

column1: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Losses, Individually Evaluated for Impairment
column2: Amount of valuation allowance for financing receivables that are expected to be uncollectible that were individually evaluated for impairment.

column1: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Losses, Recovery
column2: Amount of recovery of financing receivables doubtful of collection that were previously charged off.

column1: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Losses, Write-downs
column2: Amount of direct write-downs of financing receivables charged against the allowance.

column1: Financing Receivable, Modifications, Number of Contracts
column2: Number of financing receivables that have been modified by troubled debt restructurings.

column1: Financing Receivable, Modifications, Post-Modification Recorded Investment
column2: Post-modification amount of investment in financing receivables modified by troubled debt restructurings.

column1: Financing Receivable, Modifications, Pre-Modification Recorded Investment
column2: Pre-modification amount of investment in financing receivables modified by troubled debt restructurings.

column1: Financing Receivable, Modifications, Subsequent Default, Number of Contracts
column2: Number of financing receivables that have been modified by troubled debt restructurings within the previous 12 months and for which there was a payment default.

column1: Financing Receivable, Modifications, Subsequent Default, Recorded Investment
column2: Amount of investment related to financing receivables modified by troubled debt restructurings within the previous 12 months, for which there was a payment default.

column1: Finite-lived Intangible Assets Acquired
column2: Amount of increase in assets, excluding financial assets, lacking physical substance with a definite life, resulting from a business combination.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, after Year Five
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized during the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Year Five
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized during the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Year Four
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized during the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Year Three
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized during the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Amortization Expense, Year Two
column2: Amount of amortization expense for assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life expected to be recognized during the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Finite-lived Intangible Assets, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of assets, excluding financial assets, that lack physical substance, having a limited useful life.

column1: Floor Brokerage
column2: Broker-dealers often use other brokers to execute trades on their behalf. The trading broker-dealer becomes a customer of the executing broker-dealer and pays a floor brokerage fee. Such fees are paid periodically either directly to the executing broker-dealer or through a clearing house.

column1: Floor Brokerage, Exchange and Clearance Fees
column2: The amount of expense during the period for floor brokerage fees paid to other broker-dealers to execute trades on their behalf, stock exchange fees, order flow fees, and clearance fees.

column1: Foreclosed Real Estate Expense
column2: Amount of expense recognized during the period for the foreclosure on real estate assets.

column1: Foreign Currency Exchange Rate, Remeasurement
column2: Foreign exchange rate used to remeasure amounts denominated in a currency other than functional currency into functional currency.

column1: Foreign Currency Exchange Rate, Translation
column2: Foreign exchange rate used to translate amounts denominated in functional currency to reporting currency.

column1: Foreign Currency Transaction Loss, before Tax
column2: Amount before tax of foreign currency transaction realized and unrealized loss recognized in the income statement.

column1: Foreign Earnings Repatriated
column2: Amount of foreign earnings repatriated from subsidiaries outside the country of domicile.

column1: Forward Contract Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Settlement Alternatives, Shares, at Fair Value
column2: Number of shares as a settlement alternative for each freestanding forward contract.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Gain Contingency, Patents Allegedly Infringed upon, Number
column2: Number of entity's patents that another entity has allegedly infringed.

column1: Gain Contingency, Patents Found Infringed upon, Number
column2: Number of entity's patents that another entity was found to have infringed.

column1: Gain Contingency, Patents Found Not Infringed upon, Number
column2: Number of entity's patents that another entity was found not to have infringed.

column1: Gain on Derivative Instruments, Pretax
column2: Aggregate gain on all derivative instruments recognized in earnings during the period, before tax effects.

column1: Gain on Sale of Investments
column2: The difference between the carrying value and the sale price of an investment. A gain would be recognized when the sale price of the investment is greater than the carrying value of the investment. This element refers to the Gain included in earnings and not to the cash proceeds of the sale.

column1: Gas and Oil Area, Developed, Gross
column2: Area spaced or assigned to productive wells in which a working interest is owned.

column1: Gas and Oil Area, Developed, Net
column2: Fractional interest owned based on working interests or other economic arrangements of area spaced or assigned to productive wells.

column1: Gas and Oil Area, Undeveloped, Gross
column2: Lease area in which a working interest is owned and on which wells have not been drilled or completed to a point that would permit the production of commercial quantities of oil and gas regardless of whether or not such area contains proved reserves.

column1: Gas and Oil Area, Undeveloped, Net
column2: Fractional interest owned based on working interests or other economic arrangements of lease area on which wells have not been drilled or completed to a point that would permit the production of commercial quantities of oil and gas regardless of whether or not such area contains proved reserves.

column1: Gas Purchase Contract, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of contract to purchase gas.

column1: General and Administrative Expense Ratio
column2: Ratio of non-life general and administrative expenses to non-life net premiums earned.

column1: General Fair Value Hedge Information, Minimum R Square, Percentage
column2: The correlation coefficient between the hypothetical instrument and the hedged item used in determination of the effectiveness of a hedging relationship.

column1: General Partner Distributions
column2: Distributions from earnings to the general partner of a partnership included in the consolidated financial statements.

column1: General Partners' Capital Account, Period Distribution Amount
column2: The total amount of distributions to the general partner during the period.

column1: Goodwill, Acquired During Period
column2: Amount of increase in asset representing future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized resulting from a business combination.

column1: Goodwill, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

column1: Goodwill, Impairment Loss, Net of Tax
column2: Amount after tax of loss recognized that results from the write-down of an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

column1: Gross Investment Income, Operating
column2: Amount, before investment expense, of income earned from investments in securities and real estate. Includes, but is not limited to, real estate investment, policy loans, dividends, and interest. Excludes realized gain (loss) on investments.

column1: Ground Leases, Accumulated Amortization
column2: Accumulated amortization on long-term land leases capitalized as part of real property.

column1: Ground Leases, Gross
column2: Gross long-term land leases capitalized as part of real property.

column1: Ground Leases, Net
column2: Net long-term land leases which are capitalized as part of real property.

column1: Health Care Organization, Allowance for Doubtful Accounts, Percentage of Accounts Receivable
column2: Ratio of the allowance for doubtful accounts to accounts receivable, expressed as a percentage, for health care organizations.

column1: Hedging Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Fair value of liability arising from a financial instrument or contract used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), expected to be settled after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Accumulated Unrecognized Holding Gain
column2: Amount of accumulated unrealized gain on investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Accumulated Unrecognized Holding Loss
column2: Amount of accumulated unrealized loss on investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, 12 Months or Longer, Accumulated Loss
column2: Amount of accumulated unrealized loss on investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity that have been in a continuous loss position for twelve months or longer.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Accumulated Loss
column2: Amount of accumulated unrealized loss on investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity in a continuous loss position.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Less than 12 Months, Accumulated Loss
column2: Amount of accumulated unrealized loss on investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity that have been in a continuous loss position for less than twelve months.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Next Rolling Twelve Months, Fair Value
