column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Remainder of Fiscal Year, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Rolling after Ten Years, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing after the tenth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Rolling Year Six Through Ten, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the sixth through tenth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Rolling Year Two Through Five, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the second through fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Single Maturity Date, Amortized Cost Basis
column2: Amount of investment in held-to-maturity debt securities with a single maturity date, after other than temporary impairment (OTTI) accretion.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Single Maturity Date, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of investment in held-to-maturity debt securities with a single maturity date.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Other, Loan to Collateral Value, Ratio
column2: This item represents the loan to collateral ratio of the underlying assets in the security, represented as a percentage, which was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are not other-than-temporarily impaired.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with No Related Allowance, Average Recorded Investment
column2: Amount of average investment of impaired financing receivables for which there is no related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with No Related Allowance, Interest Income, Accrual Method
column2: Amount of interest income, recognized on accrual basis, on financing receivables that are recognized as impaired, for which there is no related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with No Related Allowance, Interest Income, Cash Basis Method
column2: Amount of interest income, recognized on cash basis, on financing receivables, for which there is no related allowance for credit losses and are recognized as impaired.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with No Related Allowance, Recorded Investment
column2: Amount of investment in impaired financing receivables for which there is no related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with No Related Allowance, Unpaid Principal Balance
column2: Amount of unpaid principal balance of impaired financing receivables for which there is no related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with Related Allowance, Average Recorded Investment
column2: Amount of average investment of impaired financing receivables for which there is a related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with Related Allowance, Interest Income, Accrual Method
column2: Amount of interest income, recognized on accrual basis, on financing receivables, for which there is a related allowance for credit losses and are recognized as impaired.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with Related Allowance, Interest Income, Cash Basis Method
column2: Amount of interest income on financing receivables, for which there is a related allowance for credit losses, recognized on a cash-basis method of accounting that the financing receivables were impaired.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with Related Allowance, Recorded Investment
column2: Amount of investment in impaired financing receivables for which there is a related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, with Related Allowance, Unpaid Principal Balance
column2: Unpaid principal balance of impaired financing receivables for which there is a related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impairment Effect on Earnings Per Share, after Tax
column2: After tax earnings per share or per unit impact arising from asset impairment.

column1: Impairment Effect on Earnings Per Share, Pretax
column2: Pretax earnings per share or per unit impact arising from asset impairment.

column1: Incentive Fee Expense
column2: Amount of expense for incentive rights held by the managing member or general partner, of limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

column1: Income Taxes Paid
column2: The amount of cash paid during the current period to foreign, federal, state, and local authorities as taxes on income.

column1: Income Tax Examination, Estimate of Possible Loss
column2: Estimated amount of loss resulting from an adverse tax position.

column1: Income Tax Holiday, Income Tax Benefits Per Share
column2: Per share amount effect of the income tax benefit resulting from the income tax holidays granted by taxing jurisdictions.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Nondeductible Expense, Research and Development, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to nondeductible research and development expense.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Credit, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to tax credits. Including, but not limited to, research credit, foreign tax credit, investment tax credit, and other tax credits.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Exempt Income, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to income (loss) exempt from income taxes.

column1: Increase in Restricted Cash
column2: Amount of cash outflow associated with funds that are not available for withdrawal or use (such as funds held in escrow) and are associated with underlying transactions that are classified as investing activities.

column1: Policyholder Benefits and Claims Incurred, Net, Property, Casualty and Liability
column2: Amount, after effect of policies assumed or ceded, of expense related to provision for policy benefits and costs incurred for property and casualty insurance contracts.

column1: Indefinite-lived Intangible Assets Acquired
column2: Amount of increase in assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with an indefinite life, resulting from a business combination.

column1: Indefinite-lived Intangible Assets (Excluding Goodwill), Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, that lack physical substance, having a projected indefinite period of benefit.

column1: Information Technology and Data Processing
column2: The amount of expenses incurred in the period for information technology and data processing products and services.

column1: Insurance Commissions
column2: The expense incurred by an insurance company to persons or entities for generating or placing insurance or investment contracts with the company, usually determined as a percentage of policy or contract premiums. Excludes advances or draws to be applied against commissions earned.

column1: Insurance Commissions and Fees
column2: Income from agency and brokerage operations (includes sales of annuities and supplemental contracts); service charges, commissions, and fees from the sale of insurance and related services; and management fees from separate accounts, deferred annuities, and universal life products.

column1: Insurance Services Revenue
column2: Revenue from insurance services, including net premiums earned, gain on sale of insurance block, agency management fees and insurance contract fees and commissions.

column1: Intangible Assets, Gross (Excluding Goodwill)
column2: Amount before accumulated amortization of intangible assets, excluding goodwill.

column1: Intangible Assets, Net (Including Goodwill)
column2: Carrying amount of finite-lived intangible assets, indefinite-lived intangible assets and goodwill. Goodwill is an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized. Intangible assets are assets, not including financial assets, lacking physical substance.

column1: Interest Accrual Rate Associated with Amortization Method of Present Value of Future Insurance Profits
column2: States the assumed long-term market interest rate used in the determination of the present value of future profits on long-duration contracts acquired in a business combination.

column1: Interest and Dividend Income, Operating
column2: Represents the total of interest and dividend income, including any amortization and accretion (as applicable) of discounts and premiums, earned from (1) loans and leases whether held-for-sale or held-in-portfolio; (2) investment securities; (3) federal funds sold; (4) securities purchased under agreements to resell; (5) investments in banker's acceptances, commercial paper, or certificates of deposit; (6) dividend income; or (7) other investments not otherwise specified herein.

column1: Interest and Dividend Income, Securities, Operating
column2: Amount of operating dividend and interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities.

column1: Interest and Dividend Income, Securities, Operating, Available-for-sale
column2: Amount of operating dividend and interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on available-for-sale securities.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, Operating, Held-to-maturity
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on held-to-maturity securities.

column1: Interest and Dividend Income, Securities, Operating, Other
column2: Amount of other operating dividend and interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities.

column1: Interest and Dividend Income, Securities, Operating, Trading or Measured at Fair Value
column2: Amount of operating dividend and interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on trading securities and other forms of securities that provide ownership interests.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans and Leases
column2: The aggregate interest and fee income generated by: (1) loans the Entity has positive intent and ability to hold for the foreseeable future, or until maturity or payoff, including commercial and consumer loans, whether domestic or foreign, which may consist of: (a) industrial and agricultural; (b) real estate; and (c) real estate construction loans; (d) trade financing; (e) lease financing; (f) home equity lines-of-credit; (g) automobile and other vehicle loans; and (h) credit card and other revolving-type loans and (2) loans and leases held-for-sale which may include mortgage loans, direct financing, and sales-type leases.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans and Leases Held-for-sale
column2: The amount of interest and fee income earned from loans held-for-sale, including mortgage loans, and interest earned from direct financing and sales-type leases held-for-sale.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans and Leases Held-in-portfolio
column2: Interest and fee income generated by loans the Entity intends and has the ability to hold for the foreseeable future, or until maturity or payoff, including commercial and consumer loans, whether domestic or foreign, which may consist of: (1) industrial and agricultural; (2) real estate; and (3) real estate construction loans; (4) trade financing; (5) lease financing; (6) home equity lines-of-credit; (7) automobile and other vehicle loans; and (8) credit card and other revolving-type loans. Also includes interest income for leases held by the Entity.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Commercial
column2: Interest and fee income related to commercial loans including industrial and agricultural, real estate (commercial and residential, construction and development), trade financing, and lease financing.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Commercial and Residential, Real Estate
column2: Interest and fee income from commercial and residential real estate loans.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Commercial, Industrial, and Agricultural Loans
column2: Interest and fee income generated from all commercial, industrial, and agricultural loans.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Commercial, Real Estate
column2: Interest and fee income generated from loans secured by commercial properties. Examples of properties commonly securing commercial real estate loans may include office buildings, apartment buildings, shopping centers, industrial property, and hotels.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Consumer
column2: Interest and fee income generated from consumer loans. Consumer loans are loans to individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures. Such loans include residential mortgages, home equity lines-of-credit, automobiles and marine transport loans, credit card transactions, and others.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Consumer, Home Equity
column2: Interest and fee income from home equity lines-of-credit extended to individuals (borrowers). Such loans are generally secured by the borrower's equity in her or his home.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Consumer Installment, Automobiles, Marine, and Other Vehicles
column2: Interest and fee income generated by automobile, marine, and other vehicle loans made to individuals.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Consumer Installment, Credit Card
column2: Interest and fee income from credit card balances due from individuals. Such loans are considered revolving credit arrangements.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Consumer, Real Estate
column2: Interest and fee income generated from loans secured by one- to four-family residential properties. This item excludes home equity lines-of-credit.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Foreign
column2: Interest and fee income generated by commercial and consumer loans, made by foreign branches of the reporting entity, which may include loans to foreign governments, foreign banks and other financial institutions, commercial and industrial entities, and citizens of not domiciled in the same country as the reporting entity.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans Held-for-sale, Mortgages
column2: Interest and fee income from mortgage loans considered to be held-for-sale.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Lease Financing
column2: Interest and fee income generated by direct lease financing which consists of an institution owning and leasing personal property for the use of its customers at the customers' specific request.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Other Consumer
column2: Interest and fee income from other loans extended to individual consumers.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Real Estate Construction
column2: Interest and fee income from loans used for real estate development and construction costs. Such loans are referred to as "Construction" loans or mortgages.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Loans, Trade Financing
column2: Interest and fee income generated by trade financing. Trade financing is a specialized area of commercial lending frequently used by businesses that engage in international activities. Such financing includes open account financing, sales on consignment, documentary collections, advances against collections, letters of credit, bankers' acceptances, factoring, and forfeiting.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Nonmortgage Loans and Leases Held-for-sale
column2: Amount of interest and fee income earned from loans held-for-sale, including interest earned from direct financing and sales-type leases held-for-sale, but excluding mortgage loans held-for sale.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Other Loans
column2: Interest and fee income derived from loans not otherwise specified in the existing taxonomy.

column1: Interest and Fee Income, Other Loans Held-for-sale
column2: Interest and fee income from other loans considered to be held-for-sale not otherwise specified in the existing taxonomy.

column1: Interest and Other Income
column2: The amount of interest income and other income recognized during the period. Included in this element is interest derived from investments in debt securities, cash and cash equivalents, and other investments which reflect the time value of money or transactions in which the payments are for the use or forbearance of money and other income from ancillary business-related activities (that is, excluding major activities considered part of the normal operations of the business).

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Checking
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic checking deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Other
column2: Amount of other interest-bearing domestic deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Costs Capitalized Adjustment
column2: Amount of interest costs capitalized disclosed as an adjusting item to interest costs incurred.

column1: Interest Credited to Policyholders Account Balances
column2: Interest allocated to policyholders holding contracts under which the insurer must provide a guaranteed yield.

column1: Interest Expense
column2: Amount of the cost of borrowed funds accounted for as interest expense.

column1: Interest Expense, Beneficial Interests Issued by Consolidated Variable Interest Entities
column2: Interest expense on beneficial interests issued by consolidated variable interest entities.

column1: Interest Expense, Borrowings
column2: Aggregate amount of interest expense on all borrowings.

column1: Interest Expense, Capital Securities
column2: Interest expense incurred during the reporting period on capital securities issued by the reporting entity.

column1: Interest Expense, Commercial Paper
column2: Interest expense incurred during the reporting period on commercial paper.

column1: Interest Expense, Demand Deposit Accounts
column2: Interest expense incurred on demand deposit accounts that represent borrowings rather than outstanding drafts.

column1: Interest Expense, Domestic Deposits
column2: The aggregate interest expense incurred on all domestic deposits.

column1: Interest Expense, Federal Funds Purchased
column2: Gross expenses on the purchase of Federal funds at a specified price with a simultaneous agreement to sell the same to the same counterparty at a fixed or determinable price at a future date.

column1: Interest Expense, Federal Funds Purchased and Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase
column2: The aggregate expense incurred on federal funds purchased and securities sold under agreements to repurchase. If amounts recognized as payables under repurchase agreements have been offset against amounts recognized as receivables under reverse repurchase agreements and reported as a net amount on the balance sheet, the income and expense from these agreements may be reported on a net basis.

column1: Interest Expense, Federal Home Loan Bank and Federal Reserve Bank Advances, Long-term
column2: Interest expense incurred during the reporting period on long-term borrowings associated with Federal Home Loan Bank and Federal Reserve Bank advances.

column1: Interest Expense, Federal Home Loan Bank and Federal Reserve Bank Advances, Short-term
column2: Interest expense incurred during the reporting period on short-term borrowings associated with Federal Home Loan Bank and Federal Reserve Bank advances.

column1: Interest Expense, Foreign Deposits
column2: Interest expense on all foreign deposits.

column1: Interest Expense, Junior Subordinated Debentures
column2: Interest expense incurred during the reporting period on junior subordinated debentures. Includes amortization of expenses incurred in the issuance of subordinated notes and debentures.

column1: Interest Expense, Long-term Debt
column2: Aggregate amount of interest paid or due on all long-term debt.

column1: Interest Expense, Long-term Debt and Capital Securities
column2: Total interest expense on long-term debt and capital securities.

column1: Interest Expense, Medium-term Notes
column2: Interest expense on medium-Term notes.

column1: Interest Expense, Money Market Deposits
column2: Interest expense incurred on all money market deposits.

column1: Interest Expense, Negotiable Order of Withdrawal (NOW) Deposits
column2: Interest expense incurred on the amount of Negotiable Order of Withdrawal (NOW). Interest-bearing transaction account that combines the payable on demand feature of checks and investment feature of savings accounts. A NOW account is functionally an interest paying checking account.

column1: Interest Expense, NOW Accounts, Money Market Accounts, and Savings Deposits
column2: The aggregate interest expense incurred on the following for deposits in domestic offices: (1) transaction accounts (NOW, and telephone and preauthorized transfer accounts), (2) money market deposits and (3) savings deposits.

column1: Interest Expense, Other Domestic Deposits
column2: Interest expense incurred on other deposits in domestic offices.

column1: Interest Expense, Other Long-term Debt
column2: Interest expense incurred on all other long-term debt, which may include (1) interest on long-term notes, and (2) amortization of issuance costs not otherwise separately disclosed.

column1: Interest Expense, Other Short-term Borrowings
column2: Interest expense incurred during the reporting period on other short-term borrowings.

column1: Interest Expense, Related Party
column2: Amount of interest expense incurred on a debt or other obligation to related party.

column1: Interest Expense, Savings Deposits
column2: Interest expense incurred on all savings account deposits.

column1: Interest Expense, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase
column2: Gross expenses on securities sold coupled with an agreement to repurchase the same from the same counterparty at a fixed or determinable price within a fixed or variable time period.

column1: Interest Expense, Short-term Borrowings
column2: The aggregate interest expense incurred on short-term borrowings including commercial paper and Federal funds purchased and securities sold under agreements to repurchase.

column1: Interest Expense, Short-term Borrowings Excluding Federal Funds and Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase
column2: The aggregate interest expense incurred on short-term borrowings including commercial paper, Federal Home Loan Bank and Federal Reserve Bank advances and other short term borrowings.

column1: Interest Expense, Subordinated Notes and Debentures
column2: Interest expense incurred during the reporting period on subordinated notes and debentures. Includes amortization of expenses incurred in the issuance of subordinated notes and debentures.

column1: Interest Expense, Time Deposits
column2: The aggregate interest expense incurred on time deposits, including certificates of deposits, in domestic offices.

column1: Interest Expense, Time Deposits, $100,000 or More
column2: Interest expense incurred on time deposits, including certificates of deposits, of $100,000 or more in domestic offices.

column1: Interest Expense, Time Deposits, Less than $100,000
column2: Interest expense incurred on time deposits, including certificates of deposits, less than $100,000 in domestic offices.

column1: Interest Expense, Trading Liabilities
column2: Interest expense incurred on short positions arising from sales of securities and other assets, which the entity does not own, to other parties. Trading liabilities includes the fair value of derivative contracts held for trading that are in loss positions.

column1: Interest Expense, Trust Preferred Securities
column2: The amount of interest incurred to a trust which has issued trust-preferred securities. In order to issue trust preferred securities, a sponsor forms a trust by investing a nominal amount of cash to purchase all of the voting common stock of the trust. The trust issues nonvoting, mandatorily redeemable preferred securities to outside investors in exchange for cash. The proceeds received from the issuance of the preferred securities, together with the cash received for issuing the common stock to the sponsor, is then loaned to the sponsor in exchange for a note which has the same terms as the trust preferred securities. Trust preferred securities possesses characteristics of both equity and debt issues and are generally issued by bank holding companies.

column1: Interest Income and Fees, Bankers Acceptances, Certificates of Deposit and Commercial Paper
column2: Interest and fee income derived from banker's acceptances, certificates of deposit and commercial paper.

column1: Interest Income, Deposits with Financial Institutions
column2: Interest income derived from funds deposited with both domestic and foreign financial institutions including funds in money market and other accounts.

column1: Interest Income, Domestic Deposits
column2: Interest earned on deposits in United States money market accounts and other United States interest earning accounts.

column1: Interest Income, Federal Funds Sold
column2: Interest income on federal funds sold. Federal funds sold represent the excess federal funds held by one commercial bank which it lends to another commercial bank, usually at an agreed-upon (federal funds) rate of interest. Such loans generally are of short-duration (overnight).

column1: Interest Income, Federal Funds Sold and Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell
column2: The aggregate interest income earned from (1) the lending of excess federal funds to another commercial bank requiring such for its legal reserve requirements and (2) securities purchased under agreements to resell.

column1: Interest Income, Foreign Deposits
column2: Interest income generated from amounts on deposit with foreign entities located outside the United States of America.

column1: Interest Income, Money Market Deposits
column2: Interest earned on funds deposited in US domestic money market accounts.

column1: Interest Income, Other
column2: Amount of interest income earned from interest bearing assets not separately disclosed.

column1: Interest Income, Other Domestic Deposits
column2: Interest earned on US domestic deposits other than funds deposited in money market accounts.

column1: Interest Income, Purchased Receivables
column2: Interest earned from receivables purchased; for instance, receivables purchased through a factoring arrangement.

column1: Interest Income, Related Party
column2: Amount of interest income earned from interest-bearing assets owed to the entity by related party.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, Corporate Debt, Operating
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on corporate debt securities.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, Mortgage Backed
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securitized, pass-through debt securities collateralized by real estate mortgage loans.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, Other US Government
column2: Interest income on securities issued by US government agencies not including US Treasury Securities.

column1: Interest Income, Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell
column2: Interest income derived from securities purchased under agreements to resell. The difference in the price at which the institution buys the securities and resells the securities represents interest for the use of the funds by the other party. Most repurchase and sale agreements involve obligations of the federal government or its agencies, but other financial instruments, such as commercial paper, banker's acceptances and negotiable certificates of deposits are sometimes used in such transactions.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, State and Municipal
column2: Interest income, including any amortization and accretion (as applicable) of discounts and premiums, derived from debt securities issued by municipal governments, local taxing districts and US state government agencies.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, Operating, Taxable
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities subject to state, federal and other income tax.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, Operating, Tax Advantaged
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities subject to tax benefits. Excludes operating interest income on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, Operating, Tax Exempt
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, US Treasury
column2: Interest income on US treasury securities. US treasury securities are negotiable debt obligations of the US government, secured by its full faith and credit and issued at various schedules and maturities. The income from treasury securities is exempt from state and local, but not federal, taxes. There are three types of securities issued by the US treasury (bonds, bills, and notes), which are distinguished by the amount of time from the initial sale of the bond to maturity.

column1: Interest Income, Securities, US Treasury and Other US Government
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on U.S. Treasury securities and other U.S. government securities.

column1: Interest Paid
column2: The amount of cash paid for interest during the period.

column1: Interest Receivable and Other Assets
column2: Carrying amount of interest earned but not received (also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable) and carrying amounts of assets not separately disclosed.

column1: Inventory, Net of Allowances, Customer Advances and Progress Billings
column2: Carrying amount (lower of cost or market) of inventories less all valuation, other allowances, and progress payments or customer advances received on long-term contracts or programs. Excludes noncurrent inventory balances (expected to remain on hand past one year or one operating cycle, if longer).

column1: Inventory, Noncurrent, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of inventory expected to be realized or consumed after one year or normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Investment Income, Dividend
column2: Amount of dividend income on nonoperating securities.

column1: Investment Income, Interest
column2: Amount before accretion (amortization) of purchase discount (premium) of interest income on nonoperating securities.

column1: Investment Income, Interest and Dividend
column2: Amount before accretion (amortization) of purchase discount (premium) of interest income and dividend income on nonoperating securities.

column1: Investment in Physical Commodities, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of investment held in physical commodities, for example, but not limited to, gold, silver, platinum, crude oil, coal, sugar, rice, wheat.

column1: Investment Owned, at Cost
column2: Cost of the investment.

column1: Investment Owned, Balance, Contracts
column2: Balance held at close of period in number of contracts.

column1: Investment Owned, Balance, Other Measure
column2: Quantity of the investment. Indicate the measure in the unit of measure. This is commonly used for investments other than securities. For example, if the investment is gold, the balance would be the number of ounces and the unit of measure would indicate "ounces".

column1: Investment Owned, Balance, Principal Amount
column2: For investments which are quantified by principal amount, the principle balance held at close of period.

column1: Investment Owned, Balance, Shares
column2: Balance held at close of period in number of shares.

column1: Investment Owned, Loaned for Short Sales, at Fair Value
column2: The aggregate value of investments loaned for short sales. This is not required to be disclosed under Regulation S-X but is commonly reported by Funds.

column1: Investment Owned, Restricted, Carrying Value Per Unit at Date of Balance Sheet
column2: The carrying value per unit of investment at date of related balance sheet.

column1: Investment Owned, Restricted, Cost
column2: The cost of the restricted investment.

column1: Investment Owned, Subject to Option, Balance, Other Measure
column2: The quantity of the investment that is subject to option.

column1: Investment Owned, Subject to Option, Price
column2: The option price of the investment that is subject to option.

column1: Investment Owned, Unrestricted, Carrying Value Per Unit at Date of Purchase Price Agreement
column2: The carrying value per unit of investment of unrestricted investment of the same issue as the restricted investment during the preceding year at the date the purchase price was agreed.

column1: Investment Owned, Unrestricted, Carrying Value Per Unit at Date When Enforceable Right to Acquire was Obtained
column2: The carrying value per unit of investment of unrestricted investment of the same issue as the restricted investment during the preceding year at the date on which an enforceable right to acquire the investments was obtained.

column1: Investments in Affiliates, Subsidiaries, Associates, and Joint Ventures, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of investments in an entity not consolidated. Includes, but is not limited to, investments in an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership, an entity in which the reporting entity shares control of the entity with another party or group, an entity which the company has significant influence, but does not have control and subsidiaries that are not required to be consolidated and are accounted for using the equity or cost method.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, at Fair Value
column2: Value of the investment at close of period. For investment in and advances to affiliates, if operations of any controlled companies are different in character from those of the company, group such affiliates within divisions and by type of activities.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, at Fair Value, Gross Additions
column2: Gross additions to the investment in and advance to the affiliate.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, at Fair Value, Gross Reductions
column2: Gross reductions to the investment in and advance to the affiliate.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, Balance, Contracts
column2: Number of contracts held with affiliates for management investment companies.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, Balance, Other Measure
column2: Mass of investment for management investment companies.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, Balance, Principal Amount
column2: Amount of principal loans outstanding to affiliates for management investment companies.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, Balance, Shares
column2: Number of shares of affiliates held for management investment companies.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, Dividend or Interest Credited to Income
column2: At the close of the period, the dividends or interest included in caption 1 of the statement of operations. In addition, show as the final item the aggregate of dividends and interest included in the statement of operations in respect of investments in affiliates not held at the close of the period. The total of this column would be expected to agree with the correlative amount shown on the related statement of operations.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, Dividend or Interest, Other
column2: All other dividends and interest. Explain in the "Schedule of Investments, Investment Notes" the treatment accorded each item.

column1: Investments in and Advances to Affiliates, Dividends or Interest
column2: Amount of dividends or interest. Give totals for each group. If operations of any controlled companies are different in character from those of the company, group such affiliates (1) within divisions and (2) by type of activities.

column1: Investments in Power and Distribution Projects, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of investments in power and distribution projects.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, at Fair Value
column2: Value of the short position.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Balance, Other Measure
column2: Quantity of the investment. Indicate the measure in the unit of measure. This is commonly used for investments other than securities. For example, if the investment is gold, the balance would be the number of ounces and the unit of measure would indicate "ounces".

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Balance, Principal Amount
column2: For investments which are quantified by principal amount, the principle balance held at close of period.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Balance, Shares
column2: Number of securities sold short (the short position) as of the end of the period.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Percent of Net Assets
column2: For schedules of investments sold, not yet purchased (short sales) that are categorized, each category would be expected to have a percent of net assets for the aggregated value of the investments sold short in the category.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Restricted, Carrying Value Per Unit at Date of Balance Sheet
column2: The carrying value per unit of investment at date of related balance sheet.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Restricted, Cost
column2: The cost of the restricted investment.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Sale Proceeds
column2: The amount of proceeds received resulting from the short sale of a security.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Unrestricted, Carrying Value Per Unit at Date of Purchase Price Agreement
column2: The carrying value per unit of investment of unrestricted investment of the same issue as the restricted investment during the preceding year at the date the purchase price was agreed.

column1: Investment Sold, Not yet Purchased, Unrestricted, Carrying Value Per Unit at Date When Enforceable Right to Acquire was Obtained
column2: The carrying value per unit of investment of unrestricted investment of the same issue as the restricted investment during the preceding year at the date on which an enforceable right to acquire the investments was obtained.

column1: Jointly Owned Utility Plant, Gross Ownership Amount of Plant in Service
column2: The period end amount owned by the reporting utility of a jointly owned utility plant in service.

column1: Jointly Owned Utility Plant, Net Ownership Amount
column2: The total period end amount of plant in service and construction in progress net of accumulated depreciation for the utility's share of jointly owned electricity generation plant.

column1: Jointly Owned Utility Plant, Ownership Amount of Construction Work in Progress
column2: The period end amount of construction work in progress at a jointly owned electricity generation plant.

column1: Jointly Owned Utility Plant, Ownership Amount of Other Assets
column2: The period end ownership amount of other assets in a jointly owned utility plant.

column1: Jointly Owned Utility Plant, Ownership Amount of Plant Accumulated Depreciation
column2: The period end amount of accumulated depreciation in a jointly owned electricity generation plant.

column1: Jointly Owned Utility Plant, Proportionate Ownership Share
column2: The proportionate share of interest (percent) in a jointly owned utility plant.

column1: Land and Land Improvements
column2: Amount before accumulated deprecation and depletion of real estate held for productive use and additions or improvements to real estate held for productive use, examples include, but are not limited to, walkways, driveways, fences, and parking lots. Excludes land held for sale.

column1: Land Subject to Ground Leases
column2: Area of land subject to a ground lease.

column1: Leasing Commissions Expense
column2: Amount of commissions expense incurred because the lessor of real estate obtained a lessee for a rental property through a real estate agent.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Income (Loss)
column2: The total recognized during the period for income on leases meeting the criteria for classification as leveraged leases.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Deferred Taxes Arising from Leveraged Leases
column2: Taxes arising from arrangements meeting the criteria for classification as leveraged leases due to timing differences between accounting and tax income recognition.

column1: Liabilities for Guarantees on Long-Duration Contracts, Guaranteed Benefit Liability, Gross
column2: Amount of expected guaranteed benefits in excess of the projected account balances for minimum guaranteed benefit contracts, as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Liabilities for Guarantees on Long-Duration Contracts, Guaranteed Benefit Liability, Net
column2: Amount of expected guaranteed benefits in excess of the projected account balances for minimum guaranteed benefit contracts, net of reinsurance recoverables, as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Liabilities for Guarantees on Long-Duration Contracts, Incurred Benefits
column2: Amount of guaranteed minimum benefit expense incurred for expected guaranteed minimum benefits in excess of projected account values.

column1: Liabilities for Guarantees on Long-Duration Contracts, Reinsurance Recoverable
column2: Amount of guaranteed minimum benefits the ceding insurer expects to recover on insurance policies ceded to other insurance entities as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise
column2: Total amount of liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
column2: The amount of trade accounts payable included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Asbestos Obligations
column2: The amount of asbestos related liabilities included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Capital Lease Obligations and Accrued Interest
column2: The amount of capital lease obligations and related accrued interest included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Debt and Accrued Interest
column2: The amount of debt and related accrued interest included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Early Contract Termination Fees
column2: The amount of early contract termination fees included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Employee and Deemed Claims
column2: The amount of employee and related claims included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Environmental Contingencies
column2: The amount of environmental remediation liabilities included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Income Tax Contingencies
column2: The amount of income taxes included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Other Liabilities
column2: The amount of other obligations included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Pension and Other Postretirement Obligations
column2: The amount of pension and other postretirement obligations included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Provision for Expected and Allowed Claims
column2: The amount of the provision for expected and allowed claims included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liabilities Subject to Compromise, Retained Obligation of Divested Businesses
column2: The amount of retained obligations related to divested businesses included in liabilities subject to compromise.

column1: Liability for Asbestos and Environmental Claims, Gross
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of reserves for the costs of settling insured claims and costs incurred in the claims settlement process attributable to asbestos and environmental claims, before estimated recoveries from reinsurers.

column1: Liability for Asbestos and Environmental Claims, Net
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of reserves for the costs of settling insured claims and costs incurred in the claims settlement process attributable to asbestos and environmental claims, net of estimated reinsurance recoveries.

column1: Liability for Catastrophe Claims, Carrying Amount
column2: The amount of estimated liability as of the balance sheet date for the specific conflagration, earthquake, windstorm, explosion, or similar event.

column1: Liability for Future Policy Benefit by Product Segment, Interest Rate, Year of Issue
column2: The assumed interest rate used to determine present value of future benefits to be paid to or on behalf of policyholders and related expenses less the present value of future net premiums using assumptions such as estimates of expected investment yields, mortality, morbidity, terminations and expenses, applicable at the time the insurance contracts are made and unpaid claim costs relating to insurance contracts including estimates of costs relating to incurred but not reported claims based on the estimated ultimate cost of settling the claims (including effects of inflation and other societal and economic factors), using past experience adjusted for current trends and any other factors that would modify past experience in the year the policy went into force.

column1: Liability for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Claims Paid, Current Year
column2: Amount of payments to settle claims incurred in the current period and related claims settlement costs.

column1: Liability for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Claims Paid, Prior Years
column2: Amount of payments to settle claims incurred in prior periods and related claims settlement costs.

column1: Liability for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Incurred Claims
column2: Amount of expense for claims incurred and costs incurred in the claim settlement process.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing after Year Five
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Year Five
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Year Four
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Year Three
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount, Maturing in Year Two
column2: Amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing after Rolling Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing after Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Next Twelve Months
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Four
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Three
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Two
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Four
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Three
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Two
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing after Rolling Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing after Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Next Twelve Months
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Four
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Three
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Two
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Four
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Three
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Two
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid after Year Five
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Year Five
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Year Four
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Year Three
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid in Year Two
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force anticipated to be paid in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Limited Liability Company (LLC) Preferred Unit, Authorized
column2: Maximum number of preferred units of ownership permitted to be issued of a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Limited Liability Company (LLC) Preferred Unit, Issuance Value
column2: Stated value of preferred units of ownership issued by a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Limited Liability Company (LLC) Preferred Unit, Issued
column2: Number of preferred units issued of limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Limited Liability Company (LLC) Preferred Unit, Outstanding
column2: Number of preferred units of ownership outstanding of a limited liability company (LLC).

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Decrease, Forgiveness
column2: Amount of decrease in line of credit facility from forgiveness by the holder of the line of credit.

column1: Liquidation Basis of Accounting, Accrued Costs to Dispose of Assets and Liabilities
column2: Amount of estimated accrued costs to dispose of assets or other items expected to be sold in liquidation.

column1: Liquidation Basis of Accounting, Items Previously Not Recognized
column2: Amount of items not previously recognized that are expected to be sold in liquidation.

column1: Loan Processing Fee
column2: Expenses paid for obtaining loans which includes expenses such as application and origination fees.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Allowance, Covered
column2: Amount of allowance for loan and lease losses covered by loss sharing agreements.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Gross, Carrying Amount, Covered
column2: Aggregate gross carrying amount of loans and leases receivable covered by loss sharing agreements.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Net Reported Amount, Covered
column2: Net carrying amount of loans and leases receivable covered by loss sharing agreements.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Net Reported Amount, Covered and Not Covered
column2: Amount after allowance and deduction of deferred interest and fees, unamortized costs and premiums over and discounts from face amounts, of loans and leases held in portfolio, including but not limited to, commercial and consumer loans. Includes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements.

column1: Loans Receivable with Fixed Rates of Interest
column2: Amount of loan with fixed rate of interest.

column1: Loans Receivable with Variable Rates of Interest
column2: Amount of loan with variable or adjustable rate of interest.

column1: Long-Duration Contracts, Assumptions by Product and Guarantee, Discount Rate
column2: Percentage discount rate used to calculate present value of an expected stream of future payments, which is included in the calculation of the amount of the specified guaranteed benefit obligation as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Long-Duration Contracts, Assumptions by Product and Guarantee, Estimated Average Investment Yield
column2: Estimated average rate of return on investments which is included in the calculation of the amount of the specified guaranteed benefit obligation as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Long-Duration Contracts, Assumptions by Product and Guarantee, Lapse Rate
column2: Anticipated rate of future terminations of contracts in force as of the balance sheet date, which is included in determining the amount of the specified guaranteed benefit obligation as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Long-Duration Contracts, Assumptions by Product and Guarantee, Mortality Rate
column2: Actuarially determined death rate of policyholders, which is included in determining the amount of the specified guaranteed benefit obligation as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Long-Duration Contracts, Assumptions by Product and Guarantee, Other Rate
column2: Anticipated rate for an assumption not otherwise specified in the taxonomy, which is included in determining the amount of the specified guaranteed benefit obligation as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Long-Duration Contracts, Assumptions by Product and Guarantee, Volatility Rate
column2: Percentage rate that is indicative of an expected degree of movement against a base line index, and which is included in determining the amount of the specified guaranteed benefit obligation as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Contract for Purchase of Electric Power, Amount of Long-term Debt or Lease Obligation Outstanding
column2: Under long-term contracts with public utility districts, cooperatives or other organizations, a utility company receives a portion of the output of a production plant constructed and financed by the district or cooperative. The utility has only a nominal or no investment at all in the plant but pays a proportionate part of the plant's costs, including debt service.

column1: Long-term Contract for Purchase of Electric Power, Annual Minimum Debt Service Payment Required
column2: Under long-term contracts with public utility districts, cooperatives or other organizations, a utility company receives a portion of the output of a production plant constructed and financed by the district or cooperative. The utility has only a nominal or no investment at all in the plant but pays a proportionate part of the plant's costs, including debt service. If the utility is obligated to pay certain minimum amounts which cover debt service requirements whether or not the plant is operating, the amount can be disclosed here.

column1: Long-term Contract for Purchase of Electric Power, Estimated Annual Cost
column2: Estimated annual cost to purchase electricity under a long-term contract from a production plant constructed and financed by a public utility district, cooperative, or other organization.

column1: Long-term Contract for Purchase of Electric Power, Interest Included in Contract Charges
column2: The allocable portion of interest included in charges under a long-term contract to purchase electric power.

column1: Long-term Contract for Purchase of Electric Power, Share of Plant Output Being Purchased
column2: Share of plant output being purchased under a long-term contract to purchase electricity from a production plant constructed and financed by a public utility district, cooperative, or other organization.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Including Current Maturities
column2: Amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligations including current maturities.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal after Year Five
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Year Five
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Year Four
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Years Four and Five
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the fourth and fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Years Two and Three
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the second and third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Year Three
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Year Two
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Maturities, Repayments of Principal Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year ended.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Repayments of Principal in Next Twelve Months
column2: Principal amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet.
