For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Rolling Year Four and Five
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the fourth and fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Rolling Year Two and Three
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the second and third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Purchase Commitment, Minimum Energy Volume Required
column2: Energy volume that must be purchased within the specified time period of the agreement to avoid penalties or unfavorable effects on pricing, among other adverse consequences.

column1: Long-term Purchase Commitment, Minimum Mass Required
column2: Mass of goods that must be purchased within the specified time period of the agreement to avoid penalties or unfavorable effects on pricing, among other adverse consequences.

column1: Long-term Purchase Commitment, Minimum Volume Required
column2: Volume that must be purchased within the specified time period of the agreement to avoid penalties or unfavorable effects on pricing, among other adverse consequences.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Rolling Year Five
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Rolling Year Four
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Rolling Year Three
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Rolling Year Two
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency, Claims Dismissed, Number
column2: Number of claims dismissed.

column1: Loss Contingency, Claims Settled, Number
column2: Number of claims settled.

column1: Loss Contingency, Damages Paid, Value
column2: Amount of damages paid to the plaintiff in the legal matter.

column1: Loss Contingency, Number of Defendants
column2: Number of defendants named in a legal action.

column1: Loss Contingency, Number of Plaintiffs
column2: Number of plaintiffs that have filed claims pertaining to a loss contingency.

column1: Loss Contingency, Patents Allegedly Infringed, Number
column2: Number of another entity's patents that the entity has allegedly infringed.

column1: Loss Contingency, Patents Found Infringed, Number
column2: Number of another entity's patents that the entity was found to have infringed.

column1: Loss Contingency, Patents Found Not Infringed, Number
column2: Number of another entity's patents that the entity was found not to have infringed.

column1: Loss Contingency, Receivable
column2: Amount of receivable related to a loss contingency accrual. For example, an insurance recovery receivable.

column1: Loss Contingency, Receivable, Current
column2: Amount of receivable related to a loss contingency accrual that is expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. For example, an insurance recovery receivable.

column1: Loss Contingency, Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of receivable related to a loss contingency accrual that is expected to be collected after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer. For example, an insurance recovery receivable.

column1: Loss on Sale of Investments
column2: The difference between the carrying value and the sale price of an investment. A loss would be recognized when the sale price of the investment is less than the carrying value of the investment. This element refers to the Loss included in earnings and not to the cash proceeds of the sale.

column1: Loss Ratio
column2: Ratio of non-life losses and loss expenses to non-life net premiums earned.

column1: Malpractice Insurance, Annual Coverage Limit
column2: Annual coverage limit provided by the insurance arrangement for malpractice claims.

column1: Malpractice Insurance, Coverage Floor
column2: Amount at the low end of the range in which the insurance begins to cover losses and costs associated with malpractice claims.

column1: Malpractice Insurance, Deductible
column2: Amount of risk retained by the entity before the insurance arrangement begins to provide coverage.

column1: Malpractice Insurance, Maximum Coverage Per Incident
column2: Maximum coverage per malpractice claim provided by the insurance arrangement.

column1: Malpractice Insurance, Percentage of Ownership in Captive Insurer
column2: State the entity's ownership interest in the captive insurer.

column1: Malpractice Insurance, Percentage of Premiums Paid to Captive Insurer
column2: Amount of the premiums paid by the entity to a partially-owned captive insurer. Express as a percentage of total premiums received by the captive insurer from all sources.

column1: Management Fee Expense
column2: Amount of expenses related to the managing member or general partner for management of the day-to-day business functions of the limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

column1: Management Fee Payable
column2: Carrying amount of the unpaid portion of the fee payable to the managing member or general partner for management of the fund or trust.

column1: Market Data Revenue
column2: Amount of revenue from market data services, including, but not limited to, information about current quotes and most recent prices for a specific security.

column1: Members' Equity Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
column2: Amount of ownership interest in limited liability company (LLC) directly or indirectly attributable to noncontrolling interests.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Net Capital Required
column2: Amount of minimum net capital required to be maintained to engage in securities transactions.

column1: Minimum Net Capital Required for Broker-Dealer Subsidiary
column2: Minimum amount of net capital required to be maintained by entity's broker-dealer subsidiary to engage in securities transactions.

column1: Minimum Net Capital Required for Entity
column2: Minimum amount of net capital required to be maintained by the entity to engage in securities transactions.

column1: Minimum Net Worth Required for Compliance
column2: The lowest amount of net worth (total assets minus total liabilities) required by secondary market investors or state-imposed regulatory mandates.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Ownership Percentage by Parent
column2: The parent entity's interest in net assets of the subsidiary, expressed as a percentage.

column1: Mortgage Loans on Real Estate, Renewed and Extended, Amount
column2: Amount of mortgage loan on real estate that was renewed or extended.

column1: Mortgage Loans on Real Estate, Write-down or Reserve, Amount
column2: Amount of reserve for write-down of a mortgage loan on real estate.

column1: Multiemployer Plans, Accumulated Benefit Obligation
column2: Amount of accumulated benefit obligation attributable to the pension or postretirement benefit plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Multiemployer Plans, Collective-Bargaining Arrangement, Percentage of Employer's Participants
column2: Percentage of employee participants subject to a collective bargaining arrangement to all of the employer's participants in a pension or postretirement benefit plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Multiemployer Plans, Collective-Bargaining Arrangement, Percentage of Participants
column2: Percentage of employee participants subject to a collective bargaining arrangement to all participants in a pension or postretirement benefit plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Multiemployer Plans, Minimum Contribution
column2: Amount of minimum contribution(s) required for future periods to a multiemployer plan by collective bargaining arrangements, statutory obligations, or other contractual obligations. A multiemployer plan is a pension or postretirement benefit plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Multiemployer Plans, Plan Assets
column2: Amount of plan assets attributable to the pension or postretirement benefit plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Multiemployer Plans, Withdrawal Obligation
column2: Amount of the obligation recognized by withdrawing from a pension or postretirement benefit plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Net Amount at Risk by Product and Guarantee, General Account Value
column2: Value of the general accounts corresponding to the specified product, guarantee type and subset of the guarantee.

column1: Net Amount at Risk by Product and Guarantee, Net Amount at Risk
column2: Net amount at risk, representing the guaranteed benefit in excess of the current account balance corresponding to the specified product, guarantee type and subset of the guarantee.

column1: Net Amount at Risk by Product and Guarantee, Separate Account Value
column2: Value of the separate accounts corresponding to the specified product, guarantee type and subset of the guarantee.

column1: Net Credit Loss on Loans Managed or Securitized or Asset-backed Financing Arrangement
column2: Amount of credit loss after recoveries for transferred financial assets that continue to be recognized in the statement of financial position.

column1: Net Rentable Area
column2: Net rentable area for properties owned.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Intangible Assets Acquired
column2: The amount of intangibles that an Entity acquires in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as information about all investing and financing activities of an enterprise during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Net Nonmonetary Assets Acquired (Liabilities Assumed) (Deprecated 2011-01-31)
column2: The net book value of a nonmonetary asset transferred or exchanged in connection with the acquisition of a business or asset in a noncash transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. Nonmonetary assets and liabilities are assets and liabilities that will not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the future.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Net Nonmonetary Assets Acquired (Liabilities Assumed)
column2: The net book value of a nonmonetary asset transferred or exchanged in connection with the acquisition of a business or asset in a noncash transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. Nonmonetary assets and liabilities are assets and liabilities that will not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the future.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Value of Liabilities Assumed
column2: The total amount of [all] liabilities that an Entity assumes in acquiring a business or in consideration for an asset received in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Divestiture, Amount of Consideration Received
column2: Amount of noncash consideration received for selling an asset or business through a noncash (or part noncash) transaction.

column1: Noncash Project Abandonment Costs
column2: The expense charged against earnings to eliminate the capitalized costs of projects that have been terminated during the reporting period, which is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by (used in) operations using the indirect method.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Increase from Sale of Parent Equity Interest
column2: Amount of increase in noncontrolling interest from sale of a portion of the parent's controlling interest.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Increase from Subsidiary Equity Issuance
column2: Amount of increase in noncontrolling interest from subsidiary issuance of equity interests to noncontrolling interest holders.

column1: Nonfinancial Liabilities Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of obligations not classified as financial liabilities. Includes, but is not limited to, accounts payable and accrued liabilities, commitments, obligations, and other liabilities.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Other
column2: Amount of other noninterest-bearing domestic deposit liabilities.

column1: Noninterest Expense
column2: Total aggregate amount of all noninterest expense.

column1: Noninterest Expense Commission Expense
column2: Amount of fees incurred for commissions on mutual funds and insurance products.

column1: Noninterest Expense Directors Fees
column2: Noninterest expense related to directors' fees which are fees paid by an Entity to its directors. Directors' fees may be paid in addition to salary and other benefits.

column1: Noninterest Expense Investment Advisory Fees
column2: This represents the company's cost incurred during an accounting period for managing the money in a fund, which will be billed back to the client and is a component of noninterest expenses.

column1: Noninterest Expense Offering Cost
column2: Includes offering costs of open-end investment companies, and closed-end funds with a continuous offering period.

column1: Noninterest Expense Printing and Fulfillment
column2: Amounts expended for printing of marketing and compliance communications and fulfillment services.

column1: Noninterest Expense Related to Performance Fees
column2: Incentive fees which are compensation paid to a trading advisor or to any practitioner who achieves investment results above a specified contractual level.

column1: Noninterest Expense Transfer Agent and Custodian Fees
column2: Fees paid to an agent employed by a corporation or mutual fund to maintain shareholder records, including purchases, sales, and account balances. Also includes custodian fees incurred during an accounting period from an agent, bank, trust company, or other organization that holds and safeguards an individual's, mutual fund's, or investment company's assets for them. These fees will be billed back to the client and are a component of noninterest expense.

column1: Noninterest Income, Other Operating Income
column2: Represents other forms of revenue earned, excluding interest, which is not otherwise specified in the taxonomy.

column1: Non Investment Assets Less Non Investment Liabilities, Percent of Net Assets
column2: The percent of net assets of non investment assets and liabilities. This represents the percentage difference between the investments, including long and short positions, and net assets.

column1: Non-Recourse Debt
column2: Amount of debt for which creditor does not have general recourse to the debtor but rather has recourse only to the property used for collateral in the transaction or other specific property.

column1: Notes Receivable by Owner to Limited Liability Company (LLC)
column2: Amount of an agreement for an unconditional promise by an owner to pay limited liability company (LLC) a definite sum of money at a future date.

column1: Notional Amount of Nonderivative Instruments
column2: Nominal or face amount used to calculate payments on a nonderivative instrument.

column1: Number of Aircraft Operated
column2: Number of aircraft operated by the carrier.

column1: Number of Operating Segments
column2: Number of operating segments. An operating segment is a component of an enterprise: (a) that engages in business activities from which it may earn revenues and incur expenses (including revenues and expenses relating to transactions with other components of the same enterprise), (b) whose operating results are regularly reviewed by the enterprise's chief operating decision maker to make decisions about resources to be allocated to the segment and assess its performance, and (c) for which discrete financial information is available. An operating segment may engage in business activities for which it has yet to earn revenues, for example, start-up operations may be operating segments before earning revenues.

column1: Number of Properties Subject to Ground Leases
column2: Number of separate real estate development properties located on land subject to ground leases.

column1: Number of Reportable Segments
column2: Number of segments reported by the entity. A reportable segment is a component of an entity for which there is an accounting requirement to report separate financial information on that component in the entity's financial statements.

column1: Number of Reporting Units
column2: Number of reporting units tested for impairment of goodwill. A reporting unit is an operating segment or one level below an operating segment.

column1: Obligation with Joint and Several Liability Arrangement, Amount Outstanding
column2: Amount outstanding, before the effects of recovery, of obligation under the joint and several liability arrangement.

column1: Obligation with Joint and Several Liability Arrangement, Amount Receivable
column2: Amount of receivable from other entities recognized in the balance sheet resulting from the joint and several liability arrangement.

column1: Obligation with Joint and Several Liability Arrangement, Amount Recognized
column2: Amount of joint and several liability recognized in the balance sheet.

column1: Occupancy, Net
column2: Amount of net occupancy expense that may include items, such as depreciation of facilities and equipment, lease expenses, property taxes and property and casualty insurance expense.

column1: Oil and Gas Delivery Commitments and Contracts, Available Amounts to be Received
column2: Total available amounts expected to be received from each oil producing property.

column1: Oil and Gas Delivery Commitments and Contracts, Daily Production
column2: Amount of daily production of the applicable energy source.

column1: Oil and Gas Delivery Commitments and Contracts, Fixed Price
column2: The delivery price committed to in the contract.

column1: Oil and Gas Delivery Commitments and Contracts, Remaining Contractual Volume
column2: Total amount of product committed to be supplied under existing contracts or agreements.

column1: Oil and Gas Delivery Commitments and Contracts, Significant Supplies Dedicated or Contracted to Entity
column2: Significant oil and gas supplies dedicated or contracted to the enterprise that can be used to fulfill existing contracts or agreements.

column1: Oil and Gas Property, Successful Effort Method, Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion Amortization and Impairment
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation, depletion, amortization and impairment of oil and gas property carried under the successful effort method.

column1: Open Option Contracts Written, Exercise Price
column2: The exercise price of the open option contracts written on the investment.

column1: Open Option Contracts Written, Number of Contracts
column2: The number of contracts written for the open option contracts written on the investment.

column1: Open Option Contracts Written, Number of Shares
column2: The number of shares for the open option contracts written on the investment.

column1: Open Option Contracts Written, Premiums
column2: Represents the premiums earned on the open option contracts held by the fund. This item is not required to be disclosed in Regulation S-X but is commonly reported by some funds.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Four and Five Years
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the fourth and fifth fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Four and Five
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the fourth and fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Rolling Year Two and Three
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the second and third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Two and Three Years
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the second and third fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments receivable in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year ended for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable letter-terms in excess of one year.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Income Statement, Lease Revenue
column2: The total amount of revenue recognized for the period from operating leases, including minimum lease revenue, contingent revenue, percentage revenue and sublease revenue.

column1: Option Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Redeemable Stock, Redemption Requirements, Amount
column2: Amount of redeemable stock for issue of capital stock that are redeemable at fixed or determinable prices on fixed or determinable dates in each of the five years following the date of the latest statement of financial position presented.

column1: Option Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Strike Price
column2: Exercise or strike price stated in the contract for options indexed to the issuer's equity shares.

column1: Order Flow Fees
column2: The amount of expense in the period for the cost of other broker-dealers' executions of orders.

column1: Origination of Loan to Purchase Common Stock
column2: Cash outflow for origination of loan for purchasing common stock.

column1: Other Commitment
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in the taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due after Fifth Year
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due in Fifth Year
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due in Fourth and Fifth Year
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing in the fourth and fifth fiscal years following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due in Fourth Year
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due in Next Twelve Months
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due in Second and Third Year
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing in the second and third fiscal years following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due in Second Year
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitment, Due in Third Year
column2: Minimum amount of other commitment maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year for commitments not otherwise specified in the taxonomy. Excludes commitments explicitly modeled in this taxonomy, including but not limited to, long-term and short-term purchase commitments, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, supply commitments, registration payment arrangements, leases, debt, product warranties, guarantees, environmental remediation obligations, and pensions.

column1: Other Commitments, Future Minimum Payments, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of other commitments maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year ended.

column1: Other Comprehensive (Income) Loss, Reclassification Adjustment from AOCI for Write-down of Securities, before Tax
column2: Amount before tax of reclassification adjustment from accumulated other comprehensive income for unrealized loss realized upon the write-down of available-for-sale securities.

column1: Other Comprehensive (Income) Loss, Reclassification Adjustment from AOCI for Write-down of Securities, Net of Tax
column2: Amount after tax of reclassification adjustment from accumulated other comprehensive income for unrealized loss realized upon the write-down of available-for-sale securities.

column1: Other Expenses
column2: This element represents a sum total of expenses not separately reflected on the income statement for the period.

column1: Other General and Administrative Expense
column2: The sum of expenses not otherwise specified in the taxonomy for managing and administering the affairs of an entity, including affiliates of the reporting entity, which are not directly or indirectly associated with the manufacture, sale or creation of a product or product line.

column1: Other Income
column2: Reflects the sum of all other revenue and income recognized by the entity in the period not otherwise specified in the income statement.

column1: Other Interest and Dividend Income
column2: Includes all other interest income, net of discount accretion and premium amortization, and dividend income. It may include dividend income from equity securities that do not have readily determinable fair values that are reportable in Other Assets, and interest income on interest-only strips receivable (not in the form of a security) that are included in Other Assets.

column1: Other Investment Not Readily Marketable, Fair Value
column2: Value of the other investment not readily marketable determined by management based upon fair value methods, including pricing of similar securities and valuation techniques, that was used to record the investment for financial reporting purposes.

column1: Other Investment Not Readily Marketable, Quoted Value
column2: Value of the other investments measured by quoted price.

column1: Other Noninterest Expense
column2: Other noninterest expenses that are not separately presented in any other noninterest expense category.

column1: Other Nonoperating Expense
column2: The aggregate amount of other expense amounts, the components of which are not separately disclosed on the income statement, resulting from ancillary business-related activities (that is, excluding major activities considered part of the normal operations of the business) also known as other nonoperating expense recognized during the period. Such amounts may include: (a) unusual costs, (b) loss on foreign exchange transactions, (c) losses on securities (net of profits), and (d) miscellaneous other expense items.

column1: Other Nonoperating Income
column2: The aggregate amount of other income amounts, the components of which are not separately disclosed on the income statement, resulting from ancillary business-related activities (that is, excluding major activities considered part of the normal operations of the business) also known as other nonoperating income recognized for the period. Such amounts may include: (a) dividends, (b) interest on securities, (c) profits on securities (net of losses), and (d) miscellaneous other income items.

column1: Other Nonrecurring Gain
column2: Amount of gain that is infrequent in occurrence or unusual in nature.

column1: Other Real Estate, Additions
column2: Additions of other real estate not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations may also be included in real estate owned. This excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure.

column1: Other Real Estate, Covered
column2: Carrying amount of other real estate covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Real Estate, Covered, Additions
column2: Additions of other real estate covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Real Estate, Covered, Disposals
column2: Disposals of other real estate covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Real Estate, Covered, Improvements
column2: Improvements made to other real estate covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Real Estate, Disposals
column2: Disposals of other real estate not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations may also be included in real estate owned. This excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure.

column1: Other Real Estate, Improvements
column2: Improvements to other real estate not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations may also be included in real estate owned. This excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure.

column1: Other Real Estate, Non Covered
column2: Carrying amount of other real estate not covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Real Estate, Non Covered, Additions
column2: Additions of other real estate not covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Real Estate, Non Covered, Disposals
column2: Disposals of other real estate not covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Real Estate, Non Covered, Improvements
column2: Improvements made to other real estate not covered by loss sharing agreements not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations that may also be included in real estate owned. Excludes real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure by banks.

column1: Other Research and Development Expense
column2: Amount of other research and development expense.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Available-for-sale Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Loan to Collateral Value
column2: This item represents the loan to collateral ratio of the underlying assets in the security, represented as a percentage, which was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the available-for-sale investments are other than temporarily impaired and only the amount of impairment related to credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Held-to-maturity Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Loan to Collateral Value
column2: This item represents the loan to collateral ratio of the underlying assets in the security, represented as a percentage, which was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are other than temporarily impaired and only the amount of impairment related to credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, before Tax, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) loss on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Reclassification Adjustment of Noncredit Portion from Held-to-maturity to Available-for-sale Securities, before Tax
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) related to factors other than credit loss transferred from held-to-maturity to available-for-sale securities.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Reclassification Adjustment of Noncredit Portion Included in Net Income, Availabe-for-sale Securities, before Tax
column2: Amount before tax of reclassification adjustment for other than temporary impairment (OTTI) related to factors other than credit loss on a previously impaired investment in available-for-sale debt security.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Reclassification Adjustment of Noncredit Portion Included in Net Income, Held-to-maturity Securities, before Tax
column2: Amount before tax of reclassification adjustment for other than temporary impairment (OTTI) related to factors other than credit loss on a previously impaired investment on held-to-maturity security.

column1: Other Underwriting Expense
column2: Costs incurred during the period, such as those relating to general administration and policy maintenance that do not vary with and are not primarily related to the acquisition or renewal of insurance contracts.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Contributions
column2: Total contributions made by each class of partners (i.e., general, limited and preferred partners).

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Deferred Compensation
column2: Total change in each class of partners' capital accounts during the year due to deferred compensation. Partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Distribution Per Unit of Limited Partner Interest
column2: The amount of the distribution per unit of limited partner interest.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Distributions
column2: Total distributions to each class of partners (i.e., general, limited and preferred partners).

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Option Exercise
column2: Total change in each class of partners' capital accounts during the year due to option exercise. All partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Private Placement of Units
column2: Monetary value of the issuance of new units of limited partnership interest in a private placement.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Public Sale of Units
column2: Monetary value of the issuance of new units of limited partnership interest in a public offering.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Public Sale of Units Net of Offering Costs
column2: Monetary value of the issuance of new units of limited partnership interest in a public offering, net of offering costs. This is a parenthetical disclosure.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Return of Capital
column2: Total change in each class of partners' capital accounts during the year due to the return of partner's capital. That is, excess distributions over earnings to partners. All partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Sale of Units
column2: Total change in each class of partners' capital accounts during the year due to the sale of units. All partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Unit-based Compensation
column2: Total change in each class of partners' capital accounts during the year due to unit-based compensation. All partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units
column2: The number of each class of partnership units outstanding at the balance sheet date. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Contributed
column2: Units contributed by each class of partners during the year. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Redeemed
column2: The number of units redeemed during the year of each class of partners' capital account. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Sale of Units
column2: Total units issued during the year due to the sale of units. All partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Sold in Private Placement
column2: The number of units sold in a private placement of each class of partners' capital account. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Sold in Public Offering
column2: The number of units sold in a public offering of each class of partners' capital account. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Treasury Units Purchased
column2: Units that were previously issued and have been repurchased during the year.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Treasury Units Reissued
column2: Units that were previously issued and then were repurchased and classified as treasury units. This element represents the number of these units which were reissued during the period.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Unit-based Compensation
column2: The number of units issued due to unit-based compensation.

column1: Patronage Source Earnings
column2: Amount of revenue in excess of cost resulting from transactions for or with patrons.

column1: Payment for Administrative Fees
column2: Amount paid to managing member or general partner, affiliate of managing member or general partner, or affiliate of limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP) for administrative services provided to the LLC or LP, for example, but not limited to, salaries, rent, or overhead costs.

column1: Payment for Incentive Fee
column2: Amount paid for incentive rights held by the managing member or general partner, of limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

column1: Payment for Management Fee
column2: Amount paid to managing member or general partner for management of the day-to-day business functions of the limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

column1: Payments for Brokerage Fees
column2: The amount of cash paid for brokerage fees during the current period. This element is intended to represent the brokerage fees paid by and between financial industry participants.

column1: Payments for Construction in Process
column2: The cash outflow from construction costs to date on capital projects that have not been completed and assets being constructed that are not ready to be placed into service.

column1: Payments for Deposits with Other Institutions
column2: Cash paid to make deposits at other institutions during the period.

column1: Payments for Lease Commissions
column2: Amount of cash outflow for lease commissions incurred.

column1: Payments for Leasing Costs
column2: Amount of cash outflow for costs that are essential to originate the lease and would not otherwise have been incurred without the lease agreement. Amount includes, but is not limited to, cash outflows to evaluate the lessee's credit condition, guarantees, and collateral and cash outflows for costs incurred in negotiating, processing, and executing the lease agreement.

column1: Payments for Loans
column2: Cash payments for and related to principal collection on loans related to operating activities.

column1: Liability for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Claims Paid
column2: Amount of payments to settle insured claims and pay costs incurred in the claims settlement process.

column1: Payments for Origination and Purchases of Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The aggregate amount of cash outflow for loans purchased and created with the intention to resell them in the near future.

column1: Payments for (Proceeds from) Federal Reserve Bank Stock
column2: Amount of cash outflow (inflow) from acquisition or sale of Federal Reserve Bank (FRB) stock.

column1: Payments for Purchase of Other Assets
column2: Amount of cash paid to purchase other assets as part of operating activities.

column1: Payments for Reinsurance
column2: Cash payments made for reinsurance during the current period.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest
column2: The cash outflow during the period for redemption of redeemable noncontrolling interests.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Trust Preferred Securities
column2: The cash outflow to reacquire preferred stocks issued by a business trust or other special purpose entity, mainly established by a bank holding entity, to third party investors. The trust's assets are deeply subordinated debentures of the bank holding entity. Most trust preferred securities are subject to a mandatory redemption upon the repayment of the debentures.

column1: Payments for Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell
column2: The cash outflow associated with agreements to purchase and then resell securities to counterparties (reverse repurchase agreements).

column1: Payments for Software
column2: The cash outflow associated with the development, modification or acquisition of software programs or applications for internal use (that is, not to be sold, leased or otherwise marketed to others) that qualify for capitalization.

column1: Payments for Tenant Improvements
column2: Amount of cash outflow for the allowance granted to lessee and/or direct costs incurred by lessor used to prepare the leased premises for tenant's occupancy.

column1: Payments for Time Deposits
column2: Cash paid to customers who withdraw money in checking and similar accounts at a financial institution.

column1: Payments for Underwriting Expense
column2: Cash paid for expenses incurred during underwriting activities (the process to review insurance applications, evaluate risks, accept or reject applications, and determine the premiums to be charged) for insurance companies.

column1: Payments of Debt Extinguishment Costs
column2: The cash outflow for incremental, external costs directly pertaining to an early extinguishment of debt, including legal costs and prepayment penalties, and excluding interest and repayment of debt principal.

column1: Payments of Derivative Issuance Costs
column2: The cash outflow for cost incurred directly with the issuance of a derivative security.

column1: Payments Related to Tax Withholding for Share-based Compensation
column2: Amount of cash outflow to satisfy an employee's income tax withholding obligation as part of a net-share settlement of a share-based award.

column1: Payments to Acquire and Develop Real Estate
column2: The cash outflow from the acquisition of a piece of land and anything permanently fixed to it, including buildings, structures on it and so forth, and payments to develop real estate assets by adding improvements on or to a parcel of land. Such improvements may include drainage, utilities, subdividing, access, buildings, and any combination of these elements. Including real estate intended to generate income for the owner; excluding real estate acquired for use by the owner.

column1: Payments to Acquire Commercial Real Estate
column2: The cash outflow from the acquisition of property as primarily intended to generate income for its owner.

column1: Payments to Acquire Federal Home Loan Bank Stock
column2: Amount of cash outflow to acquire Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) stock.

column1: Payments to Acquire Held-for-sale Real Estate
column2: The cash outflow from the acquisition of a piece of land held for sale, anything permanently fixed to it, including buildings, structures on it, and so forth.

column1: Payments to Acquire Land
column2: The cash outflow from the acquisition of real estate intended to generate income for the owner; excludes land acquired for use by the owner.

column1: Payments to Acquire Loans Held-for-investment
column2: The cash outflow associated with purchasing loans held for investment purposes during the period.

column1: Payments to Acquire Management Contract Rights
column2: The cash outflow from amounts paid for the rights to manage the property.

column1: Payments to Acquire Mortgage Backed Securities (MBS) categorized as Available-for-sale
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of securities issued by a governmental agency or corporation (for example, GNMA or FHLMC) or by private issuers (for example, banks and mortgage banking enterprises) secured by and repaid from underlying mortgages, which were designated as available for sale when acquired.

column1: Payments to Acquire Mortgage Backed Securities (MBS) categorized as Held-to-maturity
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of securities issued by a governmental agency or corporation (for example, GNMA or FHLMC) or by private issuers (for example, banks and mortgage banking enterprises) secured by and repaid from underlying mortgages, which were designated as held to maturity when acquired.

column1: Payments to Acquire Mortgage Notes Receivable
column2: The cash outflow from the purchase of receivables arising from the mortgage note on real estate.

column1: Payments to Acquire Mortgage Servicing Rights (MSR)
column2: The cash outflow to obtain servicing rights, which contractually entitle the servicer to receive fees and ancillary revenues for performing billing, collection, disbursement and recordkeeping services in connection with a mortgage portfolio. Rights may be obtained via (1) acquisition or assumption of a servicing obligation that does not relate to financial assets of the servicer or its consolidated affiliates; or (2) by originating mortgage loans and then (a) transferring the loans to a Variable Interest Entity (VIE) in a transaction that meets the necessary transfer and classification requirements, or (b) transferring the loans in a transaction that meets the requirements for sale accounting.

column1: Payments to Acquire Other Real Estate
column2: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of other real estate investments held by the entity for investment purposes not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Payments to Acquire Partners Interest in Real Estate Partnership, Net of Cash Acquired
column2: The cash outflow from the purchase of ownership in a partnership, the purpose of which is to construct, sell, hold or invest in real estate.

column1: Payments to Acquire Property, Plant, and Equipment
column2: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of long-lived, physical assets that are used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale; includes cash outflows to pay for construction of self-constructed assets.

column1: Payments to Acquire Real Estate
column2: The cash outflow from the acquisition of a piece of land, anything permanently fixed to it, including buildings, structures on it and so forth; includes real estate intended to generate income for the owner; excludes real estate acquired for use by the owner.

column1: Payments to Acquire Real Estate Held-for-investment
column2: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of real estate held for investment purposes.

column1: Payments to Acquire Residential Real Estate
column2: The cash outflow from the acquisition of residential property intended to generate income for the owner.

column1: Payments to Acquire Trust Preferred Investments
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of trust preferred securities, which possess characteristics of both equity and debt securities.

column1: Payments to Develop Real Estate Assets
column2: Payments to develop real estate assets is the process of adding improvements on or to a parcel of land. Such improvements may include drainage, utilities, subdividing, access, buildings, and any combination of these elements; and are generally classified as cash flow from investing activities.

column1: Payments to Fund Policy Loans
column2: The initial funding or additional funding of loans receivable to policy holders principally secured by the benefits under the policy.

column1: Payments to Purchase Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The aggregate cash outflow used to purchase all loans that are held with the intention to resell in the near future.

column1: Payments to Purchase Mortgage Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash outflow used to purchase loans that are secured with real estate mortgage and are held with the intention to resell in the near future.

column1: Payments to Purchase Other Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash outflow used to purchase loans (other than mortgage loans) that are held with the intention to resell in the near future.

column1: Policyholder Benefits and Claims Incurred, Direct
column2: Amount, before effect of policies assumed or ceded, of expense related to provision for policy benefits and costs incurred.

column1: Policyholder Benefits and Claims Incurred, Net, Health
column2: Amount, after effect of policies assumed or ceded, of expense related to provision for policy benefits and costs incurred for health insurance contracts.

column1: Policyholder Benefits and Claims Incurred, Net, Life and Annuity
column2: Amount, after effect of policies assumed or ceded, of expense related to provision for policy benefits and costs incurred for life and annuity insurance contracts.

column1: Policyholder Benefits and Claims Incurred, Net, Other
column2: Amount, after effect of policies assumed or ceded, of expense related to provision for benefits and costs incurred for other insurance contracts.

column1: Policyholder Dividends, Expense
column2: Amount of expense for dividends to policyholders.

column1: Policyholders' Surplus
column2: Amount of policyholders' surplus excluded from calculating deferred taxes.

column1: Postage Expense
column2: Amount of expense associated with postage.

column1: Preferred Stock Dividends, Income Statement Impact
column2: The amount of preferred stock dividends that is an adjustment to net income apportioned to common stockholders.

column1: Premiums Earned, Net, Accident and Health
column2: Amount, after premiums ceded to other entities and premiums assumed by the entity, of accident and health premiums earned.

column1: Premiums Earned, Net, Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts
column2: Amount, after premiums ceded to other entities and premiums assumed by the entity, of financial guarantee premiums earned.

column1: Premiums Earned, Net, Life
column2: Amount, after premiums ceded to other entities and premiums assumed by the entity, of life premiums earned.

column1: Premiums Earned, Net, Property and Casualty
column2: Amount, after premiums ceded to other entities and premiums assumed by the entity, of property and casualty premiums earned.

column1: Premiums, Percentage Assumed to Net
column2: Percentage of assumed premiums earned by the entity to net premiums earned.

column1: Premiums Written, Gross
column2: Amount of direct and assumed premiums written.

column1: Prepaid Expense and Other Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for costs that provide economic benefits in future periods, and amount of other assets that are expected to be realized or consumed after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipts, after Year Five
column2: Amount of the prescription drug subsidy receipts to be received after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipts, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of the prescription drug subsidy receipts to be received in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipts, Year Five
column2: Amount of the prescription drug subsidy receipts to be received in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipts, Year Four
column2: Amount of the prescription drug subsidy receipts to be received in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipts, Year Three
column2: Amount of the prescription drug subsidy receipts to be received in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipts, Year Two
column2: Amount of the prescription drug subsidy receipts to be received in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense
column2: Amount of the present value of future profits asset amortized.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Impairment Write-down
column2: Amount of impairment recognized in the income statement reducing the present value of future profits asset below amortized carrying value.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Unrealized Investment Gains
column2: Amount of unrealized investment gains recognized in the income statement from the increase in the present value of future insurance profits asset.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Unrealized Investment Losses
column2: Amount of unrealized investment loss recognized in the income statement from the decrease in the present value of future profits asset.

column1: Principal Amount Outstanding on Loans Managed and Securitized or Asset-backed Financing Arrangement
column2: This is the sum of principal amount outstanding for both securitized and unsecuritized loans of all types.

column1: Proceeds from Annuities and Investment Certificates
column2: The cash inflow from an insurance contract under which the policy holder make a lump sum payment or a series of payments in exchange for periodic payments to the policyholder beginning immediately or at some future date.

column1: Proceeds from Bank Debt
column2: The cash inflow from bank borrowing during the year.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Advance to Affiliate
column2: The cash inflow from the collection of money previously advanced to an entity that is related to it but not strictly controlled.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from collection of repayments from borrowers on loans that are held with the intention to resell in the near future; includes mortgages and other types of loans.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Long-term Loans to Related Parties
column2: The cash inflow associated with collection, whether partial or full, of long-term loans to a related party. Alternate caption: Proceeds from Advances to Affiliates.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Other Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from collection of repayments from borrowers on loans that are held with the intention to resell in the near future; includes loans that are not mortgages.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Policy Loans
column2: The cash inflow associated with the collection of policy loans receivable.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Retained Interest in Securitized Receivables categorized as Available-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from the collection of a retained interest in a receivable securitized via a structured process whereby interests in loans and other receivables are packaged, underwritten, and sold in the form of asset-backed securities, categorized as available-for-sale.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Retained Interest in Securitized Receivables categorized as Held-to-maturity
column2: The cash inflow from the collection of a retained interest in a receivable securitized via a structured process whereby interests in loans and other receivables are packaged, underwritten, and sold in the form of asset-backed securities, categorized as held to maturity.

column1: Proceeds from Construction Loans Payable
column2: The cash inflow from borrowings to finance the cost of construction.

column1: Proceeds from Deposits with Other Institutions
column2: Cash received from refund of deposits with other institutions during the period.

column1: Proceeds from Derivative Instrument, Investing Activities
column2: The cash inflow provided by derivative instruments during the period, which are classified as investing activities, excluding those designated as hedging instruments.

column1: Proceeds from Distributions Received from Real Estate Partnerships
column2: The cash inflow from earnings received from real estate partnerships.

column1: Proceeds from Divestiture of Real Estate Partnership
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of interest in partnership during the period.

column1: Proceeds from Equity Method Investment, Dividends or Distributions, Return of Capital
column2: Cash dividends or other distributions received from unconsolidated subsidiaries, certain corporate joint ventures, and certain noncontrolled corporations that are returns of capital. Excludes dividends or distributions from equity method investments classified as operating activities.

column1: Proceeds from Federal Home Loan Bank Borrowings
column2: The cash inflow from a borrowing made from Federal Home Loan Bank.

column1: Proceeds from Insurance Premiums Collected
column2: Cash received as payments for insurance premiums during the current period.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Common Stock, Dividend Reinvestment Plan
column2: Amount of cash inflow from capital contributions to an entity associated with a dividend reinvestment plan.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Debt
column2: The cash inflow during the period from additional borrowings in aggregate debt. Includes proceeds from short-term and long-term debt.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Preferred Stock, Preference Stock, and Warrants
column2: Proceeds from issuance of capital stock which provides for a specific dividend that is paid to the shareholders before any dividends to common stockholder, which takes precedence over common stockholders in the event of liquidation and from issuance of rights to purchase common shares at a predetermined price.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Shares under Incentive and Share-based Compensation Plans, Including Stock Options
column2: The total cash inflow associated with the amount received from holders to acquire the entity's shares under incentive and share awards, including stock option exercises. This item inherently excludes any excess tax benefit, which the entity may have realized and reported separately.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Trust Preferred Securities
column2: The cash inflow from issuance of preferred stocks by a business trust or other special purpose entity, mainly established by a bank holding entity, to third party investors. The trust's assets are deeply subordinated debentures of the bank holding entity. Most trust preferred securities are subject to a mandatory redemption upon the repayment of the debentures.

column1: Proceeds from Loan and Lease Originations and Principal Collections
column2: Cash inflow related to a loan origination (the process when securing a mortgage for a piece of real property), lease origination, and principal collections.

column1: Proceeds from Loan Originations
column2: Cash inflow associated with loan origination (the process when securing a mortgage for a piece of real property) or lease origination.

column1: Proceeds from Loans
column2: Cash received from principal payments made on loans related to operating activities.

column1: Proceeds from Maturities, Prepayments and Calls of Mortgage Backed Securities (MBS)
column2: The cash inflow from the maturity (principal due), prepayment and call (request of early payment) of a loan financed by home mortgage payments classified as held to maturity.

column1: Proceeds from Maturities, Prepayments and Calls of Other Investments
