column2: The cash inflow associated with the maturity (principal being due), prepayment and call (request of early payment) of other investments not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Proceeds from Maturities, Prepayments and Calls of Securities, Operating Activities
column2: Cash received from maturities, prepayments and calls of trading securities and other securities, classified as operating.

column1: Proceeds from Other Deposits
column2: Cash inflow related to receipts of other deposits not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Proceeds from Principal Repayments on Loans and Leases Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow from repayments of the balance excluding interest (principal) on loans receivable and leases held for investment purposes.

column1: Proceeds from Recoveries of Loans Previously Charged off
column2: The cash inflow from loans reinstated and recovered that were previously deemed uncollectible.

column1: Proceeds from Related Party Debt
column2: The cash inflow from a long-term borrowing made from related parties where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth. Alternate caption: Proceeds from Advances from Affiliates.

column1: Proceeds from Repayment of Loans to Purchase Common Stock
column2: Cash inflow from repayment of loans for purchasing common stock.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Collection of Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from sale proceeds and collection of repayments from borrowers on loans classified as held-for-sale, including proceeds from loans sold through mortgage securitization; includes mortgages and other types of loans.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Collection of Mortgage Notes Receivable
column2: The cash inflow from proceeds from sale of receivables arising from the mortgage note on real estate; includes collections on mortgage notes receivable that are not classified as operating cash flows.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Federal Home Loan Bank Stock
column2: Amount of cash inflow from sale of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) stock.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Land Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of land held for investment; excludes sales of land held as inventory or productive use.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Loans Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow from Sales of Loans Held For Investment.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow resulting from the sale of loans classified as held-for-sale, including proceeds from loans sold through mortgage securitization.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Mortgage Backed Securities (MBS) categorized as Available-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of securities issued by a governmental agency or corporation (for example, GNMA or FHLMC) or by private issuers (for example, banks and mortgage banking enterprises) secured by and repaid from underlying mortgages, which were designated as available for sale when acquired.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Mortgage Servicing Rights (MSR)
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of servicing rights, which contractually entitle the servicer to receive fees and ancillary revenues for performing billing, collection, disbursement and recordkeeping services in connection with a mortgage portfolio. Rights may be obtained via (1) acquisition or assumption of a servicing obligation that does not relate to financial assets of the servicer or its consolidated affiliates; or (2) by originating mortgage loans and then (a) transferring the loans to a Variable Interest Entity (VIE) in a transaction that meets the necessary transfer and classification requirements, or (b) transferring the loans in a transaction that meets the requirements for sale accounting.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Other Assets
column2: Amount of cash inflow from the sale of other assets as part of operating activities.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Other Assets, Investing Activities
column2: Amount of cash inflow from the sale of other assets recognized in investing activities.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Other Investments
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of other investments not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Other Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow resulting from the sale of loans (other than mortgage loans) that are held with the intention to resell in the near future.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Other Real Estate
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of other real estate not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Other Real Estate Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of other real estate held for investment not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Property Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of formerly productive land held for sale, anything permanently fixed to it, including buildings, structures on it, and so forth.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Property, Plant, and Equipment
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of long-lived, physical assets that are used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Real Estate Held-for-investment
column2: Cash received from the sale of real estate that is held for investment, that is, it is part of an investing activity during the period.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Securities, Operating Activities
column2: Cash received from sale of investments in debt and equity securities, classified as operating activities, during the period; includes trading securities and any other investments classified as operating.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Trust Assets to Pay Expenses
column2: Amount of cash inflows from the sale of trust assets to pay trust expenses.

column1: Proceeds from Secured Lines of Credit
column2: The cash inflow from a contractual arrangement with the lender, including letter of credit, standby letter of credit and revolving credit arrangements, under which borrowings can be made up to a specific amount at any point in time with either short term or long term maturity that is collateralized (backed by pledge, mortgage or other lien in the entity's assets).

column1: Proceeds from Secured Notes Payable
column2: The cash inflow from borrowings supported by a written promise to pay an obligation that is collateralized (backed by pledge, mortgage or other lien in the entity's assets).

column1: Proceeds from Securitizations of Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from securitizing loans held with the intention to resell in the near future.

column1: Proceeds from Short-term Capital Lease Obligations
column2: The cash inflow from proceeds received from lessor related to capital lease obligation.

column1: Proceeds from Time Deposits Accepted
column2: Cash received from customers who deposit money in checking and similar accounts at a financial institution.

column1: Proceeds from Unsecured Lines of Credit
column2: The cash inflow from a contractual arrangement with the lender, including letter of credit, standby letter of credit and revolving credit arrangements, under which borrowings can be made up to a specific amount at any point in time with either short term or long term maturity that is uncollateralized (where debt is not backed by the pledge of collateral).

column1: Proceeds from Unsecured Notes Payable
column2: The cash inflow from borrowings supported by a written promise to pay an obligation that is uncollateralized (where debt is not backed by the pledge of collateral).

column1: Production and Distribution Costs
column2: Amount of expense related to the production and distribution of goods or services to customers and clients.

column1: Production, Barrels of Oil Equivalents
column2: Energy measure of oil and natural gas production reserves.

column1: Production Costs, Period Cost
column2: The capitalized costs incurred during the period (excluded from amortization) to operate and maintain wells and related equipment and facilities, including depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of operating and maintaining those wells and related equipment and facilities. They become part of the cost of oil and gas produced. Examples of production costs (sometimes called lifting costs) are: costs of labor to operate the wells and related equipment and facilities; repairs and maintenance; materials, supplies, and fuel consumed and supplies utilized in operating the wells and related equipment and facilities; property taxes and insurance applicable to proved properties and wells and related equipment and facilities; severance taxes; some support equipment or facilities may serve two or more oil and gas producing activities and may also serve transportation, refining, and marketing activities. To the extent that the support equipment and facilities are used in oil and gas producing activities, their depreciation and applicable operating costs become exploration, development or production costs, as appropriate. Depreciation, depletion, and amortization of capitalized acquisition, exploration, and development costs are not production costs but also become part of the cost of oil and gas produced along with production (lifting) costs identified above.

column1: Production Tax Expense
column2: A tax assessed on oil and gas production.

column1: Productive Gas Wells, Number of Wells, Gross
column2: The total number of producing gas wells and gas wells capable of production, in which the entity owns an undivided working interest.

column1: Productive Gas Wells, Number of Wells, Net
column2: The total number of producing gas wells and gas wells capable of production, in which the entity owns a fractional working interest.

column1: Productive Oil Wells, Number of Wells, Gross
column2: The total number of producing oil wells and oil wells capable of production, in which the entity owns an undivided working interest.

column1: Productive Oil Wells, Number of Wells, Net
column2: The total number of producing oil wells and oil wells capable of production, in which the entity owns a fractional working interest.

column1: Productive Oil Wells, Number of Wells with Multiple Completions, Gross
column2: The total number of productive oil wells and oil wells capable of production which access multiple reservoirs through one well bore, in which the entity owns an undivided working interest.

column1: Productive Oil Wells, Number of Wells with Multiple Completions, Net
column2: The total number of productive oil wells and oil wells capable of production which access multiple reservoirs through one well bore, in which the entity owns a fractional working interest.

column1: Professional and Contract Services Expense
column2: Professional and contract service expense includes cost reimbursements for support services related to contracted projects, outsourced management, technical and staff support.

column1: Professional Fees
column2: A fee charged for services from professionals such as doctors, lawyers and accountants. The term is often expanded to include other professions, for example, pharmacists charging to maintain a medicinal profile of a client or customer.

column1: Program Rights Obligations
column2: Total amount of obligations related to rights to programming, including, but not limited to, feature films and episodic series, acquired under license agreements.

column1: Program Rights Obligations, Current
column2: Amount of obligations related to rights to programming, including, but not limited to, feature films and episodic series, acquired under license agreements that will be paid within the next twelve months.

column1: Program Rights Obligations, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of obligations related to rights to programming, including, but not limited to, feature films and episodic series, acquired under license agreements that will be paid after one year.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Additions
column2: Amount of acquisition of long-lived, physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, furniture and fixtures, and computer equipment.

column1: Property, Plant, and Equipment, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Gross, Excluding Capital Leased Assets
column2: Gross amount of long-lived physical assets excluding assets held under lease agreements used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, furniture and fixtures, and computer equipment.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Net, Excluding Capital Leased Assets
column2: Amount, net of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization, of long-lived physical assets excluding assets held under lease agreements used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, furniture and fixtures, and computer equipment.

column1: Property Subject to or Available for Operating Lease, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: The amount of accumulated depreciation, by major property class, recorded on property subject to or available for lease as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Property Subject to or Available for Operating Lease, Net
column2: The amount of property, by major property class, net of accumulated depreciation, subject to or available for lease as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Public Utilities, Amount of Allowance for Funds Used During Construction, Equity Costs Capitalized Only for Rate-making Purposes
column2: Amount of costs of debt and equity financing capitalized for setting rates but not capitalized for financial statement purposes.

column1: Public Utilities, Approved Debt Capital Structure, Percentage
column2: Percentage of public utility's approved debt to capital, including debt and equity.

column1: Public Utilities, Approved Equity Capital Structure, Percentage
column2: Percentage of public utility's approved equity to capital, including debt and equity.

column1: Public Utilities, Approved Return on Equity, Percentage
column2: Percentage of public utility's approved return on equity.

column1: Public Utilities, Inventory
column2: The period end amount for a type of inventory held by the utility in a schedule of inventories.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: Period end book value of accumulated depreciation on property, plant and equipment (PPE) that is owned by the regulated operations of the public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Amortization of Present Value of Regulated Asset for Plant Abandonment
column2: Amortization of the present value amount of future cost recoveries related to plant abandonment in regulated industries.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Common
column2: Period end amount of property, plant and equipment (PPE) related to regulated assets common to business units.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Construction Work in Progress
column2: Period end amount of construction work in progress in public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Distribution
column2: Period end amount of property, plant and equipment (PPE) related to utility distribution.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Equipment
column2: Period end book value of equipment owned (but not classified elsewhere) by the public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Fuel
column2: Period end amount of property, plant and equipment (PPE) related to fuels owned by the public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Generation or Processing
column2: Period end amount of property, plant and equipment (PPE) related to generation or processing owned by public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Land
column2: Period end book value of land owned by the public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Net
column2: Period end amount of total net PPE.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Other Property, Plant and Equipment
column2: Period end book value of other property, plant and equipment (PPE) owned (but not classified elsewhere) by the public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Plant in Service
column2: Period end amount of total gross PPE.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Transmission
column2: Period end amount of property, plant and equipment (PPE) related to utility transmission owned by public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Transmission and Distribution
column2: Period end amount of property, plant and equipment (PPE) related to transmission and distribution owned by public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Vehicles
column2: Period end book value of vehicles owned by the public utility.

column1: Public Utilities, Requested Debt Capital Structure, Percentage
column2: Percentage of public utility's requested debt to capital, including debt and equity.

column1: Public Utilities, Requested Equity Capital Structure, Percentage
column2: Percentage of public utility's requested equity to capital, including debt and equity.

column1: Public Utilities, Requested Return on Equity, Percentage
column2: Percentage of public utility's requested return on equity.

column1: Purchase Obligation
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement in which the entity has agreed to expend funds to procure goods or services from a supplier.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due after Fifth Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due in Fifth Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due in Fourth and Fifth Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the fourth and fifth fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due in Fourth Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due in Next Twelve Months
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due in Second and Third Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the second and third fiscal years following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due in Second Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Due in Third Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Includes, but not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Ratio of Indebtedness to Net Capital
column2: Indebtedness divided by net capital.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Carrying Amount of Buildings and Improvements
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation of buildings and improvements for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes real estate not held as an investment or interest.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Carrying Amount of Land
column2: Amount of land for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes real estate not held as an investment or interest.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Costs Capitalized Subsequent to Acquisition, Carrying Costs
column2: Amount of carrying costs of properties that were capitalized after acquisition, for example, but not limited to, real estate taxes and insurance for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes initial purchase price and improvements.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Costs Capitalized Subsequent to Acquisition, Improvements
column2: Amount of land and buildings and improvements made to real estate investments and capitalized after acquisition for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Initial Cost of Buildings and Improvements
column2: Initial cost of buildings and improvements for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes real estate not held as an investment or interest.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Initial Cost of Land
column2: Initial cost of land for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes real estate not held as an investment or interest.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate, Improvements
column2: Amount of increase in real estate investments related to improvements for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Real Estate Investment Partnership Cost of Sales
column2: Amount of cost of sales related to investments in real estate partnerships and variable interest entities.

column1: Real Estate Investment Partnership Revenue
column2: Amount of revenue recognized from investments in real estate partnerships and variable interest entities.

column1: Real Estate Owned, Amount of Loss at Acquisition
column2: Amount of reduction to fair value of loan related to real estate owned (REO) at time of acquisition.

column1: Real Estate Owned, Valuation Allowance, Provision
column2: Amount of expense recognized in the income statement for a decrease in valuation of real estate owned (REO).

column1: Real Estate Owned, Valuation Allowance, Valuation Increase
column2: Amount of gain recognized in the income statement for an increase in valuation of real estate owned (REO).

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Reduction of Short-term Capital Lease Obligations
column2: The cash outflow for a borrowing recorded for a lease meeting the criteria for capitalization (with maturities within one year or the normal operating cycle of the entity, if longer).

column1: Regulatory Assets
column2: The amount for the individual regulatory asset as itemized in a table of regulatory assets as of the end of the period.

column1: Regulatory Assets, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of capitalized costs of regulated entities that are not expected to be recovered through revenue sources.

column1: Regulatory Liabilities
column2: The amount for the individual regulatory liability as itemized in a table of regulatory liabilities as of the end of the period.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverable for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustments
column2: Amount after valuation allowance recoverable under reinsurance contracts for claims and claims adjustments.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables, Allowance
column2: Amount of valuation allowance for reinsurance recoverables. Examples include, but are not limited to, settled and unsettled claims, incurred but not reported losses, loss adjustment expense, premium paid, policy benefits and policy reserves.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation allowance recoverable under reinsurance contracts. Examples include, but are not limited to, settled and unsettled claims, incurred but not reported losses, loss adjustment expense, premium paid, policy benefits and policy reserves.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables on Paid and Unpaid Losses
column2: Amount after valuation allowance recoverable under reinsurance contracts, including, but not limited to, settled and unsettled claims, incurred but not reported losses, loss adjustment expense, policy benefits and policy reserves.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables on Paid Losses
column2: Amount after valuation allowance of reinsurance recoverables on paid losses.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables on Paid Losses, Allowance
column2: Amount of valuation allowance for reinsurance recoverables on paid losses.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables on Paid Losses, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation allowance of reinsurance recoverables on paid losses.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables on Unpaid Losses, Allowance
column2: Amount of valuation allowance for reinsurance recoverables for losses reported to the ceding insurer but not yet paid, and for amounts expected based upon statistical projections and other measures of incurred losses and loss settlement expenses which have not yet been reported to the ceding insurer.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables on Unpaid Losses, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation allowance of reinsurance recoverables for losses reported to the ceding insurer but not yet paid, and for amounts expected based upon statistical projections and other measures of incurred losses and loss settlement expenses which have not yet been reported to the ceding insurer.

column1: Reinsurance Retention Policy, Excess Retention, Amount Reinsured
column2: Amount of risk reinsured in excess of stated retention per company policy.

column1: Reinsurance Retention Policy, Excess Retention, Percentage
column2: Percentage of risk reinsured in excess of stated retention per entity policy.

column1: Reinsurance Retention Policy, Reinsured Risk, Percentage
column2: Percentage of risk reinsured on insurance products per entity policy.

column1: Related Party Deposit Liabilities
column2: Amount of deposits held by the entity for a related party (entity, shareholder, employee).

column1: Related Party Tax Expense, Due from Affiliates, Current
column2: The amount of any current tax-related balances due from affiliates as of the date of each statement of financial position presented.

column1: Related Party Tax Expense, Due from Affiliates, Deferred
column2: The amount of any deferred tax-related balances due from affiliates as of the date of each statement of financial position presented.

column1: Related Party Tax Expense, Due to Affiliates, Current
column2: The amount of any current tax-related balances due to affiliates as of the date of each statement of financial position presented.

column1: Related Party Tax Expense, Due to Affiliates, Deferred
column2: The amount of any deferred tax-related balances due to affiliates as of the date of each statement of financial position presented.

column1: Related Party Transaction, Expenses from Transactions with Related Party
column2: Expenses recognized resulting from transactions (excluding transactions that are eliminated in consolidated or combined financial statements) with related party.

column1: Related Party Transaction, Purchases from Related Party
column2: Purchases during the period (excluding transactions that are eliminated in consolidated or combined financial statements) with related party.

column1: Related Party Transaction, Rate
column2: Identify the stated interest rate per the agreement, for example, leasing and debt arrangements between related parties.

column1: Related Party Transaction, Selling, General and Administrative Expenses from Transactions with Related Party
column2: Amount of selling, general and administrative expenses resulting from transactions, excluding transactions that are eliminated in consolidated or combined financial statements, with related party.

column1: Repayments of Annuities and Investment Certificates
column2: The cash outflow for an insurance contract under which the policy holder make a lump sum payment or a series of payments in exchange for periodic payments to the policyholder beginning immediately or at some future date.

column1: Repayments of Construction Loans Payable
column2: The cash outflow from repayment of borrowings to finance the cost of construction.

column1: Repayments of Federal Home Loan Bank Borrowings
column2: The cash outflow for the payment of loan drawn from Federal Home Loan.

column1: Repayments of Notes Payable
column2: The cash outflow for a borrowing supported by a written promise to pay an obligation.

column1: Repayments of Related Party Debt
column2: The cash outflow for the payment of a long-term borrowing made from a related party where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth. Alternate caption: Payments for Advances from Affiliates.

column1: Reporting Unit, Amount of Fair Value in Excess of Carrying Amount
column2: Amount of fair value of reporting unit in excess of carrying amount.

column1: Reporting Unit, Percentage of Fair Value in Excess of Carrying Amount
column2: Percentage of fair value of reporting unit in excess of carrying amount.

column1: Repurchase Agreement Counterparty, Amount at Risk
column2: The amount at risk under repurchase agreements is defined as the excess of carrying amount (or market value, if higher than the carrying amount or if there is no carrying amount) of the securities or other assets sold under agreement to repurchase, including accrued interest plus any cash or other assets on deposit to secure the repurchase obligation, over the amount of the repurchase liability (adjusted for accrued interest).

column1: Required Net Capital under Commodity Exchange Act
column2: Amount of net capital required to be maintained under the Commodity Futures Trading Commission's (CFTC) minimum financial requirements, pursuant to the Commodity Exchange Act, less the market value of certain commodity options.

column1: Resale Agreement Counterparty, Amount at Risk
column2: The amount at risk under resale agreements (reverse repurchase agreements) is defined as the excess of the carrying amount of the resale agreements over the market value of assets delivered pursuant to the agreements by the counterparty to the registrant (or to a third party agent that has affirmatively agreed to act on behalf of the registrant) and not returned to the counterparty, except in exchange for their approximate market value in a separate transaction.

column1: Restricted Investments, at Fair Value
column2: The aggregate value of all restricted investments.

column1: Restricted Investments Exempt from Registration, at Fair Value
column2: The aggregate value of all restricted investments which are exempt from registration pursuant to Rule 144A.

column1: Restricted Investments Exempt from Registration, Percent of Net Assets
column2: The percent of net assets of the aggregate value of all restricted investments exempt from registration pursuant to Rule 144A.

column1: Restricted Investments Not Exempt from Registration, at Fair Value
column2: The aggregate value of all restricted investments which are not exempt from registration pursuant to Rule 144A.

column1: Restricted Investments Not Exempt from Registration, Percent of Net Assets
column2: The percent of net assets of the aggregate value of all restricted investments not exempt from registration pursuant to Rule 144A.

column1: Restricted Investments, Percent of Net Assets
column2: The percent of net assets of the aggregate value of all restricted investments.

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Cost Incurred to Date
column2: Amount of costs incurred to date for the specified restructuring cost.

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Expected Cost
column2: Amount expected to be recognized in earnings for the specified restructuring cost.

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Expected Cost Remaining
column2: Amount of expected cost remaining for the specified restructuring cost.

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Accelerated Depreciation
column2: Amount of accelerated depreciation charged against earnings associated with exit from or disposal of business activities or restructuring plan.

column1: Results of Operations, Accretion of Asset Retirement Obligations
column2: Accretion expense of asset retirement obligations related to oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, and Valuation Provisions
column2: Depreciation, depletion and amortization, and valuation provisions (impairments) related to oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Dry Hole Costs
column2: Dry hole costs from oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Expense, Other
column2: Other costs for oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Exploration Expense
column2: Exploration costs from oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, General and Administrative Related to Oil and Gas Producing Activities
column2: General and administrative costs from oil & gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Impairment of Oil and Gas Properties
column2: Costs related to the impairment of oil and gas properties.

column1: Results of Operations, Production or Lifting Costs
column2: Production (lifting) costs from oil and gas producing activities, including but not limited to lease operating expense, production and ad valorem taxes, and transportation expense.

column1: Results of Operations, Revenue from Oil and Gas Producing Activities
column2: Total revenues from oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Revenue, Other
column2: Other revenues from oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Sales or Transfers to Entity's Other Operations
column2: Sales or transfers to the enterprises other operations from oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Sales Revenue to Unaffiliated Enterprises
column2: Sales revenue to unaffiliated enterprises from oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Results of Operations, Transportation Costs
column2: Includes the cost to prepare and move liquid hydrocarbons and natural gas to their points of sale.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retained Patronage Allocations
column2: Amount of patronage earnings retained within the agricultural cooperative.

column1: Retention Payable, Due after Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid after the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Risk Weighted Assets
column2: Amount of risk-weighted assets as calculated in accordance with U.S. Federal regulatory capital standards.

column1: Salaries, Wages and Officers' Compensation
column2: Expenditures for salaries for officers and non-officers. Does not include allocated share-based compensation, pension and post-retirement benefit expense or other labor-related non-salary expense. For commercial and industrial companies, excludes any direct and overhead labor that is included in cost of goods sold.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: The accumulated depreciation and amortization related to the asset(s) sold in connection with the property sold to another party and leased back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Amount Due under Financing Arrangement
column2: The liability due as of the balance sheet date for leasebacks accounted for using the deposit method.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Annual Rental Payments
column2: The yearly payments due under the lease entered into in connection with the transaction involving the sale of property to another party and the lease of the property back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Cumulative Gain Recognized
column2: Cumulative amount of gain recognized (out of deferred gain) as income or a reduction in rent expense.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Current Period Gain Recognized
column2: The portion of the deferred gain that was recognized in the current period.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Deferred Gain, Gross
column2: The amount of the gain recorded in connection with the transaction involving the sale of property to another party and the lease of the property back to the seller to be recognized in future periods.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Deferred Gain, Net
column2: The portion of the gain that will be recorded as income or a reduction in rent expense in future periods less amounts recognized in the current period.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Gross Proceeds, Financing Activities
column2: Amount of cash inflow before closing and deferred financing costs received by a seller-lessee in a sale-leaseback recognized in financing activities.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Gross Proceeds, Investing Activities
column2: Amount of cash inflow before closing and deferred financing costs received by a seller-lessee in a sale-leaseback recognized in investing activities.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Historical Cost
column2: The historical cost of the asset(s) sold in connection with the sale of the property to another party and the lease of the property back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Imputed Interest Rate
column2: The financing cost related to leases that have been recorded under the deposit method, as a financing or as a capital leases in connection with the transaction involving the sale of property to another party and the lease of the property back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Monthly Rental Payments
column2: The amount of the monthly rental payments due under the lease entered into in connection with the transactions involving the sale of property to another party and the lease of the property back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Net Book Value
column2: The net book value of the asset(s) sold in connection with the sale of the property to another party and lease back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Net Proceeds, Financing Activities
column2: Amount of cash inflow after closing and deferred financing costs received by a seller-lessee in a sale-leaseback recognized in financing activities.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Net Proceeds, Investing Activities
column2: Amount of cash inflow after closing and deferred financing costs received by a seller-lessee in a sale-leaseback recognized in investing activities.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Other Payments Required
column2: Other amounts the seller-lessee is required to pay under the terms of the transaction involving the sale of property to another party and lease of the property back to the seller, including reimbursements for such items, as utilities, taxes, insurance and common area maintenance.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Quarterly Rental Payments
column2: The amount of the quarterly rental payments due under the lease entered into in connection with the transactions involving the sale of property to another party and the lease of the property back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Rent Expense
column2: The amount of the current period expense recorded for use of the property in connection with the transaction involving the sale of property to another party and the lease of the property back to the seller.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Transaction Costs, Financing Activities
column2: Amount of cash outflow for transaction costs in a sale-leaseback recognized in financing activities. For example, but not limited to, closing and deferred financing costs.

column1: Sale Leaseback Transaction, Transaction Costs, Investing Activities
column2: Amount of cash outflow for transaction costs in a sale-leaseback recognized in investing activities. For example, but not limited to, closing and deferred financing costs.

column1: Sale of Trust Assets to Pay Expenses
column2: Amount of sale of trust assets (includes, but is not limited to, gold and silver) to pay trust expenses.

column1: Schedule of Fair Value of Separate Accounts by Major Category of Investment, Fair Value
column2: Fair value amount of the specified investment category of assets maintained in separate accounts as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Gross Claim Liability
column2: This element represents the gross claim liability for financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Insured Contractual Payments Outstanding
column2: This element represents the amount of insured contractual payments outstanding on the underlying insured obligations for financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Insured Contractual Payments Outstanding, Interest
column2: This element represents the amount of insured contractual payments outstanding attributable to interest accrued on the underlying insured obligations for financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Insured Contractual Payments Outstanding, Principal
column2: This element represents the amount of insured contractual payments outstanding attributable to the principal of the underlying insured obligations for financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Net Claim Liability
column2: This element represents the net claim liability related to financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Number of Contracts Issued and Outstanding
column2: This element represents the number of issued and outstanding contracts for each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Reductions of Gross Claim Liability
column2: This element represents the aggregate reductions related to financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Reductions of Gross Claim Liability, Gross Potential Recoveries
column2: This element represents the gross potential recoveries against the gross claim liability for financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Reductions of Gross Claim Liability, Net Discount
column2: This element represents the net discount consisting of the difference between the discount related to the claim liability for and potential recoveries thereof related to financial guarantee insurance contracts presented in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Statement of Financial Position, Claim Liability
column2: This element represents the claim liability, reported on or included in the statement of financial position, related to financial guarantee insurance contracts and presented in the schedule of insured financial obligations with credit deterioration in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Statement of Financial Position, Reinsurance Recoverable
column2: This element represents the amount of reinsurance recoverable, reported on or included in the statement of financial position, related to financial guarantee insurance contracts and presented in the schedule of insured financial obligations with credit deterioration in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: Schedule of Insured Financial Obligations with Credit Deterioration, Statement of Financial Position, Unearned Premium Revenue
column2: This element represents the amount of unearned premium revenue, reported on or included in the statement of financial position, related to financial guarantee insurance contracts and presented in the schedule of insured financial obligations with credit deterioration in the context of each surveillance grouping or category used by management to monitor and track potential deterioration in the credit worthiness of the insured party's ability to meet its financial obligations related to the contracts underlying financial guarantee insurance contracts the entity has issued.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate Accumulated Depreciation, Depreciation Expense
column2: Amount of depreciation expense of real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: SEC Schedule III Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Costs Capitalized Subsequent to Acquisition, Buildings and Improvements
column2: Amount of building and improvement costs capitalized since acquisition for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes real estate not held as an investment or interest.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate and Accumulated Depreciation, Costs Capitalized Subsequent to Acquisition, Land
column2: Amount of land costs capitalized since acquisition for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes real estate not held as an investment or interest.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate Investment Property, Net
column2: Amount after accumulated depreciation of real estate held for investment for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate, Write-down or Reserve, Amount
column2: Amount of write-down or reserve recognized in the income statement on real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Amount Offset Against Collateral
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, of securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral offset against an obligation to return collateral under a master netting arrangement. Includes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Collateral, Obligation to Return Cash
column2: Amount of obligation to return cash collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities borrowed.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Collateral, Obligation to Return Securities
column2: Amount of obligation to return securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities borrowed.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Fair Value of Collateral
column2: Fair value of the securities received as collateral against securities borrowed.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Gross
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral. Includes assets elected not to be offset. Excludes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral. Includes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Liability
column2: Amount of liability associated with securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Amount of securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral, elected not to be offset, deducted from securities borrowed.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount of securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral, not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Amount of securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from securities borrowed.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of securities borrowed from entities in exchange for collateral, offset against an obligation to return collateral under a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities for Reverse Repurchase Agreements
column2: The carrying value of securities purchased to be resold in reverse repurchase transactions as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Securities Loaned, Amount Offset Against Collateral
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral offset against a right to receive collateral. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.

column1: Securities Loaned, Asset
column2: Amount of asset associated with securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral.

column1: Securities Loaned, Collateral, Right to Reclaim Cash
column2: Amount of right to receive cash collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities loaned.

column1: Securities Loaned, Collateral, Right to Reclaim Securities
column2: Amount of right to receive securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities loaned.

column1: Securities Loaned, Fair Value of Collateral
column2: Fair value of the securities pledged as collateral against securities loaned.

column1: Securities Loaned, Gross
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral. Includes liabilities elected not to be offset. Excludes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Loaned, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Securities Loaned, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Amount of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral, elected not to be offset, deducted from securities loaned.

column1: Securities Loaned, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral, not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Loaned, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Amount of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from securities loaned.

column1: Securities Loaned, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral, offset against a right to receive collateral.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell
column2: Amount, after the effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes purchases of participations in pools of securities that are subject to a resale agreement, assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Collateral, Obligation to Return Cash
column2: Amount of obligation to return cash collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities purchased under agreement to resell.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Collateral, Obligation to Return Securities
column2: Amount of obligation to return securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities purchased under agreement to resell.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Fair Value of Collateral
column2: Fair value of securities received as collateral against securities purchased under agreement to resell.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Gross
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes assets elected not to be offset. Excludes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Liability
column2: Amount of liability associated with funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Amount of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, elected not to be offset, deducted from securities purchased under agreements to resell.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Amount of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from securities purchased under agreements to resell.

column1: Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, offset against an obligation to return collateral.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Asset
column2: Amount of asset associated with funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Collateral, Right to Reclaim Cash
column2: Amount of right to receive cash collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities sold under agreement to repurchase.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Collateral, Right to Reclaim Securities
column2: Amount of right to receive securities collateral under master netting arrangements that have not been offset against securities sold under agreement to repurchase.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Fair Value of Collateral
column2: Fair value of securities pledged as collateral against securities sold under agreement to repurchase.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Gross
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes liabilities elected not to be offset. Excludes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement Deduction
column2: Amount of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, not subject to a master netting arrangement, deducted from securities sold under agreements to repurchase.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Offset Against Collateral, Net of Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement, Policy Election
column2: Amount, after effects of master netting arrangements, deduction of liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and elected not to be offset, of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, offset against a right to receive collateral.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Not Offset, Policy Election Deduction
column2: Amount of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price, elected not to be offset, deducted from securities sold under agreements to repurchase.

column1: Assets that Continue to be Recognized, Securitized or Asset-backed Financing Arrangement Assets and any Other Financial Assets Managed Together, Delinquent Amount at End of Period
column2: This is the amount of the financial instruments that are considered delinquent (past due) at the end of the period.

column1: Continuing Involvement with Continued to be Recognized Transferred Financial Assets, Amount Outstanding
column2: Amount of transferred financial assets in which the transferor has continuing involvement with the assets underlying the transaction that continue to be recognized in the statement of financial position. Includes, but is not limited to, servicing, recourse, and restrictions on transferor's interests in transferred financial assets.

column1: Security Owned and Pledged as Collateral, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of financial instrument held by the entity for its own account (proprietary securities) for trading or investment purposes that are carried at fair value and pledged to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions.

column1: Security Owned and Sold, Not yet Purchased Fair Value, Security Owned
column2: Fair value of financial instruments held by a broker-dealer for their own account (proprietary securities) for trading or investment purposes determined by management based upon quoted prices of a financial instrument with similar characteristics or on a valuation technique or model.

column1: Security Owned and Sold, Not yet Purchased Fair Value, Security Sold, Not yet Purchased
column2: Fair value of financial instruments sold short by a broker-dealer for their own account (proprietary securities) for trading or investment purposes determined by management based upon quoted prices of a financial instrument with similar characteristics or on a valuation technique or model.

column1: Security Owned Not Readily Marketable, Fair Value
column2: Value of the not readily marketable security or category which has been determined by management based upon fair value methods, including pricing of similar securities and valuation techniques and is included in the schedule of financial condition or the balance sheet.

column1: Security Owned Not Readily Marketable, Quoted Price
column2: Amount of not readily marketable security or investment measured by quoted price.

column1: Selling, General and Administrative Expense
column2: The aggregate total costs related to selling a firm's product and services, as well as all other general and administrative expenses. Direct selling expenses (for example, credit, warranty, and advertising) are expenses that can be directly linked to the sale of specific products. Indirect selling expenses are expenses that cannot be directly linked to the sale of specific products, for example telephone expenses, Internet, and postal charges. General and administrative expenses include salaries of non-sales personnel, rent, utilities, communication, etc.

column1: Sensitivity Analysis of Fair Value, Transferor's Interests in Transferred Financial Assets, Impact of Other than 10 or 20 Percent Adverse Change in Discount Rate, Percent
column2: A specified percentage variance in the discount rate assumption in the determination of fair value of transferor's interests in transferred financial assets (including any servicing assets or servicing liabilities) as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Sensitivity Analysis of Fair Value, Transferor's Interests in Transferred Financial Assets, Impact of Other than 10 or 20 Percent Adverse Change in Other Assumption, Percent
column2: A specified percentage variance in a specified key assumption in the determination of fair value of transferor's interests in transferred financial assets (including any servicing assets or servicing liabilities).

column1: Sensitivity Analysis of Fair Value, Transferor's Interests in Transferred Financial Assets, Impact of Other than 10 or 20 Percent Adverse Change in Prepayment Speed, Percent
column2: A specified percentage variance in the prepayment speed assumption in the determination of fair value of transferor's interests in transferred financial assets (including any servicing assets or servicing liabilities).

column1: Sensitivity Analysis of Fair Value, Transferor's Interests in Transferred Financial Assets, Impact Other than 10 or 20 Percent Adverse Change in Expected Credit Loss, Percent
column2: A specified percentage variance in the expected credit losses assumption, including static pool losses, in the determination of fair value of transferor's interests in transferred financial assets (including any servicing assets or servicing liabilities).

column1: Servicing Asset
column2: Aggregate amount of servicing assets that are subsequently measured at fair value and servicing assets that are subsequently measured using the amortization method.

column1: Servicing Asset at Amortized Cost, Other than Temporary Impairments
column2: Amount of other-than-temporary impairment (OTTI) applied to contract to service financial assets under which the benefits of servicing are expected to more than adequately compensate the servicer.

column1: Servicing Asset at Amortized Cost, Additions
column2: Amount of additions from purchases, assumption or transfer to contract to service financial assets under which the benefits of servicing are expected to more than adequately compensate the servicer.

column1: Servicing Asset at Amortized Cost, Amortization
column2: Amount of amortization of contract to service financial assets under which the benefits of servicing are expected to more than adequately compensate the servicer.

column1: Servicing Asset at Amortized Cost, Disposals
column2: Amount conveyed to unrelated parties of contract to contract to service financial assets under which the benefits of servicing are expected to more than adequately compensate the servicer.

column1: Servicing Asset at Amortized Cost, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of contract to service financial assets under which the benefits of servicing are expected to more than adequately compensate the servicer.

column1: Servicing Asset at Amortized Cost, Valuation Allowance
column2: Amount of valuation allowance applied to contract to service financial assets under which the benefits of servicing are expected to more than adequately compensate the servicer.

column1: Servicing Asset at Fair Value, Additions
column2: The value of new servicing assets, subsequently measured at fair value, acquired or created during the current period through purchases or from transfers of financial assets.

column1: Servicing Asset at Fair Value, Disposals
column2: Decrease in servicing assets subsequently measured at fair value resulting from conveyance of servicing rights to unrelated parties.

column1: Servicing Liability
column2: Aggregate amount of servicing liabilities that are subsequently measured at fair value and servicing liabilities that are subsequently measured using the amortization method.

column1: Servicing Liability at Amortized Cost, Amortization
column2: Amount of amortization of contract to service financial assets under which estimated future revenue from contractually specified servicing fees, late charges, and other ancillary revenues are not expected to adequately compensate the servicer for performing the servicing.
