column1: Servicing Liability at Amortized Cost, Additions
column2: Amount of additions from purchases, assumption or transfer to contract to service financial assets under which estimated future revenues from contractually specified servicing fees, late charges, and other ancillary revenue are not expected to adequately compensate the servicer for performing the servicing.

column1: Servicing Liability at Amortized Cost, Balance
column2: Amortized amount of contract to service financial assets under which estimated future revenues from contractually specified servicing fees, late charges, and other ancillary revenue are not expected to adequately compensate the servicer for performing the servicing.

column1: Servicing Liability at Amortized Cost, Disposals
column2: Amount conveyed to unrelated parties of contract to service financial assets under which estimated future revenue from contractually specified servicing fees, late charges, and other ancillary revenues are not expected to adequately compensate the servicer for performing the servicing.

column1: Servicing Liability at Amortized Cost, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of the servicing liability that has been amortized.

column1: Servicing Liability at Fair Value, Additions
column2: The value of new servicing liabilities, that are subsequently measured at fair value, acquired or created during the current period through assumptions of servicing obligations and servicing obligations that result from transfers of financial assets.

column1: Servicing Liability at Fair Value, Disposals
column2: Decreases in fair value of servicing liabilities resulting from conveyance of servicing rights to unrelated parties.

column1: Settlement of Asset Retirement Obligations Through Noncash Payments, Amount
column2: Amount of asset retirement obligations settled through noncash transactions. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement from service of a tangible long-lived asset.

column1: Severance Costs
column2: Amount of expenses for special or contractual termination benefits provided to current employees involuntarily terminated under a benefit arrangement associated exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to one-time termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award Accelerated Compensation Cost
column2: Additional share-based compensation cost recognized as a result of an occurrence of an event that accelerates its recognition.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Accelerated Vesting, Number
column2: Number of shares for which recognition of compensation cost was accelerated.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Award Vesting Rights, Percentage
column2: Percentage of vesting of share-based compensation awards.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Compensation Cost
column2: Amount of capitalized and expensed compensation cost from equity-based compensation arrangements.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Aggregate Intrinsic Value, Nonvested
column2: Intrinsic value of equity-based compensation awards not vested. Excludes stock and unit options.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Aggregate Intrinsic Value, Outstanding
column2: Intrinsic value of equity-based compensation awards outstanding. Excludes stock and unit options.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Aggregate Intrinsic Value, Vested
column2: Intrinsic value of equity-based compensation awards vested. Excludes stock and unit options.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Forfeited in Period
column2: The number of equity-based payment instruments, excluding stock (or unit) options, that were forfeited during the reporting period.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Forfeitures, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
column2: Weighted average fair value as of the grant date of equity-based award plans other than stock (unit) option plans that were not exercised or put into effect as a result of the occurrence of a terminating event.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Share-based Liabilities Paid
column2: Amount of cash paid related to share-based compensation liabilities.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Vested in Period
column2: The number of equity-based payment instruments, excluding stock (or unit) options, that vested during the reporting period.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Discount for Postvesting Restrictions
column2: Restrictions on equity-based instruments during the vesting period, such as the inability to transfer unvested awards, are not taken into account in estimating the fair value of the award. However, restrictions that remain in effect after an award is vested, such as the inability to transfer or hedge vested options or a prohibition on the sale of outstanding vested shares (or other type of equity) for a period of time, affect the estimate of an award's fair value.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Exercise Price
column2: Agreed-upon price for the exchange of the underlying asset relating to the share-based payment award.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Expected Volatility Rate
column2: The estimated measure of the percentage by which a share price is expected to fluctuate during a period. Volatility also may be defined as a probability-weighted measure of the dispersion of returns about the mean. The volatility of a share price is the standard deviation of the continuously compounded rates of return on the share over a specified period. That is the same as the standard deviation of the differences in the natural logarithms of the stock prices plus dividends, if any, over the period.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Weighted Average Volatility Rate
column2: Weighted average expected volatility rate of share-based compensation awards.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Exercised
column2: Number of non-option equity instruments exercised by participants.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Expirations
column2: Number of shares under non-option equity instrument agreements for which rights to exercise lapsed.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Forfeitures
column2: Number of shares under non-option equity instrument agreements that were cancelled as a result of occurrence of a terminating event.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Forfeitures and Expirations
column2: Number of shares under non-option equity instrument agreements that were either cancelled or expired.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Granted
column2: Net number of non-option equity instruments granted to participants.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Outstanding, Number
column2: Number of equity instruments other than options outstanding, including both vested and non-vested instruments.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Number of Additional Shares Authorized
column2: Number of additional shares authorized for issuance under an established share-based compensation plan.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Expirations in Period
column2: Number of options or other stock instruments for which the right to exercise has lapsed under the terms of the plan agreements.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures and Expirations in Period
column2: For presentations that combine terminations, the number of shares under options that were cancelled during the reporting period as a result of occurrence of a terminating event specified in contractual agreements pertaining to the stock option plan or that expired.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures and Expirations in Period, Weighted Average Intrinsic Value
column2: The combined weighted average of the accumulated differences between the fair values on underlying shares and exercises prices to acquire such shares as of the grant date on options that were either forfeited or lapsed.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures in Period
column2: The number of shares under options that were cancelled during the reporting period as a result of occurrence of a terminating event specified in contractual agreements pertaining to the stock option plan.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested, Number of Shares
column2: Number of non-vested options outstanding.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested Options Forfeited, Number of Shares
column2: Number of non-vested options forfeited.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested Options Forfeited, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
column2: Weighted average grant-date fair value of non-vested options forfeited.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
column2: Weighted average grant-date fair value of non-vested options outstanding.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested in Period, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of options vested. Excludes equity instruments other than options, for example, but not limited to, share units, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested, Number of Shares
column2: Number of options vested.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
column2: Weighted average grant-date fair value of options vested.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Percentage of Outstanding Stock Maximum
column2: Maximum number of shares that may be issued in accordance with the plan as a proportion of outstanding capital stock.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Purchase Price of Common Stock, Percent
column2: Purchase price of common stock expressed as a percentage of its fair value.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangements by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Exercises in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average price at which option holders acquired shares when converting their stock options into shares.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangements by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Expirations in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average price at which grantees could have acquired the underlying shares with respect to stock options of the plan that expired.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangements by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average price at which grantees could have acquired the underlying shares with respect to stock options that were terminated.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangements by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Grants in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average per share amount at which grantees can acquire shares of common stock by exercise of options.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangements by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Other Share Increase (Decrease) in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average price at which grantees could acquire or could have acquired the underlying shares with respect to any other type of change in shares reserved for issuance.

column1: Share Price
column2: Price of a single share of a number of saleable stocks of a company.

column1: Shares Issued, Price Per Share
column2: Per share or per unit amount of equity securities issued.

column1: Short-term Debt, Interest Rate Increase
column2: Percentage increase in the stated interest rate on a short-term debt instrument.

column1: Short-term Debt, Percentage Bearing Fixed Interest Rate
column2: The portion of the carrying amount of short-term borrowings outstanding as of the balance sheet date which accrues interest at a set, unchanging rate.

column1: Short-term Debt, Percentage Bearing Variable Interest Rate
column2: The portion of the carrying amount of short-term borrowings outstanding as of the balance sheet date, which accrues interest at a rate subject to change from time to time.

column1: Supply Commitment, Remaining Minimum Amount Committed
column2: The floor amount as of the balance sheet date that the entity must expend to satisfy the terms of disclosed arrangements (excluding long-term commitments) in which the entity must commit resources to supply goods or services to one or more customers.

column1: Statutory Accounting Practices, Dividends Paid with Approval of Regulatory Agency
column2: Amount of dividends paid subject to regulatory approval.

column1: Statutory Accounting Practices, Statutory Amount Available for Dividend Payments without Regulatory Approval
column2: Amount of dividends that can be declared or paid without approval of regulatory agency.

column1: Statutory Accounting Practices, Statutory Amount Available for Dividend Payments with Regulatory Approval
column2: Amount of dividends that can be declared or paid with approval of regulatory agency.

column1: Stockholders' Equity Note, Stock Split, Conversion Ratio
column2: Ratio applied to the conversion of stock split, for example but not limited to, one share converted to two or two shares converted to one.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Shares, Issued for Services
column2: Number of shares issued in lieu of cash for services contributed to the entity. Number of shares includes, but is not limited to, shares issued for services contributed by vendors and founders.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Value, Issued for Services
column2: Value of stock issued in lieu of cash for services contributed to the entity. Value of the stock issued includes, but is not limited to, services contributed by vendors and founders.

column1: Stock or Units Available for Distributions
column2: Number of stock or units eligible for distribution to members or limited partners of the limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

column1: Stock Repurchase Program, Authorized Amount
column2: Amount of stock repurchase plan authorized.

column1: Stock Repurchase Program, Remaining Authorized Repurchase Amount
column2: Amount remaining of a stock repurchase plan authorized.

column1: Subadvisory Fees for Mutual Funds
column2: Subadvisory fees that the funds adviser pays for out of the management fee, which it receives from the fund.

column1: Subordinated Borrowing, Interest Rate
column2: Stated interest rate of the subordinated debt.

column1: Subordinated Liabilities, Additions
column2: New liabilities assumed during the reporting period that are subordinated to claims of general creditors.

column1: Subordinated Liabilities, Extinguished
column2: Liabilities that are subordinated to claims of general creditors and were paid or extinguished during the reporting period.

column1: Subsidiary or Equity Method Investee, Noncontrolling Interest in Income of Subsidiary
column2: The dividends from redeemable preferred stock of a subsidiary that are accounted for as a noncontrolling interest in income of a subsidiary in a parent's consolidated financial statements.

column1: Summary of Investments, Other than Investments in Related Parties, Carrying Amount
column2: This element represents the carrying (reported) amount of the entity's investments as of the balance sheet date. This amount may represent the individual investment's or group of similar investments' original cost, fair value, or such other amount at which the investment is shown in the entity's balance sheet.

column1: Summary of Investments, Other than Investments in Related Parties, Cost
column2: This item represents the original cost of the entity's investments including investments in equity securities and, as to fixed maturities, original cost reduced by repayments and adjusted for amortization of premiums or accrual of discounts.

column1: Summary of Investments, Other than Investments in Related Parties, Fair Value
column2: This item represents the reported amount of the entity's investments measured at fair value. Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an investment in an orderly transaction between market participants at the balance sheet [measurement] date.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Amortization of Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs
column2: Amount of amortization expense on deferred policy acquisition cost.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs
column2: Amount of deferred policy acquisition cost related to property-casualty insurance policy written.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Discount Deducted from Reserves
column2: The amount of discount that may be deducted from the reserve for unpaid claims and claims adjustment expense.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Earned Premiums
column2: Amount of property-casualty insurance premium revenue earned on insurance policies.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Interest Rate at which Discount Computed
column2: The rate at which the discount was computed for each business segment reported.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Net Investment Income
column2: Amount of net investment income earned by property-casualty insurance underwriter.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Paid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense
column2: Payments of claims and claims adjustment expenses during the period of a property-casualty insurance entity.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Premiums Written
column2: Amount of actual premium written by property-casualty insurance underwriter.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Reserves for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense
column2: The amount of reserve, policy claim payable and loss expense incurred by property-casualty insurance underwriter.

column1: Supplemental Information for Property, Casualty Insurance Underwriters, Unearned Premiums
column2: Amount of property-casualty insurance premium revenue not yet earned on insurance policies.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Amortization of Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs
column2: Amount of amortization of deferred policy acquisition costs recognized.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Benefits, Claims, Losses and Settlement Expense
column2: Amount of insurance benefits, claims, losses and settlement expenses incurred.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs
column2: Net amount of deferred policy acquisition costs capitalized on contracts remaining in force on the balance sheet date.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Liability for Future Policy Benefits, Losses, Claims and Loss Expense Reserves
column2: Amount of reserves for future policy claims payable and loss expenses to be incurred.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Net Investment Income
column2: Amount of net investment income earned.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Other Operating Expense
column2: Amount of other operating expense incurred.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Other Policy Claims and Benefits Payable
column2: Amount of claims and benefits payable not included within other categories.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Premium Revenue
column2: Amount of premium revenue earned.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Premiums Written
column2: Amount of actual written premiums, including, as applicable, premiums from reinsurance assumed and net of premiums on reinsurance ceded.

column1: Supplementary Insurance Information, Unearned Premiums
column2: Amount of premiums not yet earned.

column1: Supplies and Postage Expense
column2: The aggregate amount of expenses directly related to the supplies and postage.

column1: Supplies Expense
column2: Amount of expense associated with supplies that were used during the current accounting period.

column1: Tangible Capital
column2: Tangible capital as defined in the regulations (generally includes outstanding stock plus retained earnings) for banking institutions subject to Office of Thrift Supervision (OTS) capital requirements.

column1: Tangible Capital Required for Capital Adequacy
column2: The minimum amount of tangible capital required under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tangible Capital Required for Capital Adequacy to Tangible Assets
column2: The minimum amount of Tangible Capital divided by tangible assets (Tangible Capital Ratio) as defined in the regulations.

column1: Tangible Capital to Tangible Assets
column2: Tangible Capital divided by Tangible assets as defined in the regulations.

column1: Tax Basis of Investments, Cost for Income Tax Purposes
column2: The aggregate cost of investments for Federal income tax purposes.

column1: Tax Basis of Investments, Gross, Unrealized Appreciation
column2: Aggregate gross unrealized appreciation for all Investments in which there is an excess of value over tax cost.

column1: Tax Basis of Investments, Gross, Unrealized Depreciation
column2: The aggregate gross unrealized depreciation for all Investments in which there is an excess of tax cost over value.

column1: Taxes and Licenses
column2: Amount of tax expense, excluding income, excise, production and property taxes, and licenses and fees not related to production.

column1: Taxes, Miscellaneous
column2: All taxes not related to income of the entity or excise or sales taxes levied on the revenue of the entity that are not reported elsewhere. These taxes could include production, real estate, personal property, and pump tax.

column1: Taxes, Other
column2: Taxes, excluding payroll, income and excise taxes, if not included elsewhere, that could include production, real and personal property, and other selling and distribution-related taxes.

column1: Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Attributable to Parent
column2: Carrying amount, attributable to parent, of an entity's issued and outstanding stock which is not included within permanent equity. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. Includes stock with a put option held by an ESOP and stock redeemable by a holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interests
column2: Carrying amount, attributable to parent and noncontrolling interests, of an entity's issued and outstanding stock which is not included within permanent equity. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. Includes stock with a put option held by an ESOP and stock redeemable by a holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Threshold Percentage of Value Decline in Equity Securities to be considered Other than Temporary Impairment
column2: Threshold percentage by which investments in equity securities have declined in value to be considered other than temporary impairment (OTTI).

column1: Tier One Leverage Capital
column2: Tier 1 Leverage Capital as defined in the regulations. Also called Core Capital.

column1: Tier One Leverage Capital Required for Capital Adequacy
column2: The minimum amount of Tier 1 Leverage Capital required for capital adequacy purposes under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tier One Leverage Capital Required for Capital Adequacy to Average Assets
column2: The minimum amount of Tier 1 Leverage Capital for capital adequacy purposes divided by average assets as defined in the regulations.

column1: Tier One Leverage Capital Required to be Well Capitalized
column2: The amount of Tier 1 Leverage Capital required to be categorized as well capitalized under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tier One Leverage Capital Required to be Well Capitalized to Average Assets
column2: The amount of Tier 1 Leverage Capital required to be categorized as well capitalized divided by average assets as defined in the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tier One Leverage Capital to Average Assets
column2: Tier 1 Leverage Capital divided by average assets as defined in the regulations.

column1: Tier One Risk Based Capital
column2: Tier 1 Risk Based Capital as defined in the regulations.

column1: Tier One Risk Based Capital Required for Capital Adequacy
column2: The minimum amount of Tier 1 Risk Based Capital required for capital adequacy purposes under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tier One Risk Based Capital Required for Capital Adequacy to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: The minimum Tier One Capital Ratio (Tier one capital divided by risk-weighted assets) required for capital adequacy purposes under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tier One Risk Based Capital Required to be Well Capitalized
column2: The amount of Tier 1 Risk Based Capital required to be categorized as well capitalized under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tier One Risk Based Capital Required to be Well Capitalized to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: The Tier 1 capital ratio (Tier 1 capital divided by risk weighted assets) required to be categorized as "well capitalized" under the regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Tier One Risk Based Capital to Risk Weighted Assets
column2: Tier 1 capital divided by risk weighted assets as defined by regulations.

column1: Tier Two Risk Based Capital
column2: Tier 2 risk-based capital as defined in the regulations.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, after Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing after the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Estimated Cost to Complete Improvements and Promised Amenities
column2: Estimated cost to complete improvements and promised amenities.

column1: Trade Receivables Held-for-sale, Reconciliation to Cash Flow, Additions to Held-for-sale
column2: Reconcile the changes in trade receivables held for sale balances to the amounts presented in the consolidated statement of cash flows. Enter the additions to trade accounts that will be sold to other entities for the period.

column1: Trade Receivables Held-for-sale, Reconciliation to Cash Flow, Deductions from Held-for-sale
column2: Reconcile the changes in trade receivables that will be sold to other entities balances to the amounts presented in the consolidated statement of cash flows. Enter the deductions to trade accounts that will be sold to other entities for the period.

column1: Trading Securities, Debt, Amortized Cost
column2: Amortized cost of investments in debt securities classified as trading.

column1: Trading Securities, Equity, Cost
column2: Cost of investments in equity securities and other forms of securities that provide ownership interests classified as trading.

column1: Transfer from Investments
column2: Value of investments transferred from the entity's investments in noncash transactions.

column1: Transfer of Loans Held-for-sale to Portfolio Loans
column2: Value of loans held-for-sale transferred to loans held in the entity's portfolio in noncash transactions.

column1: Real Estate Owned, Transfer from Real Estate Owned
column2: Value transferred out of real estate owned (REO) in noncash transactions.

column1: Transfer of Portfolio Loans and Leases to Held-for-sale
column2: Value of loans and leases held in the entity's portfolio transferred to loans and leases held-for-sale in noncash transactions.

column1: Transfers Accounted for as Secured Borrowings, Assets, Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of financial assets accounted for as secured borrowings recognized in the transferor's statement of financial position at the end of each period presented.

column1: Transfers Accounted for as Secured Borrowings, Associated Liabilities, Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of liabilities associated with financial assets accounted for as secured borrowings recognized in the transferor's statement of financial position at the end of each period presented.

column1: Transfer to Investments
column2: Value of investments transferred to the entity's investments in noncash transactions.

column1: Real Estate Owned, Transfer to Real Estate Owned
column2: Value transferred from mortgage loans to real estate owned (REO) in noncash transactions.

column1: Two Percent of Debit Items
column2: This element represents the amount of net capital of a broker or dealer that has elected not to be subject to the Aggregate Indebtedness Standard (as defined). The amount of net capital represented by this element is the greater of $250,000 or two percent of aggregate debit items computed in accordance with the Formula for Determination of Reserve Requirements for Brokers and Dealers (as defined).

column1: Unbilled Receivables, Not Billable, Amount Expected to be Collected after Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of receivables under long-term contracts that have not been billed and were not billable that are expected to be collected after the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unbilled Receivables, Not Billable, Amount Expected to be Collected in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of receivables under long-term contracts that have not been billed and were not billable that are expected to be collected in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unbilled Receivables, Not Billable, Amount Expected to be Collected in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of receivables under long-term contracts that have not been billed and were not billable that are expected to be collected in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Underlying, Derivative
column2: Specified interest rate, security price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates for a derivative contract but not the derivative contract itself.

column1: Underlying, Derivative Asset
column2: Specified interest rate, security price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates for a derivative asset contract but not the derivative contract itself.

column1: Underlying, Derivative Energy Measure
column2: Specified interest rate, security price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates for a derivative contract measured in energy volume but not the derivative contract itself.

column1: Underlying, Derivative Flow Rate
column2: Specified interest rate, security price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates for a derivative contract measured in flow rate but not the derivative contract itself.

column1: Underlying, Derivative Liability
column2: Specified interest rate, security price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates for a derivative liability contract but not the derivative contract itself.

column1: Underlying, Derivative Mass
column2: Specified interest rate, security price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates for a derivative contract measured in mass but not the derivative contract itself.

column1: Underlying, Derivative Volume
column2: Specified interest rate, security price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates for a derivative contract measured in volume but not the derivative contract itself.

column1: Underwriting Expense Ratio
column2: Ratio of non-life acquisition expenses and certain non-life general and administrative expenses, to non-life net premiums earned.

column1: Undistributed Earnings of Domestic Subsidiaries
column2: Amount of undistributed earnings of domestic subsidiaries or domestic joint ventures intended to be permanent.

column1: Undistributed Earnings of Foreign Subsidiaries
column2: Amount of undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries intended to be permanently reinvested outside the country of domicile.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Decrease Resulting from Acquisition
column2: Amount of decrease in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from acquisitions.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Decrease Resulting from Foreign Currency Translation
column2: Amount of decrease in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from foreign currency translation.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Increase Resulting from Acquisition
column2: Amount of increase in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from acquisitions.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Increase Resulting from Foreign Currency Translation
column2: Amount of increase in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from foreign currency translation.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unsolicited Tender Offer Costs
column2: Costs incurred in connection with an unsolicited tender offer (one where the Entity being sought has not requested the offer). These would include costs relating to evaluation and dissemination of information regarding an unsolicited tender offer. A tender offer is a broad solicitation by an Entity or a third party to purchase a substantial percentage of another entity's shares or units for a limited period of time. The offer is at a fixed price, usually at a premium over the current market price, and is contingent on shareholders' tendering a fixed number of their shares or units.

column1: Unused Commitments to Extend Credit
column2: Unused amount of commitments to extend credit to customers.

column1: Unusual or Infrequent Item, Gain, Gross
column2: Amount of gain recognized in the income statement for an event or transaction, that is unusual in nature or occurs infrequently, but not both.

column1: Unusual or Infrequent Item, Loss, Gross
column2: Amount of loss recognized in the income statement for an event or transaction, that is unusual in nature or occurs infrequently, but not both.

column1: Valuation Allowance for Impairment of Recognized Servicing Assets, Aggregate Write-Downs
column2: The charge against the valuation allowance related to a servicing asset that is subsequently measured using the amortization method.

column1: Valuation Allowance for Impairment of Recognized Servicing Assets, Balance
column2: Reflects the estimated amount of impairment as of the balance sheet date of recognized servicing assets that are being amortized in proportion to and over the period of estimated net servicing income or loss.

column1: Valuation Allowance for Impairment of Recognized Servicing Assets, Sales and Disposals
column2: Reduction in valuation allowance of servicing assets based on sales and disposals.

column1: Valuation Allowances and Reserves, Balance
column2: Total of allowances and reserves, the valuation and qualifying accounts that are either netted against the cost of an asset (in order to value it at its carrying value) or that reflect a liability established to represent expected future costs.

column1: Valuation Allowances and Reserves, Recoveries
column2: Total of recoveries of amounts due the Entity that had previously been written off as uncollectible using allowances (the valuation accounts that are netted against the cost of an asset to value it at its carrying value) and total of reestablishments of reserves (liabilities established to represent expected future costs) that had previously been utilized.

column1: Valuation Allowances and Reserves, Reserves of Businesses Acquired
column2: Total of allowances and reserves, the valuation and qualifying accounts that are either netted against the cost of an asset (in order to value it at its carrying value) or that reflect a liability established to represent expected future costs, acquired in a business combination.

column1: Warrants Not Settleable in Cash, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of warrants not settleable in cash classified as equity.

column1: Weighted Average Interest Rate on Overdrawn Demand Deposit
column2: Weighted average interest rate on overdrawn demand deposit.

column1: Weighted Average Limited Partnership Units Outstanding, Diluted
column2: Weighted average number of limited partnership units outstanding determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that limited partnership units have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Used in the calculation of diluted net income or loss per limited partnership unit.

column1: Weighted Average Number of Shares Outstanding, Basic and Diluted
column2: Average number of shares or units issued and outstanding that are used in calculating basic and diluted earnings per share (EPS).

column1: Weighted Average Number Diluted Limited Partnership Units Outstanding Adjustment
column2: The sum of dilutive potential limited partnership units used in the calculation of the diluted per-unit computation.

column1: Wells in Process of Drilling
column2: The number of wells in the process of being drilled in each geographic area as of the date listed.

column1: Wells Temporarily Suspended
column2: The number of wells temporarily suspended in each geographic area as of the date listed.

column1: Withdrawal from Contract Holders Funds
column2: The cash outflow for a segregated fund account during the period.

column1: Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Reclassifications from Property, Plant and Equipment
column2: Amount of decrease in accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization as a result of reclassifications from property, plant and equipment.

column1: Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Sale or Disposal of Property, Plant and Equipment
column2: Amount of decrease in accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization as a result of sale or disposal of property, plant and equipment.

column1: Affordable Housing Project Investment, Write-down, Amount
column2: Amount of write-down from impairment of an investment in a qualified affordable housing project.

column1: Affordable Housing Tax Credits and Other Tax Benefits, Amount
column2: Amount of affordable housing tax credits and other tax benefits recognized.

column1: Amortization Method Qualified Affordable Housing Project Investments
column2: Amount of investment in qualified affordable housing projects.

column1: Amortization Method Qualified Affordable Housing Project Investments, Amortization
column2: Amount of amortization expense of investment in qualified affordable housing projects.

column1: Assets Held-for-sale, Not Part of Disposal Group
column2: Amount of assets held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group.

column1: Assets Held-for-sale, Not Part of Disposal Group, Current
column2: Amount of assets held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group, expected to be sold within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Assets Held-for-sale, Not Part of Disposal Group, Current, Other
column2: Amount of other assets held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group, expected to be sold within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Assets Held-for-sale, Not Part of Disposal Group, Other
column2: Amount of other assets held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group.

column1: Average Collected Cash Balances with Commercial Banks, Federal Home Loan Bank
column2: Average amount of collected cash balances with commercial banks the Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks) maintain in return for certain services.

column1: Capital Expenditure, Discontinued Operations
column2: Amount of capital expenditure attributable to discontinued operations.

column1: Cash Pass-through Reserve, Federal Home Loan Bank
column2: Amount of pass-through reserves deposited with Federal Reserve Banks from member institutions of Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks).

column1: Decrease in Unrecognized Tax Benefits is Reasonably Possible
column2: Amount of decrease reasonably possible in the next twelve months for the unrecognized tax benefit.

column1: #NAME?
column2: #NAME?

column1: #NAME?
column2: #NAME?

column1: Discontinued Operation, Equity Method Investment Retained after Disposal, Ownership Interest after Disposal
column2: Percent, after disposal, of ownership interest of a discontinued operation in which an equity method investment is retained.

column1: Discontinued Operation, Equity Method Investment Retained after Disposal, Ownership Interest Prior to Disposal
column2: Percent, prior to disposal, of ownership interest of a discontinued operation in which an equity method investment is retained.

column1: Discontinued Operation, Intra-Entity Amounts, Discontinued Operation after Disposal, Expense
column2: Amount of expense in continuing operations related to continuing involvement in a discontinued operation after the disposal that before the disposal was eliminated as intra-entity transactions.

column1: Discontinued Operation, Intra-Entity Amounts, Discontinued Operation after Disposal, Revenue
column2: Amount of revenue in continuing operations related to continuing involvement in a discontinued operation after disposal that before the disposal was eliminated as intra-entity transactions.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Capital Leased Assets
column2: Amount classified as capital leased assets attributable to disposal group.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Capital Leased Assets, Current
column2: Amount classified as capital leased assets attributable to disposal group, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Capital Leased Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as capital leased assets attributable to disposal group, expected to be disposed of after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Inventory, Current
column2: Amount classified as inventory attributable to disposal group, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Financial Assets Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a financial asset repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same financial asset at a date certain for a specified price. Includes repurchase-to-maturity transactions and liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Next Rolling Twelve Months, Amortized Cost
column2: Amortized cost of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Rolling after Ten Years, Amortized Cost
column2: Amortized cost of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing after the tenth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Rolling Year Six Through Ten, Amortized Cost
column2: Amortized cost of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the sixth through tenth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Rolling Year Two Through Five, Amortized Cost
column2: Amortized cost of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the second through fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Increase in Unrecognized Tax Benefits is Reasonably Possible
column2: Amount of increase reasonably possible in the next twelve months for the unrecognized tax benefit.

column1: Loan Restructuring, Trial Modifications, Amount
column2: Amount of loan receivable in which the terms of the loan agreement have been modified on a trial basis.

column1: Loans Receivable Held-for-sale, Net, Not Part of Disposal Group
column2: Amount, after allowance for bad debt, of loan receivables held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group. Excludes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements and loans classified as debt securities.

column1: Mortgage Loans in Process of Foreclosure, Amount
column2: Recorded investment of consumer mortgage loan receivables secured by residential real estate properties for which formal foreclosure proceedings are in process.

column1: Net Amount at Risk by Product and Guarantee, Guaranteed Minimum Return Rate
column2: Rate of guaranteed minimum return on deposits made to contracts reported in separate accounts maintained by an insurance entity.

column1: Qualified Affordable Housing Project Investments, Commitment
column2: Amount of commitment or contingent commitments to qualified affordable housing project investments.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Common, Redemption Value
column2: Redemption value, as if currently redeemable, of redeemable noncontrolling interest for common shares, units or ownership interests classified as temporary equity and the election has been made to accrete changes in redemption value to the earliest redemption date.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Other, Redemption Value
column2: Redemption value, as if currently redeemable, of redeemable noncontrolling interest for other shares, units or ownership interests classified as temporary equity and the election has been made to accrete changes in redemption value to the earliest redemption date.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Preferred, Redemption Value
column2: Redemption value, as if currently redeemable, of redeemable noncontrolling interest for preferred shares, units or ownership interests classified as temporary equity and the election has been made to accrete changes in redemption value to the earliest redemption date.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Redemption Value
column2: Redemption value, as if currently redeemable, of redeemable noncontrolling interest classified as temporary equity and the election has been made to accrete changes in redemption value to the earliest redemption date.

column1: Secured Borrowings, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of financial assets loaned to entities in exchange for collateral and funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a financial asset repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same financial assets at a date certain for a specified price. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Loaned and Securities Sold under Agreement to Repurchase, Gross Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of securities loaned to entities in exchange for collateral and funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement.

column1: Securities Loaned, Including Not Subject to Master Netting Arrangement and Assets other than Securities Transferred
column2: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of financial assets loaned to entities in exchange for collateral. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and financial assets transferred other than securities that qualify as secured borrowings.

column1: Trade and Loans Receivables Held-for-sale, Net, Not Part of Disposal Group
column2: Amount, after allowance for bad debt, of trade and loan receivables held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group. Excludes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements and loans classified as debt securities.

column1: Trade Receivables Held-for-sale, Net, Not Part of Disposal Group
column2: Amount, after allowance for bad debt, of trade receivables held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group.

column1: Transfer of Financial Assets Accounted for as Sales, Amount Derecognized
column2: Amount of derecognized financial assets from transactions which comprise an initial transfer and an agreement entered into in contemplation of the initial transfer resulting in retention of substantially all of the exposure to the economic return throughout the term of the transaction, at the date of derecognition.

column1: Transfer of Financial Assets Accounted for as Sales, Cash Proceeds Received for Assets Derecognized, Amount
column2: Amount, before counterparty netting, of cash proceeds received in transfers of derecognized financial assets from transactions which comprise an initial transfer and an agreement entered into in contemplation of the initial transfer resulting in retention of substantially all of the exposure to the economic return throughout the term of the transaction.

column1: Transfer of Financial Assets Accounted for as Sales, Fair Value of Derecognized Assets
column2: Fair value of derecognized financial assets from transactions which comprise an initial transfer and an agreement entered into in contemplation of the initial transfer resulting in retention of substantially all of the exposure to the economic return throughout the term of the transaction.

column1: Accretion Expense
column2: Amount recognized for the passage of time, typically for liabilities, that have been discounted to their net present values. Excludes accretion associated with asset retirement obligations.

column1: Allowance for Doubtful Accounts Receivable
column2: For an unclassified balance sheet, a valuation allowance for receivables due a company that are expected to be uncollectible.

column1: Amortization of Deferred Charges
column2: The amount of amortization of deferred charges applied against earnings during the period.

column1: Amortization of Financing Costs
column2: Amount of noncash expense included in interest expense to issue debt and obtain financing associated with the related debt instruments. Alternate captions include noncash interest expense.

column1: Asset Retirement Obligation, Accretion Expense
column2: Amount of accretion expense recognized during the period that is associated with an asset retirement obligation. Accretion expense measures and incorporates changes due to the passage of time into the carrying amount of the liability.

column1: Asset Retirement Obligation, Liabilities Settled
column2: Amount of asset retirement obligations settled, or otherwise disposed of, during the period. This may include asset retirement obligations transferred to third parties associated with the sale of a long-lived asset.

column1: Assets
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

column1: Assets, Current
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

column1: Cash Acquired from Acquisition
column2: The cash inflow associated with the acquisition of business during the period (for example, cash that was held by the acquired business).

column1: Cash and Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value
column2: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

column1: Common Stock, Share Subscribed but Unissued, Subscriptions Receivable
column2: Amount of subscription receivable from investors who have been allocated common stock.

column1: Convertible Notes Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the portion of long-term debt due within one year or the operating cycle if longer identified as Convertible Notes Payable. Convertible Notes Payable is a written promise to pay a note which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another, related security, at the option of the issuer and the holder.

column1: Cost of Goods and Services Sold
column2: The aggregate costs related to goods produced and sold and services rendered by an entity during the reporting period. This excludes costs incurred during the reporting period related to financial services rendered and other revenue generating activities.

column1: Cost of Revenue
column2: The aggregate cost of goods produced and sold and services rendered during the reporting period.

column1: Debt Conversion, Converted Instrument, Amount
column2: The value of the financial instrument(s) that the original debt is being converted into in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs, Additions
column2: Total amount of policy acquisition costs capitalized during the income statement period.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Gross
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and carryforwards.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Net of Valuation Allowance
column2: Amount after allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and carryforwards.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Net of Valuation Allowance, Current
column2: Amount after allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and carryforwards expected to be realized or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Benefit Obligation
column2: 1) For defined benefit pension plans, the benefit obligation is the projected benefit obligation, which is the actuarial present value as of a date of all benefits attributed by the pension benefit formula to employee service rendered prior to that date. 2) For other postretirement defined benefit plans, the benefit obligation is the accumulated postretirement benefit obligation, which is the actuarial present value of benefits attributed to employee service rendered to a particular date.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Interest Cost
column2: The increase in a defined benefit pension plan's projected benefit obligation or a defined benefit postretirement plan's accumulated postretirement benefit obligation due to the passage of time.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Service Cost
column2: The actuarial present value of benefits attributed by the pension benefit formula to services rendered by employees during the period. The portion of the expected postretirement benefit obligation attributed to employee service during the period. The service cost component is a portion of the benefit obligation and is unaffected by the funded status of the plan.

column1: Depreciation
column2: The amount of expense recognized in the current period that reflects the allocation of the cost of tangible assets over the assets' useful lives. Includes production and non-production related depreciation.

column1: Derivative Instruments, Loss Reclassified from Accumulated OCI into Income, Effective Portion
column2: The effective portion of loss reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income into income on derivative instruments designated and qualifying as hedging instruments.

column1: Dividends, Common Stock
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid common stock dividends declared with the form of settlement in cash, stock and payment-in-kind (PIK).

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Gross
column2: Amount before amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Net
column2: Amount after amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

column1: General and Administrative Expense
column2: The aggregate total of expenses of managing and administering the affairs of an entity, including affiliates of the reporting entity, which are not directly or indirectly associated with the manufacture, sale or creation of a product or product line.

column1: Goodwill, Impaired, Accumulated Impairment Loss
column2: Amount of accumulated impairment loss for an asset representing future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

column1: Goodwill, Impairment Loss
column2: Amount of loss from the write-down of an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Deduction, Dividends, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to deduction for dividend.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Nondeductible Expense, Life Insurance, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to nondeductible life insurance expense.

column1: Interest Costs Capitalized
column2: Amount of interest capitalized during the period.

column1: Interest Expense, Debt
column2: Amount of the cost of borrowed funds accounted for as interest expense for debt.

column1: Interest Expense, Other
column2: Interest expense on all other items not previously classified. For example, includes dividends associated with redeemable preferred stock of a subsidiary that is treated as a liability in the parent's consolidated balance sheet.

column1: Interest Paid, Net
column2: The amount of cash paid for interest during the period net of cash paid for interest that is capitalized.

column1: Inventory Valuation Reserves
column2: Amount of valuation reserve for inventory.

column1: Investment Income, Nonoperating
column2: The aggregate amount of income from investments (for example, dividends) not considered a component of the entity's core operations.

column1: Investments in and Advance to Affiliates, Subsidiaries, Associates, and Joint Ventures
column2: Total investments in (A) an entity in which the entity has significant influence, but does not have control, (B) subsidiaries that are not required to be consolidated and are accounted for using the equity and or cost method, and (C) an entity in which the reporting entity shares control of the entity with another party or group. Includes long-term advances receivable from a party that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership.

column1: Liabilities
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.

column1: Liabilities and Equity
column2: Amount of liabilities and equity items, including the portion of equity attributable to noncontrolling interests, if any.

column1: Liabilities, Current
column2: Total obligations incurred as part of normal operations that are expected to be paid during the following twelve months or within one business cycle, if longer.

column1: Long-term Debt
column2: Carrying amount of long-term debt, net of unamortized discount or premium, including current and noncurrent amounts. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

column1: Long-term Debt, Current Maturities
column2: Amount of long-term debt, after unamortized discount or premium, scheduled to be repaid within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Decrease from Distributions to Noncontrolling Interest Holders
column2: Decrease in noncontrolling interest balance from payment of dividends or other distributions by the non-wholly owned subsidiary or partially owned entity, included in the consolidation of the parent entity, to the noncontrolling interest holders.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Decrease from Redemptions or Purchase of Interests
column2: Decrease in noncontrolling interest (for example, but not limited to, redeeming or purchasing the interests of noncontrolling shareholders, issuance of shares (interests) by the non-wholly owned subsidiary to the parent entity for other than cash, and a buyback of shares (interest) by the non-wholly owned subsidiary from the noncontrolling interests).

column1: Operating Loss Carryforwards, Valuation Allowance
column2: The portion of the valuation allowance pertaining to the deferred tax asset representing potential future taxable deductions from net operating loss carryforwards for which it is more likely than not that a tax benefit will not be realized.

column1: Amortization of Other Deferred Charges
column2: Amount of amortization of other deferred costs recognized in the income statement.

column1: Other Cost and Expense, Operating
column2: The total amount of other operating cost and expense items that are associated with the entity's normal revenue producing operation.

column1: Other Noncash Expense
column2: Other expenses or losses included in net income that result in no cash outflows or inflows in the period and are not separately disclosed.

column1: Other Operating Income
column2: The total amount of other operating income, the components of which are not separately disclosed on the income statement, from items that are associated with the entity's normal revenue producing operation.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Common Stock
column2: The cash outflow to reacquire common stock during the period.

column1: Payments for Restructuring
column2: Amount of cash payments made as the result of exit or disposal activities. Excludes payments associated with a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

column1: Payments of Debt Issuance Costs
column2: The cash outflow paid to third parties in connection with debt origination, which will be amortized over the remaining maturity period of the associated long-term debt.

column1: Payments of Distributions to Affiliates
column2: The distributions of earnings to an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership.

column1: Payments of Dividends
column2: Cash outflow in the form of capital distributions and dividends to common shareholders, preferred shareholders and noncontrolling interests.

column1: Payments of Financing Costs
column2: The cash outflow for loan and debt issuance costs.

column1: Payments of Stock Issuance Costs
column2: The cash outflow for cost incurred directly with the issuance of an equity security.

column1: Payments to Acquire Intangible Assets
column2: The cash outflow to acquire asset without physical form usually arising from contractual or other legal rights, excluding goodwill.

column1: Payments to Acquire Interest in Subsidiaries and Affiliates
column2: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of or advances to an entity that is related to it but not strictly controlled (for example, an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, and joint venture or equity method investment) or the acquisition of an additional interest in a subsidiary (controlled entity).

column1: Payments to Acquire Productive Assets
column2: The cash outflow for purchases of and capital improvements on property, plant and equipment (capital expenditures), software, and other intangible assets.

column1: Pension and Other Postretirement Defined Benefit Plans, Current Liabilities
column2: For a classified balance sheet, the amount recognized in balance sheet as a current liability associated with an underfunded defined benefit plan.

column1: Pension and Other Postretirement Defined Benefit Plans, Liabilities
column2: This represents the entire liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit plans.

column1: Pension and Other Postretirement Defined Benefit Plans, Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: This represents the noncurrent liability for underfunded plans recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans and other postretirement defined benefit plans.

column1: Policyholder Benefits and Claims Incurred, Net
column2: Amount, after effects of policies assumed or ceded, of expense related to the provision for policy benefits and costs incurred.

column1: Proceeds from Contributions from Affiliates
column2: The cash inflow from an entity that is affiliated with the entity by means of direct or indirect ownership.

column1: Proceeds from Contributions from Parent
column2: The cash inflow from parent as a source of financing that is recorded as additional paid in capital.

column1: Proceeds from Lines of Credit
column2: Amount of cash inflow from contractual arrangement with the lender, including but not limited to, letter of credit, standby letter of credit and revolving credit arrangements.

column1: Proceeds from Notes Payable
column2: The cash inflow from a borrowing supported by a written promise to pay an obligation.

column1: Product Warranty Accrual, Payments
column2: Represents the aggregate decrease in the liability related to payments to satisfy claims for standard and extended product warranties.

column1: Allowance for Funds Used During Construction, Capitalized Interest
column2: Amount capitalized of allowance for funds used during construction.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate Accumulated Depreciation
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation pertaining to real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Repayment of Notes Receivable from Related Parties
column2: The cash inflow from a loan, supported by a promissory note, granted to related parties where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth.

column1: Repayments of Debt
column2: The cash outflow during the period from the repayment of aggregate short-term and long-term debt. Excludes payment of capital lease obligations.

column1: Repayments of Lines of Credit
column2: Amount of cash outflow for payment of an obligation from a lender, including but not limited to, letter of credit, standby letter of credit and revolving credit arrangements.

column1: Repayments of Long-term Debt
column2: The cash outflow for debt initially having maturity due after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Repayments of Other Debt
column2: The cash outflow for the payment of other borrowing not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Research and Development Expense
column2: The aggregate costs incurred (1) in a planned search or critical investigation aimed at discovery of new knowledge with the hope that such knowledge will be useful in developing a new product or service, a new process or technique, or in bringing about a significant improvement to an existing product or process; or (2) to translate research findings or other knowledge into a plan or design for a new product or process or for a significant improvement to an existing product or process whether intended for sale or the entity's use, during the reporting period charged to research and development projects, including the costs of developing computer software up to the point in time of achieving technological feasibility, and costs allocated in accounting for a business combination to in-process projects deemed to have no alternative future use.

column1: Shares, Outstanding
column2: Number of shares issued which are neither cancelled nor held in the treasury.

column1: Standard Product Warranty Accrual, Payments
column2: Represents the aggregate decrease in the liability for payments made (in cash or in kind) to satisfy claims under the terms of the standard product warranty. Does not include any Increase or Decrease in the liability for payments related to extended product warranties.

column1: Stock Repurchased During Period, Value
column2: Equity impact of the value of stock that has been repurchased during the period and has not been retired and is not held in treasury. Some state laws may mandate the circumstances under which an entity may acquire its own stock and prescribe the accounting treatment therefore. This element is used when state law does not recognize treasury stock.

column1: Temporary Equity, Accretion to Redemption Value
column2: Value of accretion of temporary equity to its redemption value during the period.

column1: Treasury Stock, Value
column2: The amount allocated to treasury stock. Treasury stock is common and preferred shares of an entity that were issued, repurchased by the entity, and are held in its treasury.

column1: Treasury Stock, Value, Acquired, Cost Method
column2: Equity impact of the cost of common and preferred stock that were repurchased during the period. Recorded using the cost method.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Decrease Resulting from Prior Period Tax Positions
