column2: Amount of decrease in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from tax positions taken in prior period tax returns.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Decrease Resulting from Settlements with Taxing Authorities
column2: Amount of decrease in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from settlements with taxing authorities.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Reduction Resulting from Lapse of Applicable Statute of Limitations
column2: Amount of decrease in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from lapses of applicable statutes of limitations.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Net of Valuation Allowance, Noncurrent
column2: Amount after allocation of valuation allowances of noncurrent deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and carryforwards. Noncurrent assets are expected to be realized or consumed after one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer).

column1: Notes Payable, Current
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of the portions of long-term notes payable due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Valuation Allowance, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of deferred tax assets for which it is more likely than not that a tax benefit will not be realized expected to be realized or consumed after one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer).

column1: Proceeds from Stock Options Exercised
column2: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from holders exercising their stock options. This item inherently excludes any excess tax benefit, which the entity may have realized and reported separately.

column1: Accrued Income Taxes, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the unpaid sum of the known and estimated amounts payable to satisfy all currently due domestic and foreign income tax obligations.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Deduction, Other, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to other deductions.

column1: Liabilities Assumed
column2: The fair value of liabilities assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

column1: #NAME?
column2: The cash outflow from advancing money to an affiliate (an entity that is related but not strictly controlled by the entity).

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Net
column2: Amount after accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Long-term Debt
column2: The cash inflow from a debt initially having maturity due after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Foreign Currency Transaction Gain, before Tax
column2: Amount before tax of foreign currency transaction realized and unrealized gain recognized in the income statement.

column1: Payments to Acquire Machinery and Equipment
column2: The cash outflow for acquisition of machinery and equipment.

column1: Derivative, Cash Received on Hedge
column2: The amount of cash received during the period on settlement of a hedge.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Fixed Assets Acquired
column2: The amount of fixed assets that an Entity acquires in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as information about all investing and financing activities of an enterprise during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Payments of Ordinary Dividends, Common Stock
column2: Amount of cash outflow in the form of ordinary dividends to common shareholders of the parent entity.

column1: Payments to Acquire Investments
column2: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of all investments (debt, security, other) during the period.

column1: Allowance for Doubtful Accounts Receivable, Current
column2: A valuation allowance for trade and other receivables due to an Entity within one year (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer) that are expected to be uncollectible.

column1: Dividends, Preferred Stock, Stock
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid preferred stock dividends declared with the form of settlement in stock.

column1: Issuance of Stock and Warrants for Services or Claims
column2: Fair value of share-based compensation granted to nonemployees as payment for services rendered or acknowledged claims.

column1: Other General Expense
column2: Amount of general expenses not normally included in Other Operating Costs and Expenses.

column1: Derivative Asset, Notional Amount
column2: Nominal or face amount used to calculate payments on the derivative asset.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Repatriation of Foreign Earnings, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to repatriation of foreign earnings.

column1: Stock Issued
column2: The fair value of stock issued in noncash financing activities.

column1: Municipal Debt Securities, at Carrying Value
column2: Bonds or similar securities issued by state, city, or local governments or the agencies operated by state, city, or local governments which are short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under that definition. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

column1: Payments to Acquire Equity Method Investments
column2: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of or advances to an equity method investments, which are investments in joint ventures and entities in which the entity has an equity ownership interest normally of 20 to 50 percent and exercises significant influence.

column1: Interest Income, Operating
column2: Amount of operating interest income, including, but not limited to, amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts on securities.

column1: Payments to Acquire Notes Receivable
column2: The cash outflow to acquire an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date. Such amount may include accrued interest receivable in accordance with the terms of the note. The note also may contain provisions including a discount or premium, payable on demand, secured, or unsecured, interest bearing or noninterest bearing, among myriad other features and characteristics.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Increase from Business Combination
column2: Increase in noncontrolling interest balance because of a business combination that occurred during the period.

column1: Payments for Rent
column2: Cash payments to lessor's for use of assets under operating leases.

column1: Product Warranty Expense
column2: The expense charged against earnings for the period pertaining to standard and extended warranties on the entity's goods and services granted to customers.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Reclassifications from Nonaccretable Difference
column2: Amount of increase of reclassification from nonaccretable difference to the excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in acquired loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Debt, Current
column2: Amount of short-term debt and current maturity of long-term debt and capital lease obligations due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Repayments of Short-term Debt
column2: The cash outflow for a borrowing having initial term of repayment within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Capitalized Computer Software, Additions
column2: Additions made to capitalized computer software costs during the period.

column1: Payments of Capital Distribution
column2: Cash outflow to owners or shareholders, excluding ordinary dividends. Includes special dividends.

column1: Capital Lease Obligations, Current
column2: Amount of capital lease obligation due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Payments to Acquire Mineral Rights
column2: The cash outflow from the acquisition of a mineral right which is the right to extract a mineral from the earth or to receive payment, in the form of royalty, for the extraction of minerals.

column1: Payments to Acquire Other Property, Plant, and Equipment
column2: The cash outflow for acquisition of or capital improvements of property, plant and equipment, used to produce goods or deliver services, and not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.

column1: Derivative Instruments, Gain Reclassified from Accumulated OCI into Income, Effective Portion
column2: The effective portion of gain reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income into income on derivative instruments designated and qualifying as hedging instruments.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Gross
column2: Amount before allowance of loans and leases held in portfolio, including but not limited to, commercial and consumer loans. Includes deferred interest and fees, undisbursed portion of loan balance, unamortized costs and premiums and discounts from face amounts. Excludes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements.

column1: Proceeds from Contributed Capital
column2: The cash inflow associated with the amount received by a corporation from a shareholder during the period.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Other, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: The cumulative amount of depreciation (related to capitalized assets classified as property, plant and equipment not otherwise defined in the taxonomy) that has been recognized in the income statement.

column1: Convertible Preferred Dividends, Net of Tax
column2: The after-tax amount of any dividends on convertible preferred stock.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Credit, Foreign, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to foreign tax credit.

column1: Deposits
column2: The aggregate of all deposit liabilities held by the entity, including foreign and domestic, interest and noninterest bearing; may include demand deposits, saving deposits, Negotiable Order of Withdrawal (NOW) and time deposits among others.

column1: Due to Related Parties, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties. For classified balance sheets, represents the current portion of such liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Payments to Noncontrolling Interests
column2: Amount of cash outflow to a noncontrolling interest. Includes, but not limited to, reduction of noncontrolling interest ownership. Excludes dividends paid to the noncontrolling interest.

column1: Repayments of Long-term Capital Lease Obligations
column2: The cash outflow for the obligation for a lease meeting the criteria for capitalization (with maturities exceeding one year or beyond the operating cycle of the entity, if longer).

column1: Convertible Notes Payable
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying value as of the balance sheet date of a written promise to pay a note, initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer, which can be exchanged for a specified amount of one or more securities (typically common stock), at the option of the issuer or the holder.

column1: Other Noncash Income
column2: Other income or gains included in net income that result in no cash inflows or outflows in the period and are not separately disclosed.

column1: Payments of Ordinary Dividends, Preferred Stock and Preference Stock
column2: Amount of cash outflow in the form of ordinary dividends to preferred shareholders of the parent entity.

column1: Temporary Equity, Accretion of Dividends
column2: Value of accretion of temporary equity during the period due to unpaid dividends.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, Related Allowance
column2: Amount of allowance for credit losses related to recorded investment.

column1: Convertible Debt, Fair Value Disclosures
column2: Fair value portion of borrowing which can be exchanged for a specified number of another security at the option of the issuer or the holder, for example, but not limited to, the entity's common stock.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Net Amount
column2: Amount after allowance and deduction of deferred interest and fees, unamortized costs and premiums and discounts from face amounts, of loans and leases held in portfolio, including but not limited to, commercial and consumer loans. Excludes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements and loans held for sale.

column1: Notes Payable
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, aggregate carrying amount of all types of notes payable, as of the balance sheet date, with initial maturities beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Liabilities
column2: The aggregate carrying amount, as of the balance sheet date, of liabilities not separately disclosed in the balance sheet.

column1: Payments to Acquire Available-for-sale Securities
column2: The cash outflow to acquire debt and equity securities not classified as either held-to-maturity securities or trading securities which would be classified as available-for-sale securities and reported at fair value, with unrealized gains and losses excluded from earnings and reported in a separate component of shareholders' equity.

column1: #NAME?
column2: #NAME?

column1: Derivative Instruments Not Designated as Hedging Instruments, Liability, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of derivative instrument not designated as hedging instrument and classified as a liability.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Reclassifications to Nonaccretable Difference
column2: Amount of decrease from reclassification to nonaccretable difference of the excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in acquired loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Payments to Acquire Businesses, Gross
column2: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of business during the period. The cash portion only of the acquisition price.

column1: Payments to Acquire Marketable Securities
column2: Cash outflow for purchase of trading, available-for-sale securities and held-to-maturity securities.

column1: Proceeds from Noncontrolling Interests
column2: Amount of cash inflow from a noncontrolling interest. Includes, but is not limited to, purchase of additional shares or other increase in noncontrolling interest ownership.

column1: Preferred Stock Redemption Discount
column2: The excess of (1) the carrying amount of the preferred stock in the registrant's balance sheet over (2) the fair value of the consideration transferred to the holders of the preferred stock, during the accounting period, which will be added to net earnings to arrive at net earnings available to common shareholders in the calculation of earnings per share.

column1: Accumulated Amortization, Debt Issuance Costs
column2: Amount of accumulated amortization of debt issuance costs.

column1: Repayments of Convertible Debt
column2: The cash outflow from the repayment of a long-term debt instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

column1: Debt and Capital Lease Obligations
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of all debt, including all short-term borrowings, long-term debt, and capital lease obligations.

column1: Other Noncash Income Tax Expense
column2: The portion of the noncash component of income tax expense for the period other than the portion from the net change in the entity's deferred tax assets and liabilities.

column1: Preferred Units, Preferred Partners' Capital Accounts
column2: The amount of the preferred partners' ownership interests.

column1: Due from Related Parties
column2: For an unclassified balance sheet, amounts due from related parties including affiliates, employees, joint ventures, officers and stockholders, immediate families thereof, and pension funds.

column1: Other Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of liabilities classified as other, due after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Recognition of Deferred Revenue
column2: The amount of previously reported deferred or unearned revenue that was recognized as revenue during the period. For cash flows, this element primarily pertains to amortization of deferred credits on long-term arrangements. As a noncash item, it is deducted from net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

column1: Asset-Backed Securities, at Carrying Value
column2: Investments in notes or bonds that are collateralized by a specific group of underlying assets owned by the issuer of the notes or bonds which are short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under that definition. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

column1: Due from Related Parties, Current
column2: The aggregate amount of receivables to be collected from related parties where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth, at the financial statement date. which are usually due within one year (or one business cycle).

column1: Due to Related Parties
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties.

column1: Investment Income, Investment Expense
column2: Amount of expenses related to the generation of investment income.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Productive Assets
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of property, plant and equipment (capital expenditures), software, and other intangible assets.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures and Expirations in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average price of options that were either forfeited or expired.

column1: Receivables, Net, Current
column2: The total amount due to the entity within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from outside sources, including trade accounts receivable, notes and loans receivable, as well as any other types of receivables, net of allowances established for the purpose of reducing such receivables to an amount that approximates their net realizable value.

column1: Temporary Equity, Accretion of Interest
column2: Value of accretion of temporary equity during the period due to unpaid interest.

column1: Commitments, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of arrangements with third parties, including, but not limited to, operating lease arrangement and arrangement in which the entity has agreed to expend funds to procure goods or services, or has agreed to commit resources to supply goods or services.

column1: Intangible Assets, Net (Excluding Goodwill)
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts of all intangible assets, excluding goodwill, as of the balance sheet date, net of accumulated amortization and impairment charges.

column1: Interest on Convertible Debt, Net of Tax
column2: The after-tax amount of interest recognized in the period associated with any convertible debt.

column1: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Current
column2: Amount of long-term debt and capital leases due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Stockholders' Equity Note, Subscriptions Receivable
column2: Note received instead of cash as contribution to equity. The transaction may be a sale of capital stock or a contribution to paid-in capital.

column1: Property, Plant, and Equipment, Owned, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: The cumulative amount of depreciation (related to long-lived, depreciable flight assets owned by the entity and used in the entity's principle business operations and capitalized assets classified as property, plant and equipment that are owned by the entity) that has been recognized in the income statement.

column1: Restructuring Reserve
column2: Carrying amount (including both current and noncurrent portions of the accrual) as of the balance sheet date pertaining to a specified type of cost associated with exit from or disposal of business activities or restructuring pursuant to a duly authorized plan.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Deduction, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to deductions. Including, but not limited to, extraterritorial income exclusion deduction, qualified production activity deduction, dividend deduction, deduction for dividend paid to employee stock ownership plan, Medicare prescription drug benefit subsidy deduction, and other deductions.

column1: Payments to Acquire Oil and Gas Property
column2: The cash outflow to purchase of mineral interests in oil and gas properties for use in the normal oil and gas operations and not intended for resale.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, Interest Income, Accrual Method
column2: Amount of interest income recognized that the financing receivables (with related allowance for credit losses and without a related allowance for credit losses) were impaired.

column1: Operating Loss Carryforwards
column2: Amount of operating loss carryforward, before tax effects, available to reduce future taxable income under enacted tax laws.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, US Government and Agency Obligations, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in debt obligations issued by the US government including short-term Treasury bills, medium-term Treasury notes, and long-term Treasury bonds, as well as debt issued by agencies. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Impairment of Long-Lived Assets Held-for-use
column2: The aggregate amount of write-downs for impairments recognized during the period for long lived assets held for use (including those held for disposal by means other than sale).

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Divestitures, Plan Assets
column2: The amount of decrease in the plan assets attributed to the sale, liquidation, spin-off or other divestiture of a corporate division or subsidiary.

column1: Deposits, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of deposit liabilities held by the entity, including, but not limited to, foreign and domestic, interest and noninterest bearing, demand deposits, saving deposits, negotiable orders of withdrawal (NOW) and time deposits.

column1: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Losses
column2: A valuation allowance for financing receivables that are expected to be uncollectible.

column1: Secured Debt, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the portion of long-term, collateralized debt obligations due within one year or the operating cycle, if longer. Such obligations include mortgage loans, chattel loans, and any other borrowings secured by assets of the borrower.

column1: Inventory, LIFO Reserve
column2: Amount by which inventory stated at last-in first-out (LIFO) is less than (in excess of) inventory stated at other inventory cost methods.

column1: Payments to Acquire Businesses and Interest in Affiliates
column2: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of a controlling interest in another entity or an entity that is related to it but not strictly controlled (for example, an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, joint venture or equity method investment).

column1: Financing Receivable, Recorded Investment, Nonaccrual Status
column2: Recorded investment in financing receivables that are on nonaccrual status as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Less than Twelve Months, Fair Value
column2: This item represents the aggregate fair value of investments in debt and equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading securities that have been in a continuous unrealized loss position for less than twelve months.

column1: Limited Partners' Capital Account, Distribution Amount
column2: The total amount of distributions to limited partners.

column1: Selling and Marketing Expense
column2: The aggregate total amount of expenses directly related to the marketing or selling of products or services.

column1: Long-term Debt, Excluding Current Maturities
column2: Amount after unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs of long-term debt classified as noncurrent and excluding amounts to be repaid within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

column1: Proceeds from Divestiture of Interest in Consolidated Subsidiaries
column2: The cash inflow associated with the deconsolidation of a previously consolidated subsidiary or the sale of investment in consolidated subsidiaries (generally greater than 50 percent).

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Net, Noncurrent
column2: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, with jurisdictional netting and classified as noncurrent.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Grants in Period, Gross
column2: Gross number of share options (or share units) granted during the period.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Contributions by Employer
column2: Amount of contributions made by the employer to defined benefit plans.

column1: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Losses, Collectively Evaluated for Impairment
column2: The valuation allowance for financing receivables that are expected to be uncollectible that were collectively evaluated for impairment.

column1: Payments to Fund Long-term Loans to Related Parties
column2: The cash outflow associated with extending a long-term loan to a related party. Alternate caption: Payments for Advances to Affiliates.

column1: Legal Fees
column2: The amount of expense provided in the period for legal costs incurred on or before the balance sheet date pertaining to resolved, pending or threatened litigation, including arbitration and mediation proceedings.

column1: Payments to Acquire Other Productive Assets
column2: Amount of cash outflow for the purchase of or improvements to tangible or intangible assets, used to produce goods or deliver services, classified as other.

column1: Payments to Acquire Short-term Investments
column2: The cash outflow for securities or other assets acquired, which qualify for treatment as an investing activity and are to be liquidated, if necessary, within the current operating cycle. Includes cash flows from securities classified as trading securities that were acquired for reasons other than sale in the short-term.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Other
column2: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowance, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from provisions, reserves, allowances, and accruals, classified as other.

column1: Impairment of Intangible Assets (Excluding Goodwill)
column2: The amount of impairment loss recognized in the period resulting from the write-down of the carrying amount of an intangible asset (excluding goodwill) to fair value.

column1: Other Assets, Current
column2: Amount of current assets classified as other.

column1: Weighted Average Number of Shares, Employee Stock Ownership Plan Shares Not Committed to be Released
column2: Number of employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) shares that have not been committed to be released determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that these shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from capitalized costs.

column1: Payments to Acquire Other Investments
column2: Amount of cash outflow to acquire investments classified as other.

column1: Standard and Extended Product Warranty Accrual, Increase for Warranties Issued
column2: Amount of increase in the standard and extended product warranty accrual from warranties issued.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate, Cost of Real Estate Sold
column2: Amount of real estate investments sold for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Outstanding, Number
column2: Number of options outstanding, including both vested and non-vested options.

column1: Accounts Receivable, Net, Current
column2: Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.

column1: Accumulated Distributions in Excess of Net Income
column2: The amount as of the balance sheet date by which cumulative distributions to shareholders (or partners) exceed retained earnings (or accumulated earnings).

column1: Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount of investment in debt and equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading.

column1: Fair Value of Assets Acquired
column2: The fair value of assets acquired in noncash investing or financing activities.

column1: Payments of Ordinary Dividends, Noncontrolling Interest
column2: Amount of cash outflow in the form of ordinary dividends provided by the non-wholly owned subsidiary to noncontrolling interests.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Cost of Sales
column2: The amount of the cost of sales reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Paid-in-Kind Interest
column2: Interest paid other than in cash for example by issuing additional debt securities. As a noncash item, it is added to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate Accumulated Depreciation, Real Estate Sold
column2: Amount of decrease to accumulated depreciation for real estate investments sold for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Write off of Deferred Debt Issuance Cost
column2: Write-off of amounts previously capitalized as debt issuance cost in an extinguishment of debt.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Accrued Liabilities
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from accrued liabilities.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Other Comprehensive Income
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from unrealized gains in other comprehensive income.

column1: Financing Receivable, Recorded Investment, Current
column2: Financing receivables that are current.

column1: Preferred Stock, Amount of Preferred Dividends in Arrears
column2: Aggregate amount of cumulative preferred dividends in arrears.

column1: Ceded Premiums Written
column2: Amount of written premiums ceded to other entities.

column1: Costs and Expenses, Related Party
column2: Costs of sales and operating expenses for the period incurred from transactions with related parties.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Goodwill and Intangible Assets
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from intangible assets including goodwill.

column1: Exploration Expense
column2: Exploration expenses (including prospecting) related to oil and gas producing entities and would be included in operating expenses of that entity. Costs incurred in identifying areas that may warrant examination and in examining specific areas that are considered to have prospects of containing oil and gas reserves, including costs of drilling exploratory wells and exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells. Exploration costs may be incurred both before acquiring the related property (sometimes referred to in part as prospecting costs) and after acquiring the property. Principal types of exploration costs, which include depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of exploration activities, are: (i) Costs of topographical, geographical and geophysical studies, rights of access to properties to conduct those studies, and salaries and other expenses of geologists, geophysical crews, and others conducting those studies. Collectively, these are sometimes referred to as geological and geophysical or "G&G" costs. (ii) Costs of carrying and retaining undeveloped properties, such as delay rentals, ad valorem taxes on properties, legal costs for title defense, and the maintenance of land and lease records. (iii) Dry hole contributions and bottom hole contributions. (iv) Costs of drilling and equipping exploratory wells. (v) Costs of drilling exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Credit, Investment, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to investment tax credit.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Credit, Other, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to other tax credits.

column1: Payments for Commissions
column2: The amount of cash paid for commissions during the current period.

column1: Proceeds from Income Tax Refunds
column2: The amount of cash received during the period as refunds for the overpayment of taxes.

column1: Business Combination, Recognized Identifiable Assets Acquired and Liabilities Assumed, Finite-Lived Intangibles
column2: The amount of identifiable intangible assets recognized as of the acquisition date.

column1: Convertible Debt, Current
column2: The portion of the carrying value of long-term convertible debt as of the balance sheet date that is scheduled to be repaid within one year or in the normal operating cycle if longer. Convertible debt is a financial instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

column1: Derivative Instruments Not Designated as Hedging Instruments, Loss
column2: Amount of realized and unrealized loss of derivative instruments not designated or qualifying as hedging instruments.

column1: Inventory, Net
column2: Amount after valuation and LIFO reserves of inventory expected to be sold, or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Proceeds from Divestiture of Businesses
column2: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from the sale of a portion of the company's business, for example a segment, division, branch or other business, during the period.

column1: Restricted Stock or Unit Expense
column2: The noncash expense that represents the cost of restricted stock or unit distributed to employees as compensation.

column1: Other Asset Impairment Charges
column2: The charge against earnings resulting from the write down of long lived assets other than goodwill due to the difference between the carrying value and lower fair value.

column1: Payments for Other Operating Activities
column2: Amount of cash outflow for operating activities classified as other.

column1: Payments of Loan Costs
column2: The cash outflow for loan origination associated cost which is usually collected through escrow.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Finance Receivables
column2: The cash inflow associated with the collection of receivables arising from the financing of goods and services.

column1: Royalty Expense
column2: Amount of expense related to royalty payments under a contractual arrangement such as payment for mineral and drilling rights and use of technology or intellectual property.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Twelve Months or Longer, Fair Value
column2: This item represents the aggregate fair value of investments in debt and equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading securities that have been in a continuous unrealized loss position for twelve months or longer.

column1: Other Assets
column2: Amount of assets classified as other.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Value, Purchase of Assets
column2: Value of shares of stock issued during the period as part of a transaction to acquire assets that do not qualify as a business combination.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Increase Resulting from Settlements with Taxing Authorities
column2: Amount of increase in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from settlements with taxing authorities.

column1: Common Stock, Value, Issued
column2: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

column1: Deferred Revenue
column2: Amount of deferred revenue as of balance sheet date. Deferred revenue represents collections of cash or other assets related to a revenue producing activity for which revenue has not yet been recognized. Generally, an entity records deferred revenue when it receives consideration from a customer before achieving certain criteria that must be met for revenue to be recognized in conformity with GAAP.

column1: Interest Payable
column2: Amount of interest payable on debt, including, but not limited to, trade payables.

column1: Interest Rate Cash Flow Hedge Liability at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all interest rate derivative liabilities designated as cash flow hedging instruments.

column1: Long-term Debt, Fair Value
column2: The fair value amount of long-term debt whether such amount is presented as a separate caption or as a parenthetical disclosure. Additionally, this element may be used in connection with the fair value disclosures required in the footnote disclosures to the financial statements. The element may be used in both the balance sheet and disclosure in the same submission.

column1: Payments for Origination of Mortgage Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The amount of cash paid for the origination of mortgages that are held for sale.

column1: Payments to Acquire Additional Interest in Subsidiaries
column2: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of noncontrolling interest during the period.

column1: Payments to Acquire Mining Assets
column2: The cash outflow from the purchase of mining and mining related assets during the period.

column1: Interest Expense, Debt, Excluding Amortization
column2: Represents the portion of interest incurred in the period on debt arrangements that was charged against earnings, excluding amortization of debt discount (premium) and financing costs.

column1: Operating Leases, Rent Expense
column2: Amount of rent expense incurred for leased assets, including but not limited to, furniture and equipment, that is not directly or indirectly associated with the manufacture, sale or creation of a product or product line.

column1: Treasury Stock, Shares
column2: Number of common and preferred shares that were previously issued and that were repurchased by the issuing entity and held in treasury on the financial statement date. This stock has no voting rights and receives no dividends.

column1: Accrued Liabilities, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Accrued Liabilities, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of accrued expenses.

column1: Allowance for Loan and Lease Losses, Loans Acquired
column2: Amount of addition to allowance reserve for credit loss arising from purchase of loan and lease portfolios.

column1: Asset Retirement Obligation
column2: The carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.

column1: Billed Contracts Receivable
column2: #NAME?

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Value, Share-based Compensation, Gross
column2: Gross value of stock (or other type of equity) issued during the period as a result of any equity-based compensation plan other than an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP). Stock issued could result from the issuance of restricted stock, the exercise of stock options, stock issued under employee stock purchase plans, and/or other employee benefit plans.

column1: Income Taxes Receivable, Current
column2: Carrying amount due within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from tax authorities as of the balance sheet date representing refunds of overpayments or recoveries based on agreed-upon resolutions of disputes.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Equity
column2: The cash outflow to reacquire common and preferred stock.

column1: Payments to Explore and Develop Oil and Gas Properties
column2: The cash outflow for exploration and development of oil and gas properties. It includes cash payments related to development of oil and gas wells drilled at previously untested geologic structures (to determine the presence of oil or gas) and wells drilled at sites where the presence of oil or gas has already been established (to extract the oil or gas).

column1: Accounts Payable, Related Parties, Current
column2: Amount for accounts payable to related parties. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Notes Payable, Related Parties, Current
column2: The amount for notes payable (written promise to pay), due to related parties. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Origination of Notes Receivable from Related Parties
column2: The cash outflow for a loan, supported by a promissory note, granted to related parties where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth.

column1: Prepaid Expense and Other Assets, Current
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for costs that provide economic benefits in future periods, and amount of other assets that are expected to be realized or consumed within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Repayments of Long-term Lines of Credit
column2: The cash outflow for the settlement of obligation drawn from a contractual arrangement with the lender, including letter of credit, standby letter of credit and revolving credit arrangements, under which borrowings can be made up to a specific amount at any point in time with maturities due beyond one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Capital Lease Obligations Incurred
column2: The increase during the period in capital lease obligations due to entering into new capital leases.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs
column2: Net amount of deferred policy acquisition costs capitalized on contracts remaining in force as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Due from Affiliate, Current
column2: Amount of receivables due from an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership, due within 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Due to Related Parties, Noncurrent
column2: Portion of the carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties that is payable after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

column1: Loans Receivable, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of loan receivable, including, but not limited to, mortgage loans held for investment, finance receivables held for investment, policy loans on insurance contracts.

column1: Repayments of Debt and Capital Lease Obligations
column2: The cash outflow during the period from the repayment of aggregate short-term and long-term debt and payment of capital lease obligations.

column1: Convertible Debt
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying amount of debt identified as being convertible into another form of financial instrument (typically the entity's common stock) as of the balance sheet date, which originally required full repayment more than twelve months after issuance or greater than the normal operating cycle of the company.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Derivative Instruments
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from derivative instruments.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Unrealized Gains on Trading Securities
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from unrealized gains on trading securities.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Participating Nonvested Shares with Non-forfeitable Dividend Rights
column2: This element represents nonvested share-based payment awards that contain non-forfeitable rights to dividends or dividend equivalents (whether paid or unpaid). Basic and dilutive earnings per share are generally disclosed for such shares using the two-class method.

column1: Financing Receivable, Gross
column2: Amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date. Such amount may include accrued interest receivable in accordance with the terms of the note. The note also may contain provisions and related items including a discount or premium, payable on demand, secured, or unsecured, interest bearing or noninterest bearing, among a myriad of other features and characteristics. Excludes amounts related to receivables held-for-sale.

column1: Selling Expense
column2: Expenses recognized in the period that are directly related to the selling and distribution of products or services.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Gross, Noncurrent
column2: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowance, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and carryforwards, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Direct Costs of Leased and Rented Property or Equipment
column2: Amount of expense incurred and directly related to generating revenue from leased and rented property or equipment.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Current Liabilities
column2: The amount of current liabilities reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Payment of Financing and Stock Issuance Costs
column2: The total of the cash outflow during the period which has been paid to third parties in connection with debt origination, which will be amortized over the remaining maturity period of the associated long-term debt and the cost incurred directly for the issuance of equity securities.

column1: Payments for Capital Improvements
column2: The cash outflow for acquisition of or capital improvements to properties held for investment (operating, managed, leased) or for use.

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Notes Receivable
column2: The cash inflow associated with principal collections from a borrowing supported by a written promise to pay an obligation.

column1: Tax Credit Carryforward, Valuation Allowance
column2: Amount of valuation allowance pertaining to the deferred tax asset representing potential future taxable deductions from tax credit carryforwards for which it is more likely than not that a tax benefit will not be realized.

column1: Taxes Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for statutory income, sales, use, payroll, excise, real, property and other taxes. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits
column2: Amount of unrecognized tax benefits.

column1: Capitalized Computer Software, Accumulated Amortization
column2: For each balance sheet presented, the amount of accumulated amortization for capitalized computer software costs.

column1: Capital Leases, Lessee Balance Sheet, Assets by Major Class, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: The total charge for the use of long-lived depreciable assets subject to a lease meeting the criteria for capitalization.

column1: Debt Related Commitment Fees and Debt Issuance Costs
column2: Represents the charge against earnings during the period for commitment fees and debt issuance expenses.

column1: Proceeds from Insurance Settlement, Operating Activities
column2: The cash inflow from the amounts received by the insured under the terms of an insurance contract settlement. This element pertains only to insurance proceeds related to operating activities. It excludes insurance settlements classified as investing cash flows, for example, insurance settlements related to fixed assets.

column1: Deferred Compensation Liability, Current
column2: Aggregate carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the liabilities for all deferred compensation arrangements payable within one year (or the operating cycle, if longer). Represents currently earned compensation under compensation arrangements that is not actually paid until a later date.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Other Liabilities Assumed
column2: Amount of liabilities, classified as other, assumed in acquiring a business or in consideration for an asset received in a noncash or part noncash acquisition.

column1: Other Significant Noncash Transaction, Value of Consideration Received
column2: The value of the noncash (or part noncash) consideration received in a transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of a transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Payments to Acquire Interest in Joint Venture
column2: The cash outflow associated with the investment in or advances to an entity in which the reporting entity shares control of the entity with another party or group.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Equity Method Investments
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of equity method investments, which are investments in joint ventures and entities in which the entity has an equity ownership interest normally of 20 to 50 percent and exercises significant influence.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Deferred Income
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from deferred income.

column1: Defined Benefit Pension Plan, Liabilities
column2: This represents the entire liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans.

column1: Due from Related Parties, Noncurrent
column2: Aggregate amount of receivables to be collected from related parties where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth, at the financial statement date. which are usually due after one year (or one business cycle).

column1: Financing Interest Expense
column2: This element represents interest incurred for borrowed money which was used to produce goods or render services.

column1: Insurance Recoveries
column2: The amount recovered from insurance. These recoveries reduce costs and losses that are reported as a separate line item under operating expenses.

column1: Other Assets, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of other assets.

column1: Other Partners' Capital
column2: Amount of other partners' capital.

column1: Payments for Merger Related Costs
column2: The amount of cash paid during the reporting period for charges associated with the mergers.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Treasury Stock
column2: The cash inflow from the issuance of an equity stock that has been previously reacquired by the entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment, Credit Losses Recognized in Earnings, Credit Losses on Debt Securities Held
column2: The cumulative amount of credit losses recognized in earnings related to debt securities held for which a portion of an other than temporary impairment (OTTI) was recognized in other comprehensive income (a component of shareholders' equity).

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, before Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment loss (OTTI) on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss and attributable to parent entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent
column2: Amount after tax of other than temporary impairment loss (OTTI) on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss and attributable to parent entity.

column1: Derivative Liability, Notional Amount
column2: Nominal or face amount used to calculate payments on the derivative liability.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Loss, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, before Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to parent entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment, Credit Losses Recognized in Earnings, Reductions, Securities Sold
column2: This item represents reductions in the cumulative amount of credit losses recognized in earnings for an other than temporary impairment (OTTI) of a debt security because of the sale of impaired securities during the period.

column1: Derivative Instruments Not Designated as Hedging Instruments, Asset, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of derivative instrument not designated as hedging instrument and classified as an asset.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent
column2: Amount of tax (expense) benefit of other than temporary impairment loss (OTTI) on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss and attributable to parent entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net
column2: The amount of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses on equity securities, OTTI related to credit losses on debt securities, and OTTI losses on debt securities when the entity intends to sell the securities or it is more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell the securities before recovery of its amortized cost basis. Additionally, this item includes OTTI losses recognized during the period on investments accounted for under the cost method of accounting.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount after tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) loss on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount after tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to parent entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount of tax (expense) benefit of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to the parent entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment, Credit Losses Recognized in Earnings, Additions, Additional Credit Losses
column2: This item represents an increase to the cumulative amount of credit losses recognized in earnings for an other than temporary impairment (OTTI) of a debt security held for which a previous OTTI was recognized and the investor does not intend to sell the debt security and it is not more likely than not that the investor will be required to sell the debt security before recovery of its amortized cost basis.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: The amount by which the fair value of an investment in debt and equity securities categorized as Available-for-sale is less than the amortized cost basis or carrying amount of that investment at the balance sheet date and the decline in fair value is deemed to be other than temporary, before considering whether or not such amount is recognized in earnings or other comprehensive income.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Derivatives and Other Contractual Agreements, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in all assets resulting from contracts that meet the criteria of being accounted for as derivative instruments. Their value is derived from the values of one or more underlying assets, reference rates, or indices of asset values. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
column2: Amount after tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) loss on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment, Credit Losses Recognized in Earnings, Reductions, Cash Flows
column2: This item represents reductions in the cumulative amount of credit losses recognized in earnings for an other than temporary impairment (OTTI) of a debt security held due to increases in cash flows expected to be collected and recognized over the remaining life of the security.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, before Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent, Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in held-to-maturity debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to parent entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent, Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: Amount after tax of amount of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in held-to-maturity debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to parent entity.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Income Loss, Tax, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount of tax (expense) benefit of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment, Credit Losses Recognized in Earnings, Additions, No Previous Impairment
column2: This item represents an increase to the cumulative amount of credit losses recognized in earnings for an other than temporary impairment (OTTI) of a debt security held for which no such other than temporary impairment (OTTI) was previously recognized.

column1: #NAME?
column2: Amount of tax (expense) benefit for other than temporary impairment loss (OTTI) on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss.

column1: Other Depreciation and Amortization
column2: Amount of expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of tangible and intangible assets over their remaining economic lives, classified as other.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Increase Resulting from Prior Period Tax Positions
column2: Amount of increase in unrecognized tax benefits resulting from tax positions taken in prior period tax returns.

column1: Deferred Compensation Equity
column2: Value of stock issued under share-based plans to employees or officers which is the unearned portion, accounted for under the fair value method.

column1: Capitalized Interest Costs, Including Allowance for Funds Used During Construction
column2: Amount of interest capitalized, including amount of allowance for funds used during construction.

column1: Financing Receivable, Individually Evaluated for Impairment
column2: The balance of financing receivables that were individually evaluated for impairment.

column1: Financing Receivables, Impaired, Troubled Debt Restructuring, Write-down
column2: Reflects the amount of the write-down related to a troubled debt restructuring.

column1: Foreign Currency Contracts, Liability, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of liability contracts related to the exchange of different currencies, including, but not limited to, foreign currency options, forward (delivery or nondelivery) contracts, and swaps entered into.

column1: Other Liabilities, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of other liabilities.

column1: Mortgage-backed Securities Available-for-sale, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of securitized, pay-through debt securities collateralized by real estate mortgage loans classified as available-for-sale.

column1: Interest Rate Derivative Liabilities, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of interest rate derivative liabilities, which includes all such derivative instruments in hedging and nonhedging relationships that are recognized as liabilities.

column1: Foreign Currency Contract, Asset, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of asset contracts related to the exchange of different currencies, including, but not limited to, foreign currency options, forward contracts, and swaps.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: The amount of other than temporary impairment losses on investments in debt securities categorized as Held-to-maturity which have been recognized in earnings during the period. Such impairment losses consist of other than temporary impairments (OTTI) of investments in debt securities due to credit losses and other than temporary impairments due to other than credit losses when the entity intends to sell an impaired debt security or it is more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell the impaired debt security before recovery of its amortized cost basis.

column1: Interest Rate Derivative Assets, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of interest rate derivative assets, which includes all such derivative instruments in hedging and nonhedging relationships that are recognized as assets.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Corporate Debt, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value of firm holdings in corporate fixed income securities. Includes pledged and unpledged holdings.

column1: Embedded Derivative, No Longer Bifurcated, Amount Reclassified to Stockholders' Equity
column2: The amount of the liability for the conversion option reclassified to stockholders' equity when the embedded option no longer required separation from the host instrument.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Asset, Off-market Lease, Favorable, Gross
column2: This element represents the identifiable intangible asset established upon acquisition based on a favorable difference between the terms of an acquired lease and the current market terms for that lease at the acquisition date.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Related Parties
column2: For an unclassified balance sheet, reflects the carrying amount of unpaid loan amounts due from related parties at the balance sheet date.

column1: Notes and Loans Payable, Current
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of the portions of all long-term notes and loans payable due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.

column1: Repayments of Bank Debt
column2: The cash outflow to settle a bank borrowing during the year.

column1: Unrealized Gain on Securities
column2: The increase (decrease), resulting in a gain, in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of securities held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.

column1: Accounts Receivable, Related Parties
column2: For an unclassified balance sheet, amount of receivables arising from transactions with related parties.

column1: Other Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of noncurrent assets classified as other.

column1: Payments of Debt Restructuring Costs
column2: The cash outflow for cost incurred in the modification of term of existing debt agreement in order for the entity to achieve some advantage.

column1: Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold or consumed after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Nondeductible Expense, Impairment Losses, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to nondeductible impairment loss.

column1: Notes Payable, Related Parties, Noncurrent
column2: The amount for notes payable (written promise to pay), payable to related parties, which are due after one year (or one business cycle).

column1: Payments for Deposits
column2: The amount of cash paid for deposits on goods and services during the period; excludes time deposits and deposits with other institutions, which pertain to financial service entities.

column1: Payments to Acquire Restricted Certificates of Deposit
column2: The cash outflow from temporary investment with specific maturity and interest rate that are prohibited for current use.

column1: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase
column2: Amount, after the effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Shares, Share-based Compensation, Forfeited
column2: Number of shares (or other type of equity) forfeited during the period.

column1: Unrealized Loss on Securities
column2: The increase (decrease), resulting in a loss, in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of securities held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.

column1: Certificates of Deposit, at Carrying Value
column2: A savings certificate entitling the Entity (that is, bearer) to receive interest at an established maturity date, based upon a fixed interest rate. A certificate of deposit may be issued in any denomination. Certificates of deposit are generally issued by commercial banks and, therefore, insured by the FDIC (up to the prescribed limit). Certificates of deposit generally restrict holders from withdrawing funds on demand without the incurrence of penalties. Generally, only certificates of deposit with original maturities of three months or less qualify as cash equivalents. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. As a related example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

column1: Convertible Debt, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount of long-term convertible debt as of the balance sheet date, net of the amount due in the next twelve months or greater than the normal operating cycle, if longer. The debt is convertible into another form of financial instrument, typically the entity's common stock.

column1: Costs in Excess of Billings
column2: Amount of receivable reflecting the cost incurred on uncompleted contracts in excess of related billings.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Inventory
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from inventory.

column1: Other Additional Capital
column2: Amount of additional paid-in capital (APIC) classified as other.

column1: Payments to Acquire Assets, Investing Activities
column2: Aggregate cash payments for a combination of transactions that are classified as investing activities in which assets, which may include securities, other types of investments, or productive assets, are purchased from third-party sellers. This element can be used by entities to aggregate payments for all asset purchases that are classified as investing activities.

column1: Payments to Employees
column2: Payments of cash to employees, including wages and salaries, during the current period.

column1: Accounts Receivable, Net
column2: For an unclassified balance sheet, the amount due from customers or clients for goods or services that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, reduced to their estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.

column1: Antidilutive Securities Excluded from Computation of Earnings Per Share, Amount
column2: Securities (including those issuable pursuant to contingent stock agreements) that could potentially dilute basic earnings per share (EPS) or earnings per unit (EPU) in the future that were not included in the computation of diluted EPS or EPU because to do so would increase EPS or EPU amounts or decrease loss per share or unit amounts for the period presented.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Goodwill
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from goodwill.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Undistributed Foreign Earnings
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from undistributed earnings of subsidiaries and other recognized entities not within the country of domicile of the entity.

column1: Defined Benefit Pension Plan Liabilities, Current
column2: This represents the current liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans.

column1: Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of obligation due after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Preferred Stock, Dividends Per Share, Declared
column2: Aggregate dividends declared during the period for each share of preferred stock outstanding.

column1: Short-term Debt, Fair Value
column2: This element represents the portion of the balance sheet assertion valued at fair value by the entity whether such amount is presented as a separate caption or as a parenthetical disclosure. Additionally, this element may be used in connection with the fair value disclosures required in the footnote disclosures to the financial statements. The element may be used in both the balance sheet and disclosure in the same submission. This item represents the amount of short-term debt existing as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Derivative Instruments in Hedges, Assets, at Fair Value
column2: Aggregate fair value of all derivative assets designated as hedging instruments. Includes instruments designated as cash flow hedges, fair value hedges, and hedges of net investments in foreign operations.

column1: Repayments of Other Long-term Debt
column2: Amount of cash outflow for the payment of debt classified as other, maturing after one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Grants in Period
column2: The number of grants made during the period on other than stock (or unit) option plans (for example, phantom stock or unit plan, stock or unit appreciation rights plan, performance target plan).

column1: Weighted Average Number of Shares, Common Stock Subject to Repurchase or Cancellation
column2: Number of shares of common stock subject to repurchase or cancellation determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that these shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Common stock subject to repurchase are outstanding common shares that are contingently returnable (that is, subject to recall).

column1: Assets Needed for Immediate Settlement, Aggregate Fair Value
column2: The aggregate fair value of assets needed to immediately settle the derivative instruments with credit-risk-related contingent features if the credit-risk-related contingent features were triggered at the end of the reporting period.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Equity Method Investments
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from equity method investments.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Derivative Instruments, Assets
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Net of Deferred Income
column2: Amount before allowance and after deduction of deferred interest and fees, unamortized costs and premiums and discounts from face amounts, of loans and leases held in portfolio, including but not limited to, commercial and consumer loans. Excludes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements.

column1: Other Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount of liabilities classified as other, due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Notes Payable, Current
column2: Amount of long-term notes classified as other, payable within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Payments for Federal Home Loan Bank Advances
column2: Amount of cash outflow from payments for Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) advances.
