Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Direct-to-television Film Costs, Production
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in the production of a direct-to-television film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Direct-to-television Film Costs, Released
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in the release of a direct-to-television film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Disposal Group, Deferred Gain on Disposal
column2: The excess amount received or due over net assets in a transaction accounted for as a divestiture where a subsidiary, business or operating assets are "sold" by the entity to a newly formed, thinly capitalized, highly leveraged buyer. This gain is not yet recognized and is disclosed on the balance sheet as an offset against the carrying amount of the securities received.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accrued Liabilities
column2: Amount classified as accrued liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Tax Assets
column2: Amount classified as deferred tax assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Pension Plan Benefit Obligation
column2: Amount classified as defined benefit plan benefit obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Postretirement Plan Benefit Obligation
column2: Amount classified as defined benefit non-pension postretirement plan obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Distributions Per General Partnership Unit Outstanding
column2: Cash dividends declared or paid to each outstanding general partnership unit during the reporting period.

column1: Distributions Per Limited Partnership and General Partnership Unit, Outstanding, Basic
column2: Cash dividends declared or paid to each outstanding limited partnership and general partnership unit during the reporting period.

column1: Distributions Per Limited Partnership Unit Outstanding, Basic
column2: Cash dividends declared or paid to each outstanding limited partnership unit during the reporting period.

column1: Dividend Payments Restrictions Schedule, Statutory Capital and Surplus
column2: Amount of statutory capital and surplus computed using prescribed or permitted statutory accounting practice.

column1: Dividends Payable, Amount Per Share
column2: The per share amount of a dividend declared, but not paid, as of the financial reporting date.

column1: Dividends Receivable
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of dividends declared but not received.

column1: Dividends, Share-based Compensation, Stock
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid stock dividends declared and applicable to holders of share-based compensation, for example, but not limited to, non-vested shares, stock options, or restricted stock units.

column1: Drafts Payable
column2: Amounts due on drafts payable on the balance sheet date.

column1: Due from Banks
column2: A bank's noninterest bearing demand deposits in other banks (such as correspondents).

column1: Due from Correspondent Brokers
column2: Amount receivable from correspondent broker-dealer.

column1: Due from Customer Acceptances
column2: Amounts receivable from customers on short-term negotiable time drafts drawn on and accepted by the institution (also known as banker's acceptance transactions) that are outstanding on the reporting date.

column1: Due from Employees
column2: For an unclassified balance sheet, amounts due from an Entity employee, not to include stockholders or officers.

column1: Due from Employees, Current
column2: Amounts due from an Entity employee, not to include stockholders or officers, which are usually due within 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Due from Employees, Noncurrent
column2: Amounts due from an Entity employee, not to include stockholders or officers, which are usually due after 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Due from Joint Ventures, Current
column2: Amounts due from an entity in which the reporting entity shares joint control with another party or group, due within 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Due from Joint Ventures, Noncurrent
column2: Amounts due from an entity in which the reporting entity shares joint control with another party or group, due after 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Due from Other Related Parties
column2: Amount receivable from related parties classified as other.

column1: Due from Other Related Parties, Current
column2: Amount receivable from related parties classified as other, due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Due to Employees, Current
column2: Amounts due to employees, not to include stockholders or officers. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Due to Employees
column2: Amounts due to employees, not to include stockholders or officers.

column1: Due to Employees, Noncurrent
column2: Amounts due to Employee, not to include stockholders or officers, which are due after one year (or one business cycle).

column1: Due to Officers or Stockholders
column2: Amounts due to recorded owners or owners with a beneficial interest of more than 10 percent of the voting interests or officers of the company.

column1: Due to Officers or Stockholders, Noncurrent
column2: Amounts due to recorded owners or owners with a beneficial interest of more than 10 percent of the voting interests or officers of the company, which are due after one year (or one business cycle).

column1: Due to Other Related Parties
column2: Amount payable to related parties classified as other.

column1: Due to Other Related Parties, Noncurrent
column2: Amount payable from related parties classified as other, due after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Early Repayment of Subordinated Debt
column2: The cash outflow from the repayment of long-term borrowing where a lender is placed in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment (senior) in case of liquidation of the entity's assets before its maturity.

column1: Earnest Money Deposits
column2: A deposit made by a purchaser of real estate to evidence good faith. It is customary for a buyer to give the seller earnest money at the time a sales contract is signed. The earnest money generally is credited to the down payment at closing, which is applied at closing as a component of payment against the purchase price.

column1: Employee Service Share-based Compensation, Estimated Quantity of Shares to be Repurchased in Following Period
column2: Number of shares to be repurchased in accordance with a policy to use treasury stock to satisfy share-award conversions.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Debt Structure, Indirect Loan, Amount
column2: The amount reported as a liability as of the balance sheet date by the entity (the employer) of the loan made by a third-party lender to the employer relating to loans made by the employer to the ESOP.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Deferred Shares
column2: Represents the carrying amount of shares held by the ESOP as of the balance sheet date in which no ESOP participant has a vested interest and no lender has a claim.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Dividends Paid to ESOP
column2: Dividends paid on stock held by an employee stock ownership plan.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Fair Value of Shares Subject to Repurchase Obligation
column2: Fair value of the shares allocated that are subject to a repurchase obligation.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Interest Payments from ESOP
column2: An entity often discloses the amount of interest paid by the ESOP to a lender.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Number of Committed-to-be-Released Shares
column2: The shares that, although not legally released, will be released by a future scheduled and committed debt service payment and will be allocated to employees for service rendered in the current accounting period. The ESOP documents typically define the period of service to which the shares relate. ESOP shares are released to compensate employees directly, to settle employer liabilities for other employee benefits, and to replace dividends on allocated shares that are used for debt service.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Number of Suspense Shares
column2: Shares contributed to the ESOP that have not yet been released, committed to be released, or allocated to participant accounts. Suspense shares generally collateralize ESOP debt.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Shares Contributed to ESOP
column2: This item represents the number of shares provided to the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) during the period.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Shares in ESOP
column2: Sum of the allocated, committed-to-be-released and suspense shares of the entity held by the plan.

column1: Energy Marketing Accounts Payable
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for energy purchases, typically by a utility or an entity engaged in selling energy contracts.

column1: Energy Marketing Contract Liabilities, Current
column2: Current liabilities attributable to energy marketing activities (trading activities). Current energy marketing (trading activities) are when entities engage in both financial and physical trading to increase profits, manage their commodity price risk and enhance system reliability. They may trade electricity, coal, natural gas and oil. These entities typically use a variety of financial instruments, including forward contracts, options and swaps.

column1: Energy Marketing Contracts Assets, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the asset arising from energy trading activities that involves the purchase and sale of energy under forward contracts at fixed and variable prices and the buying and selling of financial energy contracts that include exchange futures and options and over the counter options and swaps, which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Energy Marketing Contracts Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the asset arising from energy trading activities that involves the purchase and sale of energy under forward contracts at fixed and variable prices and the buying and selling of financial energy contracts that include exchange futures and options and over the counter options and swaps, which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of after a year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Energy Related Inventory
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of merchandise, goods, commodities, or supplies relating to a source of usable power held for future sale or future use in manufacturing or production process.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Chemicals
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of solvents or substances produced by or used in a process to change the shape, form or composition of some related matter.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Coal
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of coal, which is a combustible rock or minerals which are extracted from the ground and used as fuel.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Natural Gas in Storage
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of natural gas in storage, which is a mixture of gases (liquefied or otherwise), used for fuel and manufacturing purposes, which is ready for sale.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Natural Gas Liquids
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of liquid hydrocarbon components recovered from natural gas.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Other Fossil Fuel
column2: Amount of fossil fuel included in inventory classified as other.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Petroleum
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of petroleum or crude oil.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Propane Gas
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of product derived from petroleum during the processing of oil or natural gas which is then used as a heat source or fuel.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Quoted Market Value
column2: This item represents the aggregate value of each identified investment accounted for under the equity method of accounting based on the quoted market price for those investments in common stock for which a quoted market price is available.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Current Assets
column2: The amount of current assets reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Redeemable Preferred Stock
column2: The amount of redeemable preferred stock reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Equity Restrictions
column2: Disclosure of the amount of equity that is restricted to use by regulation or agreement.

column1: Estimated Insurance Recoveries
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts expected to be recovered under the terms of insurance contracts.

column1: Excess Net Capital at 1500 Percent
column2: The amount of net capital in excess of the minimum required net capital.

column1: Expenses and Losses, Reporting Currency Denominated, Value
column2: The reporting currency-denominated expense (including losses) amount.

column1: Exploration Costs, Cumulative
column2: The capitalized costs incurred (excluded from amortization), as of the date of the balance sheet, in identifying areas that may warrant examination and in examining specific areas that are considered to have prospects of containing oil and gas reserves, including costs of drilling exploratory wells and exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells. Exploration costs may be incurred both before acquiring the related property (sometimes referred to in part as prospecting costs) and after acquiring the property. Principal types of exploration costs, which include depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of exploration activities, are: costs of topographical, geographical and geophysical studies, rights of access to properties to conduct those studies, and salaries and other expenses of geologists, geophysical crews, and others conducting those studies. Collectively, these are sometimes referred to as geological and geophysical or "G&G" costs. Exploration costs also include costs of carrying and retaining undeveloped properties, such as delay rentals, ad valorem taxes on properties, legal costs for title defense, the maintenance of land and lease records, dry hole contributions and bottom hole contributions, costs of drilling and equipping exploratory wells and costs of drilling exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells.

column1: Extended Product Warranty Accrual
column2: Amount as of the balance sheet date of the aggregate extended product warranty liability. Does not include the ending balance for the standard product warranty liability.

column1: Extended Product Warranty Accrual, Additions from Business Acquisition
column2: Liability for an extended product warranty acquired in a business acquisition. Does not include any liability for a standard warranty acquired in a business acquisition.

column1: Extended Product Warranty Accrual, Noncurrent
column2: Amount at end of the reporting period of the aggregate extended product warranty liability that is expected to be paid after one year from the balance sheet date or normal operating cycle, if longer. Does not include the balance for the standard product warranty liability.

column1: Extended Product Warranty Accrual, Decrease for Payments
column2: Amount of decrease in the extended product warranty accrual from payments made in cash or in kind to satisfy claims under the terms of the extended product warranty. Excludes standard product warranties.

column1: Extended Product Warranty Accrual, Increase for Warranties Issued
column2: Amount of increase in the extended product warranty accrual from warranties issued. Excludes standard product warranties.

column1: Facility Costs
column2: Facility expenses incurred related to gas and oil produced and sold during the reporting period.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Accounts Receivable
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Cash and Cash Equivalents
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Cash Surrender Value
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Commitments
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Derivative Instruments, Liabilities
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Equity Method Investments
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Federal Funds Sold and Securities Borrowed or Purchased under Agreements to Resell
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Foreign Currency Contract, Asset
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Foreign Currency Contracts
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Guarantees
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Investment in Federal Home Loan Bank Stock
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Investments
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Liabilities Related to Investment Contracts
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Loans Receivable
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Notes Receivable
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Premiums Receivable
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Retained Interest
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value, Concentration of Risk, Trading Account Assets
column2: This item represents disclosure of all significant concentrations of credit risk or market risk arising from the subject financial instrument (as defined), whether from an individual counterparty or groups of counterparties.

column1: Fair Value Disclosure, Off-balance Sheet Risks, Amount, Asset
column2: The fair value of financial assets, which are not recognized in the financial statements (off-balance sheet) because they fail to meet some other criterion for recognition.

column1: Fair Value Disclosure, Off-balance Sheet Risks, Face Amount, Asset
column2: The face amount of financial assets, which are not recognized in the financial statements (off-balance sheet) because they fail to meet some other criterion for recognition.

column1: Fair Value Hedge Assets
column2: Fair value of all derivative assets designated as fair value hedging instruments.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Percent Arbitrage Investments
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that are arbitrage investments for a given category of investments for which net asset value per share is calculated.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Percent Currencies
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that are currencies for a given category of investments for which net asset value per share is calculated.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Percent Debt Securities
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that are debt securities for a given category of investments for which net asset value per share is calculated.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Percent Domestic Equity Securities
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that are domestic equity securities for a given category of investments for which net asset value per share is calculated.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Percent Equity Securities
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that are equity securities for a given category of investments for which net asset value per share is calculated.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Percent Foreign Equity Securities
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that are foreign equity securities for a given category of investments for which net asset value per share is calculated.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Percent Real Estate
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that are real estate for a given category of investments for which net asset value per share is calculated.

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Planned Sale, Investments Not Identified, Number
column2: The total number of all investments, comprising or included in the major category, of those certain investments for which net asset value per share is calculated (including by unit, membership interest, or other equity (ownership interest) unit measure) (alternative investments) for which the entity has intentions to sell or liquidate, but the specific assets for sale or liquidation have not been identified (for example, the entity intends to sell 10 of its investments in hedge funds, but the individual investments to be sold have not been identified).

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Planned Sale, Investments Not Identified, Percentage
column2: The total percentage of all investments, comprising or included in the major category, of those certain investments for which net asset value per share is calculated (including by unit, membership interest, or other equity (ownership interest) unit measure) (alternative investments) for which the entity has intentions to sell or liquidate, but the specific assets for sale or liquidation have not been identified (for example, the entity intends to sell 20 percent of its investments in private equity funds, but the individual investments to be sold have not been identified).

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Planned Sale, Investments Not Identified, Value
column2: The total fair value for all investments, comprising or included in the major category, of those certain investments for which net asset value per share is calculated (including by unit, membership interest, or other equity (ownership interest) unit measure) (alternative investments) for which the entity has intentions to sell or liquidate, but the specific assets for sale or liquidation have not been identified (for example, the entity intends to sell $10,000,000 of its investments in private equity funds, but the individual investments to be sold have not been identified).

column1: Fair Value, Investments, Entities that Calculate Net Asset Value Per Share, Redemption Restriction, Percentage
column2: The percentage of the total value of investments that cannot be redeemed because of a redemption restriction as of the statement of financial position date.

column1: Fair Value of Securities Received as Collateral that Have Been Resold or Repledged
column2: Fair value of the collateral, or portion thereof, that has been re-pledged, delivered, or otherwise used.

column1: Federal Funds Purchased and Securities Loaned or Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of short term borrowing where a bank borrows, at the federal funds rate, from another bank and securities that an entity sells and agrees to repurchase at a specified date for a specified price.

column1: Federal Funds Purchased and Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase
column2: Amount after offset of short term borrowing where a bank borrows, at the federal funds rate, from another bank and securities that an entity sells and agrees to repurchase at a specified date for a specified price.

column1: Federal Funds Purchased, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of short term borrowing where a bank borrows, at the federal funds rate, from another bank.

column1: Federal Funds Sold
column2: The amount outstanding of funds lent to other depository institutions, securities brokers, or securities dealers in the form of Federal Funds sold; for example, immediately available funds lent under agreements or contracts that mature in one business day or roll over under a continuing contract, regardless of the nature of the transaction or the collateral involved, excluding overnight lending for commercial and industrial purposes. Also include Federal Funds sold under agreements to resell on a gross basis, excluding (1) sales of term Federal Funds, (2) due bills representing purchases of securities or other assets by the reporting bank that have not yet been delivered and similar instruments, (3) resale agreements that mature in more than one business day involving assets other than securities, and (4) yield maintenance dollar repurchase agreements.

column1: Federal Funds Sold and Securities Borrowed or Purchased under Agreements to Resell, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of federal funds sold and securities borrowed or purchased under agreements to resell.

column1: Federal Funds Sold and Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell
column2: Includes: (1) the amount outstanding of funds lent to other depository institutions, securities brokers, or securities dealers in the form of Federal Funds sold; for example, immediately available funds lent under agreements or contracts that mature in one business day or roll over under a continuing contract, regardless of the nature of the transaction or the collateral involved, excluding overnight lending for commercial and industrial purposes. Also include Federal Funds sold under agreements to resell on a gross basis, excluding (1) sales of term Federal Funds, (2) due bills representing purchases of securities or other assets by the reporting bank that have not yet been delivered and similar instruments, (3) resale agreements that mature in more than one business day involving assets other than securities, and (4) yield maintenance dollar repurchase agreements (Federal Funds Sold) and (2) the dollar amount outstanding of funds lent in the form of security resale agreements regardless of maturity, if the agreement requires the bank to resell the identical security purchased or a security that meets the definition of substantially the same in the case of a dollar roll. Also include purchases of participations in pools of securities, regardless of maturity (Securities Purchased Under Agreements to Re-sell).

column1: Federal Funds Sold and Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell Pledged as Collateral
column2: The fair value of federal funds sold and securities purchased under agreements to resell that serve as collateral for borrowings.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Activity for Year, Average Balance of Agreements Outstanding
column2: The calculated average balance outstanding for the year for all Federal Home Loan Bank advances as of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Activity for Year, Average Interest Rate at Period End
column2: The calculated weighted average interest rate for Federal Home Loan Bank advances outstanding as of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Activity for Year, Average Interest Rate for Year
column2: The calculated weighted average interest rate for Federal Home Loan Bank advances for the period ended as of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Activity for Year, Maximum Outstanding at any Month End
column2: The maximum balance outstanding at any month end during the period as of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Long-term Federal Home Loan Bank Advances, Current
column2: The current portion of Federal Home Loan Bank borrowings initially due beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, General Debt Obligations, Amount of Available, Unused Funds
column2: Amount of advances or credit lines available from the Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, General Debt Obligations, Disclosures, Interest Rate at Period End
column2: States the interest rate applicable to Federal Home Loan Bank advances outstanding as of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, General Debt Obligations, Maximum Amount Available
column2: Amount of maximum advances or credit lines available from the Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB).

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Average Interest Rate, after Five Years from Balance Sheet Date
column2: The weighted average interest rate applicable to the Federal Home Loan Bank advances which are due after five years of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Average Interest Rate of Amounts Due within One Year of Balance Sheet Date
column2: The weighted average interest rate applicable to the Federal Home Loan Bank advances which are due within one year of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Average Interest Rate, One to Two Years from Balance Sheet Date
column2: The weighted average interest rate applicable to the Federal Home Loan Bank advances which are due from one to two years of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Average Interest Rate, Two to Three Years from Balance Sheet Date
column2: The weighted average interest rate applicable to the Federal Home Loan Bank advances which are due from two to three years of the Balance Sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Fixed Rate
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have fixed interest.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Fixed Rate, after Five Years
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have fixed interest rates maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Fixed Rate, One to Five Years
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have fixed interest rates maturing between the next fiscal year and the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Fixed Rate, under One Year
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have fixed interest rates maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Floating Rate
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have floating interest rates.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Floating Rate, after Five Years
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have floating interest rates maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Floating Rate, One to Five Years
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have floating interest rates maturing between the next fiscal year and the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Floating Rate, under One Year
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances which have floating interest rates maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, One to Five Years
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) advances maturing between the next fiscal year and the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due after Year Five
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Year Five
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Year Two
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Year Four
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Year Three
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank, Advances, Maturities Summary, Due in Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of advances from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank Assessments
column2: Amount of Affordable Housing Program (AHP) assessments and Congressionally mandated Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) assessments.

column1: Federal Home Loan Bank Stock
column2: Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB) stock represents an equity interest in a FHLB. It does not have a readily determinable fair value because its ownership is restricted and it lacks a market (liquidity).

column1: Federal Reserve Bank Stock
column2: Federal Reserve Bank stock represents an equity interest in the Federal Reserve Bank. It does not have a readily determinable fair value because its ownership is restricted and it lacks a market (liquidity).

column1: Fee Income on Acceptances Executed
column2: Amount of amortization to income from discounts on short-term negotiable time drafts drawn on and accepted by an institution (also known as Banker's Acceptances).

column1: Fees Paid on Acceptances Resold
column2: Represents the amortization to expense from discounts on short-term negotiable time drafts drawn on and accepted by an institution (also known as Banker's Acceptances) which have been resold in the secondary market.

column1: FIFO Inventory Amount
column2: The amount of FIFO (first in first out) inventory present at the reporting date when inventory is also valued using different valuation methods.

column1: Film Costs
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in the physical production of a film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Film Costs, Amortized in Next Operating Cycle
column2: The amount of film costs related to completed films that are expected to be amortized during the upcoming operating cycle.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Accelerated Premium Revenue, Amount
column2: This element represents the amount of premium revenue on financial guarantee insurance contracts recognized during the period that was accelerated for revenue recognition purposes.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Claim Liability, Weighted Average Risk Free Discount Rate
column2: This element represents the weighted average risk free rate used to discount the claim liability related to financial guarantee insurance contracts.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Unearned Premium Revenue
column2: Amount of unearned premium revenue under contracts issued by an insurance entity that provide protection to the holder of a financial obligation from a financial loss in the event of a default.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Next Quarter
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the next fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Fourth Quarter
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the fourth fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Second Quarter
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the second fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Third Quarter
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the third fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year 11 Through 15
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the eleventh through fifteenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year 16 Through 20
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the sixteenth through twentieth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year 21 Through 25
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the twenty-first through twenty-fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year 26 Through 30
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the twenty-sixth through thirtieth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year 31 Through 35
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the thirty-first through thirty-fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year 36 Through 40
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the thirty-sixth through fortieth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year Six Through Ten
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the sixth through tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year Five
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year Two
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year Four
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Year Three
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Future Expected Premium Revenue to be Recognized, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of premium revenue under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be recognized in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Next Quarter
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the next fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Fourth Quarter
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the fourth fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Second Quarter
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the second fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Third Quarter
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the third fiscal quarter following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year 11 Through 15
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the eleventh through the fifteenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year 16 Through 20
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the sixteenth through the twentieth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year 21 Through 25
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the twenty-first through the twenty-fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year 26 Through 30
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the twenty-sixth through the thirtieth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year 31 Through 35
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the thirty-first through the thirty-fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year 36 Through 40
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the thirty-sixth through the fortieth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year Six Through Ten
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the sixth through the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year Five
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year Two
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year Four
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Year Three
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts expected to be collected in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable
column2: Amount of the premium receivable for financial guarantee insurance contracts reported in the statement of financial position. This element primarily would consist of those financial guarantee insurance contracts which premiums are to be collected over the contract period, but may, on occasion, include premiums which are to be collected in full at inception, but which straddle a financial reporting period.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Receivable, Premium Expected to be Collected
column2: Amount of premium receivables under financial guarantee insurance contracts.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Received over Contract Period, Premium Receivable
column2: Amount of premium receivable in the statement of financial position for financial guarantee insurance contracts where the premium is received over the contract period.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Received over Contract Period, Premium Receivable, Accretion
column2: The amount of accretion on premium receivable in the statement of income for financial guarantee insurance contracts where premium is received over the contract period.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Received over Contract Period, Premium Receivable, Weighted Average Risk Free Discount Rate
column2: This element represents the weighted average risk free rate used to discount the premiums expected to be collected for financial guarantee insurance contracts where the premium is to be received over the contract period.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Premium Received over Contract Period, Unearned Premium Revenue
column2: Amount of unearned premium revenue in the statement of financial position for financial guarantee insurance contracts where the premium is received over the contract period.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Risk Management Activities, Mitigating Claim Liabilities, Accrued Liabilities
column2: The amount of expense accrued as of the reporting date related to risk management activities (not including reinsurance) for the mitigating of claim liabilities related to financial guarantee insurance contracts.

column1: Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts, Risk Management Activities, Mitigating Claim Liabilities, Expense
column2: The amount of expense recognized during the period related to risk management activities (not including reinsurance) for the mitigating of claim liabilities related to financial guarantee insurance contracts.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned and Not Pledged, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of financial instruments and other positions owned by the entity including: (1) mortgages, mortgage-backed and asset backed securities; (2) US government and agency obligations; (3) state and municipal government obligations; (4) other sovereign government debt; (5) corporate obligations; (6) corporate equities; (7) principal investments; (8) derivative contracts; and (9) physical commodities. Excludes financial instruments and other positions owned and pledged as collateral to counterparties.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned and Pledged as Collateral, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of financial instruments and other positions owned by the entity and pledged to counterparties as collateral, including: (1) mortgages, mortgage-backed and asset backed securities; (2) US government and agency obligations; (3) state and municipal government obligations; (4) other sovereign government debt; (5) corporate obligations; (6) corporate equities; (7) principal investments; (8) derivative contracts; and (9) physical commodities.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Corporate Equities, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in corporate stocks (common and preferred), stock options, warrants and any other financial instrument which represents, or provides the ability to obtain, ownership rights in a corporation. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Mortgages, Mortgage-backed and Asset-backed Securities, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in mortgages, mortgage backed securities (investment instruments that represent ownership of an undivided interest in a group of mortgages, where principal and interest from the individual mortgages are used to pay investors' principal and interest on the mortgage backed security) and asset-backed securities that are primarily paid from the cash flows of a discrete pool of receivables or other financial assets (such as credit-card receivables), either fixed or revolving, that by their terms convert into cash within a finite time period. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Other, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value of firm holdings in securities classified as other. Includes pledged and unpledged holdings.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Other Sovereign Government Obligations, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in fixed income obligations issued by foreign governments. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Physical Commodities, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in physical commodity contracts (for example, agricultural products, metals and energy). Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, Principal Investments, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in private equity, mezzanine, venture capital, merchant banking, real estate and special situations investments. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Financial Instruments, Owned, State and Municipal Government Obligations, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in fixed income obligations issued by state and local governments and authorities. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

column1: Financial Instruments Sold, Not yet Purchased, Corporate Debt
column2: Fair value of obligations arising from corporate debt obligations sold short.

column1: Financial Instruments Sold, Not yet Purchased, Corporate Equities
column2: Fair value of obligations arising from corporate equity sold short.

column1: Financial Instruments Sold, Not yet Purchased, Mortgages, Mortgage-backed and Asset-backed Securities
column2: Fair value of obligations arising from mortgages, mortgage-backed securities and asset-backed securities sold short.

column1: Financial Instruments Sold, Not yet Purchased, Other Sovereign Government Debt
column2: Fair value of obligations arising from foreign government debt obligations short.

column1: Financial Instruments Sold, Not yet Purchased, State and Municipal Government Obligations
column2: Fair value of obligations arising from state and municipal debt obligations sold short.

column1: Financial Services Liabilities
column2: For entities that provide full or partial financing and servicing for customers supplementary to its major operations (such as a manufacturer or a homebuilder providing and servicing loans to buyers), represents the liabilities associated with such activities, including accounts payable and accrued liabilities.

column1: Financing Receivable, Recorded Investment, 90 Days Past Due and Still Accruing
column2: Recorded investment in financing receivables that are 90 days or more past due and still accruing.

column1: Financing Receivable, Significant Purchases
column2: The amount of any significant purchases of financing receivables during the reporting period.

column1: Financing Receivable, Significant Sales
column2: The amount of any significant sales of financing receivables during the reporting period.

column1: Finite-Lived Core Deposits, Gross
column2: Bank deposits belonging to an acquired bank that can be counted on as a stable source of lending funds. These deposits have the following attributes: predictable costs and low sensitivity to interest rates. This intangible asset is usually amortized over its estimated useful life.

column1: Finite-Lived Customer Lists, Gross
column2: Gross carrying amount before accumulated amortization as of the balance sheet date of an asset comprised of customer information, acquired in a business combination or other transaction, having a finite beneficial life.

column1: Finite-Lived Noncompete Agreements, Gross
column2: Gross carrying amount before accumulated amortization as of the balance sheet date of payments made to third parties in exchange for their agreement not to engage in specified competitive practices in specified geographic territories for a specified period of time.

column1: Finite-Lived Trademarks, Gross
column2: Gross carrying amount before accumulated amortization as of the balance sheet date for the rights acquired through registration of a trademark to gain or protect exclusive use of a business name, symbol or other device or style for a specified period of time.

column1: Finite-Lived Trade Names, Gross
column2: Gross carrying amount before accumulated amortization as of the balance sheet date of the rights acquired through registration of a trade name to gain or protect exclusive use thereof for a reasonably expected period of economic benefit.

column1: Fixtures and Equipment, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation of fixtures and equipment. Includes, but is not limited to, machinery, equipment, and engines.

column1: Flight Equipment, Gross
column2: The gross amount of long-lived, depreciable flight assets used in the entity's principle business operations, including owned aircraft and on capital lease, as well as capitalized improvements.

column1: Flight Equipment, Net
column2: The net amount of long-lived, depreciable flight assets used in the entity's principle business operations, including owned aircraft and on capital lease, as well as capitalized improvements.

column1: Foreign Currency Fair Value Hedge Asset at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all derivative assets designated as foreign currency fair value hedging instruments.

column1: Foreign Financial Institutions, Actual Deposits
column2: The amount of deposits held by branches of foreign institutions.

column1: Foreign Financial Institutions, Actual Reserve Amount
column2: The amount of reserves held by branches of foreign institutions.

column1: Foreign Financial Institutions, Mandated Deposits
column2: The amount of mandated deposits required of branches of foreign institutions.

column1: Foreign Financial Institutions, Mandated Reserve Amount
column2: The mandated reserve amounts required of branches of foreign institutions.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance Transactions, Claims Additions to Underwriting Balances
column2: The amount for insured risks paid or due and owing to the ceding entity, recorded as additions to net premiums written minus net losses paid minus the sum of loss adjustment expenses and underwriting costs and expenses on insurance ceded to companies outside the United States.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance Transactions, Claims Recognized as Income
column2: Amounts for insured risks on policies that have been ceded to entities outside the United States and for which claims income is paid or due and owing to the ceding entity.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance Transactions, Expense Additions to Underwriting Balances
column2: The amount of expenses on insured risks paid or due and owing to the ceding entity, recorded as additions to net premiums written minus net losses paid minus the sum of loss adjustment expenses and underwriting costs and expenses on insurance ceded to companies outside the United States.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance Transactions, Expense Recognized as Income
column2: The amount of insurance policy expenses on insurance that has been ceded to companies outside the United States and for which amounts are paid or due and owing from those foreign companies.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance Transactions, Premium Additions to Underwriting Balances
column2: The amount recorded as additions to net premiums written minus net losses paid minus the sum of loss adjustment expenses and underwriting costs and expenses on insurance ceded to companies outside the United States.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance Transactions, Premiums Recognized as Income
column2: The amount recorded as income on insurance ceded to companies outside the United States.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance under Open Year Method, Claims
column2: Amount of foreign reinsurance claims accounted for under the open year method in the underwriting account.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance under Open Year Method, Expense
column2: Amount of foreign reinsurance expenses accounted for under the open year method in the underwriting account.

column1: Foreign Reinsurance under Open Year Method, Premiums
column2: Amount of foreign reinsurance premiums accounted for under the open year method in the underwriting account.

column1: Forward Contract Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Forward Rate Per Share
column2: The per share price of the Company's stock at which the contract holder of the freestanding contract has the right to purchase or sell the Company's stock at a future date.

column1: Forward Contract Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Indexed Shares
column2: The number of issuer's shares to which the forward contract is indexed.

column1: Forward Contract Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Shares
column2: The maximum number of shares that could be issued to net share settle a contract, if applicable. If a contract does not have a fixed or determinable maximum number of shares that may be required to be issued, disclose the fact that a potentially infinite number of shares could be issued to settle the contract.

column1: Franchisor Costs
column2: Aggregate costs incurred that are directly related to activities, including but not limited to, generating franchise revenues from franchisor owned outlets and franchised outlets.

column1: Frequent Flier Liability, Current
column2: Value of revenue deferred or cost to provide future products or services, primarily air transportation, associated with programs used by airlines to encourage passenger loyalty by providing rewards geared to the frequency of travel on the sponsoring airline, typically in the form of frequent flyer miles, points, or segments that can be accumulated and converted into free or discounted travel or other redemption options. Used to reflect the current portion of the liability (within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Frequent Flier Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Value of revenue deferred or cost to provide future products or services, primarily air transportation, associated with programs used by airlines to encourage passenger loyalty by providing rewards geared to the frequency of travel on the sponsoring airline, typically in the form of frequent flyer miles, points, or segments that can be accumulated and converted into free or discounted travel or other redemption options. Used to reflect the noncurrent portion of the liability.

column1: Fuel Costs, Gross of Hedging
column2: The cost for fuel, incurred during the period, before considering the impacts of any related hedging activities.

column1: Funds Held for Clients
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the funds held on behalf of others and that are expected to be liquidated within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. This does not include funds held under reinsurance agreements.

column1: Funds Held under Reinsurance Agreements, Asset
column2: Amount of the reinsurer's funds held on its behalf by the ceding insurer, including funds held in trust, under reinsurance treaties or contracts with the assuming insurer as security for the payment of the obligations thereunder.

column1: Funds Held under Reinsurance Agreements, Liability
column2: Amount of funds held as security for payments to be received under reinsurance contracts.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Thereafter
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Five Years
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Four Years
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Three Years
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Gain from Components Excluded from Assessment of Cash Flow Hedge Effectiveness
column2: The gain relating to components of the gain (loss) on the cash flow hedging instrument excluded from the assessment of cash flow hedge effectiveness. Recognized in earnings.

column1: Gain from Components Excluded from Assessment of Fair Value Hedge Effectiveness
column2: Gain relating to components of the gain (loss) on the fair value hedging instrument excluded from the assessment of fair value hedge effectiveness. Recognized in earnings.

column1: Gain from Hedged Firm Commitment Not Qualifying as Fair Value Hedge
column2: Amount of gain recognized in earnings when a hedged firm commitment no longer qualifies as a fair value hedge.

column1: Gain on Discontinuation of Cash Flow Hedge Due to Forecasted Transaction Probable of Not Occurring
column2: The amount of gain reclassified into earnings in the period when cash flow hedge is discontinued because it is probable that the original forecasted transactions will not occur by the end of the original period or an additional two month time period.

column1: Gain on Fair Value Hedge Ineffectiveness
column2: Amount of gain recognized in the income statement from the hedging ineffectiveness of a fair value hedge.

column1: Gain Recognized on Assets Transferred to Separate Account, Gross
column2: Amount of gain recognized during the reporting period on assets that were transferred into separate accounts.

column1: Gas Balancing Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable to an underproduced working interest owner when an overproduced working interest owner has sold gas in excess of the party's ownership percentage. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Gas Balancing Payable
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable to an underproduced working interest owner when an overproduced working interest owner has sold gas in excess of the party's ownership percentage.

column1: Gas Purchase Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for purchases of natural gas. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Gas Purchase Payable
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for purchases of natural gas.

column1: General and Administrative Costs in Inventory, Amount Incurred
column2: Aggregate amount of general and administrative costs incurred in each period and charged to inventory.

column1: General and Administrative Costs in Inventory, Amount Remaining
column2: Actual or estimated amount of general and administrative costs remaining in inventory.

column1: General Partners' Capital Account, Units Authorized
column2: The number of general partner units authorized to be issued.

column1: General Partners' Capital Account, Units Issued
column2: The number of general partner units issued.

column1: General Partners' Capital Account, Units Outstanding
column2: The number of general partner units outstanding.

column1: General Partners' Contributed Capital
column2: The amount of capital contributed by the general partner.

column1: General Partners' Cumulative Cash Distributions
column2: Aggregate cumulative cash distributions made to the general partner.

column1: Good Faith and Margin Deposits with Broker-Dealers
column2: Amount of right to receive cash and securities on deposit with broker-dealers to demonstrate an intention to complete a purchase (good faith deposit) and collateral deposited by counterparty to cover the credit risk assumed (margin deposit).

column1: Goodwill, Not Allocated, Amount
column2: Portion of goodwill not yet allocated to reportable segments.

column1: Government Contract Receivable
column2: The amount of receivables that are derived from government contracts.

column1: Government Contract Receivable, Progress Payments Offset
column2: The amount of progress payments offset against unbilled government contract receivables.

column1: Grandfathered ESOP Expense Recognition, Actual Interest Incurred on ESOP Debt
column2: For grandfathered ESOP shares acquired prior to January 1, 1993, the actual interest incurred on debt for obligations that the employer may secure on behalf of the ESOP.

column1: Grandfathered ESOP Expense Recognition, Cash Contributions to ESOP
column2: For grandfathered ESOP shares acquired prior to January 1, 1993, the amount of cash contributions made to the ESOP.

column1: Grandfathered ESOP Expense Recognition, Dividends Paid to ESOP
column2: For grandfathered ESOP shares acquired prior to January 1, 1993, the dividends paid to the ESOP.

column1: Grandfathered ESOP Expense Recognition, Dividends Used by ESOP for Debt Service
column2: For grandfathered ESOP shares acquired prior to January 1, 1993, the amount of ESOP dividends used to pay debt service by the sop.

column1: Grants Receivable
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants.

column1: Grants Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount due after one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants.

column1: Gross Billings
column2: Disclosure of gross transaction volume for revenues which are reported net.
