column1: Guaranteed Interest Contracts
column2: The amount of the liability as of the balance sheet date pertaining to the guarantee given by the insurance entity to contract holders of a specified rate of return (a guaranteed yield) on their investments for a specified period.

column1: Guarantees, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of guarantee, including, but not limited to, financial standby letter of credit, fair value guarantee, guarantee of collection of scheduled contractual cash flows from financial assets, and contracts that contingently require the guarantor to make payments or perform services.

column1: Guaranty Assets
column2: The carrying amount of the contractual right to receive fees, as compensation in exchange for providing a guarantee to a third party, over life of the guarantee.

column1: Guaranty Liabilities
column2: This item represents a non-contingent liability for the fair value of an obligation to stand ready to perform over the term of a guaranty issued in the event that specified triggering events or conditions occur.

column1: Health Care Organization, Contract Acquisition Expense
column2: Costs associated with marketing of subscriber contracts and member enrollments. For example, commissions paid to agents or brokers and incentive compensation based on new enrollments. Includes also salaries of the marketing director and staff, general marketing brochures, and general advertising and promotion expenses.

column1: Health Care Organization, Expenses, Gross
column2: Total expenses of a HCO before stop-loss insurance recoveries. Costs of services rendered (including costs of services rendered but not yet reported).

column1: Health Care Organization, Stop Loss Insurance Premium Expense
column2: Stop-loss insurance premiums recognized as expense. In stop-loss insurance, prepaid health care providers or associated entities transfer portions of their financial risks to other companies. A provider typically contracts to recover health care costs in excess of stated amounts during the contract periods.

column1: Health Care Organization, Stop Loss Insurance Recoveries
column2: Amount of stop-loss insurance recoveries. In stop-loss insurance, prepaid health care providers or associated entities transfer portions of their financial risks to other companies. A provider typically contracts to recover health care costs in excess of stated amounts during the contract periods.

column1: Health Care Trust Fund, Assets Limited as to Use, Current
column2: The portion of trust fund assets classified as current assets because they are expected to be liquidated to pay current liabilities as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Health Care Trust Fund, Assets Limited as to Use, Noncurrent
column2: Total trust fund assets, excluding those classified as current assets because they are expected to be liquidated to pay current liabilities as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Hedging Assets, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the asset arising from a financial instrument or a contract used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), and which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Hedging Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the asset arising from a financial instrument or a contract used to hedge price changes in underlying assets, and which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of after a year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Hedging Liabilities, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the liability arising from a financial instrument or a contract used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), and which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Amortized Cost before Other than Temporary Impairment
column2: Amount before other than temporary impairment (OTTI) accretion, of investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Current
column2: Amount after other than temporary impairment (OTTI) accretion, of investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity, expected to be converted to cash, sold or exchanged within one year or the normal operating cycle.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, without Single Maturity Date, Fair Value
column2: Amount of held-to-maturity debt securities at fair value that do not have a single maturity date and which the entity has decided to disclose separately rather than allocating the fair value over several maturity groupings.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, without Single Maturity Date, Net Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of debt securities accounted for as held-to-maturity, net of adjustments including, but not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments, over several maturity groupings.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Number of Positions
column2: Disclosure regarding factors used to determine that the impairment of securities categorized as held-to-maturity where cost exceeds fair value is not an other than temporary impairment (OTTI). This item contains disclosure of the number of investment positions in the held-to-maturity investments determined to be temporarily impaired.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Other, Default Rate
column2: This item represents the default rate of the underlying assets in the security that were considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are not other-than-temporarily impaired.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Other, Delinquency Rate
column2: This item represents the delinquency rate of the underlying assets in the security that were considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are not other-than-temporarily impaired.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Other, Fair Value Volatility, Rate
column2: This item represents the volatility rate related to the fair value of the underlying assets in the security, represented as a percentage, which was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are not other-than-temporarily impaired.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Other, Level of Subordination
column2: This item represents the current level of subordination of the entity's receipt of consideration should the assets underlying the security be liquidated when the level of subordination was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are not other-than-temporarily impaired.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Other, Percentage of Nonperforming Assets
column2: This item represents the percentage of nonperforming assets that the underlying assets in the security represent and which were considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are not other-than-temporarily impaired.

column1: Held-to-maturity, Securities in Unrealized Loss Positions, Qualitative Disclosure, Other, Third Party Guarantees, Amount
column2: Amount of third party guarantees against loss of value in the underlying assets of a held-to-maturity security in an unrealized loss position and for which other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) have not been recognized.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Noncurrent
column2: Amount after other than temporary impairment (OTTI) accretion, of investments in debt securities classified as held-to-maturity, not expected to be converted to cash, sold or exchanged within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Restricted
column2: The carrying amount of securities categorized as held-to-maturity which serve as security for borrowings or other arrangements.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Sold at Par
column2: The aggregate value of securities held, which were categorized as held-to-maturity, for which the interest rate reset through an auction process, that failed to be liquidated through auction, and which were sold at par value during the period.

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, Unpaid Principal Balance
column2: Amount of unpaid principal balance of impaired financing receivables with related allowance for credit losses and without related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Impairment of Retained Interest
column2: The charge against earnings to reduce the carrying value of an interest continued to be held by the transferor in a securitized financial instrument.

column1: Incentive Distribution, Distribution Per Unit
column2: Per-share or per-unit amount of incentive dividend declared and paid to managing member or general partner.

column1: Incentive from Lessor
column2: This item represents the deferred credit for an incentive or inducement received by a lessee from a lessor, in order to motivate the lessee to enter the lease agreement, which incentive or inducement is to be recognized as a reduction of rental expense over the lease term.

column1: Incentive to Lessee
column2: This item represents the deferred charge for an incentive or inducement granted by a lessor to a lessee, in order to motivate the lessee to enter the lease agreement, which incentive or inducement is to be recognized as a reduction of rental revenue over the lease term.

column1: Income Taxes Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount due after one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from tax authorities as of the balance sheet date representing refunds of overpayments or recoveries based on agreed-upon resolutions of disputes.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Dilutive Effect of Conversion of Debt Securities
column2: Additional shares included in the calculation of diluted EPS as a result of the potentially dilutive effect of convertible debt securities using the if-converted method.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Dilutive Effect of Equity Forward Agreements
column2: Additional shared included in the calculation of diluted EPS as a result of the potentially dilutive effect of equity forward arrangements using the reverse treasury stock method.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Dilutive Effect of Equity Unit Purchase Agreements
column2: Additional shares included in the calculation of diluted EPS as a result of the potentially dilutive effect of equity unit purchase agreements using the treasury stock method.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Dilutive Effect of Written Put Options
column2: Additional shares included in the calculation of diluted EPS as a result of the potentially dilutive effect of outstanding written put options using the reverse treasury stock method.

column1: Indefinite-Lived Contractual Rights
column2: Carrying amount (original costs adjusted for previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date of rights with an indefinite period of benefit that arose from a contractual arrangement with a third party (not including franchise rights and license agreements).

column1: Indefinite-Lived Domestic Slots and Routes
column2: Carrying amount, (original cost adjusted for any previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date, of domestic slots, route authorities, airport operating and gate lease rights and related intangibles.

column1: Indefinite-Lived Franchise Rights
column2: Carrying amount (original costs adjusted for previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date for the rights acquired through a franchise arrangement having an indefinite period of benefit.

column1: Indefinite-Lived International Slots and Routes
column2: Carrying amount, (original cost adjusted for any previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date, of international slots, route authorities, airport operating and gate lease rights and related intangibles.

column1: Indefinite-Lived License Agreements
column2: Carrying amount (original costs adjusted for previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date for the capitalized costs to acquire rights under a license arrangement (for example, to sell specified products in a specified territory) having an indefinite period of benefit.

column1: Indefinite-Lived Slots and Routes
column2: Carrying amount, (original cost adjusted for any previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date, of slots, route authorities, airport operating and gate lease rights and related intangibles.

column1: Indefinite-Lived Trademarks
column2: Carrying amount (original costs adjusted for previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date for the rights acquired through registration of a trademark to gain or protect exclusive use of a business name, symbol or other device or style for a projected indefinite period of benefit.

column1: Indefinite-Lived Trade Names
column2: Carrying amount (original costs adjusted for previously recognized amortization and impairment) as of the balance sheet date for the rights acquired through registration of a trade name to gain or protect exclusive use thereof for a projected indefinite period of benefit.

column1: Initial Franchise Fees
column2: The amount of initial franchise fees.

column1: Insurance Agency Management Fee
column2: Fees earned during the period for providing management services.

column1: Insurance Investment Income
column2: Investment income associated with the company's insurance services.

column1: Insurance Receivable for Malpractice
column2: The amount receivable from insurance and similar arrangements for reimbursement and payment of malpractice claims and litigation costs.

column1: Insurance Receivable for Malpractice, Current
column2: The current portion of the amount receivable from insurance and similar arrangements for reimbursement and payment of malpractice claims and litigation costs.

column1: Insurance Receivable for Malpractice, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent portion of the receivable from insurance and similar arrangements for reimbursement and payment of malpractice claims and litigation costs.

column1: Insurance Settlements Receivable
column2: Amount due in settlement of a claim for reimbursement from an insurance company when the Company has suffered a loss covered under an insurance policy.

column1: Insurance Settlements Receivable, Current
column2: Amount due in settlement of a claim for reimbursement from an insurance company when the Company has suffered a loss covered under an insurance policy. For classified balance sheets, represents the current amount receivable, that is amounts expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Insurance Settlements Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount due after one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) of amount due in settlement of a claim for reimbursement from an insurance company when the Company has suffered a loss covered under an insurance policy.

column1: Insurance Tax
column2: Represents total insurance tax expense reflected in the income statement for each period presented.

column1: Interest and Dividends Payable, Current
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of (a) interest payable on all forms of debt, including trade payables, that has been incurred, and (b) dividends declared but unpaid on equity securities issued by the entity and outstanding (also includes dividends collected on behalf of another owner of securities that are being held by the entity). Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Interest and Dividends Payable
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of (a) interest payable on all forms of debt, including trade payables, that has been incurred, and (b) dividends declared but unpaid on equity securities issued by the entity and outstanding (also includes dividends collected on behalf of another owner of securities that are being held by the entity).

column1: Interest-bearing Deposit Liabilities
column2: The aggregate of all domestic and foreign interest-bearing deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Deposit Liabilities, Domestic
column2: Total amount of interest-bearing domestic deposit liabilities, which may include brokered, retail, demand, checking, notice of withdrawal, money market and other interest-bearing deposits.

column1: Interest-bearing Deposit Liabilities, Foreign
column2: Amount of foreign interest-bearing deposits held by the entity.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Brokered
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic third-party deposits placed by or through the assistance of a deposit broker, also known as brokered deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Certificates of Deposits
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic certificate of deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Money Market
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic money market demand account deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Negotiable Order of Withdrawal (NOW)
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic negotiable order of withdrawal (NOW) demand deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Other Time Deposit
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic deposit liabilities classified as other. Excludes certificates of deposit.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Retail
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic retail deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Savings
column2: Amount of interest-bearing domestic savings deposit liabilities. Saving deposits bear interest and have no stated maturity.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Brokered
column2: Amount of interest-bearing foreign third-party deposits placed by or through the assistance of a deposit broker, also known as brokered deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Certificates of Deposits
column2: Amount of interest-bearing certificates of deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Checking
column2: Amount of interest-bearing checking deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Demand
column2: Amount of money in interest-bearing foreign accounts that entitle the depositor to withdraw funds at any time without prior notice, also known as demand deposits. Checking and negotiable order withdrawals (NOW) are the most common forms of demand deposits.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Money Market
column2: Amount of interest-bearing money market demand account deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Negotiable Order of Withdrawal (NOW)
column2: Amount of interest-bearing negotiable order of withdrawal (NOW) deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Other Time Deposits
column2: Amount of interest-bearing time deposit liabilities other than certificates of deposit in foreign banking offices.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Retail
column2: Amount of interest-bearing retail deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Savings
column2: Amount of interest-bearing savings deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Interest-bearing Foreign Deposit, Time Deposits
column2: Amount of interest-bearing time deposits in foreign banking offices. Time deposits bear interest for a fixed, stated period of time and include certificate of deposits and individual retirement accounts.

column1: Interest Expense, Deposits from Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of interest expense on interest-bearing deposits from another Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities
column2: Aggregate amount of all interest expense on domestic deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Brokered
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic brokered deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Certificates of Deposit
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic certificates of deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Checking
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic checking deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Demand
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic demand deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Money Market
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic money market demand account deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Other Time Deposit
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic time deposit liabilities other than certificates of liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Retail
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic retail deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Savings
column2: Amount of interest expense on domestic savings deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Time Deposit
column2: Amount of interest expense on time deposit liabilities.

column1: Interest Expense, Loans from Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of interest expense on loans received from another Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB).

column1: Interest Income, Deposits with Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of interest income from interest-bearing funds deposited into another Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Interest Income, Loans to Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of interest income from loans to another Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Interest Paid, Discontinued Operations
column2: The amount of cash paid during the current period for interest owed on debt associated with discontinued operations.

column1: Interest Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of noncurrent interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.

column1: Transferor's Interests in Transferred Financial Assets, Fair Value
column2: The carrying amount (fair value) as of the balance sheet date of the transferor's interests in transferred financial assets (typically securitized receivables, generally not involved in the collection of principal) following transfer of significant portions of such financial instruments to other parties. Such interests could be ancillary cash flows and interest-only strips.

column1: Interim Period, Costs Not Allocable Amount, First Item
column2: The amount of the cost or expense incurred during an interim period that cannot be readily identified with the activities or benefits of other interim periods and are charged to the interim period in which incurred.

column1: Interim Period, Costs Not Allocable Amount, Second Item
column2: The amount of the cost or expense incurred during an interim period that cannot be readily identified with the activities or benefits of other interim periods and are charged to the interim period in which incurred.

column1: Interim Period, Costs Not Allocable Amount, Third Item
column2: The amount of the cost or expense incurred during an interim period that cannot be readily identified with the activities or benefits of other interim periods and are charged to the interim period in which incurred.

column1: Intermediate-life Plants, Accumulated Costs
column2: The amount of accumulated costs related to intermediate-life plants.

column1: Inventory Amount, Unpriced Change Orders for Long-term Contracts or Programs
column2: Amount of unpriced change orders or other similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization included in inventory as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Inventory, Buildings and Improvements
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of building structures held as inventory including any additions, improvements, or renovations to those structures.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Crude Oil, Products and Merchandise
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of finished goods inventories for petroleum products, crude oil, petrochemical products, and other oil and gas inventories.

column1: Inventory, Finished Goods and Work in Process, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation reserves of merchandise or goods held by the entity that are readily available for sale and items held by the entity which are partially complete or in the process of being readied for sale.

column1: Inventory, Finished Goods and Work in Process, Net of Reserves
column2: The aggregated amount of merchandise or goods held by the entity and readily available for future sale plus items held by the entity which are partially complete or in the process of being readied for future sale. This amount is net of valuation reserves and adjustments.

column1: Inventory, Finished Homes
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of homes that have been finished and are ready for sale, net of valuation allowance and impairment loss.

column1: Inventory for Long-term Contracts or Programs, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves, and progress payments, of inventory associated with long-term contracts, expected to be sold, or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Inventory for Long-term Contracts or Programs, General and Administrative Costs Included in Inventory
column2: The actual or estimated amount of general and administrative expense remaining in inventory as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Inventory for Long-term Contracts or Programs, General and Administrative Expense Incurred
column2: Amount of general and administrative costs charged to inventory.

column1: Inventory, Gas in Storage Underground, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of natural gas stored underground in depleted gas reservoirs, aquifers, or salt caverns to meet future seasonal and peak load demands and also as insurance against unforeseen supply disruptions, and deemed to be a noncurrent asset because it is not expected to be used within 12 months or in the normal operating cycle.

column1: Inventory, Homes under Construction
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of capitalized construction costs of homes for future sale.

column1: Inventory, Land Held for Development and Sale
column2: Carrying amount net of impairment reserves as of the balance sheet date primarily consisting of deposits for land purchases (including option payments), related acquisition costs, and land which is not expected to be developed in the next two years.

column1: Inventory, Land Held-for-sale
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of parcels of land held for sale, and on which the entity has no intention or no further intention to perform construction activities.

column1: Inventory, Operative Builders
column2: The net carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the sum of the various components of an operative builder's inventory, including finished homes. Operative builders primarily consist of entities that develop land, construct residential homes and commercial and industrial buildings thereon, and sell them to home buyers and operators of the commercial and industrial properties.

column1: Inventory, Operative Builders, Other
column2: Amount of inventory used in the development of real estate classified as other.

column1: Inventory, Ore Stockpiles on Leach Pads, Gross
column2: Amount before last-in first-out (LIFO) and valuation reserves of ore stockpile material contained on a leach pad, for example, but not limited to, copper or gold ore.

column1: Inventory, Parts and Components, Net of Reserves
column2: Carrying amount, net of valuation reserves and adjustments, as of the balance sheet date for elements of machinery or equipment held for the purpose of replacing similar parts in the course of repair or maintenance.

column1: Inventory, Raw Materials and Purchased Parts, Net of Reserves
column2: Carrying amount, net of valuation reserves and adjustments, as of the balance sheet date of items purchased for use as components of a finished product or pieces of machinery and equipment plus any items in their natural and unrefined state. This element may be used when the reporting entity combines raw materials and purchased parts into an aggregate amount.

column1: Inventory, Raw Materials and Supplies, Gross
column2: Gross amount of unprocessed materials to be used in manufacturing or production process and supplies that will be consumed.

column1: Inventory, Raw Materials and Supplies, Net of Reserves
column2: Aggregated amount of unprocessed materials to be used in manufacturing or production process and supplies that will be consumed. This amount is net of valuation reserves and adjustments.

column1: Inventory, Raw Materials, Net of Reserves
column2: Carrying amount, net of valuation reserves and adjustments, as of the balance sheet date of unprocessed items to be consumed in the manufacturing or production process.

column1: Inventory, Real Estate
column2: Total of (1) improvements, (2) held-for-sale, (3) land and land under development, (4) construction-in-process, (5) mortgage loans held-in-inventory, and (6) other real estate investments which are considered inventory due to being held for sale or disposition.

column1: Inventory, Real Estate, Construction in Process
column2: Cost of real estate projects incurred for projects for eventual sale or transfer (condominium or time share projects, vacation clubs).

column1: Inventory, Real Estate, Held-for-sale
column2: Represents properties which were acquired directly or through foreclosure for which a committed plan to sell exists and an active program to market such properties has been initiated.

column1: Inventory, Real Estate, Improvements
column2: Represents improvements to real estate during development for ultimate sale to third parties. Improvements may consist of project infrastructure and other expenditures necessary to completion of the development project which is generally of a long-term nature.

column1: Inventory, Real Estate, Land and Land Development Costs
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date, net of valuation allowances and impairment losses, of costs of land expected to be developed in the near term plus capitalized costs of development, for purposes of selling completed units to home buyers or commercial or industrial entities..

column1: Inventory, Real Estate, Mortgage Loans Held in Inventory
column2: Represents mortgage loans held in inventory primarily for sale to others (third parties, businesses, legal entities) in the ordinary course of business.

column1: Inventory, Real Estate, Other
column2: Amount of investment in certain other real estate investments not specifically identified elsewhere in the existing taxonomy.

column1: Inventory, Real Estate, Timeshare Available-for-sale
column2: Amount of real estate which is available for sale in the form of shared property ownership in which rights vest in several owners (buyers, timeshare holders) to use the property for a specified period each year (timeshare). Included in this item would be real estate assets in which timeshares are for sale, such as in condominiums at timeshare resorts. Excluded from this item would be assets, other than real estate, in which the Entity has sold or intends to sell timeshares, such as for cruises, recreational vehicles, campgrounds, aircraft (fractional ownership) and other types of rights.

column1: Investment Contract Volume
column2: The volume of a commodity or material specified in an investment contract.

column1: Investment Contract Weight
column2: The weight of a commodity or material specified in an investment contract. For this element, weight may be specified using units of weight (such as pounds) or units of mass (such as kilograms) since in commercial practice, the term 'weight' tends to be interchangeable with 'mass'.

column1: Investment Foreign Currency, Contract, Amount Purchased
column2: The amount of a currency that the reporting entity is obligated to purchase at settlement.

column1: Investment Foreign Currency, Contract, Amount Sold
column2: The amount of a currency that the reporting entity is obligated to sell at settlement.

column1: Investment in Federal Home Loan Bank Stock, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of investments in Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) stock.

column1: Investment in Physical Commodities
column2: Investments held in physical commodities, such as gold, silver, platinum, crude oil, coal, sugar, rice, wheat.

column1: Investment-related Liabilities
column2: The aggregate amount of liabilities as of the balance sheet date for obligations incurred in connection with the entity's investments.

column1: Investments and Other Noncurrent Assets
column2: Amount of investments, and noncurrent assets classified as other.

column1: Investments in Power and Distribution Projects
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of investments in power and distribution projects that are expected to be realized after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Investment Warrants, Exercise Price
column2: Exercise price of the warrants.

column1: Japanese Welfare Pension Insurance Law, Government Subsidies
column2: The amount of the subsidy from the transfer of employee pension fund liabilities to the Japanese government. The amount of this subsidy excludes any amounts related to previously accrued salary progression.

column1: Japanese Welfare Pension Insurance Law, Previously Accrued Salary Progression Derecognition
column2: The amount of the derecognition of previously accrued salary progression.

column1: Junior Subordinated Debenture Owed to Unconsolidated Subsidiary Trust
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, the carrying value of junior subordinated long-term debt owed to unconsolidated subsidiary trusts as of the balance sheet date. Such debt places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment in liquidation of the entity's assets and was initially scheduled to be repaid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

column1: Junior Subordinated Debenture Owed to Unconsolidated Subsidiary Trust, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent portion of the carrying value of junior subordinated long-term debt owed to unconsolidated subsidiary trusts as of the balance sheet date. Such debt places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment in liquidation of the entity's assets and was initially scheduled to be repaid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

column1: Junior Subordinated Notes, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of long-term debt (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer) identified as Junior Subordinated Notes, which have a lower priority than senior instruments, excluding current portion.

column1: Junior Subordinated Notes, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of portion of long-term debt due within one year or the operating cycle if longer identified as Junior Subordinated Notes, which have a lower priority than senior instruments.

column1: Land Available for Development
column2: Carrying amount of land available for development.

column1: Land Available-for-sale
column2: Carrying value of land held for sale.

column1: Land Improvements
column2: Amount before accumulated deprecation and depletion of additions or improvements to real estate held for productive use. Examples include, but are not limited to, walkways, driveways, fences, and parking lots.

column1: Landing Fees and Other Rentals
column2: Direct costs incurred at airports in which the entity conducts flight operations. The costs primarily consist of fees paid to the airport authority for takeoff and landing, gate space and facilities, allocations of common space such as security and other terminal costs and fuel storage facilities.

column1: Land under Purchase Options, Not Recorded
column2: Discloses the total purchase price of land option agreements that were not recorded.

column1: Land under Purchase Options, Recorded
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of land not owned but under a contract in which the entity has an option to purchase the land.

column1: Late Fee Income Generated by Servicing Financial Assets, Amount
column2: All amounts that are due to the servicer of a financial asset as a result of the debt holder not meeting the monthly payment terms.

column1: Lease Incentive, Payable, Current
column2: This item represents an incentive or inducement contractually stipulated between parties to a lease whereby the lessor has committed to provide the entity (lessee) with a cash payment as inducement to enter the lease. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Lease Incentive, Payable
column2: This item represents an incentive or inducement contractually stipulated between parties to a lease whereby the lessor has committed to provide the entity (lessee) with a cash payment as inducement to enter the lease.

column1: Lease Incentive Receivable
column2: This item represents a receivable for an incentive or inducement contractually stipulated between parties to a lease whereby the lessor has committed to provide the entity (lessee) with a cash payment as inducement to enter the lease.

column1: Lease Incentive Receivable, Current
column2: This item represents the current receivable for an incentive or inducement contractually stipulated between parties to a lease whereby the lessor has committed to provide the entity (lessee) with a cash payment as inducement to enter the lease. The receivable is due within one year. For classified balance sheets, this element represents the current amount receivable, that is amounts expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Lease Incentive Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: Noncurrent portion of receivables for an incentive or inducement contractually stipulated between parties to a lease whereby the lessor has committed to provide the entity (lessee) with a cash payment as inducement to enter the lease.

column1: Leveraged Lease Investment
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of leveraged lease investments which represent the aggregate amount of the estimated residual value of the lease assets and lease payments receivables, net of unearned and deferred income to be allocated over the lease term and non-recourse debt.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Balance Sheet, Deferred Taxes Arising from Leveraged Leases
column2: The liability for taxes payable in the future as a result of temporary differences in treatment of certain items in the current year arising from the net investment in arrangements meeting the criteria for classification as a leveraged lease.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Balance Sheet, Investment in Leveraged Leases
column2: The net investment in arrangements meeting the criteria to be classified as leveraged excluding deferred taxes.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Balance Sheet, Investment in Leveraged Leases, Net
column2: The net investment in arrangements meeting the criteria to be classified as leveraged.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Income Statement, Investment Tax Credit Recognized on Leveraged Leases
column2: The receivable for the amount of investment tax credit to be realized on the transaction as part of the net investment allocated in proportionate amounts to income.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Deferred Income
column2: The estimated portion of pretax income and investment tax credit remaining to be allocated to income over the lease term.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Investment Tax Credit Receivable
column2: This element represents the receivable for the amount of the investment tax credit to be realized on the leveraged lease transaction.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Rental Receivables, Gross
column2: The gross rentals receivable equal to the future cash flows from the lessee.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Rental Receivables, Net
column2: This element represents leveraged lease rentals receivable, net of that portion of the rental applicable to principal and interest on the nonrecourse debt.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Residual Value of Leased Assets
column2: The estimate of the value of the leased asset at the end of the lease term.

column1: Liabilities of Business Transferred under Contractual Arrangement, Current
column2: The current carrying amount, due within one year or one operating cycle, if longer, of liabilities resulting from the transfer of a business segment under contractual arrangement where the transferor maintains certain risks, obligations or liabilities.

column1: Liabilities of Business Transferred under Contractual Arrangement, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent portion, due in greater than one year or one operating cycle, if longer, of liabilities resulting from the transfer of a business segment under contractual arrangement where the transferor maintains certain risks, obligations, or liabilities.

column1: Liability for Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Disability, Accident and Health
column2: The amount needed to reflect the estimated ultimate cost of settling claims relating to disability, accident and health insurance insured events that have occurred on or before a particular date (ordinarily, the balance sheet date) and the amount needed to provide for the estimated ultimate cost required to investigate and settle claims relating to insured events that have occurred on or before a particular date (ordinarily, the balance sheet date), whether or not reported to the insurer at that date.

column1: Liability for Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Property Casualty Liability
column2: The amount needed to reflect the estimated ultimate cost of settling claims relating to casualty insurance insured events that have occurred on or before a particular date (ordinarily, the balance sheet date) and the amount needed to provide for the estimated ultimate cost required to investigate and settle claims relating to insured events that have occurred on or before a particular date (ordinarily, the balance sheet date), whether or not reported to the insurer at that date.

column1: Liability for Future Policy Benefits and Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense
column2: The aggregate amount of policy reserves (provided for future obligations including unpaid claims and claims adjustment expenses) and policy benefits (liability for future policy benefits) as of the balance sheet date; grouped amount of all the liabilities associated with the company's insurance policies.

column1: Liability for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Incurred but Not Reported (IBNR) Claims, Amount
column2: Estimated costs as of the balance sheet date of settling insured claims and costs incurred in the claims settlement process for claims that have not yet been submitted to the insurance company for reimbursement.

column1: Liability for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Reported Claims, Amount
column2: Costs of settling insured claims and costs incurred in the claims settlement process for the specified year specifically for claims that have already been submitted to the insurance company for reimbursement.

column1: Liability, Reporting Currency Denominated, Value
column2: The reporting currency-denominated liability value.

column1: Life Insurance Assumed Ratio
column2: Ratio of life insurance assumed from another insurer to gross life insurance in force.

column1: Life Insurance, Corporate or Bank Owned, Amount
column2: This item represents the amount that could be realized under a life insurance contract or contracts owned by the Entity as of the date of the statement of financial position. Such Entity-owned life insurance policies are commonly known as corporate-owned life insurance (COLI) or bank-owned life insurance (BOLI).

column1: Life Premiums as Percentage of Gross Premiums
column2: Ratio with total life insurance premiums in numerator and total GAAP premiums in the denominator.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing after Rolling Year Five
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing after Year Five
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Next Twelve Months
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Five
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Four
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Three
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Two
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Year Five
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Year Four
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Year Three
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value, Maturing in Year Two
column2: Fair value of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value
column2: Fair value amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value
column2: Face value (death benefits) of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing after Rolling Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing after Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Next Twelve Months
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Four
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Three
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Rolling Year Two
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Five
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Four
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Three
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Face Value, Maturing in Year Two
column2: Face value of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing after Rolling Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing after the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing after Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the next rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Next Twelve Months
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fifth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Four
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fourth rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Three
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the third rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Rolling Year Two
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the second rolling twelve months following the latest balance sheet. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Five
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Four
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Three
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Fair Value Method, Number of Contracts, Maturing in Year Two
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Limited Liability Company (LLC) or Limited Partnership (LP), Managing Member or General Partner, Ownership Interest
column2: Percentage investment held by the managing member or general partner of the limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

column1: Limited Liability Company (LLC) or Limited Partnership (LP), Members or Limited Partners, Ownership Interest
column2: The number of units or percentage investment held by one or more members or limited partners of the LLC or LP.

column1: Limited Partners' Capital Account, Units Authorized
column2: The number of limited partner units authorized to be issued.

column1: Limited Partners' Cumulative Cash Distributions
column2: Aggregate cumulative cash distributions made to the limited partners.

column1: Limited Partners' Offering Costs
column2: The cumulative amount of offering costs allocated to the limited partners.

column1: Line of Credit Assumed
column2: The fair value of line of credit assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Capacity Available for Specific Purpose Other than for Trade Purchases
column2: The maximum amount of borrowing capacity under a line of credit that is available as of the balance sheet date for a specific purpose other than for financing goods acquired for inventory or imminent delivery to a customer.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Capacity Available for Trade Purchases
column2: The maximum amount of borrowing capacity under a line of credit that is available as of the balance sheet date for financing purchases of goods acquired for inventory or imminent delivery to a customer.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Collateral Fees, Amount
column2: Amount of the fees associated with providing collateral for the credit facility.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Commitment Fee Percentage
column2: The fee, expressed as a percentage of the line of credit facility, for the line of credit facility regardless of whether the facility has been used.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Unused Capacity, Commitment Fee Percentage
column2: The fee, expressed as a percentage of the line of credit facility, for available but unused credit capacity under the credit facility.

column1: Estimated Litigation Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount of estimated litigation liability for known or estimated probable loss from litigation, which may include attorneys' fees and other litigation costs, which is expected to be paid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Loan Portfolio Expense
column2: The loan servicing fees paid to third parties that relate to loan expenses for a portfolio containing the entire group of loans owned by the company.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Collateral for Secured Borrowings
column2: Reflects the aggregate value of loans, trade receivables, securities and financial instruments that serve as collateral for obligations arising from a transfer of financial assets recorded as a secured borrowing.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Commitments, Fixed Rates
column2: Reflects the amount of cash required to fully fund agreements to provide advances to borrowers and lessees at stated interest rates.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Commitments, Variable Rates
column2: Reflects the amount of cash required to fully fund agreements to provide advances to borrowers and lessees at interest rates that increase or decrease depending on certain facts or circumstances.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Fees Earned but Excluded from Yield
column2: Reflects the amount of fees recognized as income related to loan originations, commitments or servicing which are not included in interest income and that exceed one percent of the aggregate of total interest income and other income.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Impaired, Commitment to Lend
column2: Reflects the unfunded portion of contractual agreements to lend funds to borrowers for loans whose terms have been modified by troubled debt restructuring.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Impaired, Interest Income Recognized, Change in Present Value Attributable to Passage of Time
column2: The amount of interest income on impaired and nonperforming loans that is due to the change in present value attributable to the passage of time.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Impaired, Interest Lost on Nonaccrual Loans
column2: Reflects the amount of additional interest income that would have been recorded if impaired or nonperforming loans were instead current, in compliance with their original terms, and outstanding throughout the reporting period or since origination (if held for part of the period).

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Nonperforming, Accrual of Interest
column2: Reflects the carrying amount of loans deemed to be questionable as to collection on which interest is continuing to be earned or accrued.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Nonperforming, Nonaccrual of Interest
column2: Reflects the carrying amount of loans deemed to be questionable as to collection on which no interest is continuing to be recognized.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Ratio of Nonperforming Loans to All Loans
column2: Reflects the percentage derived from dividing impaired loans on which interest has ceased to be accrued by total loans.

column1: Loans from Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) loans from another FHLBank.

column1: Loans, Gross, Insurance Policy
column2: Amount before allowance of loans made to policy and contract holders using their life insurance contracts' cash value or separate accounts as collateral. Includes deferred interest and fees, undisbursed portion of loan balance, unamortized costs and premiums over and discounts from face amounts. Excludes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements.

column1: Loans Pledged as Collateral
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of loans that have been pledged as collateral for borrowings. If the secured party has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge the collateral, then the debtor reclassifies that asset and report that asset in its statement of financial position separately from other assets not so encumbered.

column1: Loans Receivable, Basis Spread on Variable Rate
column2: The percentage points (also referred to as 'margin') added to the reference rate as stated in the loan agreement and used to compute the variable rate on the loans receivable. For instance, the loan agreement might state that the interest rate the borrower is obligated to pay is the London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR) plus three quarters (3/4) of a percentage point adjusted quarterly (each three months). LIBOR in this example is the index or reference rate, 3/4 percentage point is the margin, the reference rate plus the margin is the fully indexed rate. This element would be used to report separately the margin.

column1: Loans Receivable, Basis Spread on Variable Rate, During Period
column2: The percentage points added to the reference rate or index during the adjustment period to compute the variable [fully indexed] rate on the loans receivable realized during the reporting period. This may be an effective margin for the period depending on the specific terms of the underlying loan agreement (for example, an annual disclosure for a loan with a quarterly adjustment period).

column1: Loans Receivable Held-for-sale, Amount
column2: The face amount of loans that will be sold to other entities.

column1: Loans to Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) loans to another FHLBank.

column1: Accounts, Notes, Loans and Financing Receivable, Net, Noncurrent
column2: The aggregate of amounts due from customers or clients more than one year from the balance sheet date, for goods or services that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business and an amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Company (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date more than one year from the balance sheet date, reduced to their estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the Company of the amount it deems uncertain of collection and net of any write-downs taken for collection uncertainty on the part of the holder, respectively.

column1: Long-term Commercial Paper, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the current portion of long-term unsecured obligations issued by corporations and other borrowers to investors (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer).

column1: Long-term Construction Loan, Current
column2: This element represents the current portion of a long-term real estate loan to finance building costs. The funds are disbursed as needed or in accordance with a prearranged plan; generally, a portion of the funds is disbursed at inception and the remainder as construction progresses. The money is repaid on completion of the project (generally one to seven years), usually from the proceeds of a mortgage loan. The rate is normally higher than the prime rate, and there is usually an origination fee. The effective yield on these loans tends to be high, and the lender has a security interest in the real property.

column1: Long-term Construction Loan
column2: This element represents the current and noncurrent portions of a long-term real estate loan with an initial maturity beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer, to finance building costs. The funds are disbursed as needed or in accordance with a prearranged plan; generally, a portion of the funds is disbursed at inception and the remainder as construction progresses. The money is repaid on completion of the project (generally one to seven years), usually from the proceeds of a mortgage loan. The rate is normally higher than the prime rate, and there is usually an origination fee. The effective yield on these loans tends to be high, and the lender has a security interest in the real property.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturing in Years Four and Five
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the fourth and fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturing in Years Two and Three
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the second and third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Percentage Bearing Fixed Interest, Amount
column2: The portion of the carrying amount of long-term borrowings outstanding as of the balance sheet date, including current maturities, which accrues interest at a set, unchanging rate.

column1: Long-term Debt, Percentage Bearing Fixed Interest, Percentage Rate
column2: The interest rate applicable to the portion of the carrying amount of long-term borrowings outstanding as of the balance sheet date, including current maturities, which accrues interest at a set, unchanging rate.

column1: Long-term Debt, Percentage Bearing Variable Interest, Amount
column2: The portion of the carrying amount of long-term borrowings outstanding as of the balance sheet date, including current maturities, which accrues interest at a rate subject to change from time to time.

column1: Long-term Debt, Percentage Bearing Variable Interest, Percentage Rate
column2: The interest rate applicable to the portion of the carrying amount of long-term borrowings outstanding as of the balance sheet date, including current maturities, which accrues interest at a rate subject to change from time to time.

column1: Long-term Debt, Weighted Average Interest Rate
column2: Weighted average interest rate of long-term debt outstanding.

column1: Long-term Federal Home Loan Bank Advances, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent portion of Federal Home Loan Bank borrowings initially due beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

column1: Loans Payable to Bank, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of loans from a bank with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer, excluding current portion.

column1: Loans Payable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of loans payable (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer), excluding current portion.

column1: Notes and Loans, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of all notes and loans payable (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer), excluding current portion.

column1: Long-term Pollution Control Bond, Current
column2: Current portion of a debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation to finance the construction of air- or water-pollution control facilities or sewage or solid waste disposal facilities pursuant to federal law. The bonds are backed by the credit of the beneficiary of the financing rather than the credit of the issuer.

column1: Long-term Pollution Control Bond
column2: Represents the current and noncurrent portions of a debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation to finance the construction of air- or water-pollution control facilities or sewage or solid waste disposal facilities pursuant to federal law. The bonds are backed by the credit of the beneficiary of the financing rather than the credit of the issuer.

column1: Long-term Transition Bond, Noncurrent
column2: Long-Term transition bonds are bonds under the Competition Act in which the proceeds of Transition Bonds are required to be used principally to reduce qualified stranded costs and the related capitalization of the utility. This represents the noncurrent portion.

column1: Long-term Transition Bond, Current
column2: Long-Term transition bonds are bonds under the Competition Act in which the proceeds of Transition Bonds are required to be used principally to reduce qualified stranded costs and the related capitalization of the utility. This represents the current portion.

column1: Long-term Transition Bond
column2: Long-Term transition bonds are bonds under the Competition Act in which the proceeds of Transition Bonds are required to be used principally to reduce qualified stranded costs and the related capitalization of the utility. This represents the current and noncurrent portions. The initial maturity is beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Loss from Components Excluded from Assessment of Cash Flow Hedge Effectiveness
column2: The loss relating to components of the gain (loss) on the cash flow hedging instrument excluded from the assessment of cash flow hedge effectiveness. Recognized in earnings.

column1: Loss from Components Excluded from Assessment of Fair Value Hedge Effectiveness
column2: Loss relating to components of the gain (loss) on the fair value hedging instrument excluded from the assessment of fair value hedge effectiveness. Recognized in earnings.

column1: Loss from Hedged Firm Commitment Not Qualifying as Fair Value Hedge
column2: Amount of loss recognized in earnings when a hedged firm commitment no longer qualifies as a fair value hedge.

column1: Loss on Contract Termination
column2: The loss recognized on termination of a contract.

column1: Loss on Contract Termination for Default
column2: The amount of the loss on termination of a contract for default.

column1: Machinery and Equipment, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation of tangible personal property used to produce goods and services, including, but is not limited to, tools, dies and molds, computer and office equipment.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Accrual, Discounted
column2: Amount of the accrued liability on a discounted basis for malpractice claims (including general and professional liability).

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Accrual, Discounted, Current
column2: Amount of the current portion of the accrued liability on a discounted basis for malpractice claims (including general and professional liability).

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Accrual, Discounted, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of the noncurrent portion of the accrued liability on a discounted basis for malpractice claims (including general and professional liability).

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Accrual, Undiscounted
column2: Amount of the accrued liability on an undiscounted basis for malpractice claims (including general and professional liability) at the end of the accounting period.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Accrual, Undiscounted, Current
column2: Amount of the current portion of the accrued liability on an undiscounted basis for malpractice claims (including general and professional liability).

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Accrual, Undiscounted, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of the noncurrent portion of the accrued liability on an undiscounted basis for malpractice claims (including general and professional liability).

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Claims Incurred in Period
column2: Amount of loss recognized for asserted and unasserted malpractice claims.
