column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Claims Incurred in Prior Periods
column2: Amount of increase in asserted and unasserted malpractice claims that were originally recognized in a prior period.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Claims Incurred, Net
column2: Amount of costs associated with malpractice claims and insurance premiums incurred during an accounting period, less insurance recoveries and returns of previously paid premiums.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Discount Rate
column2: The interest rate used to discount the estimated cash flows associated with the payment of malpractice claims.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Insurance Recoveries
column2: Amount of insurance recoveries recognized from insurance and similar arrangements for reimbursement and payment of malpractice claims recognized during an accounting period.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Letters of Credit and Surety Bonds
column2: Amount of letters of credit and other surety bonds that are available for the future payment of malpractice claims.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Number of Claims
column2: Number of malpractice claims outstanding at the end of the accounting period.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Period Cost
column2: Amount of costs associated with malpractice claims, including costs associated with litigating and settling claims, incurred during an accounting period.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Premium Costs
column2: Amount of costs incurred that are associated with obtaining malpractice insurance and other risk transferring arrangements during an accounting period.

column1: Malpractice Loss Contingency, Return of Premiums
column2: Amount received during the period representing a return of premiums previously paid, generally under a retrospectively rated policy.

column1: Managing Member or General Partner, Subsequent Distribution Amount
column2: Amount of cash or stock or unit payment to a limited liability corporation managing member or limited partnership general partner after the end of the accounting period.

column1: Marketable Securities, Noncurrent
column2: Total debt and equity financial instruments including: (1) securities held-to-maturity and (2) securities available-for-sale that will be held for the long-term.

column1: Medium-term Notes
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying value at the balance sheet date of a financial instrument used to receive debt funding on a regular basis with original maturities ranging from 5-10 years.

column1: Medium-term Notes, Current
column2: Carrying value at the balance sheet date of the current portion of a financial instrument used to receive debt funding on a regular basis with original maturities ranging from 5-10 years.

column1: Medium-term Notes, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value at the balance sheet date of the noncurrent portion of a financial instrument used to receive debt funding on a regular basis with original maturities ranging from 5-10 years.

column1: Memberships in Exchanges Owned
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the capitalized costs of obtaining memberships that provide the entity, typically a broker-dealer, with the right to do business on trading exchanges (such as stock or commodity exchanges) in which the entity or its employees are members. Memberships are usually registered in the names of individuals who are affiliated with the broker-dealer. A membership held in the name of an individual is considered to be an asset of the broker-dealer if it is held by the broker-dealer under an agreement (such as an ABC agreement) that would require the member, upon leaving the broker-dealer, to do one of the following: a) Pay the member organization the amount necessary to purchase another membership (if the named individual wished to retain the membership); b) Sell the membership and pay the proceeds over to the member organization; or, c) Transfer the membership for a nominal consideration to a person designated by the member organization and satisfactory to the exchange.

column1: Mineral Properties, Gross
column2: Carrying amount at the balance sheet date of mineral properties, gross of adjustments.

column1: Mineral Properties, Net
column2: Mineral properties, net of adjustments.

column1: Mineral Rights
column2: Carrying amount at the balance sheet date of mineral rights, or rights to extract a mineral from the earth or to receive payment in the form of a royalty for the extraction of minerals, net of amortization.

column1: Mine Reclamation and Closing Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of a reclamation and mine closing liability that is associated with a legal obligation for the closure and reclamation of a mine including the removal of buildings, equipment, machinery and other physical remnants of mining, closure of tailings impoundments, leach pads and other mine features, and contouring, covering and revegetation of waste rock piles and other disturbed areas.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Thereafter
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Five Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Four Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Three Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Two Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing due in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Amount Represented by Preferred Stock
column2: The amount of noncontrolling interest in subsidiary represented by preferred securities issued by the subsidiary.

column1: Mortgage-backed Securities Held-to-maturity, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of securitized, pay-through debt securities collateralized by real estate mortgage loans classified as held-to-maturity.

column1: Mortgage Loans on Real Estate, Intercompany Profits in Carrying Amount of Loans
column2: Amount of any intercompany profits included in the carrying amount of mortgage loans on real estate.

column1: Mortgages Held-for-sale, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of mortgage loans held-for-sale.

column1: Municipal Investment Agreements
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the obligations arising from contracts specifying rights and responsibilities of a host municipality in the structure or operation of an investment project. For example, proceeds from a revenue bond may be invested temporarily in contracts until disbursements are required for construction of a major project. There is little or no insurance risk for the entity.

column1: Net Capital in Excess of Five Percent of Debit Items
column2: Net capital less five percent of aggregate debit items.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Employee Benefit Liabilities Assumed
column2: The amount of employee benefit liabilities that an Entity assumes in acquiring a business or in consideration for an asset received in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Interest Acquired
column2: The level of ownership or equity interest acquired in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Inventory Acquired
column2: The amount of inventory that an Entity acquires in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as information about all investing and financing activities of an enterprise during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Noncash Financial or Equity Instrument Consideration, Rate
column2: Dividend or interest rate associated with the financial or equity instrument issued as noncash or part noncash consideration for a business or asset acquired. Noncash are transactions that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments. Part noncash refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Deposit Liabilities
column2: The aggregate amount of all domestic and foreign noninterest-bearing deposits liabilities held by the entity.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Deposit Liabilities, Domestic
column2: Amount of domestic noninterest-bearing deposits held by the entity, which may include demand deposits, checking, brokered and retail deposits.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Deposit Liabilities, Foreign
column2: Amount of foreign noninterest-bearing deposits held by the entity which may include demand deposits, checking, brokered and retail deposits.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Brokered
column2: Amount of noninterest-bearing domestic third-party deposits placed by or through the assistance of a deposit broker, also known as brokered deposit liabilities.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Checking
column2: Amount of noninterest-bearing domestic checking deposit liabilities.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Demand
column2: Amount of money in noninterest-bearing domestic accounts that entitle the depositor to withdraw funds at any time without prior notice, also known as demand deposits.

column1: Noninterest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Retail
column2: Amount of noninterest-bearing domestic retail deposit liabilities.

column1: Nonmonetary Transaction, Gross Operating Revenue Recognized
column2: The amount of gross operating revenue recognized in a nonmonetary transaction.

column1: Nonpatronage Source Earnings
column2: The excess or revenues over costs resulting from transactions that do not relate to patrons.

column1: Nontrade Receivables
column2: Carrying amounts due as of the balance sheet date of the sum of amounts receivable other than from customers.

column1: Nontrade Receivables, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent portion of the receivable other than from customers, that is amounts expected to be collected after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Notes, Loans and Financing Receivable, Net, Noncurrent
column2: An amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date more than one year from the balance sheet date, net of any write-downs taken for collection uncertainty on the part of the holder. Such amount may include accrued interest receivable in accordance with the terms of the debt. The debt also may contain provisions and related items including a discount or premium, payable on demand, secured, or unsecured, interest bearing or noninterest bearing, among a myriad of other features and characteristics. This amount does not include amounts related to receivables held-for-sale.

column1: Notes Payable to Bank
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, the carrying value as of the balance sheet date of notes payable to banks, excluding mortgage notes, initially due beyond one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer.

column1: Notes Payable to Bank, Noncurrent
column2: The total amount due within more than 12 month, or the operating cycle if longer, on all notes payable to banks paid on an installment. This can include the amount of any loans from the applicant firm. This does not, however, include any mortgage balances.

column1: Notes Receivable, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the holder a definite sum of money at a future date.

column1: Financing Receivable, Net
column2: Net amount of the investment in a contractual right to receive money on demand or on fixed or determinable dates that is recognized as an asset in the creditor's statement of financial position. Examples include, but are not limited to, credit card receivables, notes receivable and receivables relating to lessor's rights to payments from leases other than operating leases that have been recorded as assets. Excludes trade accounts receivable with contractual maturity of one year or less and arose from the sale of goods or services.

column1: Qualitative and Quantitative Information, Transferor's Continuing Involvement, Not Previously Required Financial Support Provided, Amount
column2: The amount of the support provided by the transferor with a continuing involvement that was not previously contractually required to provide to the transferee or its beneficial interest holders.

column1: Number of Businesses Acquired
column2: The number of businesses acquired by the entity during the period.

column1: Number of Countries in which Entity Operates
column2: The number of countries in which the entity operates as of balance sheet date.

column1: Number of Credit Risk Derivatives Held
column2: Number of credit risk derivative instruments held.

column1: Number of Foreign Currency Derivatives Held
column2: Number of foreign currency exchange rate derivatives held by the entity at the reporting date.

column1: Number of Interest Rate Derivatives Held
column2: Number of interest rate derivative instruments held by the entity at the reporting date.

column1: Number of Price Risk Derivatives Held
column2: Number of price risk derivative instruments held by the entity at the reporting date.

column1: Number of Real Estate Properties
column2: The number of real estate properties owned as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Number of Real Estate Properties, Fee Simple
column2: The number of real estate properties owned as of the statement of financial position to which the entity has fee simple title.

column1: Number of States in which Entity Operates
column2: The number of states the entity operates in as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Number of Stores
column2: Represents the number of stores.

column1: Number of Units in Real Estate Property
column2: The number of units in a real estate property owned as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Office of Finance, Cost Assessed on Federal Home Loan Bank
column2: Amount of a Federal Home Loan Bank's (FHLBank) proportionate share of the costs of operating the Office of Finance.

column1: Oil and Gas Joint Interest Billing Receivables, Current
column2: Current portion of accounts receivable attributable to joint interest partners in oil and gas properties. These are billings to the non-operators associated with the operation of wells and are based on those owners' working interests in the wells. For classified balance sheets, represents the current amount receivable, that is amounts expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Oil and Gas Joint Interest Billing Receivables, Noncurrent
column2: Noncurrent portion of accounts receivable attributable to joint interest partners in oil and gas properties. These are billings to the non-operators associated with the operation of wells and are based on those owners' working interests in the wells.

column1: Oil and Gas Producing Properties of Rate Regulated Companies, Proved and Unproved Reserves
column2: The quantity of proved and unproved reserves related to properties subject to cost-of-service ratemaking.

column1: Oil and Gas Producing Properties of Rate Regulated Companies, Unamortized Cost
column2: The amount of unamortized cost related to properties subject to cost-of-service ratemaking.

column1: Oil and Gas Property, Successful Effort Method, Gross
column2: Oil and Gas properties, gross, carried under the successful effort method.

column1: Oil and Gas Reclamation Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of a reclamation liability that is associated with a legal obligation for the closure and reclamation of oil and gas properties.

column1: Oil and Gas Sales Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable to third parties for oil and gas that has been sold but not delivered. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Oil and Gas Sales Payable
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable to third parties for oil and gas that has been sold but not delivered.

column1: Operating Insurance and Claims Costs, Production
column2: Insurance and claims costs directly related to goods produced and sold, or services rendered, during the reporting period.

column1: Operating Leases, Income Statement, Carrying Amount at Lease Inception Exceeds Fair Value
column2: This element represents the loss resulting from the amount by which the cost or carrying amount, if different, of an asset subject to an agreement classified as an operating lease, at the inception of a lease involving real estate, exceeds the fair value of the leased property.

column1: Operating Leases, Income Statement, Contingent Revenue
column2: Amount of contingent rental revenue recognized for the period under lease, based on the occurrences of an event or condition.

column1: Operating Leases, Income Statement, Minimum Lease Revenue
column2: The total amount of lease revenue recognized for the period for which the lessee was obligated under leasing arrangements regardless of any other events or conditions. This amount excludes contingent revenue and sublease revenue.

column1: Operating Leases of Lessee, Contingent Rentals, Basis Spread on Variable Rate
column2: The percentage points added to the reference rate to compute the variable rate on the lessee's operating lease.

column1: Operating Leases of Lessor, Contingent Rentals, Basis Spread on Variable Rate
column2: The percentage points added to the reference rate to compute the variable rate on the lessor's operating lease.

column1: Operating Leases, Rent Expense, Minimum Rentals
column2: This element represents the payments that the lessee is obligated to make or can be required to make in connection with a property under the terms of an agreement classified as an operating lease, excluding contingent rentals and a guarantee by the lessee of the lessor's debt and the lessee's obligation to pay (apart from the rental payments) executory costs such as insurance, maintenance, and taxes.

column1: Operating Support from Adviser, Amount
column2: The amount of the support provided by the Adviser to help the REIT achieve a certain return for the period.

column1: Option Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Indexed Shares
column2: The number of issuer's shares to which the option contract is indexed.

column1: Option Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Shares
column2: The maximum number of shares that could be issued to net share settle a contract, if applicable. If a contract does not have a fixed or determinable maximum number of shares that may be required to be issued, disclose the fact that a potentially infinite number of shares could be issued to settle the contract.

column1: Origination of Loans to Employee Stock Ownership Plans
column2: The cash outflow to finance the entity's defined contribution plan to acquire shares of the entity. The plan initially holds the shares in a suspense account, which is collateral for the loan. As the plan makes payment on the debt, the shares are released from the suspense account and become available to be allocated to participant accounts.

column1: Other Assets, Miscellaneous, Current
column2: Amount of other miscellaneous assets expected to be realized or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Assets, Miscellaneous, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of other miscellaneous assets expected to be realized or consumed after one year or normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Borrowings
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date for the aggregate of other miscellaneous borrowings owed by the reporting entity.

column1: Other Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value
column2: Amount of short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates, classified as other. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

column1: Other Deferred Compensation Arrangements, Liability, Classified, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of the liabilities, classified as other, for deferred compensation arrangements payable after one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Deferred Compensation Arrangements, Liability, Current and Noncurrent
column2: Amount of the liabilities for deferred compensation arrangements classified as other.

column1: Other Deferred Costs, Gross
column2: Gross amount of other deferred costs capitalized at the end of the reporting period. Does not include deferred finance costs or deferred acquisition costs of insurance companies.

column1: Other Deferred Costs, Net
column2: Net amount of other deferred costs capitalized at the end of the reporting period. Does not include deferred finance costs or deferred acquisition costs of insurance companies.

column1: Other Deferred Credits, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of unearned revenue or income classified as other, expected to be taken into income after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Employee-related Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount of obligations incurred for employer-related costs classified as other, payable within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Employee-related Liabilities
column2: Amount of obligations incurred for employer-related costs classified as other.

column1: Other Indefinite-lived Intangible Assets
column2: Amount after impairment of indefinite-lived intangible assets classified as other. Excludes financial assets and goodwill.

column1: Other Interest Earning Assets
column2: Amount of interest earning assets classified as other.

column1: Other Inventories, Spare Parts, Gross
column2: Gross amount of components of assembled products that can be sold directly or indirectly through sales of assembled products.

column1: Other Inventory, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of other inventory expected to be sold, or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Inventory, Demo, Gross
column2: Gross amount of merchandise, goods, commodities, or supplies to which the entity holds the title and uses for the specific purpose of showing the benefits and features of the entity's products to existing or potential customers.

column1: Other Inventory, in Transit, Gross
column2: Gross amount of merchandise or supplies to which the entity holds the title but does not hold physical possession because the goods are currently being transported.

column1: Other Inventory, Inventory at off Site Premises, Gross
column2: Gross amount of merchandise or materials to which the entity holds the title, but physically at another entity's facilities (for example, but not limited to, work in process may be temporarily at the site of a subcontractor).

column1: Other Inventory, Materials, Supplies and Merchandise under Consignment, Gross
column2: Gross amount of inventory owned by the entity but in the hands of a customer, typically a reseller.

column1: Other Inventory, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of inventories not expected to be converted to cash, sold or exchanged within the normal operating cycle (such as inventory related to long-term contracts or program rights).

column1: Other Inventory, Purchased Goods, Gross
column2: Gross amount of components used by the entity which are bought from another entity rather than produced by the entity.

column1: Other Inventory, Scrap, Gross
column2: Gross amount of residue from manufacturing or production process that has recovery value.

column1: Other Inventory, Supplies, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of other supplies used within the manufacturing or production process expected to be consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Inventory, Warehouse, Gross
column2: Gross amount of merchandise, goods, commodities, or supplies held by the entity in a building or part of a building for future sale.

column1: Other Investments and Securities, at Cost
column2: Includes other investments and securities that are not at fair value as of the balance sheet date and those that are not accounted for under the equity method.

column1: Other Liabilities and Deferred Revenue, Noncurrent
column2: Aggregate carrying amount, as of the balance sheet date, of noncurrent obligations and noncurrent portion of deferred revenue not separately disclosed in the balance sheet. Noncurrent liabilities are expected to be paid after one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Deferred revenue is a liability related to a revenue producing activity for which revenue has not yet been recognized, and is not expected to be recognized in the next twelve months.

column1: Other Loans Payable
column2: Amount of long-term loans payable classified as other.

column1: Other Loans Payable, Current
column2: Amount of long-term loans classified as other, payable within one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Loans Payable, Long-term, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of long-term loans classified as other, payable after one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Long-term Debt, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of long-term debt classified as other, payable after one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Notes Payable, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of long-term notes classified as other, payable after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Notes Payable
column2: Amount of long-term notes payable classified as other.

column1: Other Oil and Gas Property, Successful Effort Method
column2: Amount of oil and gas properties accounted for using the successful effort method, classified as other.

column1: Other Ownership Interests, Cumulative Cash Distributions
column2: Aggregate cumulative cash distributions made to the other unit holders in a limited partnership or master limited partnership. Does not include limited or general partners' ownership interests.

column1: Other Ownership Interests, Offering Costs
column2: The cumulative amount of offering costs allocated to the other unit holders.

column1: Other Ownership Interests, Units Authorized
column2: The number of units of other ownership interest authorized to be issued in a limited partnership or master limited partnership. Does not include limited or general partners' ownership interests.

column1: Other Ownership Interests, Units Issued
column2: The number of units of other ownership interests issued in a limited partnership or master limited partnership. Does not include limited or general partners' ownership interests.

column1: Other Ownership Interests, Units Outstanding
column2: The number of units of other ownership interests outstanding in a limited partnership or master limited partnership. Does not include limited or general partners' ownership interests.

column1: Other Ownership Interests, Contributed Capital
column2: The amount of capital contributed by other unit holders.

column1: Other Payables to Broker-Dealers and Clearing Organizations
column2: Amount of other payables due to broker-dealers or clearing organizations.

column1: Other Policyholder Funds
column2: Amount due to policyholders for funds held that are returnable under the terms of insurance contracts, classified as other.

column1: Other Postretirement Benefits Payable
column2: The total amount of the entity's obligation as of the balance sheet date under any other retirement plan(s), such as one or more defined contribution plans.

column1: Other Postretirement Benefits Payable, Noncurrent
column2: The total amount of the entity's noncurrent obligation as of the balance sheet date under any other retirement plan(s), such as one or more defined contribution plans.

column1: Other Recurring Income
column2: Amount of recurring income classified as other.

column1: Other Restricted Assets
column2: Total assets that cannot be used for operating purposes because of contract or regulatory requirements that are in effect for a period that extends beyond one year.

column1: Other Restricted Assets, Current
column2: Amount of current assets that are pledged or subject to withdrawal restrictions, classified as other.

column1: Other Restricted Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of noncurrent assets that are pledged or subject to withdrawal restrictions, classified as other.

column1: Other Secured Financings
column2: Secured financing other than securities sold under agreements to repurchase and securities loaned.

column1: Other Short-term Investments
column2: Amount of short-term investments classified as other.

column1: Other Sundry Liabilities, Current
column2: Obligations not otherwise itemized or categorized in the footnotes to the financial statements that are due within one year or operating cycle, if longer, from the balance sheet date.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Available-for-sale Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Default Rate
column2: This item represents the default rate of the underlying assets in the security that was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the available-for-sale investments are other than temporarily impaired and the amount of such impairment determined to be related to credit loss recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Available-for-sale Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Delinquency Rate
column2: This item represents the delinquency rates of the underlying assets in the security that was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the available-for-sale investments are other than temporarily impaired and measure the amount of impairment related to credit loss recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Available-for-sale Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Level of Subordination
column2: This item represents the current level of subordination of the entity's receipt of consideration should the assets underlying the security be liquidated when the level of subordination was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the available-for-sale investments are other than temporarily impaired and the amount of such impairment determined to be related to credit loss recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Available-for-sale Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Percentage of Nonperforming Assets
column2: This item represents the percentage of nonperforming assets underlying the security which were considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the available-for-sale investments are other than temporarily impaired and the amount of such impairment determined to be related to credit loss recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Available-for-sale Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Third Party Guarantees, Amount
column2: Amount of third party guarantees against loss of value in the underlying assets of an available-for-sale security for which only the portion of an other-than-temporary impairment (OTTI) related to a credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Held-to-maturity Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Default Rate
column2: This item represents the default rate of the underlying assets in the security that was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are other than temporarily impaired and only the amount of impairment related to credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Held-to-maturity Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Delinquency Rate
column2: This item represents the delinquency rate of the underlying assets in the security that was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are other than temporarily impaired and only the amount of impairment related to credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Held-to-maturity Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Level of Subordination
column2: This item represents the current level of subordination of the entity's receipt of consideration should the assets underlying the security be liquidated when the level of subordination was considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are other than temporarily impaired and only the amount of impairment related to credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Held-to-maturity Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Percentage of Nonperforming Assets
column2: This item represents the percentage of nonperforming assets that the underlying assets in the security represent and which were considered as one of the potential factors in reaching a conclusion that the held-to-maturity investments are other than temporarily impaired and only the amount of impairment related to credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Held-to-maturity Securities, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Qualitative Disclosures, Third Party Guarantees, Amount
column2: Amount of third party guarantees against loss of value in the underlying assets of a held-to-maturity security for which only the portion of an other-than-temporary impairment (OTTI) related to a credit loss was recognized in earnings.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, before Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in held-to-maturity debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
column2: Amount after tax of other than temporary impairment loss (OTTI) on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss and attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount after tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Net of Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: Amount after tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in held-to-maturity debt security, recognized in other comprehensive income loss, attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount of tax (expense) benefit of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: Amount of tax (expense) benefit of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in held-to-maturity debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Own-share Lending Arrangement, Collateral
column2: The amount of collateral required to be received or received by the entity from the counterparty (share borrower) in connection with an own-share lending arrangement entered into by the entity, in contemplation of a convertible debt offering or other financing.

column1: Own-share Lending Arrangement, Counterparty Default, Earnings Per Share, Shares
column2: In periods in which default, by a counterparty (share borrower) to a share-lending arrangement, is probable, but has not yet occurred, this item represents the number of the entity's shares related to the share-lending arrangement that will be reflected in basic and diluted earnings per share when the counterparty (share borrower) default does occur.

column1: Own-share Lending Arrangement, Counterparty Default, Period of Default, Expense
column2: The amount of default related expense recognized in earnings in the period in which the entity concludes it is probable that the counterparty (share borrower) to a share-lending arrangement will default.

column1: Own-share Lending Arrangement, Dividends, Not Reimbursed
column2: The amount of dividends paid to holders of record of shares of the entity's stock associated with an own-share lending arrangement in contemplation of a convertible debt offering or other financing, which will not be reimbursed by the counterparty (share borrower) to the arrangement.

column1: Own-share Lending Arrangement, Shares, Outstanding
column2: The number of shares outstanding as of the date of the statement of financial position in connection with an own-share lending arrangement entered into by the entity, in contemplation of a convertible debt offering or other financing.

column1: Own-share Lending Arrangement, Shares, Outstanding, Value
column2: The fair value as of the date of the statement of financial position of shares outstanding in connection with an own-share lending arrangement, in contemplation of a convertible debt offering or other financing.

column1: Participating Mortgage Loans, Mortgage Obligations, Amount
column2: The aggregate amount of the participating mortgage obligation at the end of the accounting period.

column1: Participating Mortgage Loans, Participation Liabilities, Amount
column2: The aggregate amount of the participation liability at the end of the accounting period.

column1: Participating Mortgage Loans, Unamortized Debt Discount, Amount
column2: The amount of the related debt discount at the end of the accounting period.

column1: Participating Policies, Additional Income Allocated
column2: Amount of additional income allocated to policy holders whose contracts entitle them to a portion of the entity's earnings or surplus, paid through dividends.

column1: Participating Policies as Percentage of Gross Insurance in Force
column2: This percent places participating policies in the numerator and insurance contracts in force in the denominator. Participating insurance contracts allow policyholders to share in the experience of the entity, primarily through policy dividends.

column1: Partners' Capital Allocated for Income Tax and Other Withdrawals
column2: Amount of partnership capital allocated for income tax and other withdrawals.

column1: Partners' Capital, Distribution Amount Per Share
column2: The distribution amount per share for all classes of units.

column1: Payables for Congressionally Mandated Assessments
column2: Amount payable for Congressionally mandated Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) assessments, for example, but not limited to, Resolution Funding Corporation (REFCORP) assessments.

column1: Payables to Customers
column2: Amounts payable to customers at the balance sheet date. The term customers generally excludes other broker-dealers; persons who are principal officers, directors, and stockholders; and persons whose securities or funds are part of the regulatory net capital of the broker-dealer. Another broker-dealer's account can be classified as a customer if the account is carried as an omnibus account in compliance with certain regulations. The accounts of principal officers, directors and stockholders may be combined in the customer captions if they are not material and the combination is disclosed in the oath that is required to accompany the annual audited FOCUS Report.

column1: Payments for Bonds Transferred to Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of cash outflow from transfers and assumptions of primary liability of consolidated obligations to another Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Payments for Delayed Tax Exempt Exchange
column2: Cash outflow related to a property which is traded for the promise to provide a replacement like-kind property in the near future also known as a tax deferred exempt exchange.

column1: Payments for Deposits Applied to Debt Retirements
column2: Cash outflow during the period as a deposit on account for application (deposits to retire or pay down) against an amount of debt owed by the entity.

column1: Payments for Flight Equipment
column2: The cash outflow for acquisition of long-lived depreciable flight assets, including owned aircraft or capital improvements.

column1: Payments for Hedge, Investing Activities
column2: The cash outflow for a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either a cash flow hedge, fair value hedge, or hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation.

column1: Payments for Investment in Restricted Cash from Pollution Control Bond
column2: The cash outflow for investments in restricted cash from pollution control bond, which is a debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation to finance the construction of air- or water-pollution control facilities or sewage or solid waste disposal facilities pursuant to federal law. The bonds are backed by the credit of the beneficiary of the financing rather than the credit of the issuer.

column1: Payments for Mortgage Deposits
column2: outflow associated with an amount paid in advance to show an intention to complete a mortgage financing.

column1: Payments for Nuclear Fuel
column2: Cash outflow associated with the purchase of any material that is commonly used in the generation of nuclear energy.

column1: Payments for Operating Activities
column2: Total amount of cash paid for operating activities during the current period.

column1: Payments for Removal Costs
column2: Cash outflow related to disposal costs of plants, whether by demolishing, dismantling, abandoning, sale, and so forth during the period.

column1: Payments to Acquire Loans and Leases Held-for-investment
column2: The cash outflow from (a) purchases of loans held-for-investment, (b) purchases of leases held-for-investment, and (c) both.

column1: Payments to Acquire Loans and Leases Held-for-investment, Credit Card Securitizations
column2: The cash outflow from the purchase of securitized credit card receivables which are held for investment purposes. Securitization is the structured process whereby interests in loans and other receivables are packaged, underwritten, and sold in the form of asset-backed securities.

column1: Payments to Acquire Real Estate and Real Estate Joint Ventures
column2: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of real estate held-for-investment and real estate joint ventures.

column1: Payments to Acquire Retained Interest in Securitized Receivables
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of a retained interest in a receivable securitized via a structured process whereby interests in loans and other receivables are packaged, underwritten, and sold in the form of asset-backed securities.

column1: Payments to Acquire Timberlands
column2: The cash outflow for acquisition of timber and timberlands during the period.

column1: Payments to Acquire Waste Water Systems
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of waste water systems which includes the waste treatment and disposal facility and equipment to households and industry.

column1: Payments to Acquire Water and Waste Water Systems
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of a facility and equipment that provides water supply which includes wells, reservoirs, pumping stations, and control facilities; and waste water systems which includes the waste treatment and disposal facility and equipment to households and industry.

column1: Payments to Acquire Water Systems
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of a facility and equipment that provides water supply which includes wells, reservoirs, pumping stations, and control facilities.

column1: Payments to Acquire Investments to be Held in Decommissioning Trust Fund
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of investments that will be held in a decommissioning trust fund.

column1: Payments to Suppliers and Employees
column2: Cash payments to suppliers for goods and services provided and to employees for services provided.

column1: Pension and Other Postretirement and Postemployment Benefit Plans, Liabilities
column2: This represents the entire liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans and other postretirement and postemployment benefit plans.

column1: Pension and Other Postretirement and Postemployment Benefit Plans, Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: This represents the noncurrent liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans and other postretirement and postemployment benefit plans.

column1: Percentage of Debt Hedged by Interest Rate Derivatives
column2: Percentage of an entity's outstanding debt that is designated as a hedged item in cash flow, fair value, or net investment hedge.

column1: Percentage of FIFO Inventory
column2: The percentage of FIFO (first in first out) inventory to total inventory as of the balance sheet date if other than 100 percent.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Brokered
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic brokered deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Certificates of Deposit
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic certificates of deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Checking
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic checking demand deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Demand
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic demand deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Money Market
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic money market demand account deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Notice of Withdrawal
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic notice of withdrawal demand deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Other Time Deposit
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic time deposit liabilities other than certificates of deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Retail
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic retail deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Savings
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic savings deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits to Deposits, Time Deposits
column2: Percentage of interest-bearing domestic time deposit liabilities to total deposit liabilities.

column1: Percentage of LIFO Inventory
column2: The percentage of LIFO (last in first out) inventory to total inventory as of the balance sheet date if other than 100 percent.

column1: Percentage of Unamortized Film Costs
column2: The percentage of unamortized film costs for released films, excluding acquired film libraries, that it expects to amortize within three years from the date of the balance sheet.

column1: Percentage of Weighted Average Cost Inventory
column2: The percentage of weighted average cost inventory present at the reporting date when inventory is valued using different valuation methods.

column1: Operating Leases, Income Statement, Percentage Revenue
column2: This element represents the rental revenue earned during the period from lessee-operators based on revenues generated in their operations, generally in excess of a base amount. Such rental revenue is generally stipulated in the lease agreement, usually will provide for a fixed percentage of revenue to be paid as additional (or possibly only) rent due the lessor, and may be based on gross revenues, net revenues, or multiple variations thereof. Percentage rent is often required under leases with retail outlets located on premises owned by hoteliers, cruise lines, others in the hospitality industry, and shopping mall operators, among others.

column1: Phase-in Plan, Amount of Capitalized Costs Recovered
column2: The sum total amount of allowable costs capitalized in the period pertaining to a phase-in plan and previously capitalized costs that were recovered (recognized in earnings) during the period through rates.

column1: Phase-in Plan, Amount of Costs Deferred for Rate-making Purposes
column2: The total amount of allowable costs capitalized during the period by the entity pertaining to Phase-In plans which were deferred on the expectation of future recovery.

column1: Plant Held for Future Use Amount
column2: Discloses the period end amount of plants held for future use and whether such amount is included in the utility's rate base.

column1: Pledged Assets, Not Separately Reported, Finance Receivables
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of finance receivables which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, primarily a secured borrowing or repurchase agreement, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Assets, Not Separately Reported, Nonsecuritized Investments
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of investments which are not evidenced by ownership of securities, such as interests in partnerships or other forms of unincorporated entities, but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, primarily a secured borrowing or repurchase agreement, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Assets, Other, Not Separately Reported on Statement of Financial Position
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of all assets that are pledged as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation primarily arising from secured borrowings, repurchase agreements or other current or potential obligations, where the secured party does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge the collateral and therefore are not reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position.

column1: Pledged Assets, Not Separately Reported, Other
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of other assets which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, primarily a secured borrowing or repurchase agreement, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Assets, Not Separately Reported, Real Estate
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of real estate owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, primarily a secured borrowing or repurchase agreement, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Finance Receivables Pledged as Collateral, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of finance receivables which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Loans Pledged for Federal Home Loan Bank, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of loans that are restricted as collateral for the payment of the FHLB debt obligations, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Loans Pledged for Other Debt Obligations, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of loans which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of other debt obligations, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Loans Pledged for Repurchase Agreements, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of loans that are restricted as collateral for the payment of repurchase agreements, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Mortgage-Related Securities Available-for-sale or Held-for-investment
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of mortgage-related securities, classified as available for sale or held for investment, which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, primarily a secured borrowing or repurchase agreement, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Nonsecuritized Investments Pledged as Collateral, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of investments which are not evidenced by ownership of securities, such as interests in partnerships or other forms of unincorporated entities, which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, and that is reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge such ownership interests.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Other, on Statement of Financial Position, at Fair Value
column2: The sum of the fair values, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of assets which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of debt obligations, primarily secured borrowings, repurchase agreements or other current or potential obligations, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Other Assets Pledged as Collateral, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of other assets which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Other Debt Securities Available-for-sale or Held-for-investment
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of other securities, classified as available for sale or held for investment, which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, primarily a secured borrowing or repurchase agreement, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Real Estate Pledged as Collateral, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of real estate which is owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the related debt obligation, and that is reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge it.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Securities Pledged as Collateral, at Fair Value
column2: The sum of the fair values, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of securities that are restricted as collateral for the payment of related debt obligations, primarily secured borrowings and repurchase agreements, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Securities Pledged for Federal Home Loan Bank, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of securities which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of the FHLB debt obligations, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Securities Pledged for Other Debt Obligations, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of securities that are restricted as collateral for the payment of other debt obligations, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Securities Pledged for Repurchase Agreements, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of securities which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of repurchase agreements, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Assets Separately Reported, Securities Pledged under Letter of Credit Facilities, at Fair Value
column2: The fair value, as of the date of each statement of financial position presented, of securities that are restricted as collateral under letter of credit agreements, and that are reclassified and separately reported in the statement of financial position because the transferee has the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Loans Receivable Pledged as Collateral
column2: The sum of the carrying amounts, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of loans receivable which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of related debt obligations, primarily secured borrowings and repurchase agreements, and for which the transferees are not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Loans Receivable, for Federal Home Loan Bank Debt
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of loans receivable which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of FHLB debt obligations, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Loans Receivable, for Other Arrangements
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of loans receivable which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of other debt obligations, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Loans Receivable, for Repurchase Agreements
column2: The carrying amount, as of the date of the latest financial statement presented, of loans receivable which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for the payment of repurchase obligations, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Mortgage-Related Securities Available-for-sale or Held-for-investment
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of mortgage-related securities classified as available for sale or held for investment which are owned but transferred to another party to serve as collateral to partially or fully secure a debt obligation, repurchase agreement or other current or potential obligation, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Mortgage-Related Securities Held-to-maturity
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of mortgage-related securities classified as held to maturity which are owned but transferred to another party to serve as collateral to partially or fully secure a debt obligation, repurchase agreement or other current or potential obligation, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Other Debt Securities Available-for-sale or Held-for-investment
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of other securities classified as available for sale or held for investment which are owned but transferred to another party to serve as collateral to partially or fully secure a debt obligation, repurchase agreement or other current or potential obligation, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Other Debt Securities Held-to-maturity
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of other debt securities classified as held to maturity which are owned but transferred to another party to serve as collateral to partially or fully secure a debt obligation, repurchase agreement or other current or potential obligation, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Securities for Federal Home Loan Bank
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of securities which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for FHLB debt obligations, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Securities for Letter of Credit Facilities
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of securities which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for letter of credit arrangements, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Securities for Other Debt Facilities
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of securities which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for debt facilities other than FHLB loans, repurchase agreements and letter of credit arrangements, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Securities for Repurchase Agreements
column2: The carrying amount as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of securities which are owned but transferred to serve as collateral for repurchase agreements, and for which the transferee does not have the right by contract or custom to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Pledged Financial Instruments, Not Separately Reported, Securities
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the date of the latest financial statement presented of securities which are owned but transferred to another party to serve as collateral to partially or fully secure a debt obligation, repurchase agreement or other current or potential obligation, and for which the transferee is not permitted to sell or re-pledge them to an unrelated party.

column1: Policyholder Dividends Payable
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the liability for dividends that are payable to the policyholders based upon the terms of the underlying insurance contracts.

column1: Policyholder Dividends, Rate on Policy Earnings
column2: The percentage of earnings allocable to participating policyholders based on earnings of such policies for payment of dividends.

column1: Policyholder Funds
column2: The total liability as of the balance sheet date of amounts due policy holders, excluding future policy benefits and claims, including unpaid policy dividends, retrospective refunds, and undistributed earnings on participating business.

column1: Policy Loans Receivable
column2: Carrying amount of loans made to policyholders against the cash surrender value (CSV) or other policyholder funds, and secured by the CSV, policyholder funds or the death benefit provided by the insurance contracts.

column1: Portion of Future Oil and Gas Production Being Hedged
column2: The quantity of future oil and gas production being hedged.

column1: Postemployment Benefits Liability, Current
column2: For a classified balance sheet, the carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the portion of the obligations recognized for the various benefits provided to former or inactive employees, their beneficiaries, and covered dependents after employment but before retirement that is payable within one year of the balance sheet date.

column1: Postemployment Benefits Liability, Noncurrent
column2: For a classified balance sheet, the carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the portion of the obligations recognized for the various benefits provided to former or inactive employees, their beneficiaries, and covered dependents after employment but before retirement that is payable after one year (or beyond the operating cycle if longer).

column1: Preferred Stock, Dividend Rate, Per-Dollar-Amount
column2: The amount per share used to calculated dividend payments on preferred stock.

column1: Preferred Stock Dividends, Shares
column2: Number of shares of preferred stock issued as dividends during the period. Excludes stock splits.

column1: Preferred Stock, Including Additional Paid in Capital
column2: Aggregate issuance value of nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) issued and outstanding.

column1: Preferred Stock, Including Additional Paid in Capital, Net of Discount
column2: Aggregate par value plus amounts in excess of par or issuance value (in cases of no-par value stock) for nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) issued and outstanding, net of discount on shares. Aggregate for preferred stock issued and outstanding.

column1: Preferred Stock, Liquidation Preference Per Share
column2: The per share liquidation preference (or restrictions) of nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) that has a preference in involuntary liquidation considerably in excess of the par or stated value of the shares. The liquidation preference is the difference between the preference in liquidation and the par or stated values of the share.

column1: Preferred Stock, No Par Value
column2: Face amount per share of no-par value preferred stock nonredeemable or redeemable solely at the option of the issuer.

column1: Preferred Stock, Per Share Amounts of Preferred Dividends in Arrears
column2: Per share amount of cumulative preferred dividends in arrears.

column1: Preferred Stock, Redemption Amount, Future Redeemable Securities
column2: The redemption (or callable) amount of redeemable preferred stock, excluding currently redeemable preferred stock. Includes amounts representing dividends not declared or paid but which will be payable under the redemption features or for which ultimate payment is solely within the control of the issuer.

column1: Preferred Stock, Redemption Price Per Share
column2: The price per share at which the preferred stock of an entity that has priority over common stock in the distribution of dividends and in the event of liquidation of the entity is redeemed or may be called at. The redemption features of this preferred stock are solely within the control of the issuer.

column1: Preferred Stock, Shares Outstanding
column2: Aggregate share number for all nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) held by stockholders. Does not include preferred shares that have been repurchased.

column1: Preferred Stock, Value, Subscriptions
column2: Amount of subscription received from investors who have been allocated nonredeemable preferred stock or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer.

column1: Preferred Units, Authorized
column2: The number of preferred units authorized to be issued.

column1: Preferred Units, Contributed Capital
column2: The amount of capital contributed by the preferred partners.

column1: Preferred Units, Cumulative Cash Distributions
column2: Aggregate cumulative cash distributions made to the preferred partners.

column1: Preferred Units, Issued
column2: The number of preferred units issued.

column1: Preferred Units, Outstanding
column2: The number of preferred units outstanding.

column1: Premiums and Other Receivables, Net
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date, net of allowance for doubtful accounts, of all premiums and other types of receivables due from other persons or entities.

column1: Premiums Receivable, Allowance for Doubtful Accounts
column2: The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the estimated valuation allowance to reduce gross premiums receivable to net realizable value.

column1: Premiums Receivable, Net
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date due the entity from (a) agents and insureds, (b) uncollected premiums and (c) others, net of the allowance for doubtful accounts.

column1: Premiums Receivable, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of amount receivable on insurance policies.

column1: Premiums Receivable, Gross
column2: Gross amount, as of the balance sheet date, due the entity from (a) agents and insureds, (b) uncollected premiums and (c) others, before deducting the allowance for doubtful accounts.

column1: Premiums Receivable, Proceeds from Sale of Receivables
column2: The amount of proceeds from the transfer of premium receivables reported as sales by an insurance entity.

column1: Prepaid Advertising
column2: Amount of consideration paid in advance for advertising that provides economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Prepaid Expense Other, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts paid in advance which will be charged against earnings in periods after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Prepaid Interest
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for interest that provides economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Prepaid Mineral Royalties, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of capitalized amounts paid for mineral royalties which will be charged against earnings after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Prepaid Reinsurance Premiums
column2: The unexpired portion of premiums ceded on policies in force as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Prepaid Royalties
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for royalties that provide economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Preproduction Costs Related to Long-term Supply Arrangements, Asset for Molds Dies and Tools Not Owned
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of capitalized costs of molds, dies, and other tools that the entity does not own which are or will be used in producing goods under a long-term supply arrangement, and for which there is a noncancelable right of use during such arrangement.

column1: Preproduction Costs Related to Long-term Supply Arrangements, Asset for Molds Dies and Tools Owned
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of capitalized costs of molds, dies, and other tools that will be used in producing products under a long-term supply arrangement.

column1: Preproduction Costs Related to Long-term Supply Arrangements, Costs Capitalized
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of capitalized preproduction costs incurred on long-term supply arrangements, including recoverable costs to design and develop products.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Additions from Acquisitions
column2: Additions in present value of future profits asset during the year arising from acquisitions of insurance entities.

column1: Present Value of Future Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions
column2: Present value of minimum lease payments for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing.

column1: Price Risk Cash Flow Hedge Asset, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all price risk derivative assets designated as cash flow hedging instruments.

column1: Price Risk Cash Flow Hedge Liability, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all price risk derivative liabilities designated as cash flow hedging instruments.

column1: Price Risk Derivative Instruments Not Designated as Hedging Instruments Asset, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all price risk derivative assets not designated as hedging instruments.

column1: Price Risk Fair Value Hedge Asset, at Fair Value
