column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all price risk derivative assets designated as fair value hedging instruments.

column1: Price Risk Fair Value Hedge Liability, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all price risk derivative liabilities designated as fair value hedging instruments.

column1: Principal Amount Outstanding of Loans Held-in-portfolio
column2: This is the result of the principal amount outstanding of total loans managed or securitized less securitized loans and loans that are in the process of being securitized.

column1: Principal Amount Outstanding on Loans Held-for-sale or Securitization or Asset-backed Financing Arrangement
column2: This is the principal amount outstanding for loans which are in the process of being securitized as of the date of the statement of financial position (across all types of loans).

column1: Principal Amount Outstanding on Loans Securitized or Asset-backed Financing Arrangement
column2: This is the principal amount outstanding for securitized loans only (across all types of loans).

column1: Proceeds from Bonds Transferred from Other Federal Home Loan Banks
column2: Amount of cash inflow from transfers and assumptions of primary liability for consolidated obligations of another Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

column1: Proceeds from Collection of Retained Interest in Securitized Receivables
column2: The cash inflow from the collection of a retained interest in a receivable securitized via a structured process whereby interests in loans and other receivables are packaged, underwritten, and sold in the form of asset-backed securities.

column1: Proceeds from Commissions Received
column2: Cash received for commissions during the current period.

column1: Proceeds from Customers
column2: Cash receipts from customers during the current period which are usually for sales of goods and services.

column1: Proceeds from Customers for Progress Payments
column2: Cash received from customers as progress payments on projects that have been partially completed.

column1: Proceeds from Debt, Maturing in More than Three Months
column2: The cash inflow from a borrowing having initial term of repayment of more than three months. Includes proceeds from long-term and short-term debt.

column1: Proceeds from Delayed Tax Exempt Exchange
column2: Cash inflow related to a property which is traded for the promise to provide a replacement like-kind property in the near future also known as a tax deferred exempt exchange.

column1: Proceeds from Deposits Applied to Debt Retirements
column2: Cash inflow received during the period as a deposit on account for application (deposits to retire or pay down) against an amount of debt owed to the entity.

column1: Proceeds from Distribution of Restricted Cash from Pollution Control Bond
column2: The cash inflow from amounts received from distributions of restricted cash from pollution control bond, which is a debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation to finance the construction of air- or water-pollution control facilities or sewage or solid waste disposal facilities pursuant to federal law. The bonds are backed by the credit of the beneficiary of the financing rather than the credit of the issuer.

column1: Proceeds from Financing Revenue Received under Leases
column2: Financing revenue received under leases during the current period by an entity that provides financial services.

column1: Proceeds from Grantors
column2: Cash received from grantors during the current period related to operating activities. This element represents receipts from a guarantor for the amount of guarantee provided.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of First Mortgage Bond
column2: The cash inflow from amounts received from a long-term debt instrument secured by a first mortgage deed of trust, containing a pledge of real property. The lender has the highest claim on the property in case of default.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Mandatory Redeemable Capital Securities
column2: The cash inflow from issuance of an equity security that embodies an unconditional obligation requiring the issuer to redeem the security by transferring the assets at a specified or determinable date (or dates) that is (or are) initially more than one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer) from the issuance date, or upon an event that is certain to occur beyond one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer) from the issuance date.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Secured Tax Exempt Debt
column2: The cash inflow from amounts received from issuance of long-term tax exempt debt that is wholly or partially secured by collateral.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Unsecured Tax Exempt Debt
column2: The cash inflow from the issuance of long-term tax exempt debt that is not secured by collateral.

column1: Proceeds from Leases Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of a lease held for investment, which may be a lease of real estate, equipment or other fixed assets for a specified time in exchange for payment, usually in the form of rent.

column1: Proceeds from Maturities, Prepayments and Calls of Long-term Investments
column2: The cash inflow from maturities, prepayments, calls and collections of all investments, including securities and other assets, having ready marketability and intended by management to be liquidated, if necessary, beyond the current operating cycle.

column1: Proceeds from Maturities, Repayments and Calls of Trading Securities Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow associated with maturities (principal being due), repayments and calls (payments before maturities) of securities classified as trading securities and held for investment purposes. Excludes proceeds from trading securities purchased and held principally for the purpose of selling them in the near term (thus held for only a short period of time).

column1: Proceeds from Mortgage Deposits
column2: Cash inflow received in association with a commitment to issue a mortgage.

column1: Proceeds from Nuclear Fuel
column2: Cash inflow resulting from the sale of any material that is commonly used in the generation of nuclear energy.

column1: Proceeds from Pollution Control Bond
column2: The cash inflow from amounts received from a long-term debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation to finance the construction of air- or water-pollution control facilities or sewage or solid waste disposal facilities pursuant to federal law. The bonds are backed by the credit of the beneficiary of the financing rather than the credit of the issuer.

column1: Proceeds from Refunds from Suppliers of Material
column2: Cash received for refunds from suppliers during the current period. This element includes refunds from suppliers of materials; it excludes refunds from providers of fixed assets.

column1: Proceeds from Removal Costs
column2: Cash inflow resulting from recoveries, by any means, against the cost of disposing of plant, whether by demolishing, dismantling, abandoning, sale, and so forth during the period.

column1: Proceeds from Rents Received
column2: Cash received for rents during the current period.

column1: Proceeds from Royalties Received
column2: Cash received for royalties during the current period.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Collection of Finance Receivables
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale or collection of receivables arising from the financing of goods and services.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Collection of Lease Receivables
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale or collection of receivables arising from the lease of real estate, equipment or other fixed assets for a specified time in exchange for payment, usually in the form of rent; excludes proceeds from sales-type lease transactions, which are classified as operating activities.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Collection of Loans Receivable
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale and collection of loans receivables arising from the financing of goods and services.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Collection of Other Receivables
column2: Amount of cash inflow from the sale and collection of receivables classified as other.

column1: Proceeds from Sale, Maturity and Collection of Long-term Investments
column2: The cash inflow from sales, maturities, prepayments, calls and collections of all investments, including securities and other assets, having ready marketability and intended by management to be liquidated, if necessary, beyond the current operating cycle.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Buildings
column2: The cash inflow from sale of buildings.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Flight Equipment
column2: Cash received from sales of long-lived depreciable flight assets, including owned aircraft or capital improvements.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Furniture and Fixtures
column2: The cash inflow from sale of furniture and fixtures.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Insurance Investments
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of insurance policy investment assets during the period.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Interest in Corporate Unit
column2: The cash inflow resulting from the sale of an interest in a corporate unit during the period.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Land Held-for-use
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of land held for use; excludes sales of land held as inventory or investments.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Loans and Leases Held-for-investment
column2: The net cash inflow from (a) sales of loans held-for-investment, (b) sales of leases held-for-investment, and (c) both. Includes proceeds from securitizations of loans.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Water Systems
column2: The cash inflow from sale of a facility and equipment that provides water supply which includes wells, reservoirs, pumping stations, and control facilities.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Wholly Owned Real Estate and Real Estate Acquired in Settlement of Loans
column2: The cash inflow from proceeds From Sales of Wholly Owned Real Estate and Real Estate Acquired in Settlement of Loans.

column1: Proceeds from Securitizations of Consumer Loans
column2: The cash inflow from the securitization of receivables for loans to consumers. Securitization is the structured process whereby interests in loans and other receivables are packaged, underwritten, and sold in the form of asset-backed securities.

column1: Proceeds from Securitizations of Loans Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow from the securitization of loans held for investment. Securitization is the structured process whereby interests in loans and other receivables are packaged, underwritten, and sold in the form of asset-backed securities.

column1: Proceeds from Short-term Debt, Maturing in Three Months or Less
column2: The cash inflow from a borrowing having initial term of repayment within three months.

column1: Proceeds of Other Loans and Leases Held-for-investment
column2: Amount of cash inflow from loans and leases held-for-investment, classified as other.

column1: Production Costs, Cumulative
column2: The capitalized costs incurred (excluded from amortization), as of the date of the balance sheet, to operate and maintain wells and related equipment and facilities, including depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of operating and maintaining those wells and related equipment and facilities. They become part of the cost of oil and gas produced. Examples of production costs (sometimes called lifting costs) are: costs of labor to operate the wells and related equipment and facilities; repairs and maintenance; materials, supplies, and fuel consumed and supplies utilized in operating the wells and related equipment and facilities; property taxes and insurance applicable to proved properties and wells and related equipment and facilities; severance taxes; some support equipment or facilities may serve two or more oil and gas producing activities and may also serve transportation, refining, and marketing activities. To the extent that the support equipment and facilities are used in oil and gas producing activities, their depreciation and applicable operating costs become exploration, development or production costs, as appropriate. Depreciation, depletion, and amortization of capitalized acquisition, exploration, and development costs are not production costs but also become part of the cost of oil and gas produced along with production (lifting) costs identified above.

column1: Product Liability Contingency, Third Party Recovery
column2: Amount of the estimated recovery from third parties recorded in the period pertaining to product liability damages from specified products.

column1: Product Liability Contingency, Third Party Recovery, Percentage
column2: Percentage of the estimated recovery from third parties recorded in the period pertaining to product liability damages from specified products.

column1: Standard and Extended Product Warranty Accrual
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for estimated claims under standard and extended warranty protection rights granted to customers.

column1: Product Warranty Accrual, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for estimated claims under standard and extended warranty protection rights granted to customers. For classified balance sheets, represents the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Pro Forma Weighted Average Shares Outstanding, Diluted
column2: The weighted average number of shares or units and dilutive common stock or unit equivalents outstanding in the calculation of proforma diluted earnings per share (earnings per unit), which is commonly presented in initial public offerings based on the terms of the offering.

column1: Projects that have Exploratory Well Costs that have been Capitalized for Period Greater than One Year, Number of Projects
column2: The number of projects for which exploratory well costs have been capitalized for a period of greater than one year after the completion of drilling.

column1: Property Management Fee, Percent Fee
column2: The percentage charged for managing real estate properties.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Number of Aircraft Sold
column2: The number of aircraft sold by the entity during the period.

column1: Property, Plant, and Equipment, Owned, Gross
column2: Gross amount of long-lived, depreciable flight assets owned by the entity and used in the entity's principle business operations (owned aircraft and capitalized improvements) and capitalized assets classified as property, plant and equipment that are owned by the entity. Excludes assets subject to a capital lease.

column1: Property, Plant, and Equipment, Owned, Net
column2: The net amount of long-lived, depreciable flight assets owned by the entity and used in the entity's principle business operations (owned aircraft and capitalized improvements) and capitalized assets classified as property, plant and equipment that are owned by the entity. Excludes assets subject to a capital lease.

column1: Property, Plant, and Equipment, Salvage Value
column2: The estimated or actual value of the asset at the end of its useful life or when it is no longer serviceable (cannot be used for its original purpose).

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Salvage Value, Percentage
column2: Stated as a percentage, the estimated or actual value of the asset at the end of its useful life or when it is no longer serviceable (cannot be used for its original purpose) divided by its [historical] capitalized cost.

column1: Property Subject to or Available for Operating Lease, Number of Units
column2: The number of units (items of property) under operating lease arrangements.

column1: Proved Oil and Gas Property, Successful Effort Method
column2: Oil and Gas properties with proved reserves under the successful effort method.

column1: Public Utilities, Allowance for Funds Used During Construction, Rate
column2: Effective rate, including composite rate, of cost of financing additions to qualifying regulated assets, commonly called allowance for funds used during construction.

column1: Public Utilities, Amount of Allowance for Earnings on Equity Capitalized for Rate Making Purposes
column2: Discloses the amount of any allowance for earnings on shareholders' investment capitalized for rate making purposes but not for the financial statements.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Amount of Construction Work in Process Included in Rate Base
column2: Discloses the amount of construction work in process that is included in the rate making process at period end.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Amount of Disallowed Costs for Recently Completed Plant
column2: Amount of disallowed costs for rate making purposes for recently completed plants in regulated industries.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Amount of Interest Incurred on Intermediary Debt for Electric Utility Plant Construction
column2: Amount of interest cost incurred for plant construction by an electric utility using a construction intermediary.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Amount of Remainder of Costs of Disallowed Assets for Recently Completed Plant
column2: The remaining amount of assets disallowed from inclusion in the rate making process pertaining to recently completed plants in regulated industries.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Disclosure of Composite Depreciation Rate for Plants in Service
column2: Composite depreciation rate for public utility plants in service.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Interest Rate on Intermediary Debt for Electric Utility Plant Construction
column2: Discloses the interest rate related to debt for plant construction for an electric utility using an intermediary for each period for which an income statement is presented.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Original Cost of Intangible Utility Plants
column2: Original cost of establishing intangible utility plants.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Present Value of Regulated Asset for Plant Abandonment
column2: The present value amount of future cost recoveries that are probable and estimable related to plant abandonment's for regulated industries.

column1: Pump Taxes
column2: Pump tax, commonly known as a Replenishment assessment. A charge on each acre-foot of groundwater extracted from the basin. Income from the pump taxes finances the replenishment of the basin and projects for water recycling and water quality improvements.

column1: Purchase Options, Land
column2: Carrying amount of an option or options to acquire real property.

column1: Real Estate Held for Development and Sale
column2: For banks, amount of real estate assets held for development or sale by the consolidated entity.

column1: Real Estate Held for Development and Sale, Net
column2: For banks, amount of real estate assets held for development or sale, net of associated liabilities.

column1: Real Estate Held for Development and Sale, Subsidiary
column2: For banks, amount of real estate assets held for development or resale by subsidiary entities which hold such assets in the course of business.

column1: Real Estate Insurance
column2: A contract to provide coverage or protection in exchange for a payment or "premium". Examples of insurance protection include liability and property insurance. The entity paying the premiums for the protection will have insurance expense and possibly an asset, Prepaid Insurance (if the premiums are paid in advance).

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate, Intercompany Profits Included in Carrying Amount
column2: Amount of intercompany profits included in the amount, before accumulated depreciation, of real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Real Estate Inventory, Construction Materials
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of unprocessed goods that will be used in the course of a construction project which will become a part of the finished inventory.

column1: Real Estate Investments, Net
column2: Amount of real estate investments, net of accumulated depreciation, which may include the following: (1) land available-for-sale; (2) land available-for-development; (3) investments in building and building improvements; (4) tenant allowances; (5) developments in-process; (6) rental properties; (7) other real estate investments; (8) real estate joint ventures; and (9) unconsolidated real estate and other joint ventures not separately presented.

column1: Real Estate Investment Subsidiaries, Cash and Other Assets
column2: For banks, amount of assets of real estate investments of a financial institution which are not land, buildings, or leasehold improvements.

column1: Real Estate Liabilities Associated with Assets Held for Development and Sale
column2: For banks, amount of all liabilities for which a financial institution is required to include in its calculation of net investment in real estate assets held for development or sale.

column1: Real Estate Owned, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation for real estate owned (REO).

column1: Real Estate Subsidiary Liabilities
column2: For banks, amount of liabilities for which a financial institution is required to include in its calculation of net investment in real estate assets held for development or sale.

column1: Real Estate Variable Interest Entity Borrowings
column2: For banks, amount of liabilities in variable interest entities for which a financial institution is required to include in its calculation of net investment in real estate assets held for development or sale.

column1: Receivable for Recovery of Import Duties, Net
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of tariffs due either from customers or suppliers arising from sales or purchases, or as previously overpaid to tax authorities or vendors.

column1: Receivables, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of receivables, including, but not limited to, trade account receivables, note receivables, and loan receivables.

column1: Receivables Held-for-sale, Amount
column2: The face amount of all receivables that will be sold to other entities, including trade and loan receivables.

column1: Receivables, Long-term Contracts or Programs
column2: Amount to be collected within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from customers in accordance with the contractual provisions of long-term contracts or programs including amounts billed and unbilled as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Receivables with Imputed Interest, Amortization Amount
column2: The amount of amortization of the discount or premium on the note or receivable which was the result of the determination of present value in cash or noncash transactions, recognized in the statement of operations for the period.

column1: Receivable with Imputed Interest, Effective Yield (Interest Rate)
column2: Yield on the receivable, on which interest has been imputed, as calculated from its issuance value or purchase price. The calculated effective interest rate considers factors such as the issued face value or price paid for the receivable, the time period between payments, and the time until maturity [full receipt] of the receivable.

column1: Receivable with Imputed Interest, Face Amount
column2: The principal amount of the receivable or note before consideration of the discount or premium.

column1: Receivable with Imputed Interest, Premium
column2: Disclosure of the unamortized amount of the premium on the note or receivable which is added to the face amount of the receivable or loan. The discount or premium is defined as the difference between the present value and the face amount.

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries, Amount
column2: Recorded amount of the individual components comprising the asset for third-party recoveries related to environmental remediation obligations.

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries, Current
column2: Cumulative amount of the asset for third-party recoveries related to environmental remediation obligations that is recoverable within one year of the balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries, Discount
column2: The amount of imputed interest necessary to reduce the expected aggregate undiscounted amount of the asset for third-party recoveries related to environmental remediation obligations to the present value recognized on the balance sheet (if the receivable is discounted).

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries, Discount Rate
column2: Rate applied to the undiscounted amount of the asset for third-party recoveries related to environmental remediation obligations to arrive at the present value recorded as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries, Noncurrent
column2: Cumulative amount of the asset for third-party recoveries related to environmental remediation obligations that is recoverable after one year from the balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries Receivable
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of known and reasonably estimable amounts of recoveries from third-parties pertaining to an entity's environmental remediation obligations. An entity's balance sheet may include several assets that relate to an environmental remediation obligation. Among them are the following: a. Receivables from other potentially responsible parties that are not providing initial funding; b. anticipated recoveries from insurers; and c. anticipated recoveries from prior owners as a result of indemnification agreements.

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries, Undiscounted
column2: Aggregate undiscounted amount of the asset for third-party recoveries related to environmental remediation obligations as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Minimum Quantity Required
column2: The minimum number of units that must be purchased, in connection with an unconditional purchase obligation that has been recognized for financial reporting purposes.

column1: Recovery Stranded Costs
column2: Revenue from billings to utility customers to recover what are also referred to as stranded assets or stranded investments. These are assets that formerly regulated utilities with monopolies on local service are allowed to recover during their transition to deregulated suppliers in competitive markets. Essentially, these investments are sunk costs, made by utilities under the old regulated system, which might not be recovered in a truly competitive marketplace. However, since they were valid investments at the time, the utilities are allowed to recover these costs from customers (for example, an investment in electrical generation assets that may not be recouped if customers are now allowed to purchase electricity from another utility).

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Common, Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the reporting date of noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the (parent) entity (1) at a fixed or determinable price on a fixed or determinable date, (2) at the option of the holder of the noncontrolling interest, or (3) upon occurrence of an event that is not solely within the control of the (parent) entity. The noncontrolling interest holder's ownership (or holders' ownership) may be in the form of common shares (regardless of class), limited partnership units (regardless of class), non-preferential membership interests, or any other form of common equity regardless of investee entity legal form.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Other, Carrying Amount
column2: Amount of noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the parent entity, classified as other equity.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Other, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the parent entity and classified as other equity.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Preferred, Carrying Amount
column2: As of the reporting date, the carrying amount of noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the (parent) entity (1) at a fixed or determinable price on a fixed or determinable date, (2) at the option of the holder of the noncontrolling interest, or (3) upon occurrence of an event that is not solely within the control of the (parent) entity. The noncontrolling interest holder's ownership (or holders' ownership) may be in the form of preferred shares (regardless of class), preferred partnership units (regardless of class), preferential membership interests, or any other form of preferred equity regardless of investee entity legal form.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Preferred, Fair Value
column2: The fair value as of the reporting date of noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the (parent) entity (1) at a fixed or determinable price on a fixed or determinable date, (2) at the option of the holder of the noncontrolling interest, or (3) upon occurrence of an event that is not solely within the control of the (parent) entity. The noncontrolling interest holder's ownership (or holders' ownership) may be in the form of preferred shares (regardless of class), preferred partnership units (regardless of class), preferential membership interests, or any other form of preferred equity regardless of investee entity legal form.

column1: Refundable Gas Costs
column2: Gas costs of a regulated entity that are refundable through future rate adjustments. Such costs are a form of a regulatory liabilities and are expected to be refunded in less than one year through rate adjustments.

column1: Refunds Due under Government Contracts
column2: Amount of renegotiation refunds which have been determined to be probable and reasonably estimated at the balance sheet date.

column1: Regulated Entity, Other Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Total of noncurrent other assets held by public utility entities.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue
column2: The total amount of regulated operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Electric, Non-Nuclear
column2: The amount of regulated power revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Field Services
column2: The amount of regulated field services operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Fossil Fuel
column2: The amount of regulated fossil fuel operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Gas
column2: The amount of regulated gas operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Other
column2: The amount of regulated other operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Pipelines
column2: The amount of regulated pipeline operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Steam
column2: The amount of regulated steam operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Water
column2: The amount of regulated water operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Regulator Expenses, Cost Assessed on Federal Home Loan Bank
column2: Amount of fees or assessments to fund the operations of the regulator of Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks).

column1: Regulatory Assets, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of capitalized costs of regulated entities that are expected to be recovered through revenue sources within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Such costs are capitalized if they meet both of the following criteria: a. It is probable that future revenue in an amount at least equal to the capitalized cost will result from inclusion of that cost in allowable costs for rate-making purposes. b. Based on available evidence, the future revenue will be provided to permit recovery of the previously incurred cost rather than to provide for expected levels of similar future costs. If the revenue will be provided through an automatic rate-adjustment clause, this criterion requires that the regulator's intent clearly be to permit recovery of the previously incurred cost.

column1: Regulatory Liability, Current
column2: The amount for the individual regulatory current liability as itemized in a table of regulatory current liabilities as of the end of the period.

column1: Reimbursement from Limited Partnership Investment
column2: A payment from an investee, in which the investment basis has previously been reduced to zero. This amount reduces net cash used in operating activities.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables, Case Basis
column2: The sum for all reinsurance arrangements of the known and estimated amount recoverable as of the balance sheet date from a given reinsurer for claims paid or incurred by the ceding insurer and associated claims settlement expenses for each reinsurance arrangement (or, the sum of all cases determined individually, probably applying different assumptions to each arrangement).

column1: Reinsurance Recoverables, Incurred but Not Reported Claims
column2: Estimated amount after valuation allowance of reinsurance recoverables, due from reinsurers for incurred claims not yet reported, and claims settlement expenses.

column1: Remaining Amounts of Regulatory Assets for which No Return on Investment During Recovery Period is Provided
column2: Remaining balance of regulatory assets for which no return on investment during recovery is provided. In some cases, a regulator may permit an enterprise to include a cost that would be charged to expense by an unregulated enterprise as an allowable cost over a period of time by amortizing that cost for rate-making purposes, but the regulator does not include the unrecovered amount in the rate base.

column1: Repayments of Debt, Maturing in More than Three Months
column2: The cash outflow from a repayment of a borrowing having initial term of repayment of more than three months. Includes repayments of short-term and long-term debt.

column1: Repayments of Mandatory Redeemable Capital Securities
column2: The cash outflow related to equity securities that embody an unconditional obligation requiring the issuer to redeem the securities by transferring the assets at a specified or determinable date (or dates) that is (or are) initially more than one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer) from the issuance date, or upon an event that is certain to occur beyond one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer) from the issuance date.

column1: Repayments of Pollution Control Bond
column2: The cash outflow from settlement of a long-term debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation to finance the construction of air- or water-pollution control facilities or sewage or solid waste disposal facilities pursuant to federal law. The bonds are backed by the credit of the beneficiary of the financing rather than the credit of the issuer.

column1: Repayments of Short-term Debt, Maturing in More than Three Months
column2: The cash outflow from a repayment of a borrowing having initial term of repayment of more than three months but less than one year or one operating cycle (if the normal cycle is more than one year).

column1: Repayments of Short-term Debt, Maturing in Three Months or Less
column2: The cash outflow from a repayment of a borrowing having initial term of repayment within three months.

column1: Repayments of Unsecured Tax Exempt Debt
column2: The cash outflow to repay long-term tax exempt debt that is not secured by collateral.

column1: Replacement Reserve Escrow
column2: This element represents those amounts set aside for the repair and replacement of real or personal property in the foreseen future. Such amount may be funded from sales revenue (for example; timeshare sales) or operating revenues; in a lump sum or installments (such as monthly); as per internal policy (for example: hotel operators), as required by contractual agreement (for example: sales contract); or by the terms of debt agreements.

column1: Repurchase Agreements, Interest Expense Amount
column2: This is the amount of interest expense incurred during the reporting period as a result of repurchase agreements.

column1: Research and Development Arrangement, Contract to Perform for Others, Compensation Earned
column2: The amount of compensation earned (contract income) under a research and development arrangement accounted for as a contract to perform research and development for others.

column1: Research and Development Arrangement, Contract to Perform for Others, Costs Incurred, Gross
column2: The amount of costs incurred under a research and development arrangement accounted for as a contract to perform research and development for others.

column1: Research and Development Arrangement with Federal Government, Costs Incurred, Net
column2: The net amount of research and development costs incurred for a fixed-price, best-efforts research and development cost-sharing arrangement with the Federal Government.

column1: Research and Development Arrangement with Federal Government, Customer Funding to Offset Costs Incurred
column2: The amount of customer funding recorded as an offset to costs incurred for a fixed-price, best-efforts research and development cost-sharing arrangement with the Federal Government.

column1: Research and Development in Process
column2: The amount of purchased research and development assets that are acquired in a business combination have no alternative future use and are therefore written off in the period of acquisition.

column1: Resell Agreements, Period End Amounts Excluding Effects of Agreements Reported Net by Counterparty
column2: This is the total amount of resale agreements as of the reporting date. This is a gross amount (does not net agreement amounts by counterparty).

column1: Restricted Cash and Investments
column2: Cash and investments whose use in whole or in part is restricted for the long-term, generally by contractual agreements or regulatory requirements. For use in an unclassified balance sheet.

column1: Restricted Cash and Investments, Current
column2: The current cash, cash equivalents and investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against short-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or entity statements of intention with regard to particular deposits; however, time deposits and short-term certificates of deposit are not generally included in legally restricted deposits. Excludes compensating balance arrangements that are not agreements which legally restrict the use of cash amounts shown on the balance sheet. Includes current cash equivalents and investments that are similarly restricted as to withdrawal, usage or disposal.

column1: Restricted Cash and Investments, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent cash, cash equivalents and investments that is restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or entity statements of intention with regard to particular deposits classified as long-term; that is not expected to be released from such existing restrictions within one year of the balance sheet date or operating cycle, whichever is longer. Excludes compensating balance arrangements that are not agreements which legally restrict the use of cash amounts shown on the balance sheet. Includes noncurrent cash equivalents and investments that are similarly restricted as to withdrawal, usage or disposal.

column1: Restricted Investments
column2: Investments which are not defined as or included in marketable (debt, equity, or other) securities whose use is restricted in whole or in part, generally by contractual agreements or regulatory requirements. For use in an unclassified balance sheet.

column1: Restricted Investments, Noncurrent
column2: This element represents the noncurrent portion of investments which are not defined as or included in marketable (debt, equity, or other) securities that are pledged or subject to withdrawal restrictions.

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Expected Number of Positions Eliminated
column2: The expected number of positions to be eliminated as a result of restructuring activities.

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Number of Positions Eliminated
column2: The number of positions eliminated during the period as a result of restructuring activities.

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Number of Positions Eliminated, Inception to Date
column2: The number of positions eliminated as of the balance sheet date since inception of the restructuring plan(s).

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Number of Positions Eliminated, Inception to Date Percent
column2: Percentage of the total number of positions eliminated as of the balance sheet date since inception of the restructuring plan(s).

column1: Restructuring and Related Cost, Number of Positions Eliminated, Period Percent
column2: The number of positions eliminated during the period as a percentage of total positions eliminated during the period in connection with the restructuring plan(s).

column1: Restructuring Reserve, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of known and estimated costs associated with exit from or disposal of business activities or restructurings pursuant to a duly authorized plan, which are expected to be paid after one year or beyond the next operating cycle, if longer. Costs of such activities include those for one-time termination benefits, termination of an operating lease or other contract, consolidating or closing facilities, and relocating employees, and costs associated with an ongoing benefit arrangement, but excludes costs associated with the retirement of a long-lived asset.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Delinquent Accounts Receivable
column2: Amount of accounts receivable that are delinquent at the end of the reporting period.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Deposit Method, Deposit Received
column2: This element represents the amount of deposit received in a retail land sale transaction accounted for under the deposit method.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Deposit Method, Property Carrying Value
column2: This element represents the carrying value, net of accumulated deprecation, as of the date of the statement of financial position of a property sold during the reporting period, but which sale is accounted for under the deposit method and, therefore, which property continues to be included in the statement of financial position.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Estimated Cost of Major Improvements
column2: The estimated total cost of expenditures for improvements in each major area from which sales are being made for the five years following the date of the accounting period.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Estimated Cost of Major Improvements, Fifth Year
column2: The estimated cost of expenditures for improvements for each major area from which sales are being made for the fifth year following the balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Estimated Cost of Major Improvements, First Year
column2: The estimated cost of expenditures for improvements for each major area from which sales are being made for the first year following the balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Estimated Cost of Major Improvements, Fourth Year
column2: The estimated cost of expenditures for improvements for each major area from which sales are being made for the fourth year following the balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Estimated Cost of Major Improvements, Second Year
column2: The estimated cost of expenditures for improvements for each major area from which sales are being made for the second year following the balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Estimated Cost of Major Improvements, Third Year
column2: The estimated cost of expenditures for improvements for each major area from which sales are being made for the third year following the balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Installment Method, Gross Profit, Deferred
column2: Amount of deferred gross profit, realized on retail land sale transaction accounted for under the installment method.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Installment Method, Sales Value
column2: Amount of sales related to retail land transactions accounted for under the installment method.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Installment Method, Cost of Sales
column2: Cost of sales related to retail land sales transactions accounted for under the installment method.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Liability for Improvements
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the liability for the obligation to provide retail land sale buyers with improvements.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Year Five
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Year Four
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Year Three
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Land Sales, Maturity of Accounts Receivable, Year Two
column2: Amount of accounts receivable from retail land sales to be collected in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retail Related Inventory
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of merchandise inventory held by a retailer, wholesaler, or distributor for future sale; includes packaging and other supplies used to store, transport, or present merchandise inventory.

column1: Retail Related Inventory, Merchandise
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of merchandise inventory purchased by a retailer, wholesaler or distributor and held for future sale.

column1: Retail Related Inventory, Packaging and Other Supplies
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of items used in storage, presentation or transportation of physical goods that are targeted for sale to end users.

column1: Retained Interest, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of interest continued to be held by a transferor after transferring financial assets to a third party.

column1: Retains
column2: Amount of patronage earnings withheld by agricultural cooperatives from distributions and allocated to patrons' capital accounts.

column1: Retention Payable
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract.

column1: Retention Payable, Due after One Year
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid after the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due after Year Five
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Year Five
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Year Two
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Next Twelve Months
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable, Due in Year Four
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Retention Payable Due in Year Three
column2: Amounts owed to vendors and subcontractors that have been withheld because of retainage provisions in a contract to be paid in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Revenue Recognition, Milestone Method, Revenue Recognized
column2: The amount of consideration recognized during the period for the milestone or milestones.

column1: Revenue Recognition, Multiple-deliverable Arrangements, Determination of Selling Price, Amount
column2: Represents the value established as the selling price of the significant unit of accounting used to allocate the consideration of the multiple-deliverable arrangement.

column1: Revenues and Gains, Reporting Currency Denominated, Value
column2: The reporting currency-denominated revenue (including gains) amount.

column1: Sale of Stock, Consideration Received Per Transaction
column2: Amount of consideration received by subsidiary or equity investee in exchange for shares of stock issued or sold. Includes amount of cash received, fair value of noncash assets received, and fair value of liabilities assumed by the investor.

column1: Sale of Stock, Percentage of Ownership after Transaction
column2: Percentage of subsidiary's or equity investee's stock owned by parent company after stock transaction.

column1: Sale of Stock, Percentage of Ownership before Transaction
column2: Percentage of subsidiary's or equity investee's stock owned by parent company before stock transaction.

column1: Secured Debt, Dollar Rolls
column2: Carrying value, as of the balance sheet date, of an agreement to sell a mortgage-backed security with an agreement to purchase a similar mortgage-backed security at a future date.

column1: Secured Debt, Other
column2: Amount of collateralized debt obligations classified as other.

column1: Secured Debt, Repurchase Agreements
column2: Carrying value, as of the balance sheet date, of securities sold under agreements to repurchase where the transferor maintains effective control over the assets, accounting for them as secured debt.

column1: Secured Demand Notes
column2: Represents the carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of loans made to broker-dealers which are generally secured by marketable securities owned by the borrower broker-dealer but held by the lender, are interest-bearing, and payable upon demand. The right to demand payment may be conditioned upon the occurrence of certain events.

column1: Secured Long-term Debt, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount of collateralized debt obligations with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer, excluding the current portion. Obligations include, but not limited to, mortgage loans, chattel loans, and other borrowings secured by assets.

column1: Securities Borrowed, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of securities borrowed from other entities.

column1: Securities Failed-to-Deliver
column2: Amount receivable as the result of a fail-to-deliver. A fail-to-deliver is a securities sale to another broker-dealer that has not been delivered to buying broker-dealer by the close of business on the settlement date.

column1: Securities Failed-to-Receive
column2: Amount payable as the result of fail-to-receive. A fail-to-receive is a securities purchase from another broker-dealer not received from the selling broker-dealer by the close of business on the settlement date.

column1: Securities Received as Collateral
column2: The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the assets received as collateral against securities loaned to other broker-dealers. Borrowers of securities generally are required to provide collateral to the lenders of securities, commonly cash but sometimes other securities or standby letters of credit, with a value slightly higher than that of the securities borrowed. In instances where the entity is permitted to sell or re-pledge these securities, the entity reports the fair value of the collateral received and the related obligation to return the collateral as a liability.

column1: Securities Received as Collateral, Amount Foreclosed
column2: The fair value of collateral received that was taken through foreclosure due to default by the original transferor in lieu of collection of the secured receivable.

column1: Securities Received as Collateral, Amount Repledged and Sold
column2: The fair value of collateral received that has been sold or re-pledged and is owed to the debtor (transferor) upon settlement of the related contractual obligation under which it was received.

column1: Securities Reserve Deposit Required and Made
column2: Securities deposited in a special reserve account for the exclusive benefit of customers pursuant to SEC Regulations.

column1: Securities Segregated under Other Regulations
column2: Fair value of securities deposited in a special reserve account for the exclusive benefit of customers pursuant to regulations other than SEC Regulations and the Commodity Exchange Act.

column1: Securities Segregated under Securities Exchange Commission Regulation
column2: Fair value of securities deposited in a special reserve account for the exclusive benefit of customers.

column1: Securitized Regulatory Transition Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value of the regulatory asset that represents capitalized stranded costs that have been securitized (financed with debt) and are expected to be recoverable through a transition charge after one year (or beyond the operating cycle if longer). A transition charge is a charge approved by a regulator that allows deregulated utilities to recover investments in certain assets, such as power plants, over a transition period leading into a deregulated market.

column1: Security Owned and Pledged as Collateral, Associated Liabilities, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of liabilities arising from or related to a financial instrument held by the entity for its own account (proprietary securities) which has been pledged to counterparties.

column1: Self Insurance Reserve, Current
column2: Carrying amount of accrued known and estimated losses incurred as of the balance sheet date for which no insurance coverage exists, and for which a claim has been made or is probable of being asserted, typically arising from workmen's compensation-type of incidents and personal injury to nonemployees from accidents on the entity's property that are expected to be paid within one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer).

column1: Self Insurance Reserve, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount of accrued known and estimated losses incurred as of the balance sheet date for which no insurance coverage exists, and for which a claim has been made or is probable of being asserted, typically arising from workmen's compensation-type of incidents and personal injury to nonemployees from accidents on the entity's property that are expected to be paid after one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer).

column1: Separate Accounts, Liability
column2: Amount of liability for variable contracts that meet specified criteria that are backed by assets held in separate accounts and carried at the fair value of those assets.

column1: Servicing Assets and Servicing Liabilities at Fair Value, Assumptions Used to Estimate Fair Value, Discount Rate
column2: Discount rate used to estimate the fair value of servicing assets and servicing liabilities.

column1: Servicing Assets and Servicing Liabilities at Fair Value, Assumptions Used to Estimate Fair Value, Expected Credit Losses
column2: Percentage of contractually collectible principal associated with a financial asset expected not to be collected due to default by the borrower.

column1: Servicing Assets and Servicing Liabilities at Fair Value, Assumptions Used to Estimate Fair Value, Prepayment Speed
column2: Estimated rate of prepayments of principal on servicing assets and servicing liabilities.

column1: Settlement Assets, Current
column2: Cash received or short term receivables for unsettled money transfers, money orders, consumer payments, or business to business payments. Settlement assets include clearing and settling customers payments due to and from financial institutions and may include cash and cash equivalents.

column1: Settlement Liabilities, Current
column2: Amounts payable for money transfers, money orders, and consumer payment service arrangements. Settlement liabilities include amounts payable to intermediaries for global payment transfers.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Discount from Market Price, Offering Date
column2: Discount rate from fair value on offering date that participants pay for shares.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Discount from Market Price, Purchase Date
column2: Discount rate from fair value on purchase date that participants pay for shares.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Expected Dividend Rate
column2: The estimated dividend rate (a percentage of the share price) to be paid (expected dividends) to holders of the underlying shares over the option's term.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Expected Volatility Rate, Minimum
column2: The estimated measure of the minimum percentage by which a share price is expected to fluctuate during a period. Volatility also may be defined as a probability-weighted measure of the dispersion of returns about the mean. The volatility of a share price is the standard deviation of the continuously compounded rates of return on the share over a specified period. That is the same as the standard deviation of the differences in the natural logarithms of the stock prices plus dividends, if any, over the period.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Risk Free Interest Rate, Minimum
column2: The minimum risk-free interest rate assumption that is used in valuing an option on its own shares.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Weighted Average Expected Dividend
column2: Disclosure of the weighted average expected dividend for an entity using a valuation technique with different dividend rates during the contractual term.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Maximum Employee Subscription Rate
column2: The highest percentage of annual salary that an employee is permitted to utilize with respect to the plan.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Maximum Number of Shares Per Employee
column2: The highest quantity of shares an employee can purchase under the plan per period.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Number of Shares Authorized
column2: The maximum number of shares (or other type of equity) originally approved (usually by shareholders and board of directors), net of any subsequent amendments and adjustments, for awards under the equity-based compensation plan. As stock or unit options and equity instruments other than options are awarded to participants, the shares or units remain authorized and become reserved for issuance under outstanding awards (not necessarily vested).

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Exercisable, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: The weighted-average price as of the balance sheet date at which grantees can acquire the shares reserved for issuance on vested portions of options outstanding and currently exercisable under the stock option plan.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Grants in Period, Grant Date Intrinsic Value
column2: The grant-date intrinsic value of options granted during the reporting period as calculated by applying the disclosed option pricing methodology.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Grants in Period, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
column2: The weighted average grant-date fair value of options granted during the reporting period as calculated by applying the disclosed option pricing methodology.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested and Expected to Vest, Exercisable, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: As of the balance sheet date, the weighted-average exercise price (at which grantees can acquire the shares reserved for issuance) for exercisable stock options that are fully vested or expected to vest.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested and Expected to Vest, Outstanding, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: As of the balance sheet date, the weighted-average exercise price for outstanding stock options that are fully vested or expected to vest.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Per Share Weighted Average Price of Shares Purchased
column2: The weighted average of per share prices paid for shares purchased on the open market for issuance to employees under the plan.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Plan Modification, Number of Employees Affected
column2: The number of employees affected by the modification of an equity-based compensation plan.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Shares to be Repurchased Next Year
column2: An entity expecting to repurchase shares in the following period, generally discloses an estimate of the amount or range of shares to be repurchased.

column1: Share-based Compensation, Shares Authorized under Stock Option Plans, Exercise Price Range, Exercisable Options, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average exercise price as of the balance sheet date for those equity-based payment arrangements exercisable and outstanding.

column1: Share-based Compensation, Shares Authorized under Stock Option Plans, Exercise Price Range, Lower Range Limit
column2: The floor of a customized range of exercise prices for purposes of disclosing shares potentially issuable under outstanding stock option awards on all stock option plans and other required information pertaining to awards in the customized range.

column1: Share-based Compensation, Shares Authorized under Stock Option Plans, Exercise Price Range, Outstanding Options, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: The weighted average price as of the balance sheet date at which grantees could acquire the underlying shares with respect to all outstanding stock options which are in the customized range of exercise prices.

column1: Share-based Compensation, Shares Authorized under Stock Option Plans, Exercise Price Range, Upper Range Limit
column2: The ceiling of a customized range of exercise prices for purposes of disclosing shares potentially issuable under outstanding stock option awards on all stock option plans and other required information pertaining to awards in the customized range.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Modification of Terms, Incremental Compensation Cost
column2: The excess of the fair value of the modified award over the fair value of the award immediately before the modification.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Quantity of Securities Issued
column2: The number of shares or units of entity securities issued in the transaction in which equity securities were issued to pay for goods or nonemployee services.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Shares Approved for Issuance
column2: The maximum number of shares (or other type of equity) that have been approved for issuance in the equity-based payment transaction.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Valuation Method, Expected Dividend Rate
column2: The estimated dividend rate (a percentage of the share price) to be paid (expected dividends) to holders of the underlying shares over the expected term of a nonvested share or option award issued to other than an employee.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Valuation Method, Expected Volatility Rate
column2: The estimated measure of the percentage amount by which a share price is expected to fluctuate during the expected term of a nonvested share or option award issued to other than an employee.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Valuation Method, Risk Free Interest Rate
column2: The risk-free interest rate assumption that is used in valuing a nonvested share or option award issued to other than an employee.

column1: Shares Held in Employee Stock Option Plan, Committed-to-be-Released
column2: Number of committed-to-be-released shares held by the Employee Stock Option Plan at balance sheet date. Committed-to-be-released shares are shares that will be released in the future and will be allocated to employees for services rendered in an accounting period. These shares are legally released from suspense and from serving as collateral for ESOP debt as a result of payment of debt service.

column1: Shares held in Employee Stock Option Plan, Suspense Shares
column2: Number of suspense shares held by the Employee Stock Option Plan at balance sheet date. Suspense shares are shares that have not been released, committed to be released or allocated to individual participant accounts.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Share Value, Amount, Current
column2: The amount that is required to be paid, determined under the conditions specified in the contract, if as of the reporting date, the holder of the share has exercised the right to or the shares are mandatorily redeemable within one year of the reporting date or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Share Value, Amount, Noncurrent
column2: The amount that is required to be paid, determined under the conditions specified in the contract, if as of the reporting date, the holder of the share has exercised the right to or the shares are mandatorily redeemable after one year from the reporting date or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Excess of Assets over Liabilities
column2: The value of the excess of assets over liabilities. If all outstanding shares are subject to mandatory redemption and the redemption price is less than the book value (the redemption price is less than the company's equity balance), the resulting cumulative transition adjustment and subsequent adjustments to reflect changes in the redemption price of the shares are recorded as an excess of assets over liabilities (equity).

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Maximum Amount
column2: The maximum amount that the issuer could be required to pay to redeem the instrument by physical settlement, if applicable.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Maximum Number of Shares
column2: The maximum number of shares that the issuer could be required to issue to redeem the instrument, if applicable.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Number of Shares
column2: The number of shares that would be issued, determined under the conditions specified in the contract, if the settlement were to occur at the reporting date.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Number of Shares Indexed
column2: For a forward contract or an option indexed to the issuer's equity shares, the number of issuer's shares to which the contract is indexed.

column1: Short-Duration Contracts, Discounted Liabilities, Amount
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of loss reserves carried at present value.

column1: Short-Duration Contracts, Discounted Liabilities, Discount Rate
column2: The discount rate used to reduce the estimated amount of loss reserves on short-duration contracts to present value.

column1: Short-term Bank Loans and Notes Payable
column2: Amount of borrowings from a bank classified as other, maturing within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Significant Changes, Franchised Outlets in Operation
column2: The number of franchised outlets in operation at the balance sheet date when there are significant changes in franchisor-owned outlets or franchised outlets during the period.

column1: Significant Changes, Franchisor Outlets in Operation
column2: The number of franchisor-owned outlets in operation at the balance sheet date when there are significant changes in franchisor-owned outlets or franchised outlets during the period.

column1: Significant Changes, Franchises Sold
column2: The number of franchises sold during the period when there are significant changes in franchisor-owned outlets or franchised outlets during the period.

column1: Significant Costs Incurred to Acquire Mineral Interest of Proved Reserves
column2: Significant costs that have been incurred, including capitalized costs and costs charged to expense, to acquire mineral interests that have proved reserves.

column1: Special Assessment Bond
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying value as of the balance sheet date of a type of municipal bond typically used to fund a development project. Also called special assessment limited liability bond, special district bond, special purpose bond, special tax bond and community development obligation. Interest owed to lenders is paid by taxes levied on the community benefiting from the particular bond-funded project. For example, if a bond of this sort was issued to pay for sidewalks to be repaved in a certain community, an additional tax would be levied on homeowners in the area benefiting from this project.

column1: Special Assessment Bond, Current
column2: The current portion of the carrying value as of the balance sheet date of a type of municipal bond typically used to fund a development project. Also called special assessment limited liability bond, special district bond, special purpose bond, special tax bond and community development obligation. Interest owed to lenders is paid by taxes levied on the community benefiting from the particular bond-funded project. For example, if a bond of this sort was issued to pay for sidewalks to be repaved in a certain community, an additional tax would be levied on homeowners in the area benefiting from this project.

column1: Special Assessment Bond, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent portion of the carrying value as of the balance sheet date of a type of municipal bond typically used to fund a development project. Also called special assessment limited liability bond, special district bond, special purpose bond, special tax bond and community development obligation. Interest owed to lenders is paid by taxes levied on the community benefiting from the particular bond-funded project. For example, if a bond of this sort was issued to pay for sidewalks to be repaved in a certain community, an additional tax would be levied on homeowners in the area benefiting from this project.

column1: Spent Nuclear Fuel Obligation, Noncurrent
column2: Provision for the disposal costs of spent nuclear fuel from generating stations.

column1: Standard Product Warranty Accrual
column2: Amount as of the balance sheet date of the aggregate standard product warranty liability. Does not include the balance for the extended product warranty liability.

column1: Standard Product Warranty Accrual, Current
column2: Amount as of the balance sheet date of the aggregate standard product warranty liability that is expected to be paid within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Does not include the balance for the extended product warranty liability.

column1: Standard Product Warranty Accrual, Noncurrent
column2: Amount as of the balance sheet date of the aggregate standard product warranty liability that is expected to be paid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer. Does not include the balance for the extended product warranty liability.

column1: Statutory Accounting Practices, Portion of Excess Retained Earnings Not Taxed
column2: The amount of retained earnings as of the balance sheet date in excess of statutory unassigned surplus on which no income tax provisions have been made.

column1: Statutory Accounting Practices, Statutory Amount Available for Dividend Payments
column2: Amount of dividends available for payment after computation of statutory restrictions on capital surplus.

column1: Statutory Capital and Surplus Applying National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) Practices
column2: Amount of statutory capital and surplus computed using statutory accounting practices prescribed by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners.

column1: Stock Dividends, Shares
column2: Number of shares of common and preferred stock issued as dividends during the period. Excludes stock splits.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Shares, Employee Benefit Plan
column2: Number of shares issued during the period to an employee benefit plan, such as a defined contribution or defined benefit plan.

column1: Stock Repurchase Program, Number of Shares Authorized to be Repurchased
column2: The number of shares authorized to be repurchased by an entity's Board of Directors under a stock repurchase plan.

column1: Stock Repurchase Program, Remaining Number of Shares Authorized to be Repurchased
column2: The remaining number of shares authorized to be repurchased by an entity's Board of Directors under a stock repurchase plan.

column1: Subordinated Debt
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying value as of the balance sheet date of subordinated debt (with initial maturities beyond one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer). Subordinated debt places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment in liquidation of the entity's assets.

column1: Subordinated Long-term Debt, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of collateralized/uncollateralized debt obligation (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer), excluding current portion. Subordinated debt places a lender in a lien position behind the primary lender of the company.

column1: Subsidiary or Equity Method Investee, Cumulative Number of Shares Issued for All Transactions
column2: Cumulative number of shares issued or sold by the subsidiary or equity method investee on all stock transactions.

column1: Subsidiary or Equity Method Investee, Cumulative Percentage Ownership after All Transactions
column2: Percentage of subsidiary's or equity method investee's stock owned by parent immediately after all stock transactions.

column1: Subsidiary or Equity Method Investee, Cumulative Proceeds Received on All Transactions
column2: Cumulative amount of cash and other consideration received by subsidiary or equity method investee in exchange for shares or stock issued or sold. Include amounts of cash received, fair value of non-cash assets received, fair value of liabilities assumed, and fair value of any other forms of consideration.

column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits
column2: Liability for benefits due terminated employees.

column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits, Continuation of Health Care
column2: Liability for extension of health coverage in instances where coverage under the plan would otherwise end.

column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits, Continuation of Life Insurance
column2: Liability for extension of life insurance coverage in instances where coverage under the plan would otherwise end.

column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits, Disability Related Benefits
column2: Liability for amount due a former employee for benefits as a result of them becoming physically or mentally impaired.

column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits, Job Training and Counseling
column2: Liability for benefits that provide the former employee with career counseling assistance and instruction in learning new skills, to assist them in finding another source of employment.

column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits, Other Postemployment
column2: Amount of postemployment benefit liabilities classified as other.
