column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits, Salary Continuation
column2: Liability for agreement to continue an employee's salary after termination of employment (but before retirement) including death, disability, or other event. For example, a company may agree to continue a disabled employee's salary for six months.

column1: Supplemental Unemployment Benefits, Severance Benefits
column2: Liability for amount due employees, in addition to wages and any other money that employers owe employees, when their employment ends through a layoff or other termination. For example, a company may provide involuntarily terminated employees with a lump sum payment equal to one week's salary for every year of employment.

column1: Surplus Notes
column2: Financial instruments issued by insurance entities (surplus notes) that are includable in surplus for statutory accounting purposes as prescribed or permitted by state laws and regulations that are liabilities of the issuer.

column1: Temporary Equity, Aggregate Amount of Redemption Requirement
column2: Aggregate amount of redemption requirements for each class or type of redeemable stock classified as temporary equity for each of the five years following the latest balance sheet date. The redemption requirement does not constitute an unconditional obligation that will be settled in a variable number of shares constituting a monetary value predominantly indexed to (a) a fixed monetary amount known at inception, (b) an amount inversely correlated with the residual value of the entity, or (c) an amount determined by reference to something other than the fair value of issuer's stock. Does not include mandatorily redeemable stock. The exception is if redemption is required upon liquidation or termination of the reporting entity.

column1: Temporary Equity, Liquidation Preference
column2: The aggregate liquidation preference (or restrictions) of stock classified as temporary equity that has a preference in involuntary liquidation considerably in excess of the par or stated value of the shares. The liquidation preference is the difference between the preference in liquidation and the par or stated values of the share. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. If convertible, the issuer does not control the actions or events necessary to issue the maximum number of shares that could be required to be delivered under the conversion option if the holder exercises the option to convert the stock to another class of equity. If the security is a warrant or a rights issue, the warrant or rights issue is considered to be temporary equity if the issuer cannot demonstrate that it would be able to deliver upon the exercise of the option by the holder in all cases. Includes stock with put option held by ESOP and stock redeemable by holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Temporary Equity, Liquidation Preference Per Share
column2: The per share liquidation preference (or restrictions) of stock classified as temporary equity that has a preference in involuntary liquidation considerably in excess of the par or stated value of the shares. The liquidation preference is the difference between the preference in liquidation and the par or stated values of the share. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. If convertible, the issuer does not control the actions or events necessary to issue the maximum number of shares that could be required to be delivered under the conversion option if the holder exercises the option to convert the stock to another class of equity. If the security is a warrant or a rights issue, the warrant or rights issue is considered to be temporary equity if the issuer cannot demonstrate that it would be able to deliver upon the exercise of the option by the holder in all cases. Includes stock with put option held by ESOP and stock redeemable by holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Temporary Equity, Par or Stated Value Per Share
column2: Per share amount of par value or stated value of stock classified as temporary equity. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable.

column1: Temporary Equity, Redemption Price Per Share
column2: Amount to be paid per share that is classified as temporary equity by entity upon redemption. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. If convertible, the issuer does not control the actions or events necessary to issue the maximum number of shares that could be required to be delivered under the conversion option if the holder exercises the option to convert the stock to another class of equity. If the security is a warrant or a rights issue, the warrant or rights issue is considered to be temporary equity if the issuer cannot demonstrate that it would be able to deliver upon the exercise of the option by the holder in all cases. Includes stock with put option held by ESOP and stock redeemable by holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Temporary Equity, Shares Outstanding
column2: The number of securities classified as temporary equity that have been issued and are held by the entity's shareholders. Securities outstanding equals securities issued minus securities held in treasury. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. If convertible, the issuer does not control the actions or events necessary to issue the maximum number of shares that could be required to be delivered under the conversion option if the holder exercises the option to convert the stock to another class of equity. If the security is a warrant or a rights issue, the warrant or rights issue is considered to be temporary equity if the issuer cannot demonstrate that it would be able to deliver upon the exercise of the option by the holder in all cases. Includes stock with put option held by ESOP and stock redeemable by holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Temporary Equity, Shares Subscribed but Unissued
column2: Amount of a new issue of securities classified as temporary equity that are allocated to investors for them to buy. When securities are sold on a subscription basis, the issuer does not initially receive the total proceeds. In general, the issuer does not issue the securities to the investor until it receives the entire proceeds. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. If convertible, the issuer does not control the actions or events necessary to issue the maximum number of shares that could be required to be delivered under the conversion option if the holder exercises the option to convert the stock to another class of equity. If the security is a warrant or a rights issue, the warrant or rights issue is considered to be temporary equity if the issuer cannot demonstrate that it would be able to deliver upon the exercise of the option by the holder in all cases. Includes stock with put option held by ESOP and stock redeemable by holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Temporary Equity, Share Subscriptions
column2: The number of securities classified as temporary equity that have been allocated to investors to buy. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. If convertible, the issuer does not control the actions or events necessary to issue the maximum number of shares that could be required to be delivered under the conversion option if the holder exercises the option to convert the stock to another class of equity. If the security is a warrant or a rights issue, the warrant or rights issue is considered to be temporary equity if the issuer cannot demonstrate that it would be able to deliver upon the exercise of the option by the holder in all cases. Includes stock with put option held by ESOP and stock redeemable by holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Tenant Improvements
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of improvements having a life longer than one year that were made for the benefit of one or more tenants.

column1: Termination Loans
column2: Definite liabilities to third parties under a termination loan agreement, whether or not guaranteed in whole or in part by the government.

column1: Theatrical Film Costs
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in the physical production of a theatrical film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Theatrical Film Costs, Completed and Not Released
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest related to the completion of a theatrical film not yet released. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Theatrical Film Costs, Development
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in development of a theatrical film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Theatrical Film Costs, Preproduction
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in the preproduction of a theatrical film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Theatrical Film Costs, Production
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in the production of a theatrical film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Theatrical Film Costs, Released
column2: The amount of direct negative costs incurred in the release of a theatrical film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Timber and Timberlands
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation and depletion of forest crops and land devoted primarily to the growth and harvest of forest crops for commercial purposes.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, after Year Five
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Year Five
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Year Four
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Year Three
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposit Maturities, Year Two
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Time Deposits, $100,000 or More
column2: Amount of time deposit liabilities, including certificates of deposit, in denominations of $100,000 or more.

column1: Time Deposits, Less than $100,000
column2: Amount of time deposit liabilities, including certificates of deposit, in denominations of less than $100,000.

column1: Time Deposits, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturities Greater than Five Years
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposits held by the entity with maturities greater than five years.

column1: Time Deposits, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturities Greater than One Year
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposits held by the entity with maturities greater than one year.

column1: Time Deposits, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturities Year Five
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposits held by the entity with maturities greater than four years, but five years or less.

column1: Time Deposits, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturities Year Four
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposits held by the entity with maturities greater than three years, but four years or less.

column1: Time Deposits, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturities Year One
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposits held by the entity with maturities of one year or less.

column1: Time Deposits, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturities Year Three
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposits held by the entity with maturities greater than two years, but three years or less.

column1: Time Deposits, Weighted Average Interest Rate, Maturities Year Two
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposits held by the entity with maturities greater than one year, but two years or less.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Aggregate Maturities of Notes Receivable, Gross
column2: Amount of notes receivable related to time share sales, before allowance for uncollectible accounts and deferred profit.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Allowance for Uncollectible Accounts on Receivables Sold with Recourse
column2: Allowance for uncollectible accounts on receivables sold with recourse at the end of the period.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Deferred Profit
column2: Amount of deferred profit on time share sales.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Allowance for Uncollectibles on Receivables Sold with Recourse, Deductions for Direct Write-offs Charged Against Allowance
column2: Amount of decrease in the allowance on receivables sold with recourse, for time sharing transactions, from direct write-offs charged against the allowance.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Maturities of Notes Receivable, Future Years
column2: Aggregate total of all maturities of notes receivable after the first five years following the date of the financial statements.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Maturities of Notes Receivable, Net
column2: Amount of notes receivable related to time share sales, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts and deferred profit.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Maturities of Notes Receivable, Year Five
column2: Maturities for the fifth year following the date of the financial statements.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Maturities of Notes Receivable, Year Four
column2: Maturities for the fourth year following the date of the financial statements.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Maturities of Notes Receivable, Year One
column2: Maturities for the first year following the date of the financial statements.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Maturities of Notes Receivable, Year Three
column2: Maturities for the third year following the date of the financial statements.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Maturities of Notes Receivable, Year Two
column2: Maturities for the second year following the date of the financial statements.

column1: Trade Receivables Held-for-sale, Amount
column2: The face amount of accounts receivable that will be sold to other entities.

column1: Trading Activity, Gain
column2: The net gain on trading activities (including both derivative and nonderivative instruments) recognized in the statement of financial performance.

column1: Trading Activity, Loss
column2: The loss on trading activities (including both derivative and nonderivative instruments) recognized in the statement of financial performance.

column1: Trading Securities, Cost
column2: Cost of investments in debt and equity securities and other forms of securities that provide ownership interests classified as trading.

column1: Trading Securities, Debt
column2: Amount of investments in debt securities classified as trading.

column1: Trading Securities, Equity
column2: Fair value of investments in trading equity securities and other forms of trading securities that provide ownership interests.

column1: Transfers of Financial Assets Accounted for as Sale, Initial Fair Value of Assets Obtained as Proceeds
column2: Represents the initial fair value recorded for assets received on transfer of financial assets in a securitization, asset-backed financing arrangement, or a similar transfer which transaction is recognized as a sale of the transferred financial assets.

column1: Transfers of Financial Assets Accounted for as Sale, Initial Fair Value of Liabilities Incurred
column2: Represents the initial fair value recorded for liabilities incurred on transfer of financial assets in a securitization, asset-backed financing arrangement, or a similar transfer which transaction is recognized as a sale of the transferred financial assets.

column1: Treasury Stock Acquired, Average Cost Per Share
column2: Total cost of shares repurchased divided by the total number of shares repurchased.

column1: Troubled Debt Restructuring, Debtor, Subsequent Periods, Contingent Payments, Amount
column2: Amount of restructured debt contingently payable based on the occurrence of future events or circumstances.

column1: Trustee Fees
column2: Fees charged annually for the professional services of a trustee, usually quoted as a percentage of the funds being managed. The fee for appointing an offshore Trustee is included in the trust price.

column1: Unamortized Costs Capitalized Less Related Deferred Income Taxes Exceed Ceiling Limitations, Expense
column2: The excess of unamortized costs capitalized within a cost center, less related deferred income taxes, over the cost center ceiling limitation, which is charged to expense for oil and gas producing companies that use full cost method of accounting for investments in oil and gas producing properties.

column1: Unamortized Discounts on Acceptances Resold
column2: The amount of the unamortized discount or expense related to the financial institution's sale of short-term negotiable time drafts drawn on and accepted by the institution (also known as Banker's Acceptances) in the secondary market.

column1: Unamortized Loss Reacquired Debt, Noncurrent
column2: Unamortized Loss on Reacquired Debt is the loss incurred upon reacquisition or refinancing of debt, is treated as a deferred charge and amortized over the life of the new debt issued.

column1: Unapproved Change Orders, Amount
column2: The amount of costs incurred on unapproved change orders when it is probable that the cost will be recovered through a change in the contract price.

column1: Unbilled Change Orders
column2: Total amount of unbilled change orders from customers under long-term contracts or programs associated with unpriced change orders or other similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization.

column1: Unbilled Change Orders, Amount Expected to be Collected after One Year
column2: Amount of unbilled change orders from customers under long-term contracts or programs associated with unpriced change orders or other similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization which is expected to be collected after one year from the balance sheet date.

column1: Unbilled Change Orders, Amount Expected to be Collected within One Year
column2: Amount of unbilled change orders from customers under long-term contracts or programs associated with unpriced change orders or other similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization which is expected to be collected within one year from the balance sheet date.

column1: Unbilled Receivables, Current
column2: Amount received for services rendered and products shipped, but not yet billed, for non-contractual agreements due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Unbilled Receivables, Not Billable
column2: Amount of unbilled receivables under long-term contracts that have not been billed and were not billable.

column1: Unbilled Receivables, Not Billable, Amount Expected to be Collected after Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of receivables under long-term contracts that have not been billed and were not billable that are expected to be collected after the next fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unbilled Receivables, Not Billable, Amount Expected to be Collected in Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of receivables under long-term contracts that have not been billed and were not billable that are expected to be collected in the next fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Undistributed Net Realized Gain (Loss) on Sale of Properties
column2: This element represents the accumulated amount as of the reporting date of undistributed income derived from the gain (loss) on sale of properties which is otherwise disclosed. The purpose of separately disclosing such information is to distinguish between income generated from the gain (loss) attributable to the sale of a real estate investment trust's portfolio properties and the operation of such properties.

column1: Units of Partnership Interest, Amount
column2: The number of units or equivalent units outstanding for all classes.

column1: Unproved Oil and Gas Property, Successful Effort Method
column2: Oil and Gas properties with unproved reserves under the successful effort method.

column1: Unrealized Gain on Price Risk Cash Flow Derivatives, before Tax
column2: Amount of unrealized gain from the increase in fair value of price risk derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income in the period, before taxes, to the extent that the cash flow hedge is determined to be effective.

column1: Unrealized Loss on Foreign Currency Derivatives, before Tax
column2: Amount of unrealized loss recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income pertaining to the decrease in fair value of foreign currency exchange rate derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments to the extent that a cash flow hedge is determined to be effective.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Due after Five Years
column2: Amount of the fixed and determinable portion of the unrecorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Maximum Quantity
column2: Maximum number of units that may be acquired, in connection with an unconditional purchase obligation that has not been recognized for financial reporting purposes.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Minimum Quantity Required
column2: The minimum number of units that must be purchased, in connection with an unconditional purchase obligation that has not been recognized for financial reporting purposes.

column1: Unrecorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Period Quantity Purchased
column2: The number of units that have been purchased during the period, in connection with an unconditional purchase obligation that has not been recognized for financial reporting purposes.

column1: Unrecovered Costs for Purchased Gas Amount
column2: Discloses the amount of unrecovered costs for purchased gas.

column1: Unrecovered Production Costs, Excess of Estimated Average Unit Cost
column2: The aggregate amount of manufacturing or production costs and any related deferred costs (for example, initial tooling costs) that exceeds the aggregate estimated cost of all in-process and delivered units on the basis of the estimated average cost of all units expected to be produced under long-term contracts and programs not yet complete.

column1: Unrecovered Production Costs, Excess Unrecoverable under Existing Firm Orders
column2: The portion of the aggregate amount of manufacturing or production costs and any related deferred costs (for example, initial tooling costs) that exceeds the aggregate estimated cost of all in-process and delivered units on the basis of the estimated average cost of all units expected to be produced under long-term contracts and programs not yet complete, which would not be absorbed in cost of sales based on existing firm orders at the latest balance sheet date.

column1: US Government Agencies Securities, at Carrying Value
column2: Debt securities issued by a United States government agency such as Government National Mortgage Association (Ginnie Mae), Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac), and Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae), which are short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under that definition. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

column1: US Government Securities, at Carrying Value
column2: Debt (bills, notes or bonds) that are issued by the government of the United States which are short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under that definition. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Depreciation and Amortization
column2: Amount of operating expense for depreciation and amortization of regulated operation.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Gas and Petroleum Purchased
column2: Amount of operating expense for purchased gas and petroleum of regulated operation.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Maintenance
column2: Amount of operating expense for routine plant maintenance and repairs of regulated operation.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Operations
column2: Amount of operating expense for routine operations of regulated operation.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Products and Services
column2: Amount of operating expense for products and services of regulated operation.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Purchased Power
column2: Amount of operating expense for purchased power of regulated operation.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Purchased Power under Long-term Contracts
column2: Amount of operating expense for purchased power procured under arrangements extending beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer, by regulated operation.

column1: Valuation Allowance for Impairment of Recognized Servicing Assets, Sales
column2: Reduction in valuation allowance of servicing assets based on sale of the related asset.

column1: Value Added Tax Receivable
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of value added taxes due either from customers arising from sales on credit terms, or as previously overpaid to tax authorities.

column1: Value Added Tax Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount due after one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle), if longer of value added taxes due either from customers arising from sales on credit terms, or as previously overpaid to tax authorities.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Measure of Activity, Purchases
column2: The amount of purchases between the reporting entity and the Variable Interest Entity (VIE).

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Unavailability of Information, Number of Entities
column2: Number of Variable Interest Entities (VIE) or potential VIEs for which the necessary information is unable to be obtained to: (1) determine whether the legal entity is a VIE, (2) determine whether it (the reporting entity) is the VIE's primary beneficiary, or (3) perform the accounting required to consolidate the VIE for which it is determined that it (the reporting entity) is the primary beneficiary.

column1: Warehouse Agreement Borrowings
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the outstanding short-term borrowings under a revolving line of credit used by mortgage bankers to finance the origination or purchase of loans.

column1: Weighted Average Basic Shares Outstanding, Pro Forma
column2: The weighted average number of shares (units) outstanding in the calculation of pro forma basic earnings per share (earnings per unit), which is commonly presented in initial public offerings based on the terms of the offering.

column1: Weighted Average Cost Inventory Amount
column2: The amount of weighted average cost inventory present at the reporting date when inventory is valued using different valuation methods.

column1: Weighted Average General Partnership Units Outstanding
column2: Weighted average number of general partnership units outstanding determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that general partnership units have been outstanding to the total time in that period.

column1: Weighted Average Interest Rate of Time Deposits, $100,000 or More
column2: Weighted average interest rate of time deposits, including certificates of deposit, in denominations of $100,000 or more.

column1: Weighted Average Interest Rate of Time Deposits, $100,000 or More, after 12 Months
column2: The weighted average interest rate of domestic and foreign time deposits (including certificates of deposits, individual retirement accounts and open accounts) in denominations of $100,000 or more, with maturities of greater than twelve months.

column1: Weighted Average Interest Rate of Time Deposits, $100,000 or More, Six Months Through 12 Months
column2: The weighted average interest rate of domestic and foreign time deposits (including certificates of deposits, individual retirement accounts and open accounts) in denominations of $100,000 or more, with maturities of six months through twelve months.

column1: Weighted Average Interest Rate of Time Deposits, $100,000 or More, Three Months or Less
column2: The weighted average interest rate of domestic and foreign time deposits (including certificates of deposits, individual retirement accounts and open accounts) in denominations of $100,000 or more, with maturities of three months or less.

column1: Weighted Average Interest Rate of Time Deposits, $100,000 or More, Three Months Through Six Months
column2: The weighted average interest rate of domestic and foreign time deposits (including certificates of deposits, individual retirement accounts and open accounts) in denominations of $100,000 or more, with maturities of three months through six months.

column1: Weighted Average Limited Partnership and General Partnership Units Outstanding, Basic
column2: Weighted average number of limited partnership and general partnership units outstanding determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that limited partnership and general partnership units have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Includes, for example, the number of units distributed to unit holders whereby unit holders have the ability to elect to receive the unit holders' entire distribution in cash or units of equivalent value or there is a potential limitation on the total amount of cash that all unit holders can elect to receive in aggregate.

column1: Weighted Average Limited Partnership Units Outstanding, Basic
column2: Weighted average number of limited partnership units outstanding determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that limited partnership units have been outstanding to the total time in that period.

column1: Weighted Average Number of Limited Partnership and General Partnership Unit Outstanding, Basic and Diluted
column2: The average number of limited partnership and general partnership units issued and outstanding that are used in calculating basic and diluted earnings per limited partnership and general partnership unit.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit
column2: The weighted average interest rate for all domestic deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Brokered
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic brokered deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Certificates of Deposit
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic certificates of deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Checking
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic checking deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Demand
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic demand deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Money Market
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic money market demand account deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Notice of Withdrawal
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic notice of withdrawal demand deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Other Time Deposit
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic time deposit liabilities other than certificates of deposit.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Savings
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic savings deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Domestic Deposit, Time Deposits
column2: The weighted average interest rate for domestic time deposit liabilities.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Foreign Deposit
column2: Weighted average interest rate for all deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Foreign Deposit, Brokered
column2: Weighted average interest rate for brokered deposit liabilities in foreign banking offices.

column1: Weighted Average Rate Foreign Deposit, Time Deposit
column2: Weighted average interest rate for time deposit in foreign banking offices.

column1: Workers' Compensation Discount, Amount
column2: Current year monetary amount of the change in worker's compensation reserve liability resulting from the discount applied to reduce the reserve to present value.

column1: Workers' Compensation Discount, Percent
column2: Percent discount applied to worker's compensation reserve liability to reduce the reserve to present value.

column1: Workers' Compensation Discount, Prior Year Amount
column2: Prior year monetary amount of the change in worker's compensation reserve liability resulting from the discount applied to reduce the reserve to present value.

column1: #NAME?
column2: #NAME?

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Loans Receivable
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of loans receivables arising from the financing of goods and services.

column1: Cost of Goods and Services Sold, Overhead
column2: Indirect expenses and costs incurred associated with goods produced and sold and services rendered by an entity during the reporting period.

column1: Notes Payable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of notes payable (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer), excluding current portion.

column1: Credit Risk Derivative Assets, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value of credit risk derivative asset.

column1: Debt Issuance Costs, Gross
column2: Amount, before accumulated amortization, of debt issuance costs. Includes, but is not limited to, legal, accounting, underwriting, printing, and registration costs.

column1: Investment Income, Amortization of Discount
column2: Amount of accretion of purchase discount on nonoperating securities.

column1: Salvage and Subrogation Recoveries, Value
column2: The estimated amount as of the balance sheet date to be received by an insurer from the sale of property (usually damaged) on which the insurer has paid a total claim to the insured and has obtained title to the property and the right of an insurer to pursue any course of recovery of damages, in its name or in the name of the policyholder, against a third party who is liable for costs relating to an insured event that have been paid by the insurer. Estimated salvage and subrogation is generally deducted from the liability for unpaid claims.

column1: Limited Partners' Contributed Capital
column2: The amount of capital contributed by the limited partners.

column1: Amortization of Deferred Leasing Fees
column2: This element represents the amortization of deferred leasing fees incurred by the lessor and amortized over the term of the lease. Such fees represent (a) costs to originate a lease incurred in transactions with independent third parties that (i) result directly from and are essential to acquire that lease and (ii) would not have been incurred had that leasing transaction not occurred and (b) certain costs directly related to specified activities performed by the lessor for that lease. Those activities are: evaluating the prospective lessee's financial condition; evaluating and recording guarantees, collateral, and other security arrangements; negotiating lease terms; preparing and processing lease documents; and closing the transaction.

column1: Amount of Regulatory Costs Not yet Approved
column2: Amount of regulatory costs not yet approved by the regulatory authority.

column1: Deferred Employee Stock Ownership Plan, Issuance of Shares or Sale of Treasury Shares
column2: The issuance of shares or sale of treasury shares to an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP).

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Weighted Average Number of Shares Outstanding, Basic
column2: Number of [basic] shares or units, after adjustment for contingently issuable shares or units and other shares or units not deemed outstanding, determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that common shares or units have been outstanding to the total time in that period.

column1: Trading Securities
column2: Amount of investments in debt and equity securities and other forms of securities that provide ownership interests classified as trading.

column1: Debt Issuance Costs Incurred During Noncash or Partial Noncash Transaction
column2: The amount of debt issuance costs that were incurred during a noncash or partial noncash transaction.

column1: Redeemable Preferred Stock Dividends
column2: Dividends paid to preferred stock holders that is redeemable solely at the option of the issuer.

column1: Deferred Costs
column2: The carrying amount of deferred costs.

column1: Liability for Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Financial Guarantee Insurance Contracts
column2: The amount needed to reflect the estimated ultimate cost of settling claims relating to financial default insured events that have occurred on or before a particular date (ordinarily, the balance sheet date) and the amount needed to provide for the estimated ultimate cost required to investigate and settle claims relating to insured events that have occurred on or before a particular date (ordinarily, the balance sheet date), whether or not reported to the insurer at that date.

column1: Weighted Average Number of Shares Outstanding, Diluted
column2: The average number of shares or units issued and outstanding that are used in calculating diluted EPS or earnings per unit (EPU), determined based on the timing of issuance of shares or units in the period.

column1: Cash, FDIC Insured Amount
column2: The amount of cash deposited in financial institutions as of the balance sheet date that is insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.

column1: Direct Premiums Written
column2: Amount, before premiums ceded to other entities and premiums assumed by the entity, of premiums written.

column1: Policyholder Benefits and Claims Incurred, Assumed
column2: Amount of policy benefits and costs incurred for policies assumed.

column1: Other Ownership Interests, Capital Account
column2: Capital account balance of the other unit holders in a limited partnership or master limited partnership. Does not include limited or general partners' ownership interests.

column1: Trading Liabilities, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of liabilities pertaining to principal and customer trading transactions, or which may be incurred with the objective of generating a profit from short-term fluctuations in price as part of an entity's market-making, hedging and proprietary trading. Examples include, but are not limited to, short positions in securities, derivatives and commodities.

column1: Real Estate Owned, Valuation Allowance
column2: For each period for which an income statement is required, disclosure of the changes in the allowance, including balances at end of period.

column1: Stock Issued, Value, Stock Options Exercised, Net of Tax Benefit (Expense)
column2: Value of stock issued as a result of the exercise of stock options, after deduction of related income tax (expense) benefit.

column1: Exploration Abandonment and Impairment Expense
column2: The adjustment to expense previously capitalized costs of drilling exploratory wells when proved reserves are not found or when the entity obtains information that raises substantial doubt about the economic or operational viability of the project.

column1: Beneficial Interest Liability
column2: Obligation reflecting another party's right to economic interests in another entity or trust under a contractual right. For example, an investor may purchase a beneficial interest in a securitization transaction.

column1: Capital Leases, Net Investment in Direct Financing Leases, Deferred Income
column2: The remaining (unamortized) difference between the gross investment in a direct financing lease and the cost or carrying amount, if different, of the leased property as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Year Three
column2: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Debt, Long-term and Short-term, Combined Amount
column2: Represents the aggregate of total long-term debt, including current maturities and short-term debt.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Noncurrent
column2: Investments in debt and equity securities which are categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading and which are intended to be sold or mature more than one year from the balance sheet date or operating cycle, if longer. Such securities are reported at fair value; unrealized gains (losses) related to Available-for-sale Securities are excluded from earnings and reported in a separate component of shareholders' equity (other comprehensive income), unless the Available-for-sale security is designated as a hedge or is determined to have had an other than temporary decline in fair value below its amortized cost basis. All or a portion of the unrealized holding gain (loss) of an Available-for-sale security that is designated as being hedged in a fair value hedge is recognized in earnings during the period of the hedge, as are other than temporary declines in fair value below the cost basis for investments in equity securities and debt securities that an entity intends to sell or it is more likely than not that it will be required to sell before the recovery of its amortized cost basis. Other than temporary declines in fair value below the cost basis for debt securities categorized as Available-for-sale that an entity does not intend to sell and for which it is not more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell before the recovery of its amortized cost basis are bifurcated into credit losses and losses related to all other factors. Other than temporary declines in fair value below cost basis related to credit losses are recognized in earnings, and losses related to all other factors are recognized in other comprehensive income.

column1: Marketing Expense
column2: Expenditures for planning and executing the conception, pricing, promotion, and distribution of ideas, goods, and services. Costs of public relations and corporate promotions are typically considered to be marketing costs.

column1: Deposit Liabilities, Collateral Issued, Financial Instruments
column2: Amount of securities, mortgage loans, or other financial instruments pledged as collateral for deposits.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Available-for-sale Securities, Debt
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of debt securities classified as available-for-sale securities.

column1: Convertible Preferred Stock Converted to Other Securities
column2: Value of convertible preferred stock that was converted to other securities.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Available-for-sale Securities
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of debt and equity securities classified as available-for-sale securities.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Assets
column2: Amount classified as assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Deferred Compensation Liability, Current and Noncurrent
column2: Aggregate carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the liabilities for all deferred compensation arrangements. Represents currently earned compensation under compensation arrangements that is not actually paid until a later date.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Intangible Assets
column2: The cash inflow from disposal of asset without physical form usually arising from contractual or other legal rights, excluding goodwill.

column1: Business Acquisition, Pro Forma Revenue
column2: The pro forma revenue for a period as if the business combination or combinations had been completed at the beginning of the period.

column1: Utilities Operating Expense, Maintenance and Operations
column2: Amount of operating expense for routine plant maintenance, repairs and operations of regulated operation.

column1: Statutory Accounting Practices, Statutory Capital and Surplus, Balance
column2: The amount of statutory capital and surplus (stockholders' equity) as of the balance sheet date using prescribed or permitted statutory accounting practices (rather than GAAP, if different) of the state or country.

column1: Preferred Stock, Dividends, Per Share, Cash Paid
column2: Aggregate dividends paid during the period for each share of preferred stock outstanding.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Other Equity
column2: Amount of cash outflow to reacquire equity classified as other.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Nonvested, Number
column2: The number of non-vested equity-based payment instruments, excluding stock (or unit) options, that validly exist and are outstanding as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Loans Payable
column2: Including the current and noncurrent portions, aggregate carrying value as of the balance sheet date of loans payable (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer).

column1: Convertible Notes Payable, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of long-term debt (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer) identified as Convertible Notes Payable, excluding current portion. Convertible Notes Payable is a written promise to pay a note which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another, related security, at the option of the issuer and the holder.

column1: Deferred Compensation Share-based Arrangements, Liability, Current
column2: Aggregate carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the liabilities for stock option plans and other equity-based compensation arrangements payable within one year (or the operating cycle, if longer).

column1: Proceeds from Advances for Construction
column2: The cash inflow from borrowing by the entity from developers, builders, government agencies and municipalities for construction that are repaid in cash, generally on a straight-line basis over periods ranging from five to forty years.

column1: General Partner's Share of Undistributed Earnings, Incentive Distribution Right Embedded in General Partner Interest
column2: Amount of undistributed earnings allocated to the general partner (as if the undistributed earnings were available cash) when the incentive distribution right is embedded in the general partner's interest. Depending on the structure of the master limited partnership, the incentive distribution right may be a separate class of non-voting limited partner interest that the general partner holds but generally may sell of transfer apart from its overall interest.

column1: Repayments of Long-term Debt, Long-term Capital Lease Obligations, and Capital Securities
column2: The cash outflow associated with security instruments that either represent a creditor or an ownership relationship with the holder of the investment security with a maturity of beyond one year or normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes repayments of (a) debt, (b) capital lease obligations, (c) mandatory redeemable capital securities, and (d) any combination of (a), (b), or (c).

column1: Other Long-term Debt
column2: Amount of long-term debt classified as other.

column1: Other Cost of Operating Revenue
column2: Other costs incurred during the reporting period related to other revenue generating activities.

column1: Deferred Discounts, Finance Charges and Interest Included in Receivables
column2: Unearned discounts (other than cash or quantity discounts and the like), finance charges, and interest included in the face amount of receivables, that are shown as a deduction from the related receivables. For example, 1) finance charges booked as a receivable when a loan is made and recognized as income at a later date; and 2) interest charges deducted from the face loan amount, resulting in a discounted amount actually advanced to the borrower (wherein the receivable includes the amount actually advanced to the borrower and the as yet unearned interest income).

column1: Long-term Line of Credit
column2: The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the current and noncurrent portions of long-term obligations drawn from a line of credit, which is a bank's commitment to make loans up to a specific amount. Examples of items that might be included in the application of this element may consist of letters of credit, standby letters of credit, and revolving credit arrangements, under which borrowings can be made up to a maximum amount as of any point in time conditional on satisfaction of specified terms before, as of and after the date of drawdowns on the line. Includes short-term obligations that would normally be classified as current liabilities but for which (a) postbalance sheet date issuance of a long term obligation to refinance the short term obligation on a long term basis, or (b) the enterprise has entered into a financing agreement that clearly permits the enterprise to refinance the short-term obligation on a long term basis and the following conditions are met (1) the agreement does not expire within 1 year and is not cancelable by the lender except for violation of an objectively determinable provision, (2) no violation exists at the BS date, and (3) the lender has entered into the financing agreement is expected to be financially capable of honoring the agreement.

column1: Escrow Deposit
column2: The designation of funds furnished by a borrower to a lender to assure future payments of the borrower's real estate taxes and insurance obligations with respect to a mortgaged property. Escrow deposits may be made for a variety of other purposes such as earnest money and contingent payments. This element excludes replacement reserves which are an escrow separately provided for within the US GAAP taxonomy.

column1: Fair Value Disclosure, Off-balance Sheet Risks, Face Amount, Liability
column2: The face amount of financial liabilities, which are not recognized in the financial statements (off-balance sheet) because they fail to meet some other criterion for recognition.

column1: Customer Advances, Current
column2: The current portion of prepayments received from customers for goods or services to be provided in the future.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Warrants
column2: The cash inflow from issuance of rights to purchase common shares at predetermined price (usually issued together with corporate debt).

column1: Proceeds from Contribution in Aid of Construction
column2: The cash inflow from developers, builders, governmental agencies and municipalities that provide the entity with cash to extend its construction services to their properties.

column1: Workers' Compensation Liability
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations and payables pertaining to claims incurred of a workers compensation nature.

column1: Payments to Suppliers
column2: Payments of cash to suppliers for goods and services during the current period.

column1: Payments to Acquire Receivables
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of all receivables.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Convertible Preferred Stock
column2: The cash outflow to reacquire preferred stock originally issued and identified as a security that can be exchanged for another type of financial security. This repurchased stock is held in treasury.

column1: Derivative Instruments in Hedges, Net Investment in Foreign Operations, Liabilities, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of all derivative liabilities designated as hedges of net investment in foreign operations.

column1: Warrants and Rights Outstanding
column2: Value of outstanding derivative securities that permit the holder the right to purchase securities (usually equity) from the issuer at a specified price.

column1: Proceeds from Maturities, Prepayments and Calls of Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: The cash inflow associated with the maturity, prepayments and calls (requests for early payments) of debt securities designated as held-to-maturity.

column1: Other Intangible Assets, Net
column2: Amount after accumulated amortization of finite-lived and indefinite-lived intangible assets classified as other.

column1: Loans Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of portion of long-term loans payable due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.

column1: Estimated Litigation Liability
column2: Aggregate carrying amount of the estimated litigation liability for known or estimated probable loss from litigation, which may include attorneys' fees and other litigation costs.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Other Liabilities
column2: Amount classified as other liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Interest Rate Cash Flow Hedge Asset at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all interest rate derivative assets designated as cash flow hedging instruments.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Noncash Financial or Equity Instrument Consideration, Shares Issued
column2: The number of shares issued as [noncash or part noncash] consideration for a business or asset acquired. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Unrealized Currency Losses
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from unrealized losses on foreign currency transactions.

column1: Preferred Stock Conversions, Inducements
column2: The excess of (1) the fair value of all securities and other consideration transferred in transactions by the registrant to the holders of the convertible preferred stock over (2) the fair value of securities issuable pursuant to the original conversion terms, during the accounting period.

column1: Cost of Property Repairs and Maintenance
column2: The aggregate costs of keeping the property in good condition but that do not appreciably prolong the life or increase the value of the property.

column1: Accrued Payroll Taxes, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for statutory payroll taxes incurred through that date and withheld from employees pertaining to services received from them, including entity's matching share of the employees FICA taxes and contributions to the state and federal unemployment insurance programs. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Debt Issuance Costs, Current, Net
column2: Amount, after accumulated amortization, of debt issuance costs classified as current. Includes, but is not limited to, legal, accounting, underwriting, printing, and registration costs.

column1: Margin Deposit Assets
column2: The amount of cash or securities placed with a broker or counterparty as security for a trading or derivatives securities position which was partially obtained with funds provided by the broker dealer.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Investment in Noncontrolled Affiliates
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from investments in unconsolidated subsidiaries and investments in other affiliates which are not controlled nor consolidated.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Compensation and Benefits, Other
column2: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowance, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from compensation and benefits, classified as other.

column1: Postemployment Benefits, Period Expense
column2: Period expense related to postemployment benefits.

column1: Restricted Stock Award, Forfeitures, Dividends
column2: The value of dividends forfeited related to restricted stock awards forfeited.

column1: Maturities of Subordinated Debt
column2: The cash outflow for a long-term borrowing where lender is placed in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment (senior) in case of liquidation of the entity's assets as it matures.

column1: General Partners' Offering Costs
column2: The cumulative amount of offering costs allocated to the general partner.

column1: Common Stock, Par or Stated Value Per Share
column2: Face amount or stated value per share of common stock.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Two Years
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Prepaid Expense and Other Assets
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for costs that provide economic benefits in future periods, and amount of other assets.

column1: Loans Payable to Bank, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of current portion of long-term loans payable to bank due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.

column1: Unregulated Operating Revenue
column2: The amount of unregulated operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Oil and Gas Property, Successful Effort Method, Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of oil and gas property carried under the successful effort method. Oil and gas property include, but not limited to, the entity's wells and related equipment and facilities.

column1: Due to Other Related Parties, Current
column2: Amount payable to related parties classified as other, due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Equity Securities, Current
column2: Amount of investments in equity securities and other forms of securities that provide ownership interests classified as available-for-sale, expected to be converted to cash, sold or exchanged within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Mortgage Loans on Real Estate, Foreclosures
column2: The amount of mortgage loans on real estate which were foreclosed on during the reporting period.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Investment in Subsidiaries
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from the entity's investment in its wholly-owned subsidiaries.

column1: Payments to Acquire Buildings
column2: The cash outflow for acquisition of buildings (properties) whether for investment or use.

column1: Payments for Affordable Housing Programs
column2: Amount of cash outflow for payments made by the Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks) to the Affordable Housing Program (AHP).

column1: Other Expense from Real Estate Partnership Operations
column2: Amount of selling, general, and administrative expenses, and other expenses, related to investments in real estate partnerships.

column1: Proceeds from Repayment of Loans by Employee Stock Ownership Plans
column2: The cash inflow from the financed defined contribution plan to acquire shares of the entity. The plan initially holds the shares in a suspense account, which is collateral for the loan. As the plan makes payment on the debt, the shares are released from the suspense account and become available to be allocated to participant accounts.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Repurchase Obligation Amount
column2: An entity will typically disclose the amount of any repurchase obligation.

column1: Business Acquisition, Equity Interest Issued or Issuable, Number of Shares
column2: Number of shares of equity interests issued or issuable to acquire entity.

column1: Notes Payable, Related Parties
column2: The amount for notes payable (written promise to pay), due to related parties.

column1: Accrual for Environmental Loss Contingencies
column2: Total costs accrued as of the balance sheet date for environmental loss contingencies.

column1: Security Deposit
column2: The amount of an asset, typically cash, provided to a counterparty to provide certain assurance of performance by the entity pursuant to the terms of a written or oral agreement, such as a lease.

column1: Deferred Rent Credit, Current
column2: For a classified balance sheet, the cumulative difference as of the balance sheet date between the payments required by a lease agreement and the rental income or expense recognized on a straight-line basis, or other systematic and rational basis more representative of the time pattern in which use or benefit is granted or derived from the leased property, expected to be recognized in income or expense, by the lessor or lessee, respectively, within one year of the balance sheet date.

column1: General Insurance Expense
column2: The expense in the period incurred with respect to protection provided by insurance entities against risks other than risks associated with production (which are allocated to cost of sales).

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Mortgage Loans Held-for-sale
column2: The cash inflow from sales of loans that are secured with real estate mortgages and are held with the intention to resell in the near future.

column1: Liability for Unpaid Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense, Net
column2: Liability as of the balance sheet date for amounts representing estimated cost of settling unpaid claims under the terms of the underlying insurance policies, less estimated reinsurance recoveries on such claims. This includes an estimate for claims which have been incurred but not reported. Claim adjustment expenses represent the costs estimated to be incurred in the settlement of unpaid claims.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Allowance for Loan Losses
column2: Reserve for loans impairments recorded after acquisition as a result of current information and events which result in it being probable that estimated cash flows will be less than previously expected or because actual cash flows are less than cash flows previously expected. This relates to loans not accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that was acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Inventory, Noncurrent
column2: Inventories not expected to be converted to cash, sold or exchanged within the normal operating cycle.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accounts Payable
column2: Amount classified as accounts payable attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Payments for Previous Acquisition
column2: Cash outflow representing an adjustment to the purchase price of a previous acquisition.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Maturity of Trading Securities Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale, maturities, repayments and calls of securities classified as trading securities and held for investment purposes. Excludes proceeds from trading securities purchased and held principally for the purpose of selling them in the near term (thus held for only a short period of time).

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Financial or Other Support, Amount
column2: The amount of financial or other support the reporting entity has provided (explicitly or implicitly) to the Variable Interest Entity (VIE) that it was not previously contractually required to provide or that the reporting entity intends to provide, including, for example, situations in which the reporting entity assisted the VIE in obtaining another type of support.

column1: Loans Receivable Held-for-sale, Reconciliation to Cash Flow, Deductions from Held-for-sale
column2: Amount, after allowance for bad debt, of deductions to loan receivables held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group.

column1: Repayments of Accounts Receivable Securitization
column2: Repayments of securitizations of receivables treated as collateralized borrowings, which are classified as financing transactions.

column1: Finite-Lived Contractual Rights, Gross
column2: Gross carrying amount before accumulated amortization as of the balance sheet date of an intangible asset that arises from a contractual arrangement with a third party (not including franchise rights and license agreements).

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Policyholder Liabilities
column2: The tax effect as of the balance sheet date of the amount of the estimated future tax deductions arising from estimated policyholder reserves, which will be deductible from future taxable income when actual costs are incurred, and which can only be realized if sufficient tax-basis income is generated in future periods to enable the tax deduction to be taken.

column1: Temporary Equity, Elimination as Part of Reorganization
column2: Redemption of temporary equity as the result of a triggering event associated with the temporary equity.

column1: Deposits with Clearing Organizations and Others, Securities
column2: The amount of securities on deposit with clearing organizations and other entities which provide services necessary to operations of the Company. This item would include, for instance, securities advanced as refundable collateral for securities borrowed.

column1: Derivative, Cost of Hedge Net of Cash Received
column2: The premium (cost) of a hedge, net of any cash received on settlement during the period.

column1: Temporary Equity, Shares Subscribed but Unissued, Subscriptions Receivable
column2: Aggregate monetary value of a new issue of securities which have been allocated to investors to buy. When security is sold on a subscription basis, the issuer does not initially receive the total proceeds. In general, the issuer does not issue the security to the investor until it receives the entire proceeds. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. If convertible, the issuer does not control the actions or events necessary to issue the maximum number of shares that could be required to be delivered under the conversion option if the holder exercises the option to convert the stock to another class of equity. If the security is a warrant or a rights issue, the warrant or rights issue is considered to be temporary equity if the issuer cannot demonstrate that it would be able to deliver upon the exercise of the option by the holder in all cases. Includes stock with put option held by ESOP and stock redeemable by holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Nondeductible Expense, Charitable Contributions, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to nondeductible charitable contributions expense.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Transfers to Loans Held-for-sale
column2: Amount of reduction, resulting from a reclassification to held-for-sale, in the excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in acquired loans not accounted for as debt securities with evidence of deterioration of credit quality.

column1: Dividends, Share-based Compensation, Paid-in-kind
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid paid-in-kind dividends declared and applicable to holders of share-based compensation, for example, but not limited to, non-vested shares, stock options, or restricted stock units.

column1: Secured Debt
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date, including the current and noncurrent portions, of collateralized debt obligations (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer). Such obligations include mortgage loans, chattel loans, and any other borrowings secured by assets of the borrower.

column1: Debt, Weighted Average Interest Rate
column2: Weighted average interest rate of debt outstanding.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Equity Instruments Other than Options, Vested in Period, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of share-based awards for which the grantee gained the right by satisfying service and performance requirements, to receive or retain shares or units, other instruments, or cash.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Three Years
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Depreciation, Nonproduction
column2: The expense recognized in the current period that allocates the cost of nonproduction tangible assets over their useful lives.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accounts, Notes and Loans Receivable, Net
column2: Amount classified as accounts, notes and loans receivable attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Price Risk Derivative Assets, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of price risk derivative assets, which includes all such derivative instruments in hedging and nonhedging relationships that are recognized as assets on the balance sheet.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield
