column2: The aggregate excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in the loan for loans accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that were acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Fair Value
column2: The aggregate fair value as of the reporting date of all noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the (parent) entity (1) at a fixed or determinable price on a fixed or determinable date, (2) at the option of the holder of the noncontrolling interest, or (3) upon occurrence of an event that is not solely within the control of the (parent) entity. This item includes noncontrolling interest holder's ownership (or holders' ownership) regardless of the type of equity interest (common, preferred, other) including all potential organizational (legal) forms of the investee entity.

column1: Derivative Instruments in Hedges, Liabilities, at Fair Value
column2: Aggregate fair value of all derivative liabilities designated as hedging instruments. Includes instruments designated as cash flow hedges, fair value hedges, and hedges of net investments in foreign operations.

column1: Interest Rate Derivative Instruments Not Designated as Hedging Instruments, Asset at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all derivative assets not designated as hedging instruments.

column1: Payments to Acquire Software
column2: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition from vendors of software programs or applications for internal use (that is, not to be sold, leased or otherwise marketed to others) that qualify for capitalization.

column1: Notes Assumed
column2: The fair value of notes assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Disposals of Loans
column2: Sale or transfer of a loan during the period resulting in a reduction in the excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment. This relates to loans accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that was acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Loss on Discontinuation of Cash Flow Hedge Due to Forecasted Transaction Probable of Not Occurring
column2: The amount of loss reclassified into earnings in the period when cash flow hedge is discontinued because it is probable that the original forecasted transactions will not occur by the end of the original period or an additional two month time period.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, Tax, Portion Attributable to Parent, Held-to-maturity Securities
column2: Amount of tax (expense) benefit of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in held-to-maturity debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to the parent entity.

column1: Consolidation, Less than Wholly Owned Subsidiary, Parent Ownership Interest, Changes, Repurchase of Shares by Subsidiary
column2: Represents the repurchase of equity (treasury stock) by a subsidiary during the period, thereby effecting a change in total (consolidated) equity attributable to the parent; but not deconsolidation by the parent.

column1: Common Stock, Shares Authorized
column2: The maximum number of common shares permitted to be issued by an entity's charter and bylaws.

column1: Employee Service Share-based Compensation, Nonvested Awards, Compensation Cost Not yet Recognized
column2: Unrecognized cost of unvested share-based compensation awards.

column1: Common Stock, Dividends, Per Share, Cash Paid
column2: Aggregate dividends paid during the period for each share of common stock outstanding.

column1: Indefinite-Lived Intangible Assets (Excluding Goodwill)
column2: Amount of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit.

column1: Share-based Compensation, Shares Authorized under Stock Option Plans, Exercise Price Range, Number of Exercisable Options
column2: The number of shares reserved for issuance pertaining to the outstanding exercisable stock options as of the balance sheet date in the customized range of exercise prices for which the market and performance vesting condition has been satisfied.

column1: Inventory, Finished Goods, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of completed merchandise or goods expected to be sold within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Financial Instruments Sold, Not yet Purchased, at Fair Value
column2: Fair value of obligations incurred from short sales.

column1: Restructuring Reserve, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of known and estimated obligations associated with exit from or disposal of business activities or restructurings pursuant to a duly authorized plan, which are expected to be paid in the next twelve months or in the normal operating cycle if longer. Costs of such activities include those for one-time termination benefits, termination of an operating lease or other contract, consolidating or closing facilities, relocating employees, and costs associated with an ongoing benefit arrangement, but excludes costs associated with the retirement of a long-lived asset.

column1: Derivative Instruments and Hedges, Liabilities
column2: Sum as of the balance sheet date of the (a) fair values of all liabilities resulting from contracts that meet the criteria of being accounted for as derivative instruments, and (b) the carrying amounts of the liabilities arising from financial instruments or contracts used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), and which are expected to be extinguished or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer, net of the effects of master netting arrangements.

column1: Customer Advances and Deposits
column2: Refundable consideration, usually cash, held by the entity pending satisfactory completion of the entity's obligations or pending the closing of a contract.

column1: Inventory, Supplies, Net of Reserves
column2: Carrying amount, net of valuation reserves and adjustments, as of the balance sheet date of products used directly or indirectly in the manufacturing or production process, which may or may not become part of the final product. May also include items used in the storage, presentation or transportation of physical goods.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Plan Modification, Incremental Compensation Cost
column2: An excess of the fair value of the modified award over the fair value of the award immediately before the modification.

column1: Proceeds from Sales of Business, Affiliate and Productive Assets
column2: Aggregate cash proceeds received from a combination of transactions in which noncurrent assets are sold, which may include the sale of a business, an investment in an affiliate (including an equity method investee), property, plant and equipment and intangible assets. Excludes sales of trading, available-for-sale, and held-to-maturity securities.

column1: Capital Leases, Income Statement, Direct Financing Lease Revenue
column2: Revenue realized in the period on direct financing leases.

column1: Payments to Acquire Furniture and Fixtures
column2: The cash outflow for acquisition of furniture and fixtures.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Asset Retirement Obligations
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from asset retirement obligations. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement from service of a tangible long-lived asset.

column1: Liability for Future Policy Benefits, Life
column2: Amount of accrued obligation to policyholders that relates to insured events under long-term life insurance contracts.

column1: Proceeds from Interest and Dividends Received
column2: Cash received for dividends and interest on the entity's equity and debt investments during the current period.

column1: Preferred Stock, Shares Subscribed but Unissued
column2: The number of nonredeemable preferred stock (shares) (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) allocated to investors to buy shares of a new issue of preferred stock before they are offered to the public. When stock is sold on a subscription basis, the issuer does not initially receive the total proceeds. In general, the issuer does not issue the shares to the investor until it receives the entire proceeds.

column1: Proceeds from Other Operating Activities
column2: Amount of cash inflow from operating activities classified as other.

column1: Customer Funds
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts received from and refundable to customers unless used by them to obtain goods and services from the entity.

column1: Capital Leases, Lessee Balance Sheet, Assets by Major Class, Property, Plant, and Equipment Other, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation on leased long-lived, physical assets used to produce goods and services and not intended for resale meeting the criteria for capitalization, classified as other.

column1: Long-term Pollution Control Bond, Noncurrent
column2: Noncurrent portion of a debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation to finance the construction of air- or water-pollution control facilities or sewage or solid waste disposal facilities pursuant to federal law. The bonds are backed by the credit of the beneficiary of the financing rather than the credit of the issuer.

column1: Repayments of Subordinated Short-term Debt
column2: The cash outflow for an obligation which places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment (senior loan) in liquidation of the entity's assets scheduled to be repaid within one year or in the normal operating cycle of the entity, if longer.

column1: Flight Equipment, Accumulated Depreciation
column2: The cumulative amount of depreciation (related to long-lived flight assets used in the entity's principle business operations, including owned aircraft and on capital lease, as well as capitalized improvements) that has been recognized in the income statement.

column1: Class of Warrant or Right, Number of Securities Called by Warrants or Rights
column2: Number of securities into which the class of warrant or right may be converted. For example, but not limited to, 500,000 warrants may be converted into 1,000,000 shares.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Four Years
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Marketing and Advertising Expense
column2: The total expense recognized in the period for promotion, public relations, and brand or product advertising.

column1: Accounts Payable, Trade, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Business Combination, Recognized Identifiable Assets Acquired and Liabilities Assumed, Inventory
column2: The amount of inventory recognized as of the acquisition date.

column1: Real Estate Tax Expense
column2: A tax based on the assessed value of real estate by the local government. The tax is usually based on the value of property (including the land).

column1: Liabilities, Other than Long-term Debt, Noncurrent
column2: Aggregated carrying amounts of obligations as of the balance sheet date, excluding long-term debt, incurred as part of the normal operations that are expected to be paid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer. Alternate captions include Total Deferred Credits and Other Liabilities.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Senior Long-term Debt
column2: The cash inflow from a borrowing with the highest claim on the assets of the entity in case of bankruptcy or liquidation (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer).

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Travel and Entertainment Expense
column2: Expenses incurred for travel and entertainment during the period.

column1: Deferred Costs, Noncurrent
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts of deferred costs that are expected to be recognized as a charge against earnings in periods after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Interest on Income Taxes Accrued
column2: Amount of interest expense accrued for an underpayment of income taxes.

column1: Tangible Asset Impairment Charges
column2: The charge against earnings resulting from the aggregate write down of tangible assets from their carrying value to their fair value.

column1: Payments to Acquire Available-for-sale Securities, Equity
column2: The cash outflow to acquire equity securities classified as available-for-sale securities, because they are not classified as trading securities.

column1: Deferred Offering Costs
column2: Specific incremental costs directly attributable to a proposed or actual offering of securities which are deferred at the end of the reporting period.

column1: Other Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
column2: Amount of liabilities incurred and payable to vendors for goods and services received classified as other, and expenses incurred but not yet paid, payable within one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Interest Income, Federal Home Loan Bank Advances
column2: Amount of interest income from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) advances to member financial institutions.

column1: Proceeds from Divestiture of Businesses and Interests in Affiliates
column2: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from the sale of a business segment or subsidiary or sale of an entity that is related to it but not strictly controlled during the period (for example, an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, joint venture or equity method investment).

column1: Payments for Royalties
column2: The amount of cash paid for royalties during the current period.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Investments Acquired
column2: The amount of investments that an Entity acquires in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as information about all investing and financing activities of an enterprise during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Payments for Derivative Instrument, Investing Activities
column2: The cash outflow for derivative instruments during the period, which are classified as investing activities, excluding those designated as hedging instruments.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Other Property, Plant, and Equipment
column2: Amount of cash inflow for the sale of long-lived, physical assets used to produce goods and services and not intended for resale, classified as other.

column1: Proceeds from Collaborators
column2: Cash received from collaborators during the current period.

column1: Mortgage Loans on Real Estate, Cost of Mortgages Sold
column2: The carrying amount of mortgage loans on real estate that were sold during the reporting period.

column1: Payments for Environmental Liabilities
column2: Cash outflows made during the period for environmental remediation activities.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Deferred Tax Liabilities
column2: Amount classified as deferred tax liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Accounts Receivable Acquired
column2: The amount of accounts receivable that an Entity acquires in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as information about all investing and financing activities of an enterprise during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Preferred Stock, Shares Subscribed but Unissued, Subscriptions Receivable
column2: Amount of subscription receivable from investors who have been allocated nonredeemable preferred stock or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer.

column1: Gain on Cash Flow Hedge Ineffectiveness
column2: The gain recognized in earnings during the reporting period representing the amount of the cash flow hedges' ineffectiveness.

column1: Capital Leases, Net Investment in Direct Financing Leases, Accumulated Amortization
column2: Accumulated amortization of deferred income and initial direct costs pertaining to direct financing leases, which resulted from producing constant periodic rates of return on the net investments in the leases over their respective lease terms.

column1: Interest Expense Domestic Deposit Liabilities, Withdrawal Penalties
column2: Early withdrawal penalties on domestic deposits which discourage customer withdrawal prior to maturity.

column1: Cash and Cash Equivalents, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

column1: Interest Expense, Deposits
column2: Aggregate amount of interest expense on all deposits.

column1: Tax Credit Carryforward, Amount
column2: The amount of the tax credit carryforward, before tax effects, available to reduce future taxable income under enacted tax laws.

column1: Accrued Liabilities
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities.

column1: Leasehold Improvements, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation of additions or improvements to assets held under a lease arrangement.

column1: Long-term Federal Home Loan Bank Advances
column2: Including both current and noncurrent portions, Federal Home Loan Bank borrowings initially due beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

column1: Liability for Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense
column2: The amount needed to reflect the estimated ultimate cost of settling claims relating to insured events that have occurred on or before the balance sheet date, whether or not reported to the insurer at that date.

column1: Money Market Funds, at Carrying Value
column2: Investment in short-term money-market instruments (such as commercial paper, banker's acceptances, repurchase agreements, government securities, certificates of deposit, and so forth) which are highly liquid (that is, readily convertible to known amounts of cash) and so near their maturity that they present an insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify as cash equivalents by definition. Original maturity means an original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

column1: Proceeds from Sale, Maturity and Collection of Investments
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale, maturity and collection of all investments such as debt, security and so forth during the period.

column1: Capitalized Computer Software, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated amortization of capitalized costs for computer software, including but not limited to, acquired and internally developed computer software.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Assets for Plan Benefits, Noncurrent
column2: The amount for overfunded plans recognized in the balance sheet as a noncurrent asset associated with a defined benefit pension plan or other postretirement defined benefit plan.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Operating Loss Carryforwards, State and Local
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible state and local operating loss carryforwards.

column1: Separate Account Assets
column2: The fair value of the assets held by the Entity for the benefit of separate account policyholders.

column1: Costs in Excess of Billings, Current
column2: Amount of receivable reflecting the cost incurred on uncompleted contracts in excess of related billings which is expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Liabilities Related to Investment Contracts, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of liability related to investment contracts for example, but not limited to, guaranteed investment contract or annuities.

column1: Repayments of Unsecured Debt
column2: The cash outflow to repay long-term debt that is not secured by collateral. Excludes repayments of tax exempt unsecured debt.

column1: Derivative Instruments and Hedges, Assets
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the asset arising from derivative instruments and hedging activities, which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Long-term Debt and Capital Securities, Net
column2: The cash inflow associated with security instrument that either represents a creditor or an ownership relationship with the holder of the investment security with a maturity of beyond one year or normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes proceeds from (a) debt, (b) capital lease obligations, (c) mandatory redeemable capital securities, and (d) any combination of (a), (b), or (c).

column1: Results of Operations, Depreciation, Depletion, Amortization and Accretion
column2: Depreciation, depletion, amortization, and accretion related to oil and gas producing activities.

column1: Payments for Derivative Instrument, Financing Activities
column2: The cash outflow for derivative instruments during the period, which are classified as financing activities, excluding those designated as hedging instruments.

column1: Payments to Acquire Trading Securities Held-for-investment
column2: The cash outflow to acquire securities classified as trading securities and held for investment purposes. Excludes payments for trading securities purchased and held principally for the purpose of selling them in the near term (thus held for only a short period of time).

column1: Income Tax Holiday, Aggregate Dollar Amount
column2: The amount of income taxes from which a reporting entity is exempt or for which it will receive a reduction in income taxes as a result of the income tax holiday granted by the taxing jurisdiction.

column1: Payments to Acquire Limited Partnership Interests
column2: Cash outflow related to the acquisition or continued holding of limited partnership interests held for investment purposes.

column1: Capital Leases, Income Statement, Interest Expense
column2: The financing charge for leasing arrangements meeting the criteria for capitalization.

column1: Proceeds from Sale and Collection of Receivables
column2: The cash inflow associated with the proceeds from sale and collection of receivables during the period.

column1: Allowance for Doubtful Accounts Receivable, Noncurrent
column2: A valuation allowance for receivables due to an Entity for more than one year from the balance sheet date that are expected to be uncollectible.

column1: Impairment of Leasehold
column2: The adjustment to reduce the value of existing agreements that specify the lessee's rights to use the leased property. This expense is charged when the estimates of future profits generated by the leased property are reduced.

column1: Deferred Income Taxes and Other Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount after allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and other assets expected to be realized or consumed after one year or normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Loss on Contracts
column2: Losses recognized in the current period on contracts which are expected to generate losses, which are probable and can be reasonably estimated, in a future period.

column1: Repayments of Medium-term Notes
column2: The cash outflow to pay off borrowing used to receive debt funding on a regular basis with maturities ranging from 5-10 years.

column1: Income Tax Examination, Interest Accrued
column2: The amount of estimated interest accrued as of the balance sheet date arising from income tax examinations.

column1: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Deduction, Employee Stock Ownership Plan Dividend, Amount
column2: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to deduction for dividend paid to employee stock ownership plan.

column1: Payments to Acquire Leases Held-for-investment
column2: The cash outflow associated with purchasing leases held for investment purposes during an accounting period.

column1: Receivable from Officers and Directors for Issuance of Capital Stock
column2: Amounts receivable from officers and directors resulting from the sale of stock to officers or directors before the cash payment is received.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense, Capitalized Patent Costs
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from patent costs.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, before Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment loss (OTTI) on investments in available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities, recognized in other comprehensive loss and attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Share-based Compensation, Shares Authorized under Stock Option Plans, Exercise Price Range, Number of Outstanding Options
column2: The number of shares reserved for issuance pertaining to the outstanding stock options as of the balance sheet date for all option plans in the customized range of exercise prices.

column1: Goodwill, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated impairment loss of an asset representing future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

column1: Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value
column2: Amount of short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

column1: Convertible Preferred Stock, Shares Issued upon Conversion
column2: Number of shares issued for each share of convertible preferred stock that is converted.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Shares, Share-based Compensation, Gross
column2: Gross number of shares (or other type of equity) issued during the period as a result of any equity-based compensation plan other than an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP). Shares issued could result from the issuance of restricted stock, the exercise of stock options, stock issued under employee stock purchase plans, and/or other employee benefit plans.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Nonconsolidated, Carrying Amount, Assets
column2: Carrying amount of the assets in the reporting entity's statement of financial position that relate to the reporting entity's variable interest in the Variable Interest Entity (VIE), where the reporting entity is not the VIE's primary beneficiary.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases.

column1: Unearned Premiums
column2: Carrying amount of premiums written on insurance contracts that have not been earned as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Cash Surrender Value of Life Insurance
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts which could be received based on the terms of the insurance contract upon surrendering life policies owned by the entity.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Present Value of Net Minimum Payments
column2: Present value of minimum lease payments for capital leases net of executory costs, including amounts paid by the lessee to the lessor for insurance, maintenance and taxes.

column1: Payables to Broker-Dealers and Clearing Organizations
column2: Amount payable to broker-dealers and clearing organizations, including, but not limited to, securities failed-to-receive, certain deposits received for securities loaned, open transactions, and floor-brokerage payables.

column1: Debt Conversion, Converted Instrument, Warrants or Options Issued
column2: The number of warrants issued in exchange for the original debt being converted in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Oil and Gas Property, Successful Effort Method, Net
column2: Oil and gas properties net of accumulated depreciation, depletion, amortization, impairment, and abandonment, carried under the successful effort method.

column1: Cost of Other Property Operating Expense
column2: Other operating costs incurred during the reporting period and may include amounts paid to maintain the property.

column1: Real Estate Investments, Unconsolidated Real Estate and Other Joint Ventures
column2: The carrying amount of investments in unconsolidated real estate and other joint ventures not separately presented. This includes direct and indirect investments.

column1: Taxes Payable
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for statutory income, sales, use, payroll, excise, real, property and other taxes.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Other Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount classified as other assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Reinsurance Payable
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the known and estimated amounts owed to insurers under reinsurance treaties or other arrangements.

column1: Amortization of Leased Asset
column2: The expense charged against earnings for the periodic recognition of capitalized leases. This element may apply to energy companies that lease mineral producing properties and to other enterprises that capitalize property, plant, or equipment obtained through capital leases.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Impairment Losses
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from estimated impairment losses.

column1: Unsecured Debt, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the portion of long-term, uncollateralized debt obligations due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Value of Business Acquired (VOBA)
column2: The remaining unamortized carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of expected future earnings from insurance contracts acquired (also known as present value of future profits).

column1: Business Combination, Liabilities Arising from Contingencies, Amount Recognized
column2: The amount, measured at acquisition-date fair value, of all liabilities assumed that arise from contingencies and were recognized by the entity.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Charitable Contribution Carryforwards
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible charitable contribution carryforwards.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Business Combinations and Acquisitions, Plan Assets
column2: The amount of increase in the plan assets attributed to a business combination.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Impaired, Troubled Debt, Interest Income
column2: The gross interest income that would have been recorded in the period on troubled debt restructurings, if the loans had been current in accordance with their original terms and had been outstanding throughout the period or since origination, if held for part of the period.

column1: Payments for Hedge, Financing Activities
column2: The cash outflow for a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

column1: Dividends, Share-based Compensation, Cash
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid cash dividends declared and applicable to holders of share-based compensation, for example, but not limited to, non-vested shares, stock options, or restricted stock units.

column1: Proceeds from Derivative Instrument, Financing Activities
column2: The cash inflow provided by derivative instruments during the period, which are classified as financing activities, excluding those designated as hedging instruments.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Federal Reserve Bank Stock
column2: Amount of cash inflow from sale of Federal Reserve Bank (FRB) stock.

column1: Mortgage Loan Related to Property Sales
column2: Mortgage loan related to property sales in noncash investing and financing activities.

column1: Proceeds from Previous Acquisition
column2: Cash inflow representing an adjustment to the purchase price of a previous acquisition.

column1: Repayments of First Mortgage Bond
column2: The cash outflow from the repayment of a long-term debt instrument issued, secured by a first mortgage deed of trust, containing a pledge of real property. The lender has the highest claim on the property in case of default.

column1: Maturities of Senior Debt
column2: The cash outflow for the settlement of long-term borrowing, with the highest claim on the assets of the entity in case of bankruptcy or liquidation, as it matures.

column1: Proceeds from Hedge, Financing Activities
column2: The cash inflow from a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

column1: Receivable with Imputed Interest, Net Amount
column2: The receivable or note face amount less the unamortized discount or premium.

column1: Unusual or Infrequent Item, or Both, Insurance Proceeds
column2: Amount of insurance proceeds for an event or transaction that is unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence, or both.

column1: Supplemental Deferred Purchase Price
column2: A device of credit enhancement where a part of the purchase price for the receivable/ payable is retained to serve as a cash collateral.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Private Placement
column2: The cash outflow associated with the repurchase of amount received from entity's raising of capital via private rather than public placement.

column1: Subordinated Debt, Current
column2: The portion of the carrying value of subordinated debt as of the balance sheet date that is scheduled to be repaid within one year or in the normal operating cycle, if longer. Subordinated debt places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment in liquidation of the entity's assets.

column1: Payments to Acquire Lease Receivables
column2: The cash outflow for the purchase of receivables arising from the lease of real estate, equipment or other fixed assets for a specified time in exchange for payment, usually in the form of rent.

column1: Interest Expense, Customer Deposits
column2: The interest expense recognized during the period on customer deposits or security deposits held in interest bearing accounts.

column1: Payments for Film Costs
column2: Cash payments related to direct negative costs incurred in the physical production of a film, as well as allocations of production overhead and capitalized interest. Examples of direct negative costs include costs of story and scenario; compensation of cast, directors, producers, extras, and miscellaneous staff; costs of set construction and operations, wardrobe, and accessories; costs of sound synchronization; rental facilities on location; and postproduction costs such as music, special effects, and editing.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Tax Benefit of Dividends Paid to Plan
column2: The tax benefit resulting from dividends paid on preferred stock held by an employee stock option plan, when that stock is not a common stock equivalent.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Outstanding, Weighted Average Exercise Price
column2: Weighted average price at which grantees can acquire the shares reserved for issuance under the stock option plan.

column1: Common Stock, Dividends, Per Share, Declared
column2: Aggregate dividends declared during the period for each share of common stock outstanding.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Risk Free Interest Rate
column2: The risk-free interest rate assumption that is used in valuing an option on its own shares.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Dilutive Effect of Share-based Payment Arrangements
column2: Additional shares included in the calculation of diluted EPS as a result of the potentially dilutive effect of share based payment arrangements using the treasury stock method.

column1: Class of Warrant or Right, Outstanding
column2: Number of warrants or rights outstanding.

column1: Advertising Expense
column2: Amount charged to advertising expense for the period, which are expenses incurred with the objective of increasing revenue for a specified brand, product or product line.

column1: Deferred Revenue, Noncurrent
column2: The noncurrent portion of deferred revenue amount as of balance sheet date. Deferred revenue is a liability related to a revenue producing activity for which revenue has not yet been recognized, and is not expected to be recognized in the next twelve months. Generally, an entity records deferred revenue when it receives consideration from a customer before achieving certain criteria that must be met for revenue to be recognized in conformity with GAAP.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due in Five Years
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Furniture and Fixtures, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation of equipment commonly used in offices and stores that have no permanent connection to the structure of a building or utilities. Examples include, but are not limited to, desks, chairs, tables, and bookcases.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Dilutive Effect of Call Options and Warrants
column2: Additional shares included in the calculation of diluted EPS as a result of the potentially dilutive effect of call options and warrants using the treasury stock method.

column1: Other Real Estate, Foreclosed Assets, and Repossessed Assets
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of other real estate and foreclosed assets. Other real estate may include real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations may also be included in real estate owned. Foreclosed assets include all assets obtained in full or partial satisfaction of a debt arrangement through foreclosure proceedings.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount classified as liabilities attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Other Short-term Borrowings
column2: Amount of borrowings classified as other, maturing within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Pension Plans with Accumulated Benefit Obligations in Excess of Plan Assets, Aggregate Fair Value of Plan Assets
column2: If aggregate disclosures are presented, the aggregate fair value of plan assets for pension plans with accumulated benefit obligations in excess of plan assets as of the measurement date of each statement of financial position presented.

column1: Prepaid Insurance
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for insurance that provides economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Accrued Environmental Loss Contingencies, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value of the obligation (known or estimated) arising from requirements to perform activities to remediate one or more sites, payable after twelve months or beyond the next operating cycle if longer.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Common Limited Partners Units
column2: The cash inflow from the issuance of common limited partners units during the period.

column1: Accrued Environmental Loss Contingencies, Current
column2: Carrying value of the obligation (known or estimated) arising from requirements to perform activities to remediate one or more sites, payable in twelve months or in the next operating cycle if longer.

column1: Proceeds from Insurance Settlement, Investing Activities
column2: The cash inflow from the amounts received by the insured under the terms of an insurance contract settlement. This element pertains only to insurance proceeds related to investments, for example fixed assets. It excludes insurance settlements classified as operating cash flows.

column1: Oil and Gas Property, Full Cost Method, Net
column2: Oil and gas properties, net of depletion, carried under the full cost method.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Credit Carryforwards, Foreign
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible foreign tax credit carryforwards.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Other Long-term Debt
column2: Amount of cash inflow from issuance of long-term debt classified as other.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Other Assets
column2: Amount classified as other assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of.

column1: Product Warranty Accrual, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and due after one year (or beyond the operating cycle if longer) for estimated claims under standard and extended warranty protection rights granted to customers.

column1: Early Repayment of Senior Debt
column2: The cash outflow for the extinguishment of long-term borrowing, with the highest claim on the assets of the entity in case of bankruptcy or liquidation, before its maturity.

column1: Accrued Salaries
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the obligations incurred through that date and payable for employees' services provided.

column1: Incentive Distribution, Distribution
column2: Amount of incentive obligation paid in cash or stock during the period to a limited liability corporation managing member or limited partnership general partner.

column1: Oil and Gas Property, Full Cost Method, Gross
column2: Oil and gas properties, gross, carried under the full cost method.

column1: Dividends, Share-based Compensation
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid cash, stock, and paid-in-kind (PIK) dividends declared and applicable to holders of share-based compensation, for example, but not limited to, non-vested shares, stock options, or restricted stock units.

column1: Value Added Tax Receivable, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of value added taxes due either from customers arising from sales on credit terms, or as previously overpaid to tax authorities. For classified balance sheets, represents the current amount receivable, that is amounts expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Investment Income, Amortization of Premium
column2: Amount of amortization of purchase premium on nonoperating securities.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Reserves
column2: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowance, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from reserves, classified as other.

column1: Restricted Stock, Shares Issued Net of Shares for Tax Withholdings
column2: The number of restricted shares issued as compensation, net of shares for the payment of withholding taxes. This element is to be used only if shares are used in lieu of cash to satisfy all or a portion of withholding taxes.

column1: Business Combination, Recognized Identifiable Assets Acquired and Liabilities Assumed, Financial Assets
column2: The amount of financial assets (as defined) recognized as of the acquisition date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due, Future Minimum Sublease Rentals
column2: Contractually required future rental payments receivable on noncancelable subleasing arrangements.

column1: Deferred Gain on Sale of Property
column2: Amount of gain on the sale of property that does not qualify for gain recognition as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Foreign Currency Cash Flow Hedge Asset at Fair Value
column2: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all foreign currency derivative assets designated as cash flow hedging instruments.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Mortgage Servicing Rights
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from mortgage servicing rights.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Credit Carryforwards, Other
column2: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowance, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible tax credit carryforwards, classified as other.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Self Insurance
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from estimated losses under self insurance.

column1: Other Repossessed Assets
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of assets other than real property that were received in full or partial satisfaction of a debt arrangement through foreclosure proceedings or defeasance.

column1: Inventory, Work in Process and Raw Materials, Net of Reserves
column2: The aggregate carrying amount, net of valuation reserves and adjustments, as of the balance sheet date of items which are partially completed at the time of measurement and unprocessed items that will go through the production process and become part of the final product. This element may be used when the reporting entity combines work in process and raw materials into an aggregate amount.

column1: Payments for Purchase of Securities, Operating Activities
column2: Cash paid to purchase debt and equity securities, classified as operating activities, during the period; includes trading securities and any other investments classified as operating.

column1: Loans Assumed
column2: The fair value of loans assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

column1: Production Related Impairments or Charges
column2: Nonrecurring impairment charges related to the write-off of production-related equipment and inventory. This tag is used when an Entity charges this cost to cost of goods sold.

column1: Energy Related Inventory, Gas Stored Underground
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of natural gas stored underground in depleted gas reservoirs, aquifers, or salt caverns to meet seasonal and peak load demands, and also as insurance against unforeseen supply disruptions, and deemed to be a current asset because it is expected to be used within twelve months or in the normal operating cycle.

column1: Repayments of Assumed Debt
column2: The cash outflow from the repayments of a long-term debt originally issued by another party but is assumed by the entity.

column1: Grants Receivable, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants. For classified balance sheets, represents the current amount receivable, that is amounts expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Standard Product Warranty Accrual, Additions from Business Acquisition
column2: Amount of increase in the standard product warranty accrual from a business acquisition. Excludes extended product warranties.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Regulatory Assets and Liabilities
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences derived regulatory assets and liabilities.

column1: Preferred Stock, Discount on Shares
column2: Discount on preferred shares, or any unamortized balance thereof, shown separately as a deduction from the applicable account(s) as circumstances require.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Regulatory Assets
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from regulatory assets.

column1: Other Selling and Marketing Expense
column2: Amount of selling and marketing expense classified as other.

column1: Payments to Acquire in Process Research and Development
column2: The cash outflows from the purchase of net carrying value allocated to in-process research and development costs and materials acquired in a business combination.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Investment Projects
column2: The cash inflow from the sale of investment projects held by an entity in hopes of getting a future return or interest from it.

column1: Reinsurance Recoverable, Guarantee Benefits
column2: Sum of the amount of guaranteed minimum benefits the ceding insurer expects to recover on insurance policies ceded to other insurance entities as of the balance sheet date for all guaranteed benefit types.

column1: Payments to Acquire Projects
column2: The cash outflow from the amount invested for projects in hopes of getting a future return or interest from it.

column1: Capital Leases, Lessor Balance Sheet, Net Investment in Direct Financing Leases, Current
column2: The net amount due within one year of the balance sheet date or the normal operating cycle, if longer, consisting of: (a) minimum lease payments due on direct financing leases, (b) unguaranteed residual value, and (c) any unamortized initial direct costs, less: (i) executory costs, (ii) unearned income, and (iii) the accumulated allowance for uncollectible minimum lease payments.

column1: Ceded Premiums Payable
column2: The consideration due to the assuming enterprise as of the balance sheet date under the terms of the reinsurance contract in exchange for the right to receive reimbursement from such entity for covered claims and expenses.

column1: Income Tax Examination, Penalties Accrued
column2: The amount of estimated penalties accrued as of the balance sheet date arising from income tax examinations.

column1: Repayments of Long-term Loans from Vendors
column2: Cash outflows under financing arrangements with vendors (seller-financed debt), which had a maturity date at inception of more than one year (or more than one operating cycle, if longer); such debt may have arisen from purchases of property, plant and equipment or other productive assets.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Allowance for Uncollectible Accounts
column2: Allowance for uncollectible accounts.

column1: Loss from Catastrophes
column2: The charge against earnings in the period for the uninsured portion of a loss from a fire, explosion, or natural disaster (hurricane, earthquake).

column1: Deferred Taxes, Business Combination, Valuation Allowance, Available to Reduce Income Tax Expense
column2: The amount of the valuation allowance recorded in a business combination against deductible temporary differences for which related tax benefits will be recorded as a reduction of the acquired entity's income tax expense (after such benefits are first being applied to reduce goodwill and then other noncurrent intangible assets to zero).

column1: Impaired Financing Receivable, Recorded Investment
column2: Amount of investment of impaired financing receivables with related allowance for credit losses and without a related allowance for credit losses.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Current
column2: Amount of investment in debt and equity securities categorized neither as trading securities nor held-to-maturity securities and intended be sold or mature one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Sale of Stock, Price Per Share
column2: Per share amount received by subsidiary or equity investee for each share of common stock issued or sold in the stock transaction.

column1: Capital Lease Obligations, Noncurrent
column2: Amount equal to the present value (the principal) at the beginning of the lease term of minimum lease payments during the lease term (excluding that portion of the payments representing executory costs such as insurance, maintenance, and taxes to be paid by the lessor, together with any profit thereon) net of payments or other amounts applied to the principal, through the balance sheet date and due to be paid more than one year (or one operating cycle, if longer) after the balance sheet date.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments, Due Thereafter
column2: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Ownership Percentage by Noncontrolling Owners
column2: The equity interest of noncontrolling shareholders, partners or other equity holders in consolidated entity.

column1: Sale of Stock, Number of Shares Issued in Transaction
column2: The number of shares issued or sold by the subsidiary or equity method investee per stock transaction.

column1: Customer Deposits, Current
column2: The current portion of money or property received from customers which is either to be returned upon satisfactory contract completion or applied to customer receivables in accordance with the terms of the contract or the understandings.

column1: Other Prepaid Expense, Current
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for other costs that provide economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Due to Officers or Stockholders, Current
column2: Amounts due to recorded owners or owners with a beneficial interest of more than 10 percent of the voting interests or officers of the company. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Unsecured Long-term Debt, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of uncollateralized debt obligation (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer), excluding current portion.

column1: Employee-related Liabilities
column2: Total of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for obligations related to services received from employees, such as accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes and fringe benefits.

column1: Number of Restaurants
column2: Represents the number of restaurants.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Other, Net
column2: Amount after depreciation of long-lived, physical assets used to produce goods and services and not intended for resale, classified as other.

column1: Off-market Lease, Unfavorable
column2: This element represents a liability associated with the acquisition of an off-market lease when the terms of the lease are unfavorable to the market terms for the lease at the date of acquisition.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Real Estate
column2: Cash received for the sale of real estate that is not part of an investing activity during the current period.

column1: Operating Leases, Income Statement, Depreciation Expense on Property Subject to or Held-for-lease
column2: The total depreciation charge recorded for property subject to or held for lease.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Deferred Rent
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from deferred rent.

column1: Prepaid Expense, Noncurrent
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of amounts paid in advance for expenses which will be charged against earnings in periods after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Billings in Excess of Cost
column2: Liability attributable to (i) billings in excess of costs under the percentage of completion contract accounting method representing the difference between contractually invoiced amounts (billings) and revenue recognized based, for example, on costs incurred to estimated total costs at period end or (ii) contractually invoiced amounts (billings) in excess of costs incurred and accumulated under the completed contract accounting method.

column1: Interest Receivable, Current
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of current interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable. For classified balance sheets, represents the current amount receivable, that is amounts expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Deferred Credits and Other Liabilities
column2: Total carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of unearned revenue or income, not otherwise specified in the taxonomy, which is expected to be taken into income in future periods and obligations not separately disclosed in the balance sheet (other liabilities).

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate, Other Acquisitions
column2: Amount of increase in real estate investments from acquisitions other than through foreclosure for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Business Combination, Separately Recognized Transactions, Additional Disclosures, Acquisition Cost Expensed
column2: For transactions that are recognized separately from the acquisition of assets and assumptions of liabilities in the business combination, such as related to pre-existing relationships with the acquiree, this element represents the disclosure of the amount of acquisition related costs which have been expensed.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Machinery and Equipment
column2: The cash inflow from sale of machinery and equipment.

column1: Derivative Instruments and Hedges, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the assets arising from derivative contracts and hedging activities, which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of after a year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Repayments of Subordinated Debt
column2: The cash outflow from the repayment of long-term borrowing where a lender is placed in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment (senior) in case of liquidation of the entity's assets or underlying collateral.

column1: Operating Leases, Income Statement, Sublease Revenue
column2: The amount of revenue recognized for the period under subleasing arrangements.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Trading Securities Held-for-investment
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of securities classified as trading securities and held for investment purposes. Excludes proceeds from trading securities purchased and held principally for the purpose of selling them in the near term (thus held for only a short period of time).

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Redeemable Preferred Stock
column2: The cash inflow from issuance of preferred stock that is classified as callable.

column1: Weighted Average Number of Shares, Treasury Stock
column2: Number of shares of treasury stock determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that treasury shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Treasury stock is stock that the Entity has issued but subsequently reacquired.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Long-term Investments
column2: The cash inflow from sales of all investments, including securities and other assets, having ready marketability and intended by management to be liquidated, if necessary, beyond the current operating cycle.

column1: Receivables from Clearing Organizations
column2: Amount of right to receive cash and securities on deposit with clearing organizations. Clearing organizations perform post trade processing and trade comparisons among numerous broker-dealers and act as settlement agents between buying and selling broker-dealers.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Restructuring Charges
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from restructuring reserve.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Interest in Partnership Unit
column2: The proceeds from the sale of an interest in a unit of partnership.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Additions
column2: Increases in the aggregate excess of a loan's cash flows expected to be collected over the investor's initial investment in the loan due to the acquisition of similar loans accounted for as debt securities during the period. This relates to loans accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that were acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Proceeds from Hedge, Investing Activities
column2: The cash inflow for a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either a cash flow hedge, fair value hedge, or hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation.

column1: Proceeds from Fees Received
column2: Cash received for fees during the current period. This element excludes cash proceeds from license fees.

column1: Health Care Organization, Expenses, Net
column2: Total costs of health care costs, net of recoveries of stop-loss insurance. Costs of services rendered (including costs of services rendered but not yet reported).

column1: Due to Correspondent Brokers
column2: Amount payable to correspondent broker-dealer.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Preferred Limited Partners Units
column2: The cash inflow from the issuance of preferred limited partners units during the period.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense, Capitalized Software
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from capitalized software.

column1: Deferred Tax Assets, Hedging Transactions
column2: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from hedging transactions.

column1: Amortization of Advance Royalty
column2: The expense charged against earnings for the periodic recognition of the advance royalties. These royalties are paid in one accounting period, but are deducted from earnings over time through amortization. For example, royalties that are required to be paid in advance of production from a mineral, oil, or gas property and amortized over the period of right to produce these items.

column1: Accumulated Amortization, Debt Issuance Costs, Current
column2: Amount of accumulated amortization of debt issuance costs classified as current.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Accounted for as Debt Securities, Accretable Yield, Reclassifications to Nonaccretable Difference
column2: Change in the estimate of cash flows expected to be collected, after acquisition of a loan, which results in a decrease in accretable yield (for example, as a result of an other-than-temporary impairment). This relates to loans accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that was acquired by completion of a transfer for which it is probable, at acquisition, that the investor will be unable to collect all contractually required payments receivable.

column1: Other Nonrecurring Income
column2: Amount of other income that is infrequent in occurrence or unusual in nature.

column1: Interest Portion of Minimum Lease Payments, Sale Leaseback Transactions
column2: Amount necessary to reduce minimum lease payments to present value for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing.

column1: Accrual for Environmental Loss Contingencies, Discount
column2: Amount of imputed interest necessary to reduce (reconcile) the undiscounted amount of the accrual for environmental loss contingencies to the present value.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Tax Benefit
column2: The amount of income tax expense reduction and deferred tax asset recorded in the transaction in which equity securities were issued to pay for goods or nonemployee services.

column1: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Interests in Financial Assets Continued to be Held
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from interests in financial instruments continued to be held after sale or transfer of related financial instruments.

column1: Preferred Stock, Shares Authorized
column2: The maximum number of nonredeemable preferred shares (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) permitted to be issued by an entity's charter and bylaws.

column1: Preferred Stock, Par or Stated Value Per Share
column2: Face amount or stated value per share of preferred stock nonredeemable or redeemable solely at the option of the issuer.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Securities
column2: Amount of debt securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading.

column1: Weighted Average Number Diluted Shares Outstanding Adjustment
column2: The sum of dilutive potential common shares or units used in the calculation of the diluted per-share or per-unit computation.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Assumptions Used Calculating Benefit Obligation, Discount Rate
column2: The interest rate used to adjust for the time value of money for the plan.

column1: Cash and Due from Banks
column2: For banks and other depository institutions: Includes cash on hand (currency and coin), cash items in process of collection, noninterest bearing deposits due from other financial institutions (including corporate credit unions), and noninterest bearing balances with the Federal Reserve Banks, Federal Home Loan Banks and central banks.

column1: Buildings and Improvements, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing.

column1: Inventory, Work in Process, Gross
column2: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of merchandise or goods in the production process expected to be completed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Mortgage Loans on Real Estate, Commercial and Consumer, Net
column2: The balance represents the amount of loans that are secured by real estate mortgages, offset by the reserve to cover probable credit losses on the loan portfolio.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Carrying Amount, Assets
column2: The carrying amount of the consolidated Variable Interest Entity's assets included in the reporting entity's statement of financial position.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Risk Free Interest Rate, Maximum
column2: The maximum risk-free interest rate assumption that is used in valuing an option on its own shares.

column1: Loss Contingency, Damages Sought, Value
column2: The value (monetary amount) of the award the plaintiff seeks in the legal matter.

column1: Cost Method Investments
column2: Amount, after adjustment, of cost-method investment. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, dividends received in excess of earnings after date of investment that are considered a return of investment and other than temporary impairments.

column1: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Fair Value Assumptions, Expected Volatility Rate, Maximum
column2: The estimated measure of the maximum percentage by which a share price is expected to fluctuate during a period. Volatility also may be defined as a probability-weighted measure of the dispersion of returns about the mean. The volatility of a share price is the standard deviation of the continuously compounded rates of return on the share over a specified period. That is the same as the standard deviation of the differences in the natural logarithms of the stock prices plus dividends, if any, over the period.

column1: Line of Credit, Current
column2: The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the current portion of long-term obligations drawn from a line of credit, which is a bank's commitment to make loans up to a specific amount. Examples of items that might be included in the application of this element may consist of letters of credit, standby letters of credit, and revolving credit arrangements, under which borrowings can be made up to a maximum amount as of any point in time conditional on satisfaction of specified terms before, as of and after the date of drawdowns on the line. Includes short-term obligations that would normally be classified as current liabilities but for which (a) postbalance sheet date issuance of a long term obligation to refinance the short term obligation on a long term basis, or (b) the enterprise has entered into a financing agreement that clearly permits the enterprise to refinance the short-term obligation on a long term basis and the following conditions are met (1) the agreement does not expire within 1 year and is not cancelable by the lender except for violation of an objectively determinable provision, (2) no violation exists at the BS date, and (3) the lender has entered into the financing agreement is expected to be financially capable of honoring the agreement.

column1: Capital Leased Assets, Gross
column2: Amount before accumulated depreciation of leased physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services.

column1: Other Receivables, Net, Current
column2: Amount, after allowance, of receivables classified as other, due within one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Notes, Loans and Financing Receivable, Net, Current
column2: An amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Company (holder) a definite sum of money within one year from the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), net of any write-downs taken for collection uncertainty on the part of the holder. Such amount may include accrued interest receivable in accordance with the terms of the debt. The debt also may contain provisions and related items including a discount or premium, payable on demand, secured, or unsecured, interest bearing or noninterest bearing, among a myriad of other features and characteristics. This amount does not include amounts related to receivables held-for-sale.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Assets
column2: The amount of assets reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Dividends Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of dividends declared but unpaid on equity securities issued by the entity and outstanding. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Prepaid Taxes
column2: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for income and other taxes that provide economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Accrued Investment Income Receivable
column2: Interest, dividends, rents, ancillary and other revenues earned but not yet received by the entity on its investments.

column1: Limited Partners' Capital Account, Units Issued
column2: The number of limited partner units issued.

column1: Other Real Estate
column2: Carrying amount of other real estate not separately disclosed, including, but not limited to, real estate investments, real estate loans that qualify as investments in real estate, and premises that are no longer used in operations may also be included in real estate owned. This does not include real estate assets taken in settlement of troubled loans through surrender or foreclosure.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due in Two Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Capital Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due in Three Years
column2: Amount of minimum lease payments for capital leases due in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Research and Development Expense (Excluding Acquired in Process Cost)
column2: The costs incurred in a planned search or critical investigation aimed at discovery of new knowledge with the hope that such knowledge will be useful in developing a new product or service, a new process or technique, or in bringing about a significant improvement to an existing product or process; or to translate research findings or other knowledge into a plan or design for a new product or process or for a significant improvement to an existing product or process whether intended for sale or the entity's use, during the reporting period charged to research and development projects, excluding in-process research and development acquired in a business combination consummated during the period. Excludes software research and development, which has a separate concept.

column1: Real Estate Held-for-sale
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of investments in land and buildings held for sale, excluding real estate considered to be inventory of the entity.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Noncurrent Assets
column2: The amount of noncurrent assets reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Deposits, Money Market Deposits
column2: Amount of deposits in accounts that offer many of the same services as checking accounts although transactions may be somewhat more limited, share some of the characteristics of a money market fund and are insured by the Federal government, also known as money market accounts.

column1: Deferred Costs, Current
column2: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of deferred costs capitalized at the end of the reporting period that are expected to be charged against earnings within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Incremental Common Shares Attributable to Dilutive Effect of Conversion of Preferred Stock
column2: Additional shares included in the calculation of diluted EPS as a result of the potentially dilutive effect of convertible preferred stock using the if-converted method.

column1: Other Accrued Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of expenses incurred but not yet paid classified as other, due after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Preferred Stock, Value, Outstanding
column2: Value of all nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) held by shareholders, which is net of related treasury stock. May be all or a portion of the number of preferred shares authorized. These shares represent the ownership interest of the preferred shareholders.

column1: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments Receivable, Current
column2: Future rental payments receivable within one year of the balance sheet date under an operating lease.

column1: Notes Receivable, Related Parties, Noncurrent
column2: Amounts due from parties associated with the reporting entity as evidenced by a written promise to pay, due after 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Finite-Lived Patents, Gross
