column2: Amount of expense classified as other allocated to the closed block.

column1: Due from Officers or Stockholders, Noncurrent
column2: Amounts due from owners or owners with a beneficial interest of more than 10 percent of the voting interests or officers of the company, which are usually due after 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

column1: Retainage Deposit
column2: The amount of assets, typically cash, provided to suppliers of goods in advance of receipt and acceptance, or services (such as research facilities, lawyers or consultants), which is held by such parties until the entity either effects full payment (including applying the retainer) or obtains release from liability.

column1: Liability for Future Policy Benefits, Individual and Group Annuities and Supplementary Contracts
column2: Amount of accrued obligation to policyholders that relates to insured events under individual and group annuities and supplementary insurance contracts.

column1: Oil and Gas Joint Interest Billing Receivables
column2: Portion of accounts receivable attributable to joint interest partners in oil and gas properties. These are billings to the non-operators associated with the operation of wells and are based on those owners' working interests in the wells.

column1: Proceeds from Securities Purchased under Agreements to Resell
column2: The cash inflow associated with agreements to purchase and then resell securities to counterparties (reverse repurchase agreements).

column1: Capital Leases, Lessor Balance Sheet, Net Investment in Direct Financing and Sales Type Leases, Current
column2: The net amount due within one year of the balance sheet date or the normal operating cycle, if longer, consisting of: (a) minimum lease payments due on direct financing and sales-type leases, (b) unguaranteed residual value, and (c) any unamortized initial direct costs on direct financing leases; less: (i) executory costs, (ii) unearned income, and (iii) the accumulated allowance for uncollectible minimum lease payments.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Debt Structure, Direct Loan, Amount
column2: The amount reported as a liability as of the balance sheet date by the entity (the employer) of the loan made by a third-party lender directly to the ESOP.

column1: Share-based Goods and Nonemployee Services Transaction, Capitalized Cost
column2: The amount by which an asset or assets increased resulting from the transaction in which equity securities were issued to pay for goods or nonemployee services.

column1: Advance Royalties, Current
column2: The amount paid to music publishers, record producers, songwriters, or other artists in advance of their earning royalties from record or music sales. Such an amount is based on contractual terms and is generally nonrefundable. This amount is expected to be consumed within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Acquired Finite-lived Intangible Asset, Residual Value
column2: The aggregate expected value at the end of their useful life of a major finite-lived intangible asset class acquired during the period either individually or as part of a group of assets (in either an asset acquisition or business combination). A major class is composed of intangible assets that can be grouped together because they are similar, either by their nature or by their use in the operations of a company.

column1: Carrying Value of Federal Funds Purchased, Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase, and Deposits Received for Securities Loaned
column2: Carrying value of federal funds purchased and securities sold under repurchase agreements and deposits received for securities loaned.

column1: Capital Leases, Lessor Balance Sheet, Net Investment in Sales Type Leases, Current
column2: The net amount due within one year of the balance sheet date or the normal operating cycle, if longer, consisting of: (a) minimum lease payments on sales type leases and (b) unguaranteed residual value; less: (i) executory costs, (ii) unearned income, and (iii) the accumulated allowance for uncollectible minimum lease payments.

column1: Convertible Subordinated Debt, Current
column2: The portion of the carrying value of convertible subordinated debt as of the balance sheet date that is scheduled to be repaid within one year or in the normal operating cycle if longer. This form of debt can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder, and places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment upon liquidation of the entity's assets.

column1: Deposits, Wholesale
column2: The aggregate amount of all wholesale deposit accounts including certificates of deposits.

column1: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Accrued Income Tax Payable, Current
column2: Amount classified as income tax obligations attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Closed Block Operations, Policyholder Dividends
column2: An expense for the period representing distributions paid or accrued for the segregated group of participating or dividend-paying policies and contracts along with the assets allocated to them (known as a closed block), which may be presented in a table of closed block operations as part of summarized financial data.

column1: Other Deferred Compensation Arrangements, Liability, Current
column2: Amount of the liabilities, classified as other, for deferred compensation arrangements payable within one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Cash Flows Between Transferor and Transferee, Receipts on Transferor's Interest in Transferred Financial Assets, Other
column2: Cash flows between transferor and a transferee attributable to the transferor's interests related to a securitization, asset-backed financing arrangement, or similar transfer in which the transferor will have continuing involvement with the transferred financial assets underlying the transaction (including, but not limited to, servicing, recourse, and restrictions on transferor's interests in the transferred financial assets).

column1: Due from Other Related Parties, Noncurrent
column2: Amount receivable from related parties classified as other, due after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals to be received by the seller-lessee for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Initial Public Offering
column2: The cash outflow associated with the repurchase of amount received from entity's first offering of stock to the public.

column1: Impairment Charge on Reclassified Assets
column2: For the asset that is reclassified back to held and used from held-for-sale, the amount of impairment charge that is recognized on the reclassification date.

column1: Capital Leases, Lessor Balance Sheet, Net Investment in Sales Type Leases, Noncurrent
column2: The net amount due after one year of the balance sheet date or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer, consisting of: (a) minimum lease payments on sales type leases, and (b) unguaranteed residual value; less: (i) executory costs, (ii) unearned income, and (iii) the accumulated allowance for uncollectible minimum lease payments.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, within Two Years
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Payments for Repurchase of Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock
column2: The cash outflow to reacquire callable preferred stock which is identified as being convertible to another type of financial security.

column1: Business Combination, Assets Arising from Contingencies, Amount Recognized
column2: The amount, measured at acquisition-date fair value, of all the assets acquired that arise from contingencies and were recognized by the entity.

column1: Business Combination, Step Acquisition, Equity Interest in Acquiree, Remeasurement Loss
column2: In a business combination achieved in stages, this element represents the amount of loss recognized by the entity as a result of remeasuring to fair value the equity interest in the acquiree it held before the business combination.

column1: Time Deposits Maturities, after Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of time deposits maturing after the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Time deposits include, but are not limited to, certificates of deposits. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Government Contract Receivable, Unbilled Amounts
column2: Unbilled amounts (net of unliquidated progress payments) of government contract receivables.

column1: Shares Held in Employee Stock Option Plan, Allocated
column2: Number of allocated shares held by the Employee Stock Option Plan at balance sheet date. Allocated shares are shares that have been assigned to individual participant accounts based on a known formula.

column1: Inventory Recall Expense
column2: Reflects the amount charged against earnings comprised of the costs to announce and effect a recall of defective merchandise.

column1: Proceeds from Sale of Lease Receivables
column2: The cash inflow associated with the sale of receivables arising from the lease of real estate, equipment or other fixed assets for a specified time in exchange for payment, usually in the form of rent; excludes proceeds from sales-type lease transactions, which are classified as operating activities.

column1: Future Minimum Sublease Rentals, Sale Leaseback Transactions, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of minimum sublease rentals for sale-leaseback transactions accounted for using the deposit method or as a financing to be received by the seller-lessee in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loans Receivable Held-for-sale, Reconciliation to Cash Flow, Additions to Held-for-sale
column2: Amount, after allowance for bad debt, of additions to loan receivables held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group.

column1: Real Estate Assets Held for Development and Sale
column2: For banks, the total amount of real estate assets held for development and sale.

column1: Transfer Mortgage Payable
column2: The fair value of transfer of mortgage payable in noncash investing or financing activities.

column1: Compensation and Benefits Trust
column2: The value of a trust established to hold the stock of an employee compensation and benefits plan as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Deferred Gain on Sale
column2: This element represents disclosure of the amount of gain which has been deferred as the result of the sale of a business or operating assets to a highly leveraged entity which deferred gain has been reflected in the accompanying statement of financial position as reduction from the related asset.

column1: Deferred Revenue, Leases, Accumulated Amortization
column2: This element represents the amount of accumulated amortization as of the reporting date of deferred lease revenue which amortization represents the cumulative amount of deferred lease revenue which has been recognized in income since the amount was established.

column1: Liability for Future Policy Benefits, Other Contracts
column2: Amount of accrued obligation to policyholders that relates to insured events under other insurance contracts.

column1: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion in Other Comprehensive Loss, before Tax, Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest, Available-for-sale Securities
column2: Amount before tax of other than temporary impairment (OTTI) on investment in available-for-sale debt security, recognized in other comprehensive loss, attributable to noncontrolling interest.

column1: Loss on Fair Value Hedge Ineffectiveness
column2: Amount of recognized loss from the hedging ineffectiveness of a fair value hedge.

column1: Derivative Instruments in Hedges, Net Investment in Foreign Operations, Assets, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of all derivative assets designated as hedges of net investment in foreign operations.

column1: Income Tax Refunds, Discontinued Operations
column2: The amount of cash received during the period as refunds for the overpayment of taxes from discontinued operations.

column1: Amount of Impairment to Carrying Amount of Regulatory Assets
column2: Discloses the amount of any reduction to the carrying amounts of regulated assets that result from impairment (for example, rate actions of a regulator).

column1: Liability for Future Policy Benefits, Disability and Accident Benefits
column2: Amount of accrued obligation to policyholders that relates to insured events under disability and accident insurance contracts.

column1: Public Utilities, Property, Plant and Equipment, Amount of Indirect Disallowance of Costs of Recently Completed Plants
column2: The amount of indirect disallowance of costs of a recently completed plant. When it becomes probable that part of the cost of a recently completed plant will be disallowed for rate-making purposes and a reasonable estimate of the amount of the disallowance can be made, the estimated amount of the probable disallowance is deducted from the reported cost of the plant and recognized as a loss. If part of the cost is explicitly, but indirectly, disallowed (for example, by an explicit disallowance of return on investment on a portion of the plant), an equivalent amount of cost is deducted from the reported cost of the plant and recognized as a loss.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Investment in Leveraged Leases, Net
column2: The net investment in arrangements meeting the criteria for classification as leveraged leases including deferred taxes.

column1: Airline Related Inventory, Valuation Reserves
column2: The amount of the valuation account as of the balance sheet date which reduces the carrying amount of airline related inventory (including expendable merchandise, goods, commodities, or supplies to be used primarily in air transport of passengers or freight) to net realizable value; takes into consideration such factors as market value, excessive quantities based on expected sales, technological obsolescence, and shrinkage.

column1: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate Accumulated Depreciation, Other Additions
column2: Amount of other additions to accumulated depreciation other than depreciation expense for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

column1: Water Production Costs
column2: Cost incurred related to water production and may include cost of treatment plants, pumps, pipes and reservoir, purchased water, power and pump taxes as well as the cost of reducing water leakage.

column1: Liability for Title Claims and Claims Adjustment Expense
column2: The amount needed to reflect the estimated ultimate cost of settling asserted and unasserted claims estimated to have been incurred by the insureds on or before the balance sheet date pertaining to the existence of a lien, encumbrance, defect or other matter purportedly affecting the title to the interest as insured.

column1: Time Sharing Transactions, Allowance for Uncollectible Accounts, Deductions for Direct Write-offs Charged Against Allowance
column2: Amount of decrease in the allowance for uncollectible accounts, for time sharing transactions, from direct write-offs charged against the allowance.

column1: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Noncash Financial or Equity Instrument Consideration, Options Issued
column2: The number of options issued as [noncash or part noncash] consideration for a business or asset acquired. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Capital Leases, Net Investment in Direct Financing Leases, Executory Costs
column2: Estimated remaining costs to be incurred to service the direct financing lease, such as taxes, maintenance and insurance and the profit thereon, that are included in the minimum lease payments.

column1: Payments for Participation Liabilities
column2: Cash payments related to participation costs.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Debt Structure, Direct Loan, Employer Cash Payments Used for Debt Service
column2: The amount of cash provided by the employer through contributions or dividends that the ESOP used in the period to repay debt and interest on a third-party loan made directly to the ESOP.

column1: Junior Subordinated Debenture Owed to Unconsolidated Subsidiary Trust, Current
column2: The current portion of the carrying value of junior subordinated long-term debt owed to unconsolidated subsidiary trusts as of the balance sheet date. Such debt places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment in liquidation of the entity's assets and was initially scheduled to be repaid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Debt Structure, Employer Loan Guarantee
column2: Reflects the amount as of the balance sheet date of the employer's guarantee of debt repayment by the ESOP.

column1: Deferred Taxes, Business Combination, Valuation Allowance, Available to Reduce Goodwill
column2: The amount of the valuation allowance recorded in a business combination against deductible temporary differences for which related tax benefits will be recorded as a reduction of the acquired entity's goodwill if those tax benefits become realizable.

column1: Payments to Acquire Other Loans and Leases Held-for-investment
column2: Amount of cash outflow from purchases of loans and leases held-for-investment classified as other.

column1: Recorded Third-Party Environmental Recoveries, Net
column2: Present value of the asset for third-party recoveries related to environmental remediation obligations as of the balance sheet date (if the receivable is discounted).

column1: Inventory, Drilling, Noncurrent
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of inventories of minerals, materials and supplies related to long-term drilling operations.

column1: Leveraged Leases, Net Investment in Leveraged Leases Disclosure, Nonrecourse Debt Service
column2: The portion of rentals receivable applicable to principal and interest on the nonrecourse debt.

column1: Gas Balancing Volume Amount
column2: The amount of the gas imbalance in terms of units of measure (Mcf) as of the end of the period.

column1: Unrealized Loss on Price Risk Cash Flow Derivatives, before Tax
column2: Amount of unrealized loss related to the decrease in fair value of price risk derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income in the period, before taxes, to the extent that the cash flow hedge is determined to be effective.

column1: Deferred Taxes, Business Combination, Valuation Allowance, Available to Reduce Intangible Assets
column2: The amount of the valuation allowance recorded in a business combination against deductible temporary differences for which related tax benefits will be recorded as a reduction of the acquired entity's other noncurrent intangible assets if those tax benefits subsequently become realizable.

column1: Certain Loans Acquired in Transfer Not Accounted for as Debt Securities, Acquired During Period, Not Accounted for Using Income Recognition Model, at Acquisition
column2: The carrying amount as of the acquisition date of loans to which the income recognition total model was not applied. This relates to loans not accounted for as debt securities, with evidence of deterioration of credit quality since origination that were acquired by completion of a transfer, for which it was deemed probable at acquisition that the investor would be unable to collect all contractually required payments.

column1: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Excess of Liabilities over Assets
column2: The value of the excess of liabilities over assets. If all outstanding shares are subject to mandatory redemption and the redemption price is more than the book value (the redemption price exceeds the company's equity balance), the resulting cumulative transition adjustment and subsequent adjustments to reflect changes in the redemption price of the shares are recorded as an excess of liabilities over assets.

column1: Deferred Purchased Power Costs
column2: Costs of power used for operations in prior periods that were expected to be recovered from customers in future periods.

column1: Loss Recognized on Assets Transferred to Separate Account, Gross
column2: Amount of loss recognized during the reporting period on assets that were transferred into separate accounts.

column1: Business Combination, Acquired Direct Financing Lease Receivable
column2: Amount of acquired direct financing lease receivable from business combination.

column1: Business Combination, Acquired Sales-type Lease Receivable
column2: Amount of acquired sales-type lease receivable from business combination.

column1: Capitalized Contract Cost, Accumulated Amortization
column2: Amount of accumulated amortization of asset recognized from cost incurred to obtain or fulfill contract with customer.

column1: Capitalized Contract Cost, Accumulated Impairment
column2: Amount of accumulated impairment loss for asset recognized from cost incurred to obtain or fulfill contract with customer.

column1: Capitalized Contract Cost, Gross
column2: Amount, before accumulated amortization and accumulated impairment loss, of asset recognized from cost incurred to obtain or fulfill contract with customer.

column1: Capitalized Contract Cost, Net
column2: Amount, after accumulated amortization and accumulated impairment loss, of asset recognized from cost incurred to obtain or fulfill contract with customer.

column1: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
column2: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

column1: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operations
column2: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

column1: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
column2: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

column1: Common Equity Tier One Capital
column2: Amount of Common Equity Tier One Risk-based Capital, as defined by regulatory framework.

column1: Common Equity Tier One Capital Ratio
column2: Percentage of Common Equity Tier One Risk-based Capital to total risk-weighted assets, as defined by regulatory framework.

column1: Common Equity Tier One Capital Required for Capital Adequacy
column2: Amount of Common Equity Tier 1 Risk-based Capital required to be categorized as adequately capitalized under regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Common Equity Tier One Capital Required to be Well-Capitalized
column2: Amount of Common Equity Tier 1 Risk-based Capital required to be categorized as well-capitalized under regulatory framework for prompt corrective action.

column1: Consideration Received for Beneficial Interest Obtained for Transferring Financial Asset
column2: Amount of beneficial interest received as consideration for transferring noncash financial asset. Includes, but is not limited to, trade receivable in securitization transaction.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Accumulated Allowance for Credit Loss
column2: Amount of accumulated credit loss for right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Accumulated Allowance for Credit Loss, Current
column2: Amount of accumulated credit loss for right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, classified as current.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Accumulated Allowance for Credit Loss, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of accumulated credit loss for right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Gross
column2: Amount, before allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer, when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Gross, Current
column2: Amount, before allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, classified as current.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Gross, Noncurrent
column2: Amount, before allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Net
column2: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Net, Current
column2: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, classified as current.

column1: Contract with Customer, Asset, Net, Noncurrent
column2: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Contract with Customer, Liability
column2: Amount of obligation to transfer good or service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable.

column1: Contract with Customer, Liability, Current
column2: Amount of obligation to transfer good or service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable, classified as current.

column1: Contract with Customer, Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of obligation to transfer good or service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Contract with Customer, Refund Liability
column2: Amount of liability for consideration received or receivable from customer which is not included in transaction price, when consideration is expected to be refunded to customer.

column1: Contract with Customer, Refund Liability, Current
column2: Amount of liability for consideration received or receivable from customer which is not included in transaction price, when consideration is expected to be refunded to customer, classified as current.

column1: Contract with Customer, Refund Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of liability for consideration received or receivable from customer which is not included in transaction price, when consideration is expected to be refunded to customer, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Contract with Customer, Right to Recover Product
column2: Amount of right to recover product from customer on settling refund liability.

column1: Contract with Customer, Right to Recover Product, Current
column2: Amount of right to recover product from customer on settling refund liability, classified as current.

column1: Contract with Customer, Right to Recover Product, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of right to recover product from customer on settling refund liability, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Cost of Goods Sold, Direct Financing Lease
column2: Cost of goods sold for direct financing lease.

column1: Cost of Goods Sold, Sales-type Lease
column2: Cost of goods sold for sales-type financing lease.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, Threshold Consecutive Trading Days
column2: Threshold period of specified consecutive trading days within which common stock price to conversion price of convertible debt instrument must exceed threshold percentage for specified number of trading days to trigger conversion feature.

column1: Deferred Compensation Arrangement with Individual, Contributions by Employer
column2: Amount of contributions made by employer into fund established for purposes of making future disbursement to individual in accordance with deferred compensation arrangement.

column1: Deferred Compensation Arrangement with Individual, Distribution Paid
column2: Amount of distribution made to individual in accordance with deferred compensation arrangement.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs, Amortization Expense, Accrued Interest
column2: Amount of amortization expense for deferred policy acquisition costs from accrued interest on unamortized balance.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs and Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Accrued Interest
column2: Amount of amortization expense for deferred policy acquisition costs and present value of future profits from insurance contract acquired in business combination, from accrued interest on unamortized balance.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs and Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Disposition
column2: Amount of deferred policy acquisition costs and present value of future profits from insurance contract acquired in business combination, disposed or classified as held-for-sale.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs and Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Impairment Loss
column2: Amount of impairment loss for deferred policy acquisition costs and present value of future profits from insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs, Disposition
column2: Amount of deferred policy acquisition costs disposed or classified as held-for-sale.

column1: Deferred Sales Inducement Cost, Amortization Expense, Accrued Interest
column2: Amount of amortization expense for deferred sales inducement cost from accrued interest on unamortized balance.

column1: Deferred Sales Inducement Cost, Disposition
column2: Amount of deferred sales inducement cost disposed or classified as held-for-sale.

column1: Deferred Tax Asset, Intra-entity Transfer, Asset Other than Inventory
column2: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowance, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary difference from intra-entity transfer of asset within consolidated group. Excludes intra-entity transfer of inventory.

column1: Deferred Tax Liability, Intra-entity Transfer, Asset Other than Inventory
column2: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to intra-entity transfer of asset within consolidated group. Excludes intra-entity transfer of inventory.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Assets Expected to be Returned to Employer, Amount
column2: Amount of plan assets expected to be returned to employer during 12-month period, or operating cycle, if longer, following latest fiscal year.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Assumptions Used Calculating Net Periodic Benefit Cost, Change Due to Subsequent Interim Measurement, Weighted-Average Expected Long-term Rate of Return on Plan Assets
column2: Weighted average rate of return on plan assets, used to determine net periodic benefit cost (credit) of defined benefit plan, in subsequent interim measurement.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Benefit Obligation, Benefits Paid
column2: Amount of payment to participant of defined benefit plan which decreases benefit obligation. For pension plan, payment includes, but is not limited to, pension benefits and death benefits. For other postretirement plan, payment includes, but is not limited to, prescription drug benefits, health care benefits, life insurance benefits, and legal, educational and advisory services.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Benefit Obligation, Contributions by Plan Participant
column2: Amount of contributions received by defined benefit plan from participant which increase benefit obligation.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Benefit Obligation, Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipt
column2: Amount, before benefit payment, of receipt from prescription drug subsidy which increases benefit obligation of defined benefit postretirement plan.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Employer Contributions, Current Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of contributions received and expected to be received by defined benefit plan from employer in current fiscal year.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Employer Contributions, Next Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of contributions expected to be received by defined benefit plan from employer in next fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Future Employer Contributions, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of contributions expected to be received by defined benefit plan from employer in fiscal year. Excludes contributions paid by employer in current fiscal year.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Plan Assets, Benefits Paid
column2: Amount of payment to participant under defined benefit plan which decreases plan assets. For pension plan, payment includes, but is not limited to, pension benefits and death benefits. For other postretirement plan, payment includes, but is not limited to, prescription drug benefits, health care benefits, life insurance benefits, and legal, educational and advisory services.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Plan Assets, Contributions by Plan Participant
column2: Amount of contributions received by defined benefit plan from participant which increases plan assets.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Plan Assets, Prescription Drug Subsidy Receipt
column2: Amount of receipt from prescription drug subsidy which increases plan assets of defined benefit postretirement plan.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Plan Assets, Target Allocation, Percentage
column2: Percentage of target investment allocation to total plan assets. Includes, but is not limited to, percentage on weighted-average basis if more than one plan.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Prescription Drug Benefit, Accumulated Postretirement Benefit Obligation, Decrease for Subsidy
column2: Amount of decrease in accumulated postretirement benefit obligation for government subsidy related to prescription drug benefits attributed to past service.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Number of Employees
column2: Number of employees eligible to participate in defined contribution plan.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Deferred Selling Profit
column2: Amount of deferred selling profit from direct financing lease.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Interest Income
column2: Amount of interest income from net investment in direct financing lease.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Lease Income
column2: Amount of lease income from variable lease payments, interest income on direct financing lease and after offset of loss recognized at commencement.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Lease Receivable
column2: Present value of lease payments not yet received by lessor and amount expected to be derived from underlying asset, following end of lease term, guaranteed by lessee or other third party unrelated to lessor, from direct financing lease.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Net Investment in Lease
column2: Amount of net investment in direct financing lease.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Residual Value of Leased Asset
column2: Amount of residual asset covered by residual value guarantee under direct financing lease. Excludes guarantee considered to be lease payments for lessor.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Revenue
column2: Amount of direct financing lease revenue.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Selling Loss
column2: Amount of loss recognized at commencement from direct financing lease.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Unguaranteed Residual Asset
column2: Present value expected to be derived from underlying asset, following end of lease term, not guaranteed by lessee or other third party unrelated to lessor.

column1: Direct Financing Lease, Variable Lease Income
column2: Amount of direct financing lease income from variable lease payments paid and payable to lessor, excluding amount included in measurement of lease receivable.

column1: Finance Lease, Interest Expense
column2: Amount of interest expense on finance lease liability.

column1: Finance Lease, Interest Payment on Liability
column2: Amount of interest paid on finance lease liability.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability
column2: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from finance lease.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Current
column2: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from finance lease, classified as current.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from finance lease, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due after Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due after fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due after fifth fiscal year following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling after Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due after fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in fourth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in third rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in second rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in next fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Four
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in fourth fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Three
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in third fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Two
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in second fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Payments, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease, due in remainder of fiscal year following latest fiscal year ended.

column1: Finance Lease, Liability, Undiscounted Excess Amount
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments in excess of discounted obligation for lease payments for finance lease.

column1: Finance Lease, Principal Payments
column2: Amount of cash outflow for principal payment on finance lease.

column1: Finance Lease, Right-of-Use Asset
column2: Amount of lessee's right to use underlying asset under finance lease.

column1: Finance Lease, Right-of-Use Asset, Amortization
column2: Amount of amortization expense attributable to right-of-use asset from finance lease.

column1: Finance Lease, Weighted Average Discount Rate, Percent
column2: Weighted average discount rate for finance lease calculated at point in time.

column1: Financing Receivable, Nonaccrual, Percent Past Due
column2: Percentage of nonaccrual financing receivable balance outstanding that is past due.

column1: Financing Receivable, Percent Past Due
column2: Percentage of financing receivable balance that is past due.

column1: Interest Credited to Policy Owner Account
column2: Amount of expense for unpaid portion of interest credited to policy owner account.

column1: Investment Company, Committed Capital
column2: Amount of funds committed to investment company from investors.

column1: Investment Company, Contractual Fee Waived
column2: Amount of fee contractually waived by investment company.

column1: Investment Company, Deferred Income Tax, Unrealized Appreciation
column2: Amount of deferred income tax expense for unrealized appreciation of investment.

column1: Investment Company, Distribution to Shareholders, Per Share
column2: Per share or unit amount of distribution to shareholders. Includes, but is not limited to, dividend and capital gain. Excludes distribution for tax return of capital.

column1: Investment Company, Dividend Distribution
column2: Amount of dividend distribution from ordinary income and capital gain. Excludes distribution for tax return of capital.

column1: Investment Company, Expense Ratio after Incentive Allocation
column2: Percentage of expense, after incentive allocation, to average net assets.

column1: Investment Company, Expense Ratio before Incentive Allocation
column2: Percentage, before incentive allocation, of expense to average net assets.

column1: Investment Company, Expense Ratio Excluding Incentive Fee
column2: Percentage, after deduction of fee waiver and before deduction of incentive fee, of expense to average net assets.

column1: Investment Company, Expense Ratio Including Incentive Fee
column2: Percentage, after deduction of fee waiver and incentive fee, of expense to average net assets.

column1: Investment Company, Expense Ratio Including Voluntary Fee Waiver
column2: Percentage, after deduction of voluntary fee waiver, of expense to average net assets.

column1: Investment Company, Expense Ratio, Voluntary Fee Waiver
column2: Percentage of voluntary fee waiver to average net assets.

column1: Investment Company, Fee Paid Indirectly
column2: Amount that would have been incurred for brokerage service had service been paid for directly in arm's-length transaction.

column1: Investment Company, Financial Commitment to Investee, Future Amount
column2: Amount of financial support to be provided in future by investment company to investee.

column1: Investment Company, Financial Support to Investee Contractually Required, Amount
column2: Amount of financial support committed by investment company to investee that is contractually required.

column1: Investment Company, Financial Support to Investee, Discretionary, Amount
column2: Amount of financial support committed by investment company to investee that is discretionary.

column1: Investment Company, General Partner Advisory Service
column2: Amount of payment or allocation for advisory service from general partner.

column1: Investment Company, Incentive Fee to Average Net Assets
column2: Percentage of incentive fee expense to average net assets.

column1: Investment Company, Payment by Affiliate, Per Share
column2: Per share or unit amount of payment by affiliate of fund to offset fund loss.

column1: Investment Company, Redemption Fee, Per Share
column2: Per share or unit amount of fee charged to investor for redemption of shares before permitted period.

column1: Investment Company, Registration Expense
column2: Amount of registration fee expense for issuance of shares or units.

column1: Investment Company, Shareholder Service Fee Expense
column2: Amount of expense for shareholder services. Includes, but is not limited to, fee and expense for transfer and dividend disbursing agent.

column1: Investment Company, Voluntary Fee Waived
column2: Amount of fee voluntarily waived by investment company.

column1: Lease, Cost
column2: Amount of lease cost recognized by lessee for lease contract.
column4: Removed because can have sublease income which is greater, added seperate rule to check.

column1: Lease Deposit Liability
column2: Amount of liability for lease payments received, including variable lease payments, when collectability is not probable at commencement date for sales-type lease.

column1: Lease Income
column2: Amount of lease income from operating, direct financing, and sales-type leases. Includes, but is not limited to, variable lease payments, interest income, profit (loss) recognized at commencement, and lease payments paid and payable to lessor.

column1: Lessee, Finance Lease, Discount Rate
column2: Discount rate used by lessee to determine present value of finance lease payments.

column1: Lessee, Finance Lease, Lease Not yet Commenced, Discount Rate
column2: Discount rate used by lessee to determine present value of finance lease payments for lease that has not yet commenced.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Discount Rate
column2: Discount rate used by lessee to determine present value of operating lease payments.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Lease Not yet Commenced, Discount Rate
column2: Discount rate used by lessee to determine present value of operating lease payments for lease that has not yet commenced.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due after fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due after Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due after fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in fourth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in third rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due in Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in second rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in next rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in next fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Five
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Four
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in fourth fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Three
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in third fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Due Year Two
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease, due in second fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Payments, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease having an initial or remaining lease term in excess of one year due in remainder of fiscal year following latest fiscal year.

column1: Lessee, Operating Lease, Liability, Undiscounted Excess Amount
column2: Amount of lessee's undiscounted obligation for lease payments in excess of discounted obligation for lease payments for operating lease.

column1: Lessor, Direct Financing Lease, Assumptions and Judgments, Value of Underlying Asset, Amount
column2: Amount lessor expects from underlying asset following end of direct financing lease term.

column1: Lessor, Direct Financing Lease, Lease Not yet Commenced, Assumption and Judgment, Value of Underlying Asset, Amount
column2: Amount lessor expects from underlying asset following end of direct financing lease term for lease that has not yet commenced.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Assumptions and Judgments, Value of Underlying Asset, Amount
column2: Amount lessor expects from underlying asset following end of operating lease term.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Indemnification Payment Received
column2: Amount received for indemnification payment for tax effect other than investment tax credit for operating lease.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Lease Not yet Commenced, Assumption and Judgment, Value of Underlying Asset, Amount
column2: Amount lessor expects from underlying asset following end of operating lease term for lease that has not yet commenced.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor for operating lease.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in period after fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date for operating lease. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Five Years
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year for operating lease. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Four Years
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in fourth year following latest fiscal year for operating lease. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in next rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date for operating lease. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in next fiscal year following latest fiscal year for operating lease. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in remainder of fiscal year following latest fiscal year for operating lease. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date for operating lease. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in fourth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date for operating lease. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in third rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date for operating lease. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in second rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date for operating lease. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Thereafter
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor after fifth fiscal year following latest statement of financial position date for operating lease. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Three Years
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in third fiscal year following latest fiscal year for operating lease. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Operating Lease, Payments to be Received, Two Years
column2: Amount of lease payments to be received by lessor in second fiscal year following latest fiscal year for operating lease. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Lessor, Sales-type Lease, Assumptions and Judgments, Value of Underlying Asset, Amount
column2: Amount that lessor expects to derive from underlying asset following end of sales-type lease term.

column1: Lessor, Sales-type Lease, Lease Not yet Commenced, Assumption and Judgment, Value of Underlying Asset, Amount
column2: Amount that lessor expects to derive from underlying asset following end of sales-type lease term for lease that has not yet commenced.

column1: Litigation Settlement, Amount Awarded from Other Party
column2: Amount awarded from other party in judgment or settlement of litigation.

column1: Litigation Settlement, Amount Awarded to Other Party
column2: Amount awarded to other party in judgment or settlement of litigation.

column1: Long-term Debt, Weighted Average Interest Rate, over Time
column2: Weighted average interest rate of long-term debt outstanding calculated over time.

column1: Multiemployer Plan, Collective-Bargaining Arrangement, Percentage of Contributions Required for Multiple Collective-Bargaining Arrangements
column2: Percentage of contributions required of employer under collective bargaining arrangement to total contributions required under all collective bargaining arrangements for pension and other postretirement plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Multiemployer Plan, Collective-Bargaining Arrangement, Required Percentage of Contributions
column2: Percentage of contributions required by collective bargaining arrangement to all contributions required of employer for pension and other postretirement plan to which two or more unrelated employers contribute where assets contributed by one participating employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers.

column1: Multiemployer Plan, Contributions by Employer
column2: Amount of contributions made to multiemployer plan by employer.

column1: Multiemployer Plans, Plan Contributions
column2: Amount of contributions made to multiemployer plan by all employers who participate in plan.

column1: Multiple-Employer Plan Accounted for as Multiemployer Plan, Contribution by Participating Entity
column2: Amount of contributions made by entity participating in defined benefit plan, defined as multiple-employer plan but accounted for as multiemployer plan.

column1: Net Asset Value Per Share
column2: Net asset value per share or per unit of investments in certain entities that calculate net asset value per share. Includes, but is not limited to, by unit, membership interest, or other ownership interest. Investment includes, but is not limited to, investment in certain hedge funds, venture capital funds, private equity funds, real estate partnerships or funds. Excludes fair value disclosure.

column1: Net Investment in Lease
column2: Amount of net investment in sales-type and direct financing lease.

column1: Net Investment in Lease, Current
column2: Amount of net investment in sales-type and direct financing lease, classified as current.

column1: Net Investment in Lease, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of net investment in sales-type and direct financing lease, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Operating Lease, Cost
column2: Amount of single lease cost, calculated by allocation of remaining cost of lease over remaining lease term. Includes, but is not limited to, single lease cost, after impairment of right-of-use asset, calculated by amortization of remaining right-of-use asset and accretion of lease liability.

column1: Operating Lease, Expense
column2: Amount of operating lease expense. Excludes sublease income.

column1: Operating Lease, Initial Direct Cost Expense, over Term
column2: Amount of operating lease initial direct cost recognized as expense over lease term.

column1: Operating Lease, Lease Income
column2: Amount of operating lease income from lease payments and variable lease payments paid and payable to lessor. Includes, but is not limited to, variable lease payments not included in measurement of lease receivable.

column1: Operating Lease, Lease Income, Lease Payments
column2: Amount of operating lease income from lease payments paid and payable to lessor. Excludes variable lease payments not included in measurement of lease receivable.

column1: Operating Lease, Liability
column2: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from operating lease.

column1: Operating Lease, Liability, Current
column2: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from operating lease, classified as current.

column1: Operating Lease, Liability, Noncurrent
column2: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from operating lease, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Operating Lease, Payments
column2: Amount of cash outflow from operating lease, excluding payments to bring another asset to condition and location necessary for its intended use.

column1: Operating Lease, Payments, Use
column2: Amount of cash outflow from operating lease to bring another asset to condition and location necessary for its intended use.

column1: Operating Lease, Residual Value of Leased Asset
column2: Amount of residual asset covered by residual value guarantee under operating lease. Excludes guarantee considered to be lease payments for lessor.

column1: Operating Lease, Right-of-Use Asset
column2: Amount of lessee's right to use underlying asset under operating lease.

column1: Operating Lease, Variable Lease Income
column2: Amount of operating lease income from variable lease payments paid and payable to lessor, excluding amount included in measurement of lease receivable.

column1: Operating Lease, Weighted Average Discount Rate, Percent
column2: Weighted average discount rate for operating lease calculated at point in time.

column1: Participating Policy, Percentage of Premium Income
column2: Percentage of participating insurance to premium income.

column1: Payment for Contingent Consideration Liability, Financing Activities
column2: Amount of cash outflow, not made soon after acquisition date of business combination, to settle contingent consideration liability up to amount recognized at acquisition date, including, but not limited to, measurement period adjustment and less amount paid soon after acquisition date.

column1: Payment for Contingent Consideration Liability, Investing Activities
column2: Amount of cash outflow, made soon after acquisition date of business combination, to settle contingent consideration liability.

column1: Payment for Contingent Consideration Liability, Operating Activities
column2: Amount of cash outflow, not made soon after acquisition date of business combination, to settle contingent consideration liability exceeding amount recognized at acquisition date. Includes, but is not limited to, measurement period adjustment and less amount paid soon after acquisition date.

column1: Payment to Acquire Life Insurance Policy, Operating Activities
column2: Amount of cash outflow for payment of premium on corporate-owned life insurance policy, classified as operating activities. Includes, but is not limited to, bank-owned life insurance policy.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Accumulated Amortization
column2: Amount of accumulated amortization of present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Accrued Interest
column2: Amount of amortization expense for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination from accrued interest on unamortized balance.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of amortization expense expected to be recognized in remainder of fiscal year following latest fiscal year ended for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Year Five
column2: Amount of amortization expense expected to be recognized during fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Year Four
column2: Amount of amortization expense expected to be recognized during fourth fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Year One
column2: Amount of amortization expense expected to be recognized during next fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Year Three
column2: Amount of amortization expense expected to be recognized during third fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Amortization Expense, Year Two
column2: Amount of amortization expense expected to be recognized during second fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Gross
column2: Amount, before accumulated amortization, of present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Percentage of Amortization Expense, Year Five
column2: Percentage of amortization expense expected to be recognized during fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Percentage of Amortization Expense, Year Four
column2: Percentage of amortization expense expected to be recognized during fourth fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Percentage of Amortization Expense, Year One
column2: Percentage of amortization expense expected to be recognized during next fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Percentage of Amortization Expense, Year Three
column2: Percentage of amortization expense expected to be recognized during third fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Present Value of Future Insurance Profits, Percentage of Amortization Expense, Year Two
column2: Percentage of amortization expense expected to be recognized during second fiscal year following latest fiscal year for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

column1: Residual Value of Leased Asset
column2: Amount of residual asset covered by residual value guarantee. Excludes guarantee considered to be lease payments for lessor.

column1: Restricted Cash
column2: Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits.

column1: Restricted Cash, Current
column2: Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as current. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits.

column1: Restricted Cash Equivalents
column2: Amount of cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

column1: Restricted Cash Equivalents, Current
column2: Amount of cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as current. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

column1: Restricted Cash Equivalents, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as noncurrent. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

column1: Restricted Cash, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as noncurrent. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits.

column1: Revenue from Contract with Customer, Excluding Assessed Tax
column2: Amount, excluding tax collected from customer, of revenue from satisfaction of performance obligation by transferring promised good or service to customer. Tax collected from customer is tax assessed by governmental authority that is both imposed on and concurrent with specific revenue-producing transaction, including, but not limited to, sales, use, value added and excise.

column1: Revenue from Contract with Customer, Including Assessed Tax
column2: Amount, including tax collected from customer, of revenue from satisfaction of performance obligation by transferring promised good or service to customer. Tax collected from customer is tax assessed by governmental authority that is both imposed on and concurrent with specific revenue-producing transaction, including, but not limited to, sales, use, value-added and excise.

column1: Revenue, Remaining Performance Obligation
column2: Amount of transaction price allocated to performance obligation that has not been recognized as revenue.

column1: Right-of-Use Asset Obtained in Exchange for Finance Lease Liability
column2: Amount of increase in right-of-use asset obtained in exchange for finance lease liability.

column1: Right-of-Use Asset Obtained in Exchange for Operating Lease Liability
column2: Amount of increase in right-of-use asset obtained in exchange for operating lease liability.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Interest Income
column2: Amount of interest income from net investment in sales-type and direct financing leases.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable
column2: Present value of lease payments not yet received by lessor and amount expected to be derived from underlying asset, following end of lease term guaranteed by lessee or other third party unrelated to lessor, from sales-type and direct financing leases.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Lease Payments to be Received, after Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases after fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Lease Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Five
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in fifth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Lease Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Three
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in third rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Lease Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Two
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in second rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Five Years
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Four Years
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in fourth fiscal year following latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Next Rolling Twelve Months
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in next rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in the next fiscal year following latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in remainder of the fiscal year following latest fiscal year.
