Excludes interim and annual period when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Rolling Year Four
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in fourth rolling twelve months following latest statement of financial position date. For interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Thereafter
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases after fifth fiscal year following latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Three Years
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in third fiscal year following latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Payments to be Received, Two Years
column2: Amount of undiscounted cash flows to be received by lessor for sales-type and direct financing leases in second fiscal year following latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest statement of financial position date.

column1: Sales-type and Direct Financing Leases, Lease Receivable, Undiscounted Excess Amount
column2: Amount of undiscounted lease receivable in excess of discounted receivable for sales-type and direct financing leases.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Initial Direct Cost Expense, Commencement
column2: Amount of sales-type lease initial direct cost recognized as expense at commencement date.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Interest Income
column2: Amount of interest income from net investment in sales-type lease.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Interest Income, Lease Receivable
column2: Amount of interest income from lease receivable of sales-type lease.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Interest Income, Unguaranteed Residual Asset
column2: Amount of interest income from unguaranteed residual asset of sales-type lease.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Lease Income
column2: Amount of lease income from variable lease payments, interest income from net investment on sales-type lease, and profit (loss) recognized at commencement.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Lease Receivable
column2: Present value of lease payments not yet received by lessor and amount expected to be derived from underlying asset, following end of lease term guaranteed by lessee or other third party unrelated to lessor, from sales-type lease.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Net Investment in Lease
column2: Amount of net investment in sales-type lease.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Residual Value of Leased Asset
column2: Amount of residual asset covered by residual value guarantee under sales-type lease. Excludes guarantee considered to be lease payments for lessor.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Revenue
column2: Amount of sales-type lease revenue.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Unguaranteed Residual Asset
column2: Present value expected to be derived from underlying asset following end of lease term not guaranteed by lessee or other third party unrelated to lessor.

column1: Sales-type Lease, Variable Lease Income
column2: Amount of sales-type lease income from variable lease payments paid and payable to lessor, excluding amount included in measurement of lease receivable.

column1: Short-term Debt, Weighted Average Interest Rate, over Time
column2: Weighted average interest rate of short-term debt outstanding calculated over time.

column1: Short-term Lease Commitment, Amount
column2: Amount of short-term lease commitment.

column1: Short-term Lease, Cost
column2: Amount of short-term lease cost, excluding expense for lease with term of one month or less.

column1: Short-term Lease Payments
column2: Amount of cash outflow for short-term lease payment excluded from lease liability.

column1: Sublease Income
column2: Amount of sublease income excluding finance and operating lease expense.

column1: Supplementary Leverage Ratio
column2: Percentage of tier one capital to total leverage exposure, as defined by regulatory framework.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Current
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets, classified as current.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Current, Not Pledged
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets that do not have to be used to settle obligations of the VIE, classified as current.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Current, Pledged
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets that can only be used to settle obligations of the VIE, classified as current.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets classified as noncurrent.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Noncurrent, Not Pledged
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets that do not have to be used to settle obligations of VIE, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Noncurrent, Pledged
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets that can only be used to settle obligations of VIE, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Not Pledged
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets that do not have to be used to settle obligations of VIE.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Assets, Pledged
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) assets that can only be used to settle obligations of VIE.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities classified as current.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, Current, No Recourse
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities that do not have recourse to general credit of primary beneficiary, classified as current.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, Current, Recourse
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities that have recourse to general credit of primary beneficiary, classified as current.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, Noncurrent, No Recourse
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities that do not have recourse to general credit of primary beneficiary, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, Noncurrent, Recourse
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities that have recourse to general credit of primary beneficiary, classified as noncurrent.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, No Recourse
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities that do not have recourse to general credit of primary beneficiary.

column1: Variable Interest Entity, Consolidated, Liabilities, Recourse
column2: Amount of consolidated variable interest entity's (VIE) liabilities that have recourse to general credit of primary beneficiary.

column1: Variable Lease, Cost
column2: Amount of variable lease cost, excluded from lease liability, recognized when obligation for payment is incurred for finance and operating leases.

column1: Variable Lease, Income
column2: Amount of variable lease payments from operating, direct financing, and sales-type leases, excluding amount included in measurement of lease receivable.

column1: Variable Lease, Payment
column2: Amount of cash outflow for variable lease payment excluded from lease liability.

column1: Weighted Average Rate, Interest-bearing Domestic Deposits, over Time
column2: Weighted average interest rate calculated over time for domestic deposit liability.

column1: Accounts Payable, Interest-bearing, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable to vendors that bear interest at either a stated or an imputed rate. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities, Current
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and due within one year (or the operating cycle, if longer), including liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received, taxes, interest, rent and utilities, accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes and fringe benefits.

column1: Accounts Payable, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of liabilities incurred for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business and related party payables.

column1: Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities, Noncurrent
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and due after one year (or beyond the operating cycle if longer), including liabilities for compensation costs, fringe benefits other than pension and postretirement obligations, rent, contractual rights and obligations, and statutory obligations.

column1: Accounts Payable, Interest-bearing
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable to vendors that bear interest at either a stated or an imputed rate.

column1: Accounts and Notes Receivable, Net
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date, net of allowance for doubtful accounts, of account and note receivables due from other than related parties.

column1: Accounts Payable and Other Accrued Liabilities, Current
column2: Amount of liabilities incurred to vendors for goods and services received, and accrued liabilities classified as other, payable within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Accounts Payable and Other Accrued Liabilities
column2: Amount of liabilities incurred and payable to vendors for goods and services received, and accrued liabilities classified as other.

column1: Accounts and Other Receivables, Net, Current
column2: Amount, after allowance, receivable from customers, clients, or other third-parties, and receivables classified as other due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Accounts, Notes, Loans and Financing Receivable, Net, Current
column2: The aggregate of amounts due from customers or clients, within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer), for goods or services that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business and an amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date within one year of the balance sheet, reduced to their estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection and net of any write-downs taken for collection uncertainty on the part of the holder, respectively.

column1: Accounts Payable
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business.

column1: Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
column2: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date, including liabilities incurred and payable to vendors for goods and services received, taxes, interest, rent and utilities, compensation costs, payroll taxes and fringe benefits (other than pension and postretirement obligations), contractual rights and obligations, and statutory obligations.

column1: Accounts Payable, Current
column2: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

column1: Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of trade and related party payables and accrued expenses.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, Year Six Through Ten, Amortized Cost Basis
column2: Amount after adjustments of available-for-sale debt securities at cost, maturing in the sixth fiscal year through the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized in earnings less cumulative-effect adjustments, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, Year Two Through Five, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of available-for-sale debt securities maturing in the second fiscal year through the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, after Ten Years, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of available-for-sale debt securities maturing after the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, Year Two Through Five, Amortized Cost Basis
column2: Amount after adjustments of available-for-sale debt securities at cost, maturing in the second fiscal year through the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized in earnings less cumulative-effect adjustments, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Gross Unrealized Loss
column2: Amount of unrealized loss before deducting unrealized gain on investments in available-for-sale securities.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, after Ten Years, Amortized Cost Basis
column2: Amount after adjustments of available-for-sale debt securities at cost, maturing after the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized in earnings less cumulative-effect adjustments, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, Year Six Through Ten, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of available-for-sale debt securities maturing in the sixth fiscal year through the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Gross Realized Losses
column2: This item represents the gross loss realized on the sale of debt or equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading securities.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, Next Twelve Months, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of available-for-sale debt securities maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, without Single Maturity Date, Amortized Cost Basis
column2: Amount of available-for-sale debt securities at cost, net of adjustments, that do not have a single maturity date and which the entity has decided to disclose separately rather than allocating the cost over several maturity groupings. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized in earnings (less any cumulative-effect adjustments, as defined) and fair value hedge accounting adjustments.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Restricted
column2: The carrying amount of securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading which serve as security for borrowings or other arrangements.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, without Single Maturity Date, Fair Value
column2: Amount of available-for-sale debt securities at fair value that do not have a single maturity date and which the entity has decided to disclose separately rather than allocating the fair value over several maturity groupings.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Gross Unrealized Gain
column2: Amount of unrealized gain before deducting unrealized loss on investments in debt and equity securities classified as available-for-sale securities.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Debt Maturities, Next Twelve Months, Amortized Cost Basis
column2: Amount after adjustments of available-for-sale debt securities at cost, maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized in earnings less cumulative-effect adjustments, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Available-for-sale Securities, Gross Realized Gains
column2: This item represents the gross profit realized on the sale of debt or equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading securities.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Amount of Claims Filed
column2: Amount of bankruptcy claim filed with bankruptcy court.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Number Claims Filed
column2: The aggregate number of claims filed with the bankruptcy court.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Number of Claims Settled
column2: The aggregate number of claims settled.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Amount of Claims under Review by Management
column2: Amount of bankruptcy claim under review by management.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Amount of Claims Settled
column2: Amount of bankruptcy claim settled.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Amount of Filed Claims Likely to be Denied
column2: Amount of bankruptcy claim filed with bankruptcy court that are likely to be denied.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Number of Claims Expunged by Bankruptcy Court
column2: The aggregate number of claims filed that the bankruptcy court has expunged.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Amount Paid to Settle Claims
column2: Amount paid to settle bankruptcy claim.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Number of Claims under Review by Management
column2: The aggregate number of claims under review by the management of the entity.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Number of Filed Claims Likely to be Denied
column2: The aggregate number of claims filed with the bankruptcy court that are likely to be denied.

column1: Bankruptcy Claims, Amount of Claims Expunged by Bankruptcy Court
column2: Amount of bankruptcy claim filed that bankruptcy court has expunged.

column1: Business Combination, Consideration Transferred, Including Equity Interest in Acquiree Held Prior to Combination
column2: Fair value at acquisition-date of the assets transferred by the acquirer, liabilities incurred by the acquirer, and equity interests issued by the acquirer, including but not limited to, instruments or interests issued or issuable in consideration for the business combination.

column1: Business Combination, Bargain Purchase, Gain Recognized, Amount
column2: In a business combination in which the amount of net identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed exceeds the aggregate consideration transferred or to be transferred (as defined), this element represents the amount of gain recognized by the entity.

column1: Business Combination, Acquisition of Less than 100 Percent, Noncontrolling Interest, Fair Value
column2: This element represents the fair value of the noncontrolling interest in the acquiree at the acquisition date.

column1: Commitments and Contingencies
column2: Represents the caption on the face of the balance sheet to indicate that the entity has entered into (1) purchase or supply arrangements that will require expending a portion of its resources to meet the terms thereof, and (2) is exposed to potential losses or, less frequently, gains, arising from (a) possible claims against a company's resources due to future performance under contract terms, and (b) possible losses or likely gains from uncertainties that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events that are deemed likely to occur do occur or fail to occur.

column1: Contractual Interest Expense on Prepetition Liabilities Not Recognized in Statement of Operations
column2: The amount of contractual interest expense on prepetition liabilities not included in the statement of operations.

column1: Costs Incurred, Development Costs
column2: Development costs incurred, including capitalized costs and costs charged to expense, in oil and gas activities.

column1: Costs Incurred, Exploration Costs
column2: Exploration costs incurred, including capitalized costs and costs charged to expense, in oil and gas activities.

column1: Customer Refundable Fees
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of proceeds that had been received in revenue related transactions that are refundable to the customers and do not meet the criteria for revenue recognition (for example, refundable membership fees).

column1: Customer Refundable Fees, Proceeds
column2: Amount of cash inflow from customers for revenue related transactions that are refundable to the customers and do not meet the criteria for revenue recognition.

column1: Debtor-in-Possession Financing, Interest Rate on Borrowings Outstanding
column2: Interest rate on outstanding borrowings under debtor-in-possession financing arrangement.

column1: Debtor Reorganization Items, Retiree Related Charges
column2: Amount of reorganization items related to retiree related charges.

column1: Debtor Reorganization Items, Debtor-in-Possession Facility Financing Costs
column2: Amount of reorganization items related to debtor-in-possession facility financing costs.

column1: Debtor Reorganization Items, Legal and Advisory Professional Fees
column2: Amount of reorganization items related to legal and advisory professional fees related to entities in bankruptcy.

column1: Debtor-in-Possession Financing, Fee on Unused Borrowings
column2: Percentage of fee on unused borrowings under debtor-in-possession financing arrangement.

column1: Debtor-in-Possession Financing, Borrowings Outstanding
column2: Amount of debtor-in-possession borrowings outstanding.

column1: Debtor Reorganization Items, Employee Related Charges
column2: Amount of reorganization items related to employee related charges.

column1: Debtor Reorganization Items, Discharge of Claims and Liabilities
column2: Amount of reorganization items related to discharge of claims and liabilities upon emergence from bankruptcy.

column1: Debtor-in-Possession Financing, Amount Arranged
column2: Amount debtor-in-possession financing arranged (but not necessarily all borrowed).

column1: Debtor-in-Possession Financing, Letters of Credit Outstanding
column2: Amount of letters of credit outstanding under debtor-in-possession financing arrangement.

column1: Debt Conversion, Original Debt, Amount
column2: The amount of the original debt being converted in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

column1: Debt Conversion, Converted Instrument, Shares Issued
column2: The number of shares issued in exchange for the original debt being converted in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or payments in the period.

column1: Long-term Debt, Gross
column2: Amount, before unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs, of long-term debt. Includes, but is not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, commercial loans, mortgage loans, convertible debt, subordinated debt and other types of debt.

column1: Debt Instrument, Annual Principal Payment
column2: Amount of the total principal payments made during the annual reporting period.

column1: Debt Instrument, Increase, Accrued Interest
column2: Increase for accrued, but unpaid interest on the debt instrument for the period.

column1: Debt Instrument, Fee Amount
column2: Amount of the fee that accompanies borrowing money under the debt instrument.

column1: Debt Instrument, Face Amount
column2: Face (par) amount of debt instrument at time of issuance.

column1: Debt Instrument, Periodic Payment
column2: Amount of the required periodic payments including both interest and principal payments.

column1: Debt Instrument, Decrease, Forgiveness
column2: Decrease for amounts of indebtedness forgiven by the holder of the debt instrument.

column1: Debt Instrument, Unused Borrowing Capacity, Amount
column2: Amount of unused borrowing capacity under the long-term financing arrangement that is available to the entity as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Debt Instrument, Periodic Payment, Principal
column2: Amount of the required periodic payments applied to principal.

column1: Debt Instrument, Unused Borrowing Capacity, Fee
column2: Amount of commitment fees for the unused borrowing capacity under the long-term financing arrangement that is available to the entity.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, Number of Equity Instruments
column2: The number of equity instruments that the holder of the debt instrument would receive if the debt was converted to equity.

column1: Debt Instrument, Unamortized Discount
column2: Amount, after accumulated amortization, of debt discount.

column1: Debt Instrument, Periodic Payment, Interest
column2: Amount of the required periodic payments applied to interest.

column1: Debt Instrument, Interest Rate, Stated Percentage
column2: Contractual interest rate for funds borrowed, under the debt agreement.

column1: Debt Instrument, Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value portion of debt instrument payable, including, but not limited to, notes payable and loans payable.

column1: Debt Instrument, Unamortized Premium
column2: Amount, after accumulated amortization, of debt premium.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, Beneficial Conversion Feature
column2: Amount of a favorable spread to a debt holder between the amount of debt being converted and the value of the securities received upon conversion. This is an embedded conversion feature of convertible debt issued that is in-the-money at the commitment date.

column1: Debt Instrument, Interest Rate, Effective Percentage
column2: Effective interest rate for the funds borrowed under the debt agreement considering interest compounding and original issue discount or premium.

column1: Debt Instrument, Convertible, If-converted Value in Excess of Principal
column2: The amount by which the convertible debt's if-converted value exceeds its principle amount at the balance sheet date, regardless of whether the instrument is currently convertible. This element applies to public companies only.

column1: Debt Instrument, Debt Default, Amount
column2: Amount of outstanding long-term debt or borrowing associated with any securities or credit agreement for which there has been a default in principal, interest, sinking fund, or redemption provisions, or any breach of covenant that existed at the end of the period and subsequently has not been cured.

column1: Debt Default, Short-term Debt, Amount
column2: Amount of outstanding short-term debt or borrowing associated with any securities or credit agreement for which there has been a default in principal, interest, sinking fund, or redemption provisions, or any breach of covenant that existed at the end of the period and subsequently has not been cured.

column1: Deferred Revenue, Additions
column2: Amount of deferred revenue recognized for transactions arising during the current reporting period. Deferred revenue is a liability as of the balance sheet date related to a revenue producing activity for which revenue has not yet been recognized. Generally, an Entity records deferred revenue when it receives consideration from a customer before achieving certain criteria that must be met for revenue to be recognized in conformity with GAAP.

column1: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs, Amortization Expense
column2: Amount of amortization expense (reversal of expense) for deferred policy acquisition costs.

column1: Defined Contribution Plan, Employer Discretionary Contribution Amount
column2: Amount of discretionary contributions made by an employer to a defined contribution plan.

column1: Defined Benefit Plan, Plan Assets, Payment for Settlement
column2: Amount of payment, which decreases plan assets of defined benefit plan, for irrevocable action relieving primary responsibility for benefit obligation and eliminating risk for obligation and assets used to effect settlement. Transaction constituting settlement includes, but is not limited to, making lump-sum cash payment to participant in exchange for their rights to receive specified benefits and purchasing nonparticipating annuity contract.

column1: Distributions on Mandatorily Redeemable Securities
column2: Amount of distributions during the period on mandatorily redeemable securities.

column1: Dividends, Preferred Stock
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid preferred stock dividends declared with the form of settlement in cash, stock and payment-in-kind (PIK).

column1: Dividends, Cash
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid cash dividends declared for classes of stock, for example, but not limited to, common and preferred.

column1: Dividends, Stock
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid stock dividends declared for classes of stock, for example, but not limited to, common and preferred.

column1: Dividends, Common Stock, Cash
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid common stock dividends declared with the form of settlement in cash.

column1: Dividends
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid cash, stock, and paid-in-kind (PIK) dividends declared, for example, but not limited to, common and preferred stock.

column1: Dividends, Paid-in-kind
column2: Amount of paid and unpaid paid-in-kind dividends (PIK) declared for classes of stock, for example, but not limited to, common and preferred.

column1: Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), Compensation Expense
column2: The amount of plan compensation cost recognized during the period.

column1: Environmental Exit Costs, Reasonably Possible Additional Losses, Best Estimate
column2: Best estimate of the reasonably possible loss exposure in excess of the amount accrued for remediation, site restoration, postclosure, monitoring commitments, or other exit costs associated with the sale, disposal or abandonment of a particular property resulting from unanticipated contamination of the assets.

column1: Environmental Exit Costs, Costs Accrued to Date
column2: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the liability for remediation, site restoration, postclosure, monitoring commitments, or other exit costs associated with the sale, disposal or abandonment of a particular property resulting from unanticipated contamination of the assets.

column1: Environmental Exit Costs, Anticipated Cost
column2: Total anticipated costs associated with remediation, site restoration, postclosure, monitoring commitments, or other exit costs that may occur on the sale, disposal, or abandonment of a particular property resulting from unanticipated contamination of the assets.

column1: Environmental Exit Costs, Assets Previously Disposed, Liability for Remediation
column2: Carrying amount of the liability for remediation of environmental damage pertaining to assets or businesses previously disposed.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Noncontrolling Interest
column2: Amount of equity attributable to noncontrolling interests of an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Liabilities and Equity
column2: The amount of liabilities and equity reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

column1: Equity Method Investment, Ownership Percentage
column2: The percentage of ownership of common stock or equity participation in the investee accounted for under the equity method of accounting.

column1: Financial Liabilities Fair Value Disclosure
column2: Fair value of financial obligations, including, but not limited to, debt instruments, derivative liabilities, federal funds purchased and sold under agreements to repurchase, securities loaned or sold under agreements to repurchase, financial instruments sold not yet purchased, guarantees, line of credit, loans and notes payable, servicing liability, and trading liabilities.

column1: Financing Receivable, Reclassification to Held-for-sale
column2: The amount of financing receivables reclassified to held for sale during the reporting period.

column1: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Cost Incurred to Renew or Extend
column2: The amount of capitalized costs incurred in the period to renew or extend the term of a recognized finite-lived (amortizing and amortizable) intangible asset.

column1: Former Gain Contingency, Recognized in Current Period
column2: Amount of gain recognized in the period that had been disclosed in prior periods as a contingent gain.

column1: Forward Contract Indexed to Issuer's Equity, Settlement Alternatives, Cash, at Fair Value
column2: Current fair value of each cash settlement alternative for each freestanding forward contract.

column1: Gain Contingency, Unrecorded Amount
column2: The amount or range of possible amounts of gain that could be realized upon the resolution of a contingency.

column1: Gain on Business Interruption Insurance Recovery
column2: The net amount (to the extent disclosed within this portion of the income statement) by which an insurance settlement exceeds incremental costs incurred from the event causing an interruption of business, plus the insurance award for earnings lost from the event, such as a natural catastrophe, explosion or fire.

column1: Goodwill, Written off Related to Sale of Business Unit
column2: Amount of divestiture of an asset representing future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

column1: Guarantor Obligations, Liquidation Proceeds, Monetary Amount
column2: Indicates, if estimable, the approximate extent to which the proceeds from liquidation of any assets held either as collateral or by third parties would be expected to cover the maximum potential amount of future payments under the guarantee or each group of similar guarantees.

column1: Guarantor Obligations, Current Carrying Value
column2: The current carrying amount of the liability for the freestanding or embedded guarantor's obligations under the guarantee or each group of similar guarantees.

column1: Guarantor Obligations, Maximum Exposure, Undiscounted
column2: Maximum potential amount of future payments (undiscounted) the guarantor could be required to make under the guarantee or each group of similar guarantees before reduction for potential recoveries under recourse or collateralization provisions.

column1: Guarantor Obligations, Liquidation Proceeds, Percentage
column2: Indicates, if estimable, (as a percentage) the approximate extent to which the proceeds from liquidation of any assets held either as collateral or by third parties would be expected to cover the maximum potential amount of future payments under the guarantee or each group of similar guarantees.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, after Ten Years, Net Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of debt securities accounted for as held-to-maturity, net of adjustments including, but not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments, maturing after the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, after One Through Five Years, Net Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of debt securities accounted for as held-to-maturity, net of adjustments including, but not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments, maturing in the next fiscal year through the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Twelve Months or Longer, Fair Value
column2: This item represents the fair value of securities categorized as held-to-maturity securities that have been in a continuous unrealized loss position for twelve months or longer.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, after Five Through Ten Years, Net Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of debt securities accounted for as held-to-maturity, net of adjustments including, but not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments, maturing in the fifth through tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, after Ten Years, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing after the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Year Six Through Ten, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the sixth fiscal year through the tenth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Fair Value
column2: This item represents the fair value of securities categorized as held-to-maturity which are in an unrealized loss position.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Less than Twelve Months, Fair Value
column2: This item represents the fair value of securities categorized as held-to-maturity that have been in a continuous unrealized loss position for less than twelve months.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Year Two Through Five, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the second fiscal year through the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, within One Year, Net Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of debt securities accounted for as held-to-maturity, net of adjustments including, but not limited to, accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments (OTTI) recognized, and fair value hedge accounting adjustments, maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year.

column1: Held-to-maturity Securities, Debt Maturities, Next Twelve Months, Fair Value
column2: Fair value of held-to-maturity debt securities maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Impaired Assets to be Disposed of by Method Other than Sale, Carrying Value of Asset
column2: The carrying amount on the books of the entity of the impaired asset to be disposed of by a method other than sale.

column1: Increase in Carrying Amount of Redeemable Preferred Stock
column2: Adjustment to retained earnings for the increase in carrying amount of redeemable preferred stock that is classified as temporary equity.

column1: Indefinite-lived Intangible Assets, Written off Related to Sale of Business Unit
column2: Amount of divestiture of an asset lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit to fair value. Excludes financial assets and goodwill.

column1: Interest and Debt Expense
column2: Interest and debt related expenses associated with nonoperating financing activities of the entity.

column1: Interest Expense on Prepetition Liabilities Recognized in Statement of Operations
column2: The amount of interest expense on prepetition obligations included in the statement of operations.

column1: Investment Banking Revenue
column2: Includes (1) underwriting revenue (the spread between the resale price received and the cost of the securities and related expenses) generated through the purchasing, distributing and reselling of new issues of securities (alternatively, could be a secondary offering of a large block of previously issued securities); and (2) fees earned for mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, restructurings, and other types of financial advisory services.

column1: Investment Banking, Advisory, Brokerage, and Underwriting Fees and Commissions
column2: Amount of fees and commissions from banking, advisory, brokerage, and securities underwriting activities. Activities include, but are not limited to, underwriting securities, private placements of securities, investment advisory and management services, merger and acquisition services, sale and servicing of mutual funds, and other related consulting fees.

column1: Investment Tax Credit
column2: The amount deducted from an entities' taxes, reflecting a percentage of an amount invested in certain assets spread over the useful life of those assets; includes deferred investment tax credits.

column1: Liability for Asbestos and Environmental Claims, Gross, Incurred Loss
column2: Amount, before effects of reinsurance, of expense for claims incurred and costs incurred in the claim settlement process attributable to asbestos and environmental claims.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Face Value
column2: Face value (death benefits) of the life insurance policies underlying the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Carrying Amount
column2: Carrying amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Number of Contracts
column2: Number of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method.

column1: Life Settlement Contracts, Investment Method, Premiums to be Paid
column2: Amount of life insurance premiums anticipated to be paid to keep the life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method in force.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Increase, Accrued Interest
column2: Increase for accrued, but unpaid interest on the credit facility for the period.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Annual Principal Payment
column2: Amount of the total principal payments made during the annual reporting period.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Maximum Amount Outstanding During Period
column2: Maximum amount borrowed under the credit facility at any time during the period.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Commitment Fee Amount
column2: Amount of the fee for available but unused credit capacity under the credit facility.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Current Borrowing Capacity
column2: Amount of current borrowing capacity under the credit facility considering any current restrictions on the amount that could be borrowed (for example, borrowings may be limited by the amount of current assets), but without considering any amounts currently outstanding under the facility.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Average Outstanding Amount
column2: Average amount borrowed under the credit facility during the period.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Maximum Month-end Outstanding Amount
column2: Maximum month-end amount borrowed under the credit facility during the period.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Fair Value of Amount Outstanding
column2: Fair value of the amount outstanding under the credit facility.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Periodic Payment, Principal
column2: Amount of the required periodic payment applied to principal.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Maximum Borrowing Capacity
column2: Maximum borrowing capacity under the credit facility without consideration of any current restrictions on the amount that could be borrowed or the amounts currently outstanding under the facility.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Periodic Payment, Interest
column2: Amount of the required periodic payment applied to interest.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Interest Rate During Period
column2: The effective interest rate during the reporting period.

column1: Line of Credit Facility, Periodic Payment
column2: Amount of the required periodic payments of both interest and principal.

column1: Loans and Leases Receivable, Commitments to Purchase or Sell
column2: Reflects the carrying amount of loans and leases for which agreements to acquire or dispose exist.

column1: Long-term Purchase Commitment, Amount
column2: The minimum amount the entity agreed to spend under the long-term purchase commitment.

column1: Long-term Purchase Commitment, Minimum Quantity Required
column2: Number of units of goods that must be purchased within the specified time period of the agreement to avoid penalties or unfavorable effects on pricing, among other adverse consequences.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Gross
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process.

column1: Loss Contingency, Discounted Amount of Insurance-related Assessment Liability
column2: The present value of the liability as of the balance sheet date representing required funding mandated by statute or regulatory authority that is related directly or indirectly to underwriting activities, including pools for self-insurance and excluding premium taxes and income taxes. The funds derived from the assessments generally enable a government guarantor to pay insurance claims in the event that the underwriting insurer is insolvent or otherwise unable to meet its payment obligations.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Undiscounted, Fifth Year
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual
column2: Amount of loss contingency liability.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Insurance-related Assessment, Discount Rate
column2: The rate applied as of the balance sheet date to reduce the undiscounted amount of a guarantee fund and other insurance-related assessments to present value.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Undiscounted, Next Twelve Months
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Undiscounted, Third Year
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Undiscounted, after Fifth Year
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Insurance-related Assessment, Premium Tax Offset
column2: The amount of insurance-related assessment liability that is expected to be recovered through a premium tax offset based on current laws applied to in-force policies.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Undiscounted, Fourth Year
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Undiscounted, Second Year
column2: Undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product or process expected to be paid in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency, Accrual, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of loss contingency liability expected to be resolved after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Insurance-related Assessment, Policy Surcharge Asset
column2: The amount of insurance-related assessment liability that is expected to be recovered through policy surcharges applied to in-force policies.

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Discount
column2: The amount of imputed interest necessary to reduce (reconcile) the estimated aggregate undiscounted amount of the accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product(s) or process(es) to the present value recognized on the balance sheet (if the accrual qualifies for discounting).

column1: Loss Contingency Accrual, Product Liability, Net
column2: Present value of the estimated aggregate accrual for damages arising from third-party use of the entity's product(s) or process(es) as of the balance sheet date (if the accrual qualifies for discounting).

column1: Loss Contingency, Claims Settled and Dismissed, Number
column2: The number of claims settled and dismissed during the period.

column1: Loss Contingency, Accrual, Current
column2: Amount of loss contingency liability expected to be resolved within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

column1: Loss Contingency, Damages Awarded, Value
column2: Amount of damages awarded to the plaintiff in the legal matter.

column1: Loss Contingency, Undiscounted Amount of Insurance-related Assessment Liability
column2: The liability as of the balance sheet date representing required funding mandated by statute or regulatory authority that is related directly or indirectly to underwriting activities, including pools for self-insurance and excluding premium taxes and income taxes. The funds derived from the assessments generally enable a government guarantor to pay insurance claims in the event that the underwriting insurer is insolvent or otherwise unable to meet its payment obligations.

column1: Loss Contingency, Receivable, Additions
column2: Amount of additions to receivables pertaining to a loss contingency.

column1: Loss Contingency, New Claims Filed, Number
column2: The total number of new claims filed pertaining to a loss contingency during the period.

column1: Loss Contingency, Estimate of Possible Loss
column2: Reflects the estimated amount of loss from the specified contingency as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Loss Contingency, Pending Claims, Number
column2: Number of pending claims pertaining to a loss contingency.

column1: Loss Contingency, Range of Possible Loss, Portion Not Accrued
column2: The difference between the maximum amount of estimated loss and the amount recorded as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Nondebtor Reorganization Items, Legal and Advisory Professional Fees
column2: Amount of reorganization items related to legal and advisory professional fees related to entities not in bankruptcy.

column1: Noncontrolling Interest, Decrease from Deconsolidation
column2: The amount of the reduction or elimination during the period of a noncontrolling interest resulting from the parent's loss of control and deconsolidation of the entity in which one or more outside parties had a noncontrolling interest.

column1: Operating Costs and Expenses
column2: Generally recurring costs associated with normal operations except for the portion of these expenses which can be clearly related to production and included in cost of sales or services. Excludes Selling, General and Administrative Expense.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Treasury Units, Reissued
column2: Value of units that were previously issued and then were repurchased and classified as treasury units. This element represents the monetary value of these units which were reissued during the period.

column1: Partners' Capital Account, Treasury Units, Purchased
column2: Value of units that were previously issued and have been repurchased during the year.

column1: Payments for Congressionally Mandated Federal Home Loan Bank Assessments
column2: Amount of cash outflow for payments made by the Federal Home Loan Banks for Congressionally mandated assessments.

column1: Plan of Reorganization, Amount of Prepetition Obligations to be Settled in Cash
column2: Amount of prepetition liabilities to be settled in cash.

column1: Postconfirmation, Liabilities
column2: Total liabilities at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Long-term Debt
column2: Total long-term debt at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Short-term Investments
column2: Amount of short-term investments at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Property and Equipment, Net
column2: Total property and equipment, net at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Receivables, Net
column2: Amount of receivables, net at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Accounts Payable
column2: Amount of accounts payable at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Other Property and Equipment
column2: Amount of other property and equipment at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of noncurrent restricted cash and cash equivalents at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Current Maturities of Capital Lease Obligations
column2: Amount of current maturities of capital lease obligations at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation and amortization at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Current Maturities of Long-term Debt
column2: Amount of current maturities of long-term debt at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Cash and Cash Equivalents
column2: Amount of cash and cash equivalents at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Preferred and Common Stock Held in Treasury
column2: Amount of preferred and common stock held in treasury at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Noncurrent Other Obligations
column2: Amount of other noncurrent obligations at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Debt Issuance Costs
column2: Amount of debt issuance costs after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Land
column2: Amount of land at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Investments
column2: Amount of investments at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Capital Lease Obligations, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of noncurrent capital lease obligations at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Postconfirmation Credit Facility
column2: Amount of long-term postconfirmation date credit facility at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Liabilities and Stockholders' Equity
column2: Total liabilities and stockholders' equity at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Nonamortizable Intangible Assets
column2: Amount of nonamortizable intangible assets at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Furniture and Fixtures
column2: Amount of furniture and fixtures at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Accrued Liabilities
column2: Amount of accrued liabilities at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Amortizable Intangible Assets
column2: Amount of amortizable intangible assets at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Other Postretirement Obligations
column2: Amount of noncurrent other postretirement obligations at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Goodwill
column2: Amount of goodwill at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents, Current
column2: Amount of current restricted cash and cash equivalents at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Property under Capital Lease Arrangements
column2: Amount of property under capital lease at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Debtor-in-Possession Financing
column2: Amount of long-term debt related to debtor-in-possession financing at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Liabilities Subject to Compromise
column2: Amount of liabilities subject to compromise at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Other Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of other noncurrent assets at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Other Current Liabilities
column2: Amount of other current liabilities at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Assets
column2: Total assets at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Other Long-term Debt
column2: Amount of other long-term debt at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Preferred Stock
column2: Amount of preferred stock at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Inventories
column2: Amount of inventories at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Other Noncurrent Obligations
column2: Total other noncurrent obligations at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Current Liabilities
column2: Total current liabilities at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Short-term Borrowings
column2: Amount of short-term borrowings at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Buildings and Improvements
column2: Amount of buildings and improvements at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Pension Obligations
column2: Amount of noncurrent pension obligations at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Prepaid and Other Current Assets
column2: Amount of prepaid and other current assets at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Leasehold Improvements
column2: Amount of leasehold improvements at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Equipment
column2: Amount of equipment at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Current Assets
column2: Total current assets at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Common Stock
column2: Amount of common stock at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Postconfirmation, Other Assets
column2: Total other assets at the balance sheet date after fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Property under Capital Lease Arrangements
column2: Amount of property under capital lease at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization
column2: Amount of accumulated depreciation and amortization at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Property and Equipment, Net
column2: Total property and equipment, net at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Short-term Borrowings
column2: Amount of short-term borrowings at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Other Postretirement Obligations
column2: Amount of noncurrent other postretirement obligations at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Other Property and Equipment
column2: Amount of other property and equipment at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Other Assets, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of other noncurrent assets at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Preferred Stock
column2: Amount of preferred stock at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Preferred and Common Stock Held in Treasury
column2: Amount of preferred and common stock held in treasury at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Amortizable Intangible Assets, Net
column2: Amount of intangible assets subject to amortization at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Goodwill
column2: Amount of goodwill at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Inventories
column2: Amount of inventories at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Prepaid and Other Current Assets
column2: Amount of prepaid and other current assets at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Accounts Payable
column2: Amount of accounts payable at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Accrued Liabilities
column2: Amount of accrued liabilities at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Pension Obligations
column2: Amount of noncurrent pension obligations at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Leasehold Improvements
column2: Amount of leasehold improvements at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Liabilities Subject to Compromise
column2: Amount of liabilities subject to compromise at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Debt Issuance Costs
column2: Amount of debt issuance costs before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Noncurrent Other Obligations
column2: Amount of other noncurrent obligations at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Current Liabilities
column2: Total current liabilities at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Current Assets
column2: Total current assets at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Debtor-in-Possession Financing
column2: Amount of long-term debt related to debtor-in-possession financing at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of noncurrent restricted cash and cash equivalents at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Long-term Debt
column2: Total long-term debt at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Other Current Liabilities
column2: Amount of other current liabilities at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Other Long-term Debt
column2: Amount of other long-term debt at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Investments
column2: Amount of investments at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Liabilities
column2: Total liabilities at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Liabilities and Stockholders' Equity
column2: Total liabilities and stockholders' equity at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Other Assets
column2: Total other assets at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents, Current
column2: Amount of current restricted cash and cash equivalents at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Furniture and Fixtures
column2: Amount of furniture and fixtures at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Other Noncurrent Obligations
column2: Total other noncurrent obligations at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Nonamortizable Intangible Assets
column2: Amount of intangible assets not subject to amortization at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Receivables, Net
column2: Amount of receivables, net at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Short-term Investments
column2: Amount of short-term investments at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Cash and Cash Equivalents
column2: Amount of cash and cash equivalents at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Current Maturities of Long-term Debt
column2: Amount of current maturities of long-term debt at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Assets
column2: Total assets at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Common Stock
column2: Amount of common stock at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Current Maturities of Capital Lease Obligations
column2: Amount of current maturities of capital lease obligations at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Buildings and Improvements
column2: Amount of buildings and improvements at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Land
column2: Amount of land at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Postconfirmation Credit Facility
column2: Amount of long-term postconfirmation date credit facility at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Equipment
column2: Amount of equipment at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preconfirmation, Capital Lease Obligations, Noncurrent
column2: Amount of noncurrent capital lease obligations at the balance sheet date before fresh-start adjustments.

column1: Preferred Stock, Liquidation Preference, Value
column2: Value of the difference between preference in liquidation and the par or stated values of the preferred shares.

column1: Preferred Stock, Accretion of Redemption Discount
column2: The amount of accretion of the preferred stock redemption discount during the period.

column1: Proceeds from Issuance of Shares under Incentive and Share-based Compensation Plans, Excluding Stock Options
column2: Amount of cash inflow from issuance of shares under share-based compensation arrangement, excluding stock option exercises.

column1: Product Liability Contingency, Loss Exposure in Excess of Accrual, Best Estimate
column2: Best estimate of the reasonably possible loss exposure in excess of the amount accrued for damages pertaining to a specified product.

column1: Product Liability Contingency, Accrual, Present Value
column2: Present value of the accrual for product liability loss contingencies as of the balance sheet date (if the accrual qualifies for discounting).

column1: Product Liability Contingency, Accrual, Discount Rate
column2: Rate applied to the undiscounted amount of estimated damages for product liability to arrive at the present value recorded as of the balance sheet date.

column1: Product Liability Contingency, Loss Exposure Not Accrued, Best Estimate
column2: Best estimate of the loss exposure for a reasonably possible liability for product liability damages for which no accrual has been recorded.

column1: Product Liability Accrual, Component Amount
column2: Recorded amount of the accrual for a material component of a product liability contingency.

column1: Property, Plant and Equipment, Disposals
column2: Amount of divestiture of long-lived, physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, furniture and fixtures, and computer equipment.

column1: Purchase Commitment, Remaining Minimum Amount Committed
column2: Minimum amount to be expended to satisfy the terms of arrangements in which the entity has agreed to expend funds to procure goods or services, excluding long-term purchase commitments or unconditional purchase obligations.

column1: Purchase Obligation, Future Minimum Payments, Remainder of Fiscal Year
column2: Minimum amount of purchase arrangement maturing in the remainder of the fiscal year following the latest fiscal year ended. Includes, but is not limited to, recorded and unrecorded purchase obligations, long-term purchase commitments, and short-term purchase commitments.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Amount of Maturities and Sinking Fund Requirements
column2: States the combined aggregate amount of maturities and sinking fund requirements for a long-term unconditional purchase obligation that has been recognized on the balance sheet.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation, Nonfinancial Assets Pledged as Security, Value
column2: The value of assets other than financial instruments pledged to provide security to a suppler under a recorded unconditional purchase obligation arrangement.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation Due in Second Year
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the second fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation Due in Fourth Year
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation Due in Fifth Year
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation Due after Fifth Year
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing after the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation
column2: Amount of the recorded obligation to transfer funds in the future for fixed or minimum amounts or quantities of goods or services at fixed or minimum prices (for example, as in take-or-pay contracts or throughput contracts).

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation Due in Next Twelve Months
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Recorded Unconditional Purchase Obligation Due in Third Year
column2: Amount of the recorded unconditional purchase obligation maturing in the third fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

column1: Registration Payment Arrangement, Accrual Carrying Value
column2: The carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the liability representing the obligation under the registration payment arrangement.

column1: Registration Payment Arrangement, Maximum Potential Consideration
column2: Describes the maximum potential amount of consideration, undiscounted, that could be transferred under the registration payment arrangement.

column1: Regulated Operating Revenue, Exploration and Production
column2: The amount of regulated exploration and production operating revenues recognized during the period.

column1: Reinsurance, Loss on Uncollectible Accounts in Period, Amount
column2: Amount of the write-down or write-off of a receivable from a reinsurer.

column1: Reinsurance Retention Policy, Amount Retained
column2: Stated amount that is the upper retention limit per entity policy.

column1: Reorganization Value, Net Realizable Value of Asset Dispositions
column2: Amount of reorganization value related to estimated net realizable value of asset dispositions. Reorganization value is the amount attributed to the reconstituted entity, as well as the expected net realizable value of those assets that will be disposed before reconstitution occurs.

column1: Reorganization Value, Cash in Excess of Normal Operating Needs
column2: Amount of reorganization value related to cash in excess of normal operating requirements generated by operations. Reorganization value is the amount attributed to the reconstituted entity, as well as the expected net realizable value of those assets that will be disposed before reconstitution occurs.

column1: Research and Development Asset Acquired Other than Through Business Combination, Fair Value Acquired
column2: The fair value of capitalized costs of a research and development nature that were acquired during the period in a transaction other than a business combination.

column1: Short-term Debt, Maximum Amount Outstanding During Period
column2: For the form of debt having an initial term of less than one year or less than the normal operating cycle, if longer, the maximum amount borrowed at any time during the period.

column1: Short-term Debt, Average Outstanding Amount
column2: For the form of debt having an initial term of less than one year or less than the normal operating cycle, if longer, average borrowings during the period.

column1: Short-term Debt, Maximum Month-end Outstanding Amount
column2: For the form of debt having an initial term of less than one year or less than the normal operating cycle, if longer, maximum month-end borrowings during the period.

column1: Shares, Issued
column2: Number of shares of stock issued as of the balance sheet date, including shares that had been issued and were previously outstanding but which are now held in the treasury.

column1: Short-term Debt, Refinanced, Amount
column2: Amount of a short-term obligation that has been excluded from current liabilities in the balance sheet because of a refinancing of the obligation.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Value, Employee Stock Ownership Plan
column2: Aggregate value of stock issued during the period as a result of employee stock ownership plan (ESOP).

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Shares, Treasury Stock Reissued
column2: Number of treasury shares (units) reissued during the period, excluding reissuance of shares (units) held in treasury used to satisfy equity-based compensation obligations exercised by the holders of such rights. Upon reissuance of shares (units) from treasury, either the common or preferred stock (unit) reissued is outstanding.

column1: Stock Issued During Period, Shares, Acquisitions
column2: Number of shares of stock issued during the period pursuant to acquisitions.

column1: Stock Redeemed or Called During Period, Shares
